dkR-9ATjdX4A4wf3TJQ5WA.text: I was hoping to have found a good "go to" mexican restaurant.  The atmosphere is good and restaurant was clean and service was decent.  But wasn't impressed with the food.  My husband ordered a lunch which included "cheesy potatoes"..which was TWO thin slices of potatoe with cheese on top, so I guess that counts lol.  I ordered the chicken enchilada with a green sauce and it was just okay.  I also had a cup of albondigas soup which was disappointing as it was a tomato base with three meatballs in it and no vegetables, I didn't care for it.

d6PVz6N7ncUEJUSYiV0iIg.text: The food is pretty subpar unfortunately. The prices are reasonable if you're looking to check it out any way. I would definitely try it again maybe it was the dish I got. The server I had was a little flustered with our big table but that is definitely understandable. All in all nothing stood out for me.

vRi8bmlw4cNsR6W78XUHFQ.text: Jake iz the best Fuccin bartender Ever...... Make sure u get serviced by Jake if u come to Leticicia's!!!

1M7g4Nl4SmszWv99wAqLwQ.text: FINALLY!!!! A Mexican  place with veggie options!!! I got the sauteed veggie tacos. They were amazing!!! Cool atmosphere, cute place! My husband got a burrito, it was huge!! Definitely my new favorite Mexican place in town!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile Colorado burrito enchilada style....it was huge!!!!
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed veggie tacos......Amazing!!

qGivwbcWzKJgZ4tW2m7XvA.text: We're done eating at Leticia's. Over the past few years we've tolerated the hit or miss quality of the food because they're located close to our house and they make great margaritas. However, after our most recent visit my wife and I are giving up. It's just too frustrating to pay hard earned money to someone else for bad food you could cook better yourself. The meat in our tacos, both carne asada and al pastor, was tastless, dry and tough to chew...a failure on the kitchen staff's part to execute the most basic and critical aspects of cooking.  Result: a ruined dining experience. Never again.

LPekNDWeB_jdLS-2sG6WkQ.text: When I first started coming here 8 years ago it was great,seems like the food and service has severely tapered off

p56-sL9_rRyO7AMfc3ajtA.text: This place is definitely a neighborhood favorite! I came here with my family around 4:30 on a Friday... before the dinner rush. The service was a little slow, but we definitely come here for the excellent food. We had to ask a couple times to refill our waters or grab a box for our leftovers. However, each dish was amazing. I ordered two shrimp tacos. They had a creamy chipotle sauce on them that made it delish!! My father ordered the queso tacos & said they were absolutely great! For appetizers, we tried the shrimp ceviche and elote de creme. The corn was absolutely amazing. A critique for the ceviche would be maybe a little more spice or lime.. it just seemed like it was missing something. The price is a little higher than most places around this area. But if you're looking for great Mexican food, this place does not fall short!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fried ice cream dessert... SO GOOD
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shrimp ceviche appetizer
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. elote de creme appetizer

KnwiHbmUXfne8gF9zi6X_Q.text: Leticias is a quaint place with excellent service. I took advantage of the $15 for $30 deal on yelp + a free margarita. They bring out heaping amount of fresh tortilla chips with 3 dips that are delicious in their own way. I ordered chicken tortilla soup and enchiladas with spicy sauce rice and beans. My server was attentive and very polite!

N7L8XIocsevRng8pydGvVA.text: Had such a great experience with the service and the tasty food. The quesa tacos are a must try! Had one shrimp and one carne asada. Will definitely be back!

iip1fuXUESeJ9z-k5sgQuw.text: This place is outrageously overpriced and the food is mediocre. I got family style enchiladas to go, and the only thing that I could say I liked was the cilantro rice. Even the flan and churro I ordered for dessert were disappointing. The flan, rather than having the rich taste of caramelized sugar that I love, tasted like orange peels. I was hoping to find great Mexican food in this part of town, but this is not where it's at.

sPki3g68P7naDShaOp8Wzw.text: Just dined here for the first time and it was really good. I'm super picky and I was pleasantly surprised

Qhtqk5GBcGQWXfoBIbLpxA.text: Heard about this place through a friend. Just moved from Texas where mom and pop Mexican restaurants are dime a dozen and all are amazing.   Well this place did not disappoint. Went on a Tuesday where the margaritas are priced 2 for 1 at 7.50. Honestly the most equally balanced margaritas I have had. Then had the make your own burrito and you honestly don't want to stop eating.  We will be a regular here that is for sure. I would recommend this place to all my friends.

XenPDavzSusSUrxG5j1ySg.text: I rarely give restaurants 5-stars because even the very best occasionally screw stuff up or fail to impress.  Leticia's is not one of those places, at least in my experience. I've NEVER had a bad meal here. The service is always good - even on a busy night - and the food is always incredible. Seriously, if you in the mood for really good Mexican food, this place is a great choice.

KZBPIg87KOVXHIKz05AgqQ.text: Food never disappoints, and service is typically top-notch. The place can get crowed quick, but for good reason.  If you sit outside, the audio from the TVs plays on the system, so it's a bit distracting.  Definitely one of the best options for Mexican in the area!

EFNq7N2Cx7EB9ZyFiKHv6Q.text: Good and drinks are always really good. Service can be up and down sometimes but more ups than downs. Mother's Day was packed but we avoided the wait times by making a reservation through Yelp. Walked right in and service was amazing for such a busy day!

7Yx1DKbwxHeEO3mzS31hBg.text: Just enjoyed an amazing meal with superb service from Mario.  From his menu suggestions down to his passion for the food it was a complete foodie experience.  Potato and cheese flautas took me back to my teens.  They'll even give you a free dessert when completing a review on social media :)

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flautas and gourmet tacos, delish!

fwWQyC-8qoaLZ0SwTcgBxw.text: I've been here three times and I hate this place.  I keep getting dragged back here by my friends.  Last night we went and the hostess told us it'd be an hour wait unless we want to sit in the building adjacent to the restaurant.  We figured why not? It's right next to the restaurant and it's set up like a karaoke bar.  Could be fun, right? WRONG.  I don't recommend eating in their special little room unless you're there for the karaoke.  The service is not the same as in the main restaurant area.  It took almost 2.5 hours to eat dinner.  I was miserable.  We were forgotten about for long stretches. Had to ask for things three or four times.  Every other time I've been there I was brought chips, a green salsa, a brown salsa, and bean dip.  No bean dip last night.  And three empty baskets of chips for 14 people. Cups sitting empty. Waitress made no effort to remember who ordered what so when the food was delivered she was just holding it and shouting what it was and you had to speak up if it was your's.  I got the quesa tacos and they were bad.  The shrimp were missing from them and they were dripping grease and the cheese was burnt. Waitress completely forgot my cup of fideo soup and about 10 minutes after I reminded her about it she brought out a stone-cold BOWL of fideo soup.  I just pushed it away.  Luckily she took it off the bill without me even asking.  I guess she could tell I was less than thrilled.   I really hope I don't have to go here ever again.

fd4omXKe6DoQ311cvc3gTw.text: Its Saturday night 8:05 pm There are 4 to 6 obviously very open tables at Leticia's And they did it again tonight. With open tables everywhere, they said the same thing they always say, "sir, that'll be a 15 minute wait" This has happened to us at least 6 times, but somehow we keep giving them a chance. Maybe its time to look around. Folks, if you're interested in a wait for a restaurant that's not busy and blatantly treats the customers to waiting while you stare at lots of empty tables, then this is the place for you. If you're not interested in long waits for no reason, there are lots of other options close by; for example try the place next to Red Robin or if Italian would fit, go across the street to Streets of New York.

YdQNUgXpCQzP63dCFB8Ynw.text: Come here for great margarita. Place always busy but we patiently wait. Love thier fajitas and fresh chips. Staff are friedly, the place is organize and easy parking.

MgvFQxocKi1Omef1FTwIFg.text: The food is great and the service in the restaurant is great but do not try to order food to go over the phone. Had to call three times. The First time was on hold for 10 mins, second time was hung up on, and third time on hold for over 10 mins. Very got a chance to order their delicious food. Also tried the online/app order route. Unfortunately, the full menu is not available. Especially kids menu or even an option to add a cheese quesadilla for my son. If you are going to offer orders over phone/ online don't half-ass it.

avx1RLsFHu8Z5M4HVWBRzg.text: If you love Mexican food, I totally recommend this spot. The food is amazing and the service is great.   The first time I came here I wasn't sure if I'd like the food and plus it was a Friday night, at least the wait wasn't too long (about 20 min) and hey it was happy hour.   When we sat down, the server approached us and introduced herself and took our drink orders. I wasn't too sure what to try because they all seemed delicious. I ended up ordering the Ribeye Tacos...YUM! My cousin ordered the tamales and I had a little sample...totally worth trying.  The second time I came here I tried the Quesa Tacos because the server said it was one of the best items on the menu and I wouldn't be let down. He was right!! I ordered the Quesa Tacos with carne asada with a side of queso rice; I totally recommend trying it and trust me you can probably share because the tacos are pretty filling and the rice is amazing.   The third time I came here I tried the shrimp tacos (grilled), yeah I don't recommend it at all just because it was salty and just not that great. However, my cousin ordered the Empanadas and had a little bite of it and it was really good.   BTW if you check if you get a free fried ice cream, so make sure you check in and show your server because dessert is a perfect way to end your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso tacos
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamale
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own burrito

uT-BmB_Nu_NlM2oRFygZjQ.text: Stopped by for lunch. My guests knee was in bad shape so they were kind enough to seat us right by the entrance. 5 Star service. Very kind and personable. My rita came out perfect. They will even try to accommodate you in any way needed. For example if you want a special drink made a certain way. Food was delicious. Cannot wait to come back and try the tacos.

V3zTJY4eJy2n5K6VjClX0w.text: The service is great.   The chips and salsa are an amazing meal alone.  Our food was spot on as usual.  Thank god we are 5 minutes from such a place.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Burrito with guac and house cheese blend and cilantro rice.  Ranchero sauce.  Bomb.com
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tamales with verde sauce.   They were great as well

E3Q6EjmC34MQOC-Gn-d3dQ.text: Great atmosphere somewhat hidden in a cute mall. We had the tortilla soup. Very good.

ivGlHa1-Gr87lLeRPkbLIw.text: Awesome place, fresh chips accompanied with salsa verde, a deep dark roasted salsa and yes warm bean dip, yum! Had the chile verde, rice and beans, one of the best chile verde dishes I've ever eaten. My bro asked our server Cecilia if the had vegetarian and she tells us they can do anything vegetarian his meal was awesome too, cheese enchiladas, black beans and rice. She was awesome too!!  If your in Northern  end of Vegas off the 95 you have to stop her

KKX--h2xgp-1BLu6As2FiQ.text: Great authentic Mexican food!!! There wasn't a single item that came to our table that was just outstanding!! They are only getting 4 stars because their service is pretty slow. We were seated and got drinks/chips and salsa real quick, but our server was not on his game, and we have had him before.  If you are not in any hurry, definitely come eat here!!!!

D31yrvtXCsxcNJg8bixI9A.text: Great food, crappy service every time. Every time I go, the food is always amazing and they hit it out of the park on that end. However, they're service sucks.  Even when it's slow, the service is slow. I ordered a drink and didn't get it til mid way through the meal. Mind you that was when we first sat down I ordered a drink. Oh and there was only a handful of people in there. Not sure what the hold up is.

xRazu28qPsV0f1jOOml9tA.text: I have always loved the food at Leticia's Cocina. This past visit was for my mothers 85th Birthday Celebration. Our reservation was 730 and we were sat down right in time, and as always great food and drinks.

F_XyKVTyybwW65Zq7SrQPg.text: This has quickly become one of my favorite Mexican restaurants. They have a good mix of classic Mexican dishes as well as some excellent specialties. The flautas remind me of the ones I had as a kid in San Diego. The house margarita was better than a lot of speciality drinks at other joints. On weekends the place gets a bit busy but I think that is a good thing. I know I'll be coming back a lot.

hvDtpzKjOd1qJvWdmubO2A.text: Went there the first week of May of 2016 and it seemed to me like all of their employees were new. My fiancee and I was asked what we would like to drink three separate times. We only wanted a Pepsi and a water. Not a hard task. We finally got our drinks around 30 minutes later. The table next to us ordered guacamole chip dip. And I overheard the customer say it was also 30 minutes! For chip dip!? We finally got our food. And that was great! My recommendation is to go to the bar and eat there. The service was excellent the last time I sat at the bar.

EzKObbMpPdyDiwuEWY-f-w.text: What happened to this place? It used to be amazing now the service is bad and the food is so dry I am so disappointed they didn't even give a salt and pepper on the table because our food needed it what happened to the old managers? We went there to sit outside and they said it was closed? We only gets so much good weather here in Vegas and you r telling me no seating outside. And our meal was expensive for what we got.

ZWCROxAoLoLktdq9sR0xqQ.text: Let me start by saying this place has the BEST margaritas. The guys and gals at the bar really know what they are doing. I have never actually ate AT the restaurant but have gotten carry out from them a few times. The quesa tacos are AMAZING. You can get them with flour tortillas or corn. I have tried both and personally prefer the flour but I'm not a big fan or corn tortillas to begin with. My husband has had their street tacos and the enchiladas. He seems to always go back and forth between the two. The rice with the quesa tacos is a white rice with some sort of cheese.... AMAZING. The other dishes come with the regular Spanish rice which my husband loves. The place is usually PACKED on weekends and most evenings. I recommend the carry out if you don't want to wait. The atmosphere is very charming as well. Will definitely be returning here often.

6WkGZJ-8s1KlmfsyjwqtWg.text: Great food, reasonable prices.  I love the fact that you get chips and three different types of salsa as part of your meal.  I could (and frequently do) fill up on them.  The food is high quality and seems more authentic than your typical Mexican restaurant.  Leticia's has a nice outdoor seating area that I like to take advantage of when the weather permits.  The service has always been very polite and professional, but can be very slow at times, hence the minus one star.

5FWQq2FLt_ZhYmF-ZDDDYA.text: The best authentic Mexican food!! Our server both times was amazing. They accommodated every request promptly and we even got free dessert! It is definitely worth the drive.

IOL9NJoSXNyfXPZPaIKRZQ.text: Had the Sopa de Mariscos, and it was delicious! If you love seafood, you will love it. It has prawns, clams, mussels, tilapia, and even a lobster tail all in a spicy seafood broth. Come early, the place tends to get very crowded around 6pm and there is usually long wait out the door from that point.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sopa de Mariscos, absolutely delicious. A must try for seafood lovers!

TvZ7uMniXyGL-I0jQaKTBQ.text: Quesatacos! Wow! So impressed from the chips to the meal, all around amazing meal. I tried the chicken (shredded) and carne asada. Can't decide which I liked better. Spicy rice casserole was delicious too!

kWI_XrROHadQMkOV1aXJaQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat I always get the El pastor burrito and it comes out perfect every time the staff is great and the bartenders do a good job making their drinks how deadly recommend coming to this place you should ask about their habanero salsa

h8vTXFLcYSQ11yReT-Xi5Q.text: Tara made the dining experience the best!! Tara is very great at her job and the dining experience she gave us would make me go back again ad again.  We need more of Tara!!! by the way the food was great too!!

GOa017yjOIBs0nSOY5oeUw.text: Awesome food.  Everything we had was wonderful. The servers were nice and attentive although one was a bit clumsy a dropped stuff a few times but everyone has a bad day now and then. My friend had a pork chop with a green chile sauce on it.  It was so tasty that when I go back this is what I'm getting.

vsPtQo_KFVSqZeELw2RyUw.text: Food is beyond fantastic. I love their shredded beef tacos. Chips and salsa is on point too. Only things preventing 5 stars is 1) it could be a little cleaner inside and 2) service isn't great...usually just okay.

J8c8c6QpZ8RnpV9SZDyVhw.text: I live near this restaurant.   If it weren't for my friends inviting me to go to "Taco Night," I wouldn't have known this place existed!  I stuck to ordering taquitos...one beef and the other two chicken.  I thought both were quite tasty, although I'm no authority on mexican fare, I liked the dish I ordered immensely.  The mexican red rice is the best I've tasted around town.  I took pleasure in their pomegranate margaritas.  I also tasted what seemed to be an odd flavor, in my opinion...a strawberry, jalapeno margarita!  It was so darn dee-lish, I think I will order that next time.  :)  The service was extremely friendly and I enjoyed both waitresses that were serving our table.  They were friendly and attentive, without being too attentive, if you know what I mean?  The fried ice cream was great way to end the night too.  It was heavy on the cinnamon, but I didn't mind a bit.  All in all, I will be coming back to this restaurant.

h8FdU6Mpwi2ZLttzTPCRsg.text: My first-time experience on Valentine's Day was horrible! Both my boyfriend's and my plate came out all wrong, and the waitress had the audacity to argue with us about it. By the time my meal came back (still wrong), it was awful. I ordered the grilled fish tacos, and I couldn't even tell there was fish in it until I picked through it with my fork. The fish appeared to be grounded or mashed...disgusting! The bottom line is that they served the worst Mexican food I'd ever had.

QMcvFTOT048zLX0d44wrOw.text: Make sure you get the fried ice cream caramel mixed with chocolate

mPxEvzY56jy8yelZq9q4yA.text: Best Mexican food around. The service was great and the food was even better. Definitely this is a must. I highly recommend it.

xxZzVUgxAEkzN9SMJbhIaQ.text: In my opinion, Leticia's is the best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas!! The food, the service, the decor, the atmosphere are all A+! And that's coming from someone who grew up eating the fine Mexican food of New Mexico. I've also lived in San Diego and Denver, where there are also some terrific Mexican restaurants, and Leticia's can stand up to any of those places. By the way, my husband is from Mexico, and he loves Leticia's, too!! Te queremos mucho, Leticia!

fxYJ6jcBO4hLx0ttyAxVCA.text: Great food, starting with the chips and salsa, to the street tacos.  The bacon wrapped shrimp were one of the best things I have EVER eaten in my life. Big bold flavors with excellent service and an intimate, homey feel makes this my new favorite restaurant in Vegas

82bnqvbMfPk4oc812C8Nlg.text: To make it simple they are as authentic as del taco I agree with don and jasmine

gaJaYQt6nboaRmGmX_BYig.text: The best best mexican food in all of las vegas...love love love

tY82G1-n6sZWpnYH5jBQZw.text: This place is excellent! We had friends visiting from out of town and we decided to try out Leticia's, as we were all craving Mexican food. This place did not disappoint. There were nine of us. Despite the fact that they were very busy, we were able to be seated after only a short wait. The staff was terrific. They were friendly and attentive. Not only did our server make sure our needs were met but two other gentelmen came over to make sure everything was to our liking. I spilled my iced tea and someone was at my side as soon as it happened, helping to wipe up the mess. She was really nice about it and within 60 seconds, it was cleaned up and I had a fresh glass of tea. It was as if it had never happened. We were there on their karaoke night and that was a lot of fun. We've decided that we'll always try to go there on karaoke night. Most importantly, the food was delicious. The portions were just right and everything tasted perfect. I'm really excited that we finally tried this place. We're from out of state and there is a Mexican restaurant back home that I miss all the time. This place totally helps fill that void.

oslS3Dw97TI_dIBu3hfegQ.text: I am from So. Cal...  just minutes from the border and I grew up on Mexican food.  Leticia's is awesome!  Incredible food... great atmosphere.... awesome service.... and the friendliest staff!  I love this place and we eat there weekly!  The green sauce is the best I have ever had!  We even had Letcia's cater our Christmas meal!

6ZfxJVS4benDzxC1YRwl6g.text: What can I say?  I love everything about this place.  We travel 20 miles to get here, passing several Mexican restaurants on the way.  The service has always been good, with chips/salsas arriving at our table when we sit.  Our water glasses never have a chance to get empty.  I have tried the chili relleno... a nice sized Anaheim chili filled with what looks to be jack cheese.  Very tasty.  The seafood enchiladas are to die for.  They are smothered in a sauce that makes you want to lick the plate.  Friends have had fajitas and like the fresh vegetables.  Food is always very fresh tasting and has so much flavor.   Prices are very reasonable.  Mixed drinks are good; a great margarita!  The staff is very attentive and friendly.  Don't miss Leticia's.  It is worth the drive.

0jMnkrHPbiLu3UWQlal5bw.text: Absolutely amazing restaurant. The food is excellent and the margaritas are amazing as well. The owner is a great person and the food is reasonably priced. The only down side is a grumpy waiter who thinks he is a gift to mexican restaurants.

ZtM8Ace3GTtu3vSSGN8Hww.text: We went to this place when they first opened and felt they had a very limited menu. We decided to go back and give it another try. While the food was tasty, the special on Friday was the Sopa de Marisco ( a seafood soup). The amount of seafood in it was a joke. A few shells and a couple of shrimp, 3 crab leg halves....I would of expected more for 14.95. It comes with a small piece of bread as well. The service was good and the food came out very quickly.

urBr7IgUzIUYKe4wWIrznA.text: Great food. Excellent drinks. But, I got rushed to place my order after telling our waitresses we were going to have some top shelf margaritas and we weren't in any hurry. Our 9th and probably last time.  I understand that this was most likely a isolated occurrence but I only get one night a week with my honey and there are a Lot of places to eat in Las Vegas.

j_kLGj7MSEJ43UwBYIB9wQ.text: Let me start by saying this is some of the best Mexican food I've ever eaten. The food is not the issue and its the only reason they get 4 stars. We spend a minimum of 2 hours at this place every time we come here. The service is very slow. From the hostess to each waiter we've had. The service is always SLOW

JaJoY6m5I1FFMnMcp4PeGQ.text: We went here for the happy hour and it was soooooo good!  I recommend the Margaritas and the tostadas!  I had to cut myself off from both!  I will definitely go here again and again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I highly recommend the Margaritas!!

u2GMdmiCXO2407eQSd2e-w.text: Love the atmosphere, food, and the service. The wait is never more than 10 minutes. Sometimes we wait for a table or just opt out and head to the bar.  Bartenders are awesome. Tacos and soups are delicious. So yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aw1DpNZPnd_F5g51V8Wwjg.text: Love their ambiance and exterior look especially at night. However, the 5x I've been here...the first time was the best time. And down the slide we go. The remainder of times...service sucked! I don't really use such word often, but felt fitting to do so. Our guy disappeared. Actually, we had the same server 3x! What luck! Each time he disappeared. I felt like our table had that "run forest run" sign they have at Bubba Gumps if you don't need your server. I reenacted in my head the part where I flip.over to the side of the sign that tells your waiter to stop because you need them. The service was special for sure. My husband has ordered their pozole a few times over and seems to be salty each time he has ordered it. He works nearby and sometimes he comes in there because vendors or board members would like to eat there as a informal lunch meeting so he has more dine-in experience. He has felt they have gone downhill. He doesn't feel the price ratio to food quality match and have been inconsistent. I have to agree because their taco salad was pretty skim considering it starts at 10 bucks then whatever extra it costs to add meat. 5 stars for the corn because I never had mexican street corn until here and I have yet to find a spot that can beat that euphoria I felt upon taking my first bite. Corn wasn't overcooked at all! Overall, it's just a 3 star spot for me. I was really excited the first time.in hopes of finding a good sit down mexican restaurant...but unfortunately, Leticias isn't it for us at least. There's nothing extra special aside from.it being the only decent restaurant within the Tule Springs vicinity. Nothing to drive across town for. They do get busy in there, though, but I have been able to bring a stroller in there without inconvenience and no broken buckle high chairs!

vov-JM4TsNHGJuS15X_PNg.text: We used to come here every weekend for the menudo and posole, but got tired of the not so great service. We decided to return because we love the food and on Tuesday they did not disappoint. The service was impeccable and the food was tasteful as always. When family or friends are in town we will be sure to come here.

aRBAnV5nO7pGUIuKy67g4g.text: Luis, our server, is out of this world!! He is charismatic and knows what he is doing. The team here are so friendly!! And the food is wonderful!!

DBlmPopVpvOdnw8pzc5nbw.text: I've been in Las Vegas since 2009 and this restaurant is by far the best Mexican food I've eaten here.   The best part is they are always pretty busy but I've never waited more than 10mins for a table.   I've had a lot of there meals/combos. But I think they have the best Carne Asada. Tonight I had the Nacho fries with the carne Asada. Very full feeling. Didn't even eat them all.  So all the good things said The service has declined and we only saw our waiter 3 times. Once to take our order. Second time to drop off food. Third was our check. The little bus boy had to stop him to refill my drink. This manager lady walked by twice and never offered to refill my empty glass. There used to be a guy named Gus. He made you smile and always told you what was best to order.  This is a good place to eat. But this is definitely not a Texas style Mexican cantina. Still on the search for a New Mexican restaurant i can call home.  Should I go back.........yes no maybe It will be awhile maybe a few months or so.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada nacho fries!

8dRmvG83uvDWK5Qg54MpLQ.text: Am visiting Las Vegas for a basketball tournament.  Had a few hours in between games, Mexican sounded good.    Found Leticia's in the area after a quick search.  When I walked in, the place has an odd smell, maybe it was the furniture or ventilation?  It wasn't an encouraging first impression.  Decor is nice, wood furniture with lots of Windows.  Service very friendly.  When the chips and salsa came, it came with a red, green and bean dip.  Both salsas had excellent flavor and respectable spice level without burning your mouth.  Love bean dip, but this one had a hint of cloves which I don't generally care for.  It grew on me, however, I wondered if all the sauces were going to have "twists" on the traditional versions.  I ordered one chicken enchilada green sauce, one shredded beef in red sauce, and one crispy tacos.  When it came out, I got concerned again, since the presentation was really nice.  In my experience, the Mexican places with fancier presentation often lack authenticity. I usually go for no fanfare.    To my surprise however, the chicken enchilada may have been the best I ever had.  Fresh bright flavor including fresh oregano, tart tomatillo sauce and really tender chicken breast.  Generous amount of meat too.  The shredded beef was super tender and flavorful, and the taco shells were lightly fried just the way I do them at home.  Both very good, although the chicken enchilada was the star on this day.  I'm really picky about authenticity, and Letticia's pleasantly surprised me at every turn.  I don't know if I'll ever be back in this remote area, but the locals have themselves a gem in this one.  If you're a stickler for quality and authenticity like I am, you'll really appreciate this place.    Immaculate bathroom for bonus points lol...it matters.

TC_DpEjGyywb7IHacFELIw.text: When it comes to Mexican food the usual rule is, if the chips and salsa are good than you can set high expectations for the food. The chips and salsa were actually very good. There's a roasted salsa, a green salsa and a bean and chorizo dip that were all very tasty. I ordered the spicy shrimp and queso taco and my husband ordered the Baja style fish tacos. My tacos were delicious but huge! I couldn't finish the 2 that came in my combo. My husband loved his food too. We will definitely be back!

g0QBVZ9rpE6yG7o_WmSdtA.text: This place is fantastic! Their ceviche is outstanding, the staff is friendly, and their margaritas are the best I've ever had!

1UTkODnhXNAWVjD6jnTRRg.text: Been coming here for years. Last few times we've been here it seems the portion sizes have gone down and the prices have gone up. A bowl of fideo soup the size of a small cereal bowl was $8.00. That's pretty outrageous for a item with such little cost. My meal of 2 tamales was $13 which is still a bit high but at least there is some work involved in making tamales. Quality of the food is also not as good as it was a few years ago. It's still ok but it used to be great.

_CX1t8YPStXgX6G4VItLrg.text: My favorite place to eat Mexican food !!! Soooooo yummy and the decor is so nice ! Love this place. It's my go to place !

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy margarita at Letecias!
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hpqFp-c-8AoAaNMZxXiAEw.text: Went for lunch the other day.  It was quiet and we were grateful that we didn't have to wait in the long lines I've heard there can be.  We were served their chips with a cilantro dip, what I think was roasted tomato salsa and beans.  We had heard so many good things about the restaurant and I was a bit disappointed.  I had the chili relleno, and enchilada platter. The pepper was tough and a bit bitter as was the red sauce on enchilada. Hubby had the empanadas which he said were ok. My friend had the crunchy chicken tacos and liked them very much.   I will go back to try something different.

rX1xxyFeXOQNvE8PcXy-Vw.text: Leticia's! Where have you been all my life? I have searched endlessly for a great Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. I was losing hope until Leticia's came along. This Mexican Cocina has got it going on! I love the vibe and decor of the restaurant. My first visit was on a Friday night and boy was it packed to the brim in there! The wait was about 40 minutes. If you come during prime time, be prepared to wait a while.  Complimentary chips and salsa are pretty good. I really like the chips. They're warm and super fresh. Vegetarians be warned! The bean dip has chorizo in it. My husband can't get enough of that bean dip. The chorizo gives it an unexpected sweet taste.   The menu is hefty and prices are a little higher than you're average Mexican restaurant. I was ecstatic to learn that Leticia's had potato and cheese flautas ($13.98). Whhaaa! I'm all about that vegetarian flauta life! The entree comes with 3 flautas and a side of rice and beans. The flautas are topped with guacamole, pico, and authentic Mexican queso (the tasty white crumbly cheese). This entree is way too much food for me, but I do my best to eat all I can, savoring every bite!  The Mexican rice here is where it's at it. I am particularly picky when it comes to Mexican rice. The Mexican rice at Leticia's, however, reminds me of the rice my mom and grandma make. I get all nostalgic eating that stuff!   Service could be better, but it's sufficient.    In a nutshell: Food: 5 Ambiance: 4 Service: 3-4  Of course I'll be back! This is the only legit Mexican restaurant I've come across in Vegas.  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #12

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5WYR-hlJ84Esjy4gLqeyqw.text: Great place! Order the molcajete. You can't go wrong with it. It's this amazing bowl of cheese with shrimp and spices that just send your taste buds on a trip! Around this amazing sizzling bowl is cactus and thin steak cooked to perfection. The cactus is my favorite. To this day, I've yet to find a Mexican place that makes cactus like the one in this dish. It comes with corn or flour tortillas and rice, beans, guac, and veggies for fajitas. Ive also have the tacos before, the prime rib ones are to die for. The service can be iffy depending on who your waiter is. Margaritas are pretty good and I'm not a margarita person. If you want a strong one, order a Cadillac one.  Update: I came here for a business lunch meeting and I seized on the opportunity to suggest this dish to my colleague. Needless to say, that's his new favorite dish here. I did learn something new! A dollar or two more gets you BACON WRAPPED SHRIMP! How can you ever resist bacon wrapped anything?

GNoMa2eYwzfU52TdUmVZ7Q.text: I think this place has very good customer service. Employees are nice and quick on their feet to help you with anything you need. I'd recommend this place to anyone who lives it north Las Vegas.

y0E8v3QE55Qd1N1qpDkoYQ.text: Just moved here from California and wanted a local Mexican restaurant. Found it. Great chips with three types of salsa. Margaritas are the bomb. Huge menu with lots of options. Everything is fresh including the hand made tortillas.

-Q5GoFWYFyh8WI9dwjiBwg.text: Amazing the chorizo beans are to die for and the rib eye tacos on a homemade  tortilla. I have also been for lunch and the menu is affordable and food. Make a reservation for dinner though... you have been warned.!!

tzplsXOkU_9tnU65wR15zg.text: This is the 2nd time i have been here. I love the food. Very authentic. The owner herself came by our table and spoke to us. She is amazing. She talked to us like family. She loved my niece and was very friendly to all of us. Love love love the food, employees, service and everything about this restaurant. Thank you Laticia!!!

ian-vFOquSEIbgDlOq09lg.text: I has no idea there was a such thing as gourmet Mexican food! But now I do. And prime rib tacos will forever be my one of my favorite dishes in the history of Mexican food.

ISZiRRXP-C6MHIjqVAseYQ.text: Amazing food, drinks, and staff! I've been here multiple times over the years and they have never failed once to provide the best food and service!

zP1GFE2wnSCPslHwkEptlA.text: The food was really good but the service was terrible. We saw our waitress came to the table one time to take our order and that's it and didn't even get the whole order right when there was only 3 of us. After waiting for 40 minutes to sit down (because half the tables are for reservations) and then having terrible service even though the food was pretty good it's not worth it.

e1aF5YpSmwFHLpUJRGOC8Q.text: Been here before- tonight we walked in & there was a wait. The hostess was so rude she greeted us visibly frustrated and said to us "30 minute wait are you staying?" It was the rude manner that she said this that made us leave. She obviously does not like her job and was taking her frustrations out on the customers. Never even looked up to make eye contact with us. **  Mgmt should hire nicer people that can better handle stressful situations.

7c7iG-Qzie1ODXvDtJ3gEQ.text: This place has great authentic Mexican food. The service is also fabulous. I highly recommended. The only down is that is a little expensive,  but for delicious food and fabulous service it was worth it.!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really good!!

aA7H1CRMHUNi9mJU67F5dw.text: Love this location, the food is good. We ordered the enchiladas and the fresh guacamole.,, delicious!!

pZppBHfKzZd3B2shaCJEeQ.text: We had our Christmas party here Friday night.  We paid 26.50 a person for 39 people.  We also charged several other fees that was almost half the cost per person.    What a HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!  The food was average at best, but the management was rude and unaccommodating.  We still had 6 people who had not gotten up to get a plate of food.  We didn't have enough food, and requested some more food.  We were told we needed to order off the menu and pay for it separately.  This is AFTER paying for the buffet for all 39 people.   When you bring almost 40 people to your place of business, that's not how you treat them.  Go somewhere else for you parties, you will be sorry if you go here!

7DcIDOdOVBFyFiNIJGDpcQ.text: I've tried this place several times and it's the same terrible experience each time. We get seated right away, but then it seems to take forever to get our food.

aTCyONPf_kgjbdxfDdcmmg.text: Food was great! Servers are awesome and lots of fun.. We had 8 people and they kept the chips and dip coming but they forgot my elote! In all it was reasonably priced and enjoyable!

7NSvX7xraPlioIlw9PmvuQ.text: We stumbled across Leticia's by a wrong turn, but we are glad we found it! We stopped in for lunch- the food is authentic and they serve complimentary chips with salsa and bean dip, my boyfriend and I ordered house margaritas which were quite tasty and then we shared a carne aside platter. The food was delicious, definitely recommend trying the cilantro rice- it was great! Our service was very friendly and always attentive. I really enjoyed our experience and the atmosphere was very fun!

w25batVjA4c2FGjsF7A49g.text: Wow! It's gone downhill.   It's just not the same... I order some Carne Asada and Enchilada plate.. After a few bites I was so confused. TShFlsif_04zD-uoNr7Xnw.text: I wish I could give less then 1 star. Service was slow, food was the worst!!! 4 out of 5 of our meals were not palatable. My sons kids meal dessert never came after 2 requests.  Drinks were great would have ordered another but waitress was missing for most of our dinner.   After the meal 3 out of 5 left feeling ill. 3Pia-YJasR3K0dYvwVJghg.text: Authentic Mexican right down the street! Nice ambiance. Food was outstanding! I had chicken fajitas and they were excellent. My wife had a combination plate which is not on the menu but they were happy to create for her. The margaritas were tasty and beer was cold. I can see why some would think service was slow but it worked out well for us since we were with friends and it was nice not to be bothered by the waiter. But we never had to ask for a refill and they did a great job cleaning the table around us without being annoying. We will definitely make this place a frequent stop!

bOKDtHH0FNhx0BVfRprZPQ.text: The food is good but not our first choice if we are going out for Mexican food.  The location works perfectly when we don't want to go out since there are delivery options. The cheese cake is huuuge (Donald Trump voice).

1hMba78kWkjLasjXTmcXQA.text: Went for the first time this evening. The staff was warm and welcoming. The atmosphere was quaint if expected for a Mexican restaurant. My one star rating is solely based on the food. I got the "best in Vegas" rib eye cheesy tacos. They were heavy, grease ridden, fatty and lacking flavor. I would have been less than thrilled if these tacos were served to me for $5 from a Roberto's. Perhaps this was an off night based on other reviews, but I can't recommend eating here.

adoZpfmRolzoPU_ZGL80WA.text: El Molcajete- Yum! Friend an I stopped in for lunch. We wanted to just stay and recover from our food comas and then have diner. So fresh and made with love!

mF1bjNLS5UO_uEtk8aV5tw.text: Great experience & Very good food, we had a table of 10 on a Sat. Night which, having been a server previously,is no easy task, but the service & server were excellent & very attentive! I'm a Mexican food snob & if it's going to be pricier than a taqueria & not a chain I'm always hopeful & this place didn't disappoint! Great flavor!

9ONmSNQHlJ7wJVrFjEWyfw.text: We used to love this place and ate here often!  The salsa is excellent but the food has gone downhill.  They did get a bad rating from the health department,  was featured on Dirty Dining & had to close for a while. The last time we ate here, my daughter had carne asada and got the worst food poisoning in her life.  She threw up from 1am to 2pm the next day.   Needless to say, we will not be going back there again

Nhsq6WmRWGYMTKWkM4ur2Q.text: Went here because I heard a lot of rave reviews from coworkers etc, and honestly, I am not impressed. It could be that my expectation is too high, but the service sucks. The waitress forget about getting tortillas, doesn't even know her own menu and idk she's was just not paying attention at all, which I would understand if it was busy, but it wasn't that night and there was just another table and a couple of ppl @ the bar. The food that I have ordered was wayyy too salty and it just didn't taste good. My fiance ordered a burrito and he said it was alright. They never check on us till the end when we asked for the check and by then they send a manager? To see if we want them to remake the food. But seriously, i just wanna get out of there by then. There's no point of remaking the food when my fiance is done eating and well just end up staying there for probably another hour longer. Just waiting.  Crappy service, meh food, and it's not even cheap. We will not be back. Oh and they were on dirty dining and attempted to hide their grade smh.

pSmpYnTHsChabdNN7GKPYQ.text: I ordered the carne asada. It was really good. My. Other in law and niece ordered the steak fajitas. (Shared size it was $36) they didn't put much meat in it. They were able to make one tortillas each. I told the manager and they fixed it and only charged us $19. It was busy, but the food was yummy.

9VA7ecfDzN_hOZwK5dJOtQ.text: The service is great and the food is great! Right when you sit, they give you chips, salsa, and refried beans. Order the potato soup, its so good and its homemade.  It can get pretty busy on saturday nights, but it's worth the wait! There is a happy hour, monday-fridays, and you can get little appetizers for 2.50 each. Two of those usually get me full already.

VM_6e77RLvKJKuvkg0zN1g.text: The first time I tried Leticia's, I wasn't feeling it. Then some friends were in town, and we went back based on Yelp reviews. I am happy I gave this place a second shot. The street tacos are absolutely delicious and a great price. The table salsa is a little spicy for this gringa, but I make the sacrifice. :) Service is average. For some reason, there never seems to be a hostess when we go and we wait a while to get seated. There is a nice but small outdoor patio to enjoy the nicer weather. It was also a bonus to find out it is a woman-owned business.

rqrWrFznf6cpHaQsFgrllw.text: Mediocre Mexican restaurant. I've had better Mexican food from a truck. I went based on yelp reviews and was unimpressed even tho the restaurant was full. Not recommended to others and I love small businesses over chain Mexican restaurants.

1YIj2PPv9MnjvEncFcnezQ.text: Went to leticias last night for dinner before a show. We went around 4:40 in the evening and when we arrived we were told the wait would be 15 minutes. We were seated shortly after around 4:50 and we waited for our waiter to come take our drink orders. 10 minutes passes and no sign of our waiter. The hostess walked by us after seating another table and asked if we had been helped yet and we replied with a no. She brought us our chips and salsa and we still had not ordered drinks (we didn't even have water). Finally the lady who was refilling waters brought us some, but did not say a word to us and still no sign of a waiter. We waited about another 15 minutes and no one had even acknowledged us so we ended up leaving. Now I understand that it was a Saturday evening and they were busy, but to not even have someone say a word to us or bring us anything except for our hostess was pretty ridiculous! I was extremely disappointed and upset because they actually have really amazing food and I was looking forward to eating it. Definitely better to go around lunch time because you will actually be taken care of.

JY9gLXmz_idt5XQO1ouFrQ.text: Had a great meal at Leticia's!  The server was excellent and had no problem recommending his favorite dishes.   I'm a fajita fan and usually get them at every Mexican restaurant on my first visit.  Leticia's did not dissapoint.  My wife got a flauta platter that was ok, not the best she's had, but still very good.   Overall, a good experience, highly recommend.

QUItPFsVyuzCCUFZ5SohzA.text: I really enjoyed the food here. I made a too go order for tamales (beef, pork and chicken) and some refried beans and rice on the side. They all tasted flavorful and home made :-) the place was packed but my order was ready and waiting for me at the bar. I'll be back for sure :-)

fl4e4ELnxqAeOcJqfZTKkA.text: The best gourmet Mexican food in Las Vegas. The award winning shrimp tacos are impeccable. On NYE my wife really enjoyed the steak and lobster tail. Great Happy Hour during the week too!

TOrGtZ7zvvLeYckdz96ceQ.text: Best Mexican food in Las Vegas, hands down! My only complaint was the hostess, don't remember her name, but she was the worst hostess ever.  LOTS of empty tables available but she choose to not seat them and make customers wait up to 1/2 hour for a table.  Poor management skills.  Food was delicious!  Can't say enough good things about this place.  If you go on the weekend, just plan to wait awhile for a table.  Its worth the wait though!

AfVPNWooQ-_6CCW-vfeIEQ.text: The quality of the food is great. I would however recommend to have reservations prior going to Leticia's as this place is packed on the weekends. ECKNvQC1zBAQbvA-kfekTg.text: Great atmosphere with great people working there.  Very Mexican style to it.  Great food and drinks.  And happy hour to go with it.

mASXAZDKPlnak9WyR4gE9A.text: I've eaten here a handful of times with friends and with my husband. Every time I have ended up with a waiter that was not friendly or even seemed happy with his job. The last time I ate at this restaurant the waiter was just plain rude when I asked about something on the menu.  Other then the bad customer service the food is just ok.

fMB8PmK9x9OlQZZEsxp1dg.text: We were greeted warmly upon entering, good start.  Seated, then waited about 20 minutes until someone asked if we'd seen a waiter, thumbs down on that one.  I ordered a house Margarita on the rocks which tasted mostly of Margarita mix (no hint of alcohol) and was about 90% ice.  Won't do that again.  We shared the Family Style for Two chicken enchiladas, which came with a variety of sauces for our pleasure, all this was quite good.  Then my wife found a small bone in her chicken, not good.  And the menu has very little to choose from, something rare to see these days.        So we'd go back again (if we had a coupon) only because there were some enjoyable parts to the visit, but too many negatives for us to make it a regular haunt.

RMC36ybGERIKmK3Y54ZnNg.text: Great food! The Shrimp Diablo was absolutely delicious as well as the steak fajitas.  Margaritas were very well made and the shots of tequila came quickly to the table!  Definitely will go back for more.

CoAZczC4X3fleapkTKMZnA.text: The food has definitely a lot better since they opened up.  My girlfriend loves it because it reminds her of her Grandmother's cooking.  I'm torn between Leticia's and Lindo Michoacan.  Very hard to decide when I want Mexican food in Centennial Hills.

gekX3-nOfxSW5EiBGhx3FQ.text: We were recently visiting Las Vegas for a conference. We drove up to Mount Charleston sight-seeing and decided to check Yelp for food in the area. We're so glad we found this restaurant!! It was so delicious, and the service was so very friendly and nice. I chose beef fajitas. They were quite tasty, and I really enjoyed the zucchini and mushrooms that were included in the vegetable mix.  At the end of the meal, one of the owners thanked us for coming in, and we mentioned we were from Nashville. He then had Leticia come over to meet us. They both seemed genuinely pleased to have visitors from so far away. Leticia then surprised us with a free serving of flan to share. It was so completely wonderful--the perfect consistency and taste! Delicious!!  I've never felt so welcomed in a place. I look forward to visiting again. It's definitely worth the drive from the Las Vegas strip.

CP5eUHWSKwGVbxWBW806EA.text: I've been to Leticia's several times, sometimes I'd go in and the food in amazing, then I'd go back the next month and it's average. I dont know if they switch chefs around or what. The service is always been very friendly I just wish the had consistency.

fFYb46Qg9sEMs8AogyjadA.text: I absolutely have loved this place food is good. But the waiters and waitresses are always awful. The last time we went my husband ordered tacos. Well he found hair in them he hadn't eaten the tacos at all and only had a bite of the rice. So the waiter took it back. Me and my children continue to eat our food, so the waiter came back and asked if we would like desert or boxes for our food. They didn't bring him a new plate of food or say anything. We would of paid for the new one plate of food, it was so rude and unprofessional. We will not be returning here.

cqpL4sk0KKbj6VS43OP8uA.text: Delicious!  My favorite items here are the tacos, guacamole, and margaritas.  I have had many other menu items as well and it is all good!

189qIpF_9QBXlQOitB2gRg.text: Good salsa verde, the best I have ever had. Food is mostly good, I stick to the usual tacos or enchilladas. I saw on yelp that if I checked it I would get a free Fried Ice Cream. My server didnt believe me and took my iPhone right out of my hand and went into the back with it. About 5 minutes later he came back and reluctantly gave me the free fried ice cream. Sometime you have to wait for a table even though there are many open. They must be short staffed. I'll keep going back though, that salsa is awesome!!

5mnhZf67dGzDoOYGCuI66w.text: Fun atmosphere,  large portions and delicious salsa choices.  The habanero salsa is only for the brave (and those who freeze their TP).    This has quickly become our favorite Mexican restaurant since moving to Las Vegas.  You typically end of taking much of your food home because of both the portion size and the attentive nature of their servers who keep the chips and salsa coming.   Plan ahead Saturdays as every time we have gone there is a 30 minute wait.  They have family style which we are yet to try but it looks like a really good option as well.

TId5Y6ULJtGyOvJqzQNqdQ.text: Some of the best street tacos I have had! Great salsas and my little girl loves the cheese queso.

bc-tbrvTFX6IJcEMcf1b5Q.text: One of the worst experiences I have ever had in dining.  We were seated fairly quickly, which is better than normal as they are always crowded.  After waiting 45 minutes for our meal, two out of 3 orders were correct.  My husband ordered a cheese enchilada and a grilled chicken taco.  He was brought a shredded chicken taco.  He does not like stewed shredded chicken.  My daughter ordered a build you own burrito, light sauce, it was swimming.  After 20 minutes into our meal, the waitress finally comes back we let he know the issues with our order.  I traded orders with my daughter, problem solved.  My husband, not so much.  He expressed that he asked for a grilled chicken and received shredded. She referred back to her order notes and realized that he did order grilled and it was definitely a mistake, fine. She asked him if he wanted a new taco he said no thank you, but take the taco off of our tab. She comes back in five minutes with a huge serving spoon and a plate and reaches into my husband plate and scooped up the taco off of the plate, and remind you he was still eating his meal.  Worst experience EVER.!!!!!

Hbjcb8fFote3KCH2Pcg-8A.text: Went in to order takeout, they were busy and took forever with my order. When I got home they had given me menudo instead of the Pozole I ordered. So I basically drove 20 minutes, waited forever, got home and was given the wrong thing. I absolutely hate menudo. So that was a huge waste of time and money.

-ROcXWeeUQ2C7Ztl8RLfBA.text: I am writing about their "margarita". We were 4 people so we ordered a pitcher of margarita. Instead we got a VERY small milk bottle of a sweet water and lemon. When the check came we were socked to see the so called pitcher/bottle  cost $31. We never will go back!!!

WW-QYrC3FFFdszNrBoHGEg.text: Great atmosphere and service.  Up scale Mexican food, good presentation. Great margaritas. Chips and dips were very good.

pIYDQ1mpmxZaaqMoYAUP8w.text: Very good. I love their tacos al pastor. Very good portions so go hungry. Their margaritas are delicious I think they have a promotion right now on Tuesdays (margaritas 2x1) haven't go on a Tuesday but definitely a will go soon. My husband ordered their enchiladas with chile the arbol sauce and he love it (this sauce is HOT so be careful). Overall, very good mexican restaurant. We'll be back.

nZD28TCDonfl5mTDphsXWw.text: Wife was craving spicy food last night...Leticia's is right down the street and look, a $15 for $25 Yelp deal too! This was our third visit to Leticia's and I have to say, I'm a fan!  They've been fairly busy each time we visited but they get you seated quickly. One reason behind my 4 stars is their waiting area. It's extremely small and with the cold weather right now, no one wants to be outside. Last night was a busy night and you could barely get in the door to put your name down. They also don't take reservations so with large groups waiting for a table, it was hard to even find a place to stand out of the way from employees and guests coming/going.  As far as the food goes, I haven't had a bad experience here. As soon as you sit down you're greeted with warm chips and 3 dips, one of which is a bean dip which my wife absolutely loves. They also serve a guacamole style dip and a spicier red salsa. Each one is good, the salsa has a good spice to it and they each have a great fresh homemade taste.    Being a cheese fanatic, on our first visit, I had the QuesaTacos and they are spectacular. Last night I had the tamales and even those surprised me since most "restaurant tamales" just aren't that good. I love that they will let you choose two styles in several dishes like the tacos and tamales I've had. I decided on 1 green sauce chicken and 1 red sauce beef tamale. My wife went with shredded chicken enchiladas. The food came out extremely fast and was even brought to us by the Executive Chef of the restaurant. They plate the dishes with generous portions of rice and beans . My tamales were delicious, the masa was moist and fluffy, both meats were juicy and even by themselves had great flavor. The only thing I did not like about the tamales were the onions. I'm usually a fan of onions but they basically threw on some slices of raw onion that just didn't quite work with the tamales. All in all, a great meal and my wife loved the enchiladas as well!  With the $15 for $25 deal, our bill came out to $5.49 (without tip) which included two dinners, one soda and one beer. Beer being another reason for my 4 star review. As another Yelper noted, they serve their beer in frosted mugs which for us beer guys is a little disappointing. Other than that though, Leticia's serves great food at decent prices and we'll definitely be coming back!

g_cdvWDj44tcVO5K82XcsQ.text: The food was mediocre. Was expecting it to be fabulous but it was just okay.  It wasn't just me either. My guests ordered carnitas and I ordered the chile verde. At 7:30 dinner should have been good but the meat was hard and bone was found in the carnitas plate. Not sure I would come here again.

_jHfMGatOI33HU9FkEoMyg.text: I rarely give out 5 stars but this Mexican restaurant is worth every star!  The service and food is both 5 stars.   Right when we sat down, we got chips and salsa right away. Also the manager came around and greeted us. But he kinda scared me when he said hi because he pop his head around the wall lol!  The salsa was bomb!!!!!!!!! We got the green  salsa and some kind if brown one. The brown salsa was so good! Wish the green salsa wasn't that salty but it would of been really good! We also got beans as out dip too! I mixed the green salsa and bean together so it won't be so salty so that was good.  It took me forever to order cuz I didn't know what to get! Everything sounded so good!   I got the make your own burrito! I got confused of the meat part cuz it i wanted shredded beef so the menu said "shredded chicken or beef & carnitas" so I thought they give you both beef and carnitas cuz it didn't say OR . Right? You pick one meat and its a dollar extra if you want another one. So I got charged . Idk what sauce to get for my burrito so I got something red lol and cheese! It was good too! Haha but damn was that burrito huge ;)  haha!   My hubby got 2 tacos they were able to let him choose 2 different meat with no extra charge! Shredded beef and shrimp!  Out waitress also got us a super super spicy salsa! Habanero!! Omg was that spicy!!!!!! I'm on fire!!!! Hahaha!   Soo full after a third of my burrito! Well..Probably cuz all that yummy chips and salsa!   Last but not least! I almost forgot my churro that I saw on yelp that someone posted a picture! And that looked bomb! And guess what! It's so darn fresh!!!! So when our waitress brought it out, I noticed I didn't get any sauce like raspberry and Carmel. She said its order on ask so I was aww oka but then  she still got it for me!! :) yaya! Couldn't eat the churro there :( but it had to be eaten that night ! And it was warm still when I got home! It was still so good! Drooool have to come here again!!! :)))))))

IS6F2Q0RDbrVjCrx0Nting.text: Great atmosphere! Amazing food, chips and salsa was bomb.com! Service was fast and friendly!!

lNVFwhqc5v0SLhCgtct1-w.text: Yummy food and great service! Rogelio was awesome. Had the shrimp tacos and chicken tamales.

wkpqXCNE3heeD-uexZ1NaA.text: My fiance and I decided to check this place out via a referral from a friend. We waited about 20 to 30 minutes to be seated which was fine as they were busy at the time. After we sat down though our waitress was nice she was really slow at attending to our table. Once our food finally came to our table it looked as though it had been sitting for awhile. You know when you put fresh beans on the plate they have a moistness to them.. These looked like dried old beans along with this on my fiance's plate he also received a taco where literally the shell wasn't cooked, it's as though they took it out of the package onto the plate no heating at all, the waitress didn't believe him so he had her physically touch the shell which was raw and she agreed and seemed taken back by it. The main course of his dish was cold on the inside which brought him to believe it was frozen then just reheated. As for my plate im vegetarian and found something suitable enough for me the volcanes, I asked the waitress to leave the cheese off to the side as I'm more vegan than vegetarian. After waiting for about an hour to get our food a different waitress finally brought our plates and there on my meal the cheese was on top. Since we'd been waiting so long I was like screw it I'll just eat it. Though I found out the guacamole and the pico have jalapenos in it which im allergic to unfortunately so I sent the plate back and since they aren't really a vegan friendly restaurant I settled for the Spanish rice which tasted like it came from a box. For all the hype this restaurant puts out it was extremely over priced for what you get and the service is horrible. I wouldnt recommend this place. The only reason I gave two stars was because the ambiance of the physical restaurant itself was nice.

eUCUjXAHVMIih1dD00oVLg.text: Frick. This place. Yeah, it's been on Food Network or Cooking Channel or whatever. Well there really is a reason for it. Unlike other places that have gotten that notoriety and now require reservations 6 months in advance, Leticia's keeps it a hunnit. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I love the quesa tacos which is their signature dish. I've always had great service. It takes some time to get your food, but it's worth it. If it were an option they might get a 1/2 star deduction for that. It's a small place so it might be busier on Friday or Saturday nights. I tend to go when I can make the trek across town which is usually a Sunday afternoon. Just something to keep in mind.

-Hu6U0Bvc5buecdRbmo3jQ.text: Good Food, Fast Service and a pretty good Happy Hour menu all around.  Will go back again.  Margaritas were very good as well!

ldfHwGaeaBQQu-ILzuAYkw.text: ROACHES!!!???!!!!   We always loved this restaurant (despite the usually slow service) but May 1st 2013 will have been our last time ever eating here.   I am a couple months pregnant, my 6 year old son and my husband were given our entrees and as I leaned over for my second bite of fajitas I see a roach hanging out on  the table between my dinner plate and my fajita platter!   My husband scooped it up with a napkin. We all just sort of froze out of disbelief! When the waiter stopped by a few moments later, my son announced there had been a roach on our table. My husband discreetly handed him (Mario) the napkin. He didnt seem too frazzled by this.   Mario informed us that the owner have been spending a lot of money trying to fix their bug problem! Umm??? Hello??? They know they have a serious problem and they are still serving costumers???   I left the table and went to the car. When my husband showed up I asked him what they did or said about this. He said they gave us 3 dollars off our meal! Wow, thanks!   There is a call being put into the health dept. on this issue. ROACHES and food dont mix!!!!

kcukhKjFoXH0n63NgJqlUw.text: Normally the food and service is really good, but today it was sub-standard.  Seems like the carnitas burrito took forever to make and when it finally arrived the sauce on top was dried out.  We asked for more sauce on the side, but the waitress never brought us any.  Had a feeling like they were under staffed.

icp0bgMGhccd-0pEB79Qbw.text: This place has amazing food, but the service gets worse and worse every time we visit. It seems like they have tried fixing it in recent visits, because there is someone to take drink orders and someone to take food. Hopefully it gets better because it's such good food.

L1nZeIWRsr8klPAub6Sbzw.text: Since I've moved to Vegas from NY this is probably the most delicious & authentic tasting Mexican food I have had so far. The restaurant is cute, great service, great food & awesome dessert!

loW2xBQGzT4Xc9iPz5daqw.text: My parents have been raving about this place so we decided to enjoy our weekly Family Sunday dinner here.  I was able to make a reservation for 10 people with a credit card on file so they can charge $100 if are a no show.  Not a problem for me, I'm hungry and I know where I am eating dinner!  They had our table ready to go when we arrived at 6:00 with chips, salsa and beans already on the table for us.  Our server was very nice, made great suggestions and did a pretty good job taking care of us.  There were only a few times we had to wait for refills or ask a second time for something.  The food was excellent.  I had the Leticia's special tacos, one shrimp and one shredded beef.  The shrimp was definitely the way to go on that one.  Yum!!  It was a great evening and I will be back again soon!

zxx2MPGNtsQvhhuLiUPM_w.text: I came in on a Monday, around 3pm. Service was great, but slow and not very attentive. We were sat and waited 15 minutes for anyone to stop by and ask if we would like anything to drink. Another 10 passed and then we got our drinks and got to order. Unfortunately, our drinks were emptied and never refilled or offered.   Our server was very sweet and her bus boy was phenomenal! He continued to bring us chips & salsa, and he even gave us extra bean dip. He made the service great!   Our food was awesome. We had the queso fundido with chorizo and that was unlike anything we have ever had! Our build your own burritos were stuffed & delicious. We will definitely be back - hopefully with faster & more attentive service with the same great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso with chorizo! Took forever but was SO worth it.

gZw8PEam8Wn6FsDtbTEO5A.text: I came for my birthday on a Tuesday night and I really enjoyed the buy one get one free margaritas. The guava margaritas are amazing. It was a pretty busy night and the service was pretty fast. The food proportions are quite large as well.

ORxzjFlgIit2KobJJOjbqQ.text: We got there around 4:50 on Friday evening thinking that it would be crowded--it wasn't.   Three young ladies greeted us at the front door, then spent more time than necessary trying decide where to seat us (I saw several empty tables in the main dining area).   After two or three minutes of trying to figure out where to put us (although I could have gone less than five yards to an empty and clean table), one  of the young ladies said to follow her as she entered the bar area.   At that point my wife said we wanted a table and not a booth. The young lady stopped and looked at something on the podium in front of her and said, "that'll be about a five minute wait!"  I said, "that's okay, we'll find some place else to eat. "  I'll never darken their door again.

_K6PH_7zwc5tDE4_aZU7bQ.text: This is some of the best Mexican food in Las Vegas. Yes, there is a ton to choose from, but this place brings it all. The atmosphere is like a bar in the middle of a small mexican town. The drinks are always to die for with lots of options. Mango, strawberry, guava with jalapeno. There's a flavor for everyone. The staff is always super friendly and helpful. The manager came over several times to make sure we were happy. We had wonderful seats outside in the patio near the fountain. I've never had a dish here I didn't like. My friend ordered the spinach enchilada and it looked AMAZING. I ordered the carnitas and the meat was tender and savory , the rice actually tasty, and the tortillas homemade. Comparable to my San Diego Mexican food. I definitely recommend Leticia's for dinner or even just drinks anytime.

EIGON9H3zGlGx4kcfxWsew.text: Can't even count how many times we've dined here - my family loves it. My husband, who normally does not like Mexican food, really enjoys the food here - his favorites are probably the posole rojo, sopa de albodinga, and carne asada. Last time my sister came to visit we brought her and she raved about the carnitas. My kids love it too and usually choose to come here when asked.  For the majority of our visits the service has usually been excellent.

XiV4RaU79BslH1ePEjrODg.text: I absolutely love the food here but the service and employees are horrible !  I realize it every time I come here but I am always amazed.  It never changes.   Yesterday I ordered three appetizers off happy hour menu.   Waiter asked "chicken or beef" failing to mention each is extra $$$$$  When I received my bill $14.50 - I gave him a $20.   My change was a $5 bill only.    He was expecting the entire $5 for a tip ?!?!   And no coin change !!!!    I know I'll come back again for the food but have to put up with lousy service again I'm sure !

t1tUmZExsE5tpNlEEbU25g.text: We had a party of about yesterday.  We were all very impressed with the ambience, the service, the food, especially from the lovely owner. 1. Our iced tea were kept full all the times. 5* 2. We had chips and salsa, 3 kinds. Fried rolls and chicken tostada, I think  (see photo). Sorry for my lack of understanding about Mexican food. The chops are thick and crunchy, but not too hard nor greasy. It went well with the salsas. The tostada were just right, crunchy, deep flavor, juicy but not soggy. I don't know how they did it. Perhaps with a touch of bean. I gave 5* for food quality. 3. The friendliness of the staff and the owner coupled with a cozy but upper class setting guaranteed my return here with my family. I gave another 5*.

f-llZ8_b7doQdDc5DCPFLQ.text: I live 5 minutes from this place and I've never tried it before tonight. Man, have I been missing out. We came the right night. Monday is all you can eat street tacos. They have 2 options, $15 for beef, chicken and pork (5 options) and $20 for those plus seafood ones (8 or 9 options). We got the cheaper one to try because we were unsure of how good they were. They were great! They were stuffed with meat (not skimpy at all) with onions and cilantro and they give you some guacamole, limes and some come with sauces to put on them.  They also have happy hour from 2-6 and have a bunch of small plates for $3 and $5. We tried the shrimp ceviche and cochinita pibil that were both $3. They were pretty good too. They also give you chips with different salsas and refried beans. Your first check-in, you can get a free margarita. If you go during happy hour tho, you can get one for $5 and they're a pretty good size.  If I remember right, their specials are: Monday- Ayce street tacos Tuesday- buy one get one margaritas Wednesday- 50% off wine Thursday- kids eat free

AZpCS2eIjgnaKOPCJdXF9A.text: I am honestly so sad that i don't like this restaurant.  We live within walking distance so we keep going back hoping it gets better but it doesn't.  The food is mediocre at best and the service is slow as molasses.

c5fu7vEwKECTojfxo20kag.text: Puebla Mole was good but my husband birria had old and dry beef no bueno Leticia please correct this because I love going there for Dinner .

MMWD5OSpzwmNiX4DA8nJFQ.text: The food was excellent. I had chilaquilles with ranchero sauce. Before ordering, I tried the mole as well. It was fantastic. My meal came with beans and chorizo potatoes - both well seasoned and great tasting.  If it were just about the food, I would give 4 1/2 stars (some salt could have been added); but, my service was terrible. I had to ask for silverware, then salt and pepper, and my water stood empty at the edge of my table, directly in front of my server while she stood chatting with other servers. She did come ask me how my food was, but ignored my water glass.  So if bad service doesn't bother you, buen provecho!   I'm back for a second try. I'm having the hamburguesa.  When I got here the waitlist was 15 minutes but I hopped right up to the bar. Trevor greeted me promptly and offered chips and salsa. I had to ask for napkins (again); this seems like a trend because others sitting at the bar had to do the same thing.  My food came quickly. It was cooked competently- but the description didn't match the low level of flavor. I still feel like the food is under seasoned - I had to ask for macha (some sort of chilies).  Service was sooooooooo much better!  I wish the flavors were more interesting.  Third time is a charm! Ramiro gave us excellent service. I didn't have to ask for napkins! And the food tasted wonderful.

vrHGqMPKYmHqlCC4Ch-9Nw.text: Simply great food. Not your typical "Americanized" Mexican food. They aren't shy about flavor or spice, though with spice nothing is too spicy it covers up the wonderful flavors.  You come hungry and leave happy and full. Not only are the award winning tacos they offer award winning but you get some extremely good chips and salsa. Don't forget the several flavors of salsa (and even yummy dipping refried beans too) they offer and definitely try the amazing guacamole. The guacamole isn't just a little bowl of green mash either, it is a flavorful mix of chunks of perfectly ripe avocados, tomatoes, etc.., and even some incredible fresh Mexican cheese that adds that perfect touch to finish off the guacamole perfection that it is.   I don't even really like guacamole, it reminds me of well baby poop, but rather guacamole they serve a Leticias is one that not only I could buckets of it's is something I randomly drool about even though it's been a few months since I've tasted it.  Whatever they wait you might run into is well worth the time. Happy eating

oL5FHG1DCivBgsYHVogcZw.text: Holy cow, superb service. The staff was very attentive and polite.Chips and salsa are great, especially the cheesy bean dip, which they brought more as I couldn't stop eating it.  When my 2 crispy shredded beef taco plate came, I was surprised how much meat and cheese was on them. The flavor was Incredible. They checked on us several times and made sure we were happy, satisfied, and had everything we needed. The place has quite a buzz, and my wife and I now know why.. we will eat there on a regular basis. I will hype this place to anyone who will listen! Keep up the good work!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time here! Love the smell, should be great!

8yPc0CPJJOBPN0XdpyJugg.text: They always mess up!! Service is slow! Waiting for a table that was empty when I checked in! Order an iceberg. Oh they don't do that anymore!! They never get my order right! Time after time. I have been here plenty of times hoping they will be on their game. I leave always disappointed and frustrated.

MfUJdB9799PE1tknAILsjQ.text: The Best Authentic Mexican Food in Las Vegas!  Everything I have tried is delicious. I highly recommend this beautiful resturant! Worth the drive from the strip... Excellent Service. Leticia please open one in San Antonio!

atL7yp6Ifi7sTn6DyEl9ug.text: During my work out at 24 hour fitness I saw Leticia's Mexican Cocina on their TV. Leticia's food looks so good immediately after my work out I stopped by at Leticia's. Their free chips tasted good along with 3 sauces to dip them with. For me Leticia's food was good but not great some of their food was unique and some of their food is sorta bland for my taste buds. My server did a good job from start to end of my meal. If I was in the neighborhood again it would be a pleasure to stop by again and try something different for a change.
