-mbbA7xfbTxG6Kayd3_FHQ.text: Service is always amazing and the food is delicious. With a reservation you will never wait, and staff is very accommodating.   The only negative is that it's very loud. Sometimes if we are having dinner, can barely hear the conversation at our table.   Margaritas are awesome though

jVbB25V5qG8md4rUbbQTtA.text: Came during lunch and the empanadas are Great!  The flavors are on point and the service is good. The server is very nice and has a smile on his face.  The decoration and the lighting is Amazing .  Beautiful Restaurant

tVnwbEmLkRMByi6ghD4Tig.text: Always good the many times I've been here had my Cadillac margarita to start much better than the regular one and only a dollar more. The menu has changed a little over the years they used to have a whole fish but customers weren't ordering it so they took it off. Anyway I had this dish I really enjoy can never remember what it's called the last one on the specialty section. A large heavy black clay bowl with fish clams mussels shrimp topped with a lobster tail in a red sauce w/pablano peppers and then they give you cheesy rice to mix in makes everything gooey delicious they also give you corn or flour tortillas. Atmosphere is good service is good food is good. Enjoy I do every time I go there.

U-rQ-Q06lAWC8oLaUbJ2PQ.text: This is our 6th or 7th visit and again, excellent! New bartender this time. Kindra was great!!!!

PrxI09vilaNuRieBmRX6Ng.text: Wow.  The chips were very fresh and they give you three choices to dip them in - a fresh chipotle salsa, refried beans, and a fresh cilantro green salsa.   We ate almost all of them.  We ordered from the lunch menu which is affordable.  The chile verde is some of the best I have ever tried.  Tender and flavorful.  The taco salad was also good.  Portions were more than adequate especially after eating a whole bowl of chips.  Service was very good.  The waitress was very helpful and had good suggestions.  We were a little in a hurry and she was attentive and got us served quickly.  We didn't lack for anything. We sent with a restaurant dot com coupon for lunch and it was accepted without issue.  I see that they have coupons on Yelp which I might buy because I will be back here again.

-E9NagnNPU0YFV6MYzFrDw.text: I loved this place when it opened years ago, now not so much!!! The carne Asada taste like pot roast n it's dry n tasteless n when it did taste like carne Asada it was over cooked n tasteless, n the fajitas last time were way over cooked n tasteless so I've really givin it 5 more chances and now I'm finally done!!!! Sad how 5 years ago was delicious and now just bland dry and tasteless!!!! Owell tome to drive way back to viva Mercado's!!! Yummm

_4WpLoOd2SvR2ITSAWS6SQ.text: It has been a while since we ventured this way and we forgot how good the food really is.  The menu is excellent, the smells coming from he kitchen are rich and mouth watering.  They are very busy tonight but we manage to get a seat.    We order a couple of appetizers, Mexican Shrimp Cocktail, large chunks of crab, shrimp, lime, avocado, and tostaditas, very good, and the Volcanoes tostaditas, 3 mini tostades with yummy melted cheese, pico de gallo and creme.  Both very good.  For my main entree, I couldn't resist getting the El Molcajete (fajitas), grilled carne asada, tiger prawns,  grilled nopales (cactus) and again some yummy melted cheese served in the volcano bowl.  Love this, a must try.  Service was great, food was delicious, just wish she'd open a location on the West side!

WhTweuCQfN-2e_4hEx4LCA.text: It's Friday afternoon, 3:30 my friend and I had a rough day and were so excited for happy hour! Not to mention one so close to home! Not our first time here, we come often. When we arrive, told no more seats at the bar area, she's closed and we're sat on the other side of the restaurant. Server explains no happy hour unless in bar area. Once I explained what we were told, server checks with the manager and comes back with a no can do! So, of course I ask to speak to manager,  who comes to the table and still claims that even though that section is closed, she offers us to move to the bar, but there are no seats open. She is not able to honor the happy hour prices. Basically she said it's a promo to get people in; what I get from this: once they get 10-12 at the bar for happy hour, there's no more happy hour pricing, which is False advertising! Shame on you! We left! There's Happy hour all over town, we went to Lindo Michoacan and were treated wonderfully.  *update 9/4/17 - regarding owners response****  Of course, leave it to the greedy owner to respond with an answer that clearly reinforces the poor employees decision! They had to say no because Ms Leticia has threatened them!!! Ha! You're making plenty of money, you're restaurant is always busy, shame on you!! That is no way to treat your loyal customers. Greed will only ruin and destroy you. Good luck with all that!

2AS7ZM8-70-GoYFBwtbUDQ.text: Excellent service,  great atmosphere,  amazing food!! We used the yelp deal, got a free yummy margarita, and pain $15 for a meal worth much more. Definitely a perfect spot to bring out of town guests, or to have an intimate meal with someone special!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A6JJOkNhqXMwfWbvCb6rHg.text: I visited Leticia's this evening with high expectations that were met and exceeded by Joanne and David! I ordered my goto favorite dish, the Carne Asada dinner which was spectacular and delicious. The service was on point, meals were accurately prepared, and the drinks, chips, and salsa's were replenished as needed without any wait time. This is the Leticia's that I have long remembered and appreciated. Also, a big bonus is the freshly made tortillas from their new tortilla station!!! Restrooms are large and clean. Atmosphere was positive, lively and on the loud side. Park behind the restaurant for best parking options. It seems like road construction is always happening in this area.

aeTu410kMa0fyNGgLJJqmQ.text: Delicious enchiladas con pollo y mole poblano!  Carnitas and margaritas were good as well!

H-YaUXZWD68L3E6YkWLVYg.text: Never a bad time. They have turned things around after their last drop in rating from the county.

KGxoikU3EXAMjP5KFiJGtg.text: I have to put this one right in the middle. I love this place for their Fideo soup. I literally could eat it everyday... the broth has so much flavor and literally warms my soul! BUT I have ordered other entrees through Grub Hub and was disappointed. Tonight I ordered a house dinner salad with carne Asada and sauteed veggies (both optional add-ons). The veggies were not sauteed. It was raw mushroom and raw zucchini. The spring mix was sparse, there were very few tomatoes, and there definitely wasn't enough dressing to cover the salad. The carne asada was good, but that's about all I can say.   I'm not completely knocking this place, but maybe dine-in instead of Grub Hub so you can give feedback and fix your order.

6VZ6fMGHuNabCzlOyqC_YQ.text: Absolutely hands down my favorite Mexican restaurant! I take my family here every time they come to Vegas . The fish tacos are amazing and they have so many menu options! Everything I have tried has been delicious! Staff are friendly and they do well with time for how busy they can be!

WehMd_NGt3WLvglu4TwzXA.text: I was so disappointed with this visit. We never received share plates with our appetizers we had to use napkins. Once our entrees arrived the food looked tired and wilted like it had all been pre made and just sitting in the back. Rice was drastically over cooked.   The server not once cleared our dirty plates from our table. I hate writing a 2 star review because I love to support neighborhood establishments but Leticia's has gone down hill and fast. Hopefully they can get back on track soon.

kHDgtoVGMeHahe-iIy6BWw.text: Loved it here! Went for dinner last night with my boyfriend, got 2 frozen margarita's, the service was seriously fantastic! Everyone was really attentive with refilling our water cups and chip basket. Our server was amazing- super friendly, energetic, and checked on is often. Our drinks and food were ready quickly. Everything was delicious!! Definitely coming back soon!

lzMyqfwpvLIdGsMhhrXnWQ.text: This was my 4th or 5th visit. Every time has been great. Las night we had my 10 year old daughter and the server was so nice and helped he build her burrito. then, I forgot my reading glasses, could barely read the menu, and again the server helped me with my order.  The food is great, I love the look of the restaurant. Restrooms were clean. The only reason I don't go more often, is because it is not by my house. Hey, Leticia, how about moving to Summerlin.

XGqF-HsJMMIVALIlYFnKGQ.text: Apparently when you ask for a burrito your way it's a fight. 3rd time asked for it my way 3 times wrong. This is what I always ask for. Chili Verdi no beans easy rice extra cheese. Never gotten one yet. Get home its wrong. Yeah no beans can't find the rice and no cheese. Food quality is great. Obviously a communication problem in the kitchen. But I don't really care what the cook thinks. I want it my way for just once.

UJ5WgyDaGRgpCC-1h7aopg.text: When we moved here from Atlanta we new we had to find a great local spot for Mexican food. Wow, Leticia's is the best! Margaritas are wonderful, queso tacos will blow your mind! Even the free bean dip (and salsas) with chips is incredible. Always great service and wonderful food. So thankful to have them near home. We will see you soon Leticia! Be sure to check out their Happy Hour and daily specials!

j4e4I03eXhd2fhHtupHP1g.text: This is our Go To mexican spot. The food tastes authentic with an essence of modern n traditional American (which means a blend of cultures!). Ask for spicy or none and you will get it. The food is good and the service is excellent. It is a bit dark in the interior (we like it light so we can see our food n the cleanliness of the place).

Ymu0Kyi3LHIOY4N9OgvoSw.text: Food is great but the service is horrible. Tried this place twice and the service went from bad to worse. Bussers walk by without filling drinks or picking up dirty dishes. It took twenty minutes for the waitress to introduce herself and almost an hour to get food. The waitress forgot to put in the order and of course blame was focused elsewhere. This seems to be a common theme and although the food is really good the service is just too bad to tolerate.

uLLQAUk6LvO1vSgo2_Yf3A.text: I've heard so many great things about this place. I finally got to try it for myself. I was insanely pleased!! The beans with chips as an appetizer -Oh Em GEE!! Heavenly!! There is a hint of chorizo in it, so bomb!! We ordered burritos which were enormous and delicious!! I also had a raspberry margarita, that hot the spot! I requested hot sauce, and a home made salsa was brought out. This was the hottest salsa, I've ever had and I am a spice fanatic. I truly enjoyed this authentic food and highly recommend, will definitely be returning. My waiter was Ramiro, he was very pleasant and attentive, much appreciated.

UMOBjo1f3BN4dYi5_9J3nQ.text: Had lunch with the wife here. She ordered chicken tacos and I ordered the pozole. You can never go wrong with the pozole. I've ordered a few times already and it's always hot and delicious. Our service was great and very attentive.

-cEoU4OzvsKpKLgQo66WaA.text: Excellent and friendly service !! Sat in the bar area in a booth. The chips and 3 dips were delicious !! We also had several appetizers and everything was spot on and I will definitely go back !!!

Ss14bu6rXKLGnnCAgP-YSA.text: After an hour and a half of sitting and waiting for our food, we ended up leaving disappointed.  The kitchen was totally understaffed and who knew when our food would have come.  So disappointing!

PS63WkPi-gsFLLCQLAjkmQ.text: I have always enjoyed coming to Leticia's for dinner, so I wanted to go there for happy hour.  I was greeted by Tammy the day bartender and she told me about the specials...I would have to say some of the best food and drink offerings for your money in Vegas.  Drafts 3.00 and quite a selection of delicious food items as well for only 3.00 each.  Tammy was great; she knows all her customers and I was treated just like a regular.  So if you need a cool place to hang out from 2 to 6, try Leticia's. You will not be disappointed!

bfJ174qRtBgghQQawhGUHw.text: Love love love me some Leticia's! I've eaten here multiple times and have never been disappointed. So far they have the best restaurant style Mexican food in Vegas in my opinion. Service is always great. The only draw back to eating at Leticia's is that there is almost always a wait to get tables because everyone else on the North West side of town is trying to eat there too!

7eHjz0bQEHFCeEwO0dRmuw.text: Service is always good and food is even better. We've moved across town but still make the drive from time to time to eat here, that's got to mean something right? It does get really busy for dinner time so we normally do lunch to avoid the wait.

hQUysGh6_V9MODgtgmxQhA.text: Amazingly fresh food and great customer service! We invited a new dessert tonight, a sopapilla with fried ice cream inside, it's called the Brett, ask Joanne!

Z0LMP8v5UuwUaZL3dG0g9w.text: My husband and I just moved here from AZ and we just love, love this place.  The service is always as wonderful as the food is.   The owner is the wonderful lady in the kitchen cooking the food. Yum,yum!!!  I have to say we have only been here a month and have almost been here for lunch or dinner about 20 times. Yes it's that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing and free for checking in.

F4vBxFb636lRWe3uEtR4Bw.text: Service is always great. Salsa is delicious. None of the other food is worth ordering. There have been fruit flies in my Margarita.

HjMuMXs_VuEEbHvX2d_74w.text: Don't ask me how I ended up at this restaurant located in one of those annoying fake-downtown retail/dining centers way the fuck out in B.F.E. Well OK, it's because my boyfriend lives out there. Otherwise, I would never have come here.  We went during happy hour, and tried everything on their happy hour menu, all of which was shockingly affordable and shockingly delicious. The house margaritas were excellent, too. The chips and salsa were AMAZING.  The atmo is sort of casual upper-middle-class-suburban Tex-Mex, and they have a patio for outdoor dining, where you can bask in the breeze created by all the SUVs blasting down one of those ginormously expansive asphalt rivers that pass for roads up there.  Overall, it was excellent food at a great price, but I probably would not drive all the way up here to eat here. If they opened a location closer to midtown, then maybe.

YUR8tDKTSXSXlBnSSIrUWQ.text: The best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas !!  same taste like Mexico City ... A+A+A+

ZxXApFgJTy__ApKgvjIjiA.text: All Way's good for Las Vegas Mexican. This is more tex mex then socal mexican ford

_J7zyuvsAvoRfNHelfEIJQ.text: This place was a nice little gem in an area we had not been aware of before.  On a cute, quaint street.  The bar offered NFL game time happy hour with really delicious margaritas for the price and the food was delicious.  Our waitress was really nice and the restaurant was very well decorated.  There was a nice little patio area which we would enjoy relaxing and eating at on a normal day, but we were interested in the game at that time.  Great place, would go back again!  P.S. Happy hour special is only at the bar.

6W6PfyUzaSzp-PO4Ck9dWw.text: Plan ahead. Be hungry. Be thirsty. BE able to make a decision. It's GREAT food. It's GREAT atmosphere. GREAT energy. GREAT ambiance. TASTY ass guacamole! TASTY ass, EVERYTHING! The agua de tamarindo was on POINT!! My ONLY let down you ask? WHY! Oh WHY are you SO far away from me?!?!?!?!?!

PwOh8VfAOEoZrTYEHmnWGA.text: I love the food. But the service seems to be lacking the last few months. The last 3 times it took forever for drinks, chips, food and check! I love the food it's what keeps us coming back.

6qQa40sVwl4Md03AX0v9Gw.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in all of LV. Happens to be close to gown too! Have eaten multiple dinners and loved them all. Recently I was able to attend a business meeting and was exposed to a breakfast menu that was delish! Wait staff has always been superb and recommends new dishes and combos. Lots of times I let them choose my meal.

_sboezpCQL8MQdyrL5onUw.text: The best of the best as far as Mexican food in the entire Las Vegas valley!  Seriously look no farther cause this is it.  The portions are perfectly sized and moderately priced.  The mood and ambiance is perfect for a date night or a family sit down for great food.  This is a family business and you can tell by the personalized service and great tasting food.  Plenty of parking available, but it does get busy on the weekends, but why won't it?!!  The food is just that good guys!

8FYfBL2qO5kg9LBSz9ZHAg.text: My boyfriend and I always enjoy date night here. The wait time to be seated is always a bit of a wait so don't expect to be seated right away. The chips and salsa are delicious and I always get a burrito topped with their green sauce. Delicious! BUT whenever I have ordered an alcoholic drink they are never really all that great :/ just to warn you! But other than that I always go back!

N2g99JRbu3i2KdSnT3aPMQ.text: This place is pretty good.  Their tacos, burritos, chips, salsa, and fried ice cream is great.  I've been here 4 or 5 times and their pretty consistent with great service too!!!

FTO13OGXIPeU2ltNDj8g7A.text: I can't speak on their whole menu, but my husband & I always order half a dozen tamales to share & they are AMAZING (& filling). Letitia's also offers Military discount, so that's a plus!

gzG_aKOfpspNELvX4Msy6w.text: This was our "go to" Mexican spot for the last few years, but they're slipping.  Went last night and the service was slow and confused...the noisy drunks at the bar were annoying...and the food wasn't nearly up to par...flavorless carnitas and the rice and beans were dried out and seemed to have been sitting on the plate for a while.  Very disappointing from a place we had reaaly enjoyed in the past.

ALdsaU8FpjDJ6LOdNrT8Ng.text: Great local Mexican restaurant with very authentic flavors.  Service is friendly, helpful and knowledgeable of the menu. The shopping complex they're located in is super cool also. Will definitely be back!

9YtMBP9IKNXvqE-vIXKqNQ.text: Our visit happened to be on their first anniversary during Hispanic Heritage month, so I hope the quality of service and food is consistent throughout the rest of the year! I had an amazing watermelon Agua Fresca and carne asada. Portions were HUGE and presentation was perfect. Sometimes Mexican restaurants can just slop their portions together, but this is not the case here.   It may not be Abuela's food to a "T" but it's pretty darn good! We put a lot of weight in customer service and this place does not disappoint!

EOzWeTzsxTyvPXo8UIcG5Q.text: My friend and I showed up for lunch Mon 2/17/2014 just as they opened at 11 am. We were the 4th or 5th party to be seated.  20 min later, our "waitress" finally took our drink order. She disappeared again and re-appeared at 11:30 only after I let the busser know that we were ready (HAD BEEN READY) to order our food. She took our order and when I asked about "margaritas" she defensively shifted the blame on the bartender.  Our drinks, which inc. a  $9 "margarita" which, I feel, had a heaping tsp of tequila arrived at about 11:40. ONE HOUR later (12:05) we still had no food in front of us. When the busser, not our disappearing waitress, asked "how's everything?" we said we were still waiting for our food!!!  Several min later, our "waitress" re-appeared on "regretfully" said the kitchen was out of the entree dish we both ordered.  Shouldn't the kitchen communicated this to the wait staff PRIOR to the opening or at least when we FIRST placed the order... not 25 min later??? When we finally get our revised order, the food was mediocre.  However, I order the chicken tinga burrito and almost threw up when on my second bite, I chomped on a 3" bone!!!! GROSSS!!!! The manager came by and apologize and stated she was going to speak with ...get this....The VENDOR who supplies the pre-cooked chicken to the restaurant.  They don't even cook their own chicken!! The best part of that 1 hour 45 min experience was the complimentary fried ice cream  and the visit with my friend.   Lindo Michoacan, Here I come from now on!!

1kLPJkZCGfb_57ZVRaraBQ.text: Had lunch here today. First let me start by saying the food is great. The salsa brought with chips when you are seated ( and you server acknowledges your existence) its so delicious it makes it a little hard to write this review. We had to ask the busser to take our drink order, then about 10 mins later we had to ask him to have someone come take out order. With a 3 yr old and 1 yr old in our party it was getting ridiculous. Our busser (great young guy) hurried around the restaurant doing as much as he could for several tables I saw the servers standing off to the side talking. As we waited for our food another patron was up front complaining she had only seen her server once and was NOT happy about her service. One of our water cups was dirty and when the guy came around to refill it was with carbonated water and had to give us all new water (no biggie) the food FINALLY came and the kids were beyond starving (took about 30 mins) I could understand if the place was busy but there were 4/5 tables max... The food was a little cold but tasted great. The place is clean and the decor is very nice. The music and the salsa were my favorite part. We left a nice tip (for the busser) it's sad to think this kid worked as hard as he did for a woman whom we interacted with twice to get the tip.. I'm not sure the salsa is enough to bring us back. Staff really needs to get it together even on a slow day. People that were seated after us had their order taken before us and we had to ASK to helped.

yiFewrf_kW3E8OJEUUKzOw.text: stopped in for lunch. had the lunch fish taco with rice and beans for $7.  the taco was enormous.   it was almost as big as a butrito.  good value and they have good happy hour specials

x0ajijgkXCXu0erPcQZ_MQ.text: Amazing food. Friendly, prompt service. Fair prices. Warm, fun atmosphere. Basically, a must try. I love Leticia's!

5DyxIsecGnsjb3yaKowmRA.text: They serve authentic mexican food.  This is not a great place for picky eaters.  If your idea of mexican food is Taco Hell and On the Border then stay away from this place.  If you are in a hurry, don't come here.  My visits here have not been "slow" but this is a sit down restaurant and the kitchen takes a little while.  Kitchens are slower when they are making food from scratch - the end result is better food.  I've always had friendly service and last time I was in they were training some nice new people.  Kids menu is very reasonable and there are tons of choices - all of them mexican food.  If your kids will only eat chicken fingers and boxed mac n cheese then I suggest a chain restaurant.  My daughter liked her taquitos, beans, and home made vanilla ice cream.  I'm glad this restaurant opened in our neighborhood.  I wouldn't drive across town just to eat here but it is worth a shorter trip or a visit if you are in the area.

UKylSBiWUPdZ-HXuxK-npA.text: I eat here regularly. The food is regularly good. The prices are slightly high. If you're looking to save a buck order your food ala cart and fill up on chips.

adU5ASp1UOUTEwKMYPNwkA.text: This place was amazing.  Everything ..... I mean everything tasted like it was just picked out the garden and cooked fresh.  The atmosphere was pleasant, the staff was super polite and engaging while we were there (I know, as opposed to when we were not there).  Serving sized were more then adequate, flavor was off the charts and prices were reflective of the quality product the cooks placed in front of you. My only regret is that I didn't get a chance to have the corn on the cob plate, which looked amazing on the other table (party of 16 all had one).  Monday night and it was busy with only a five minute wait.  My wife had a enchilada, my daughter the burrito (enchilada style) and I had the Two Tacos, which actually had additional flour tortillas, so it was actually like Four Tacos. The cheesecake was probably the best I have had in Vegas.  Very surprised by this little slice of heaven we found.  We will definitely be back again and again.  Thank you .

Qhf4n8HuAg4jQT3TFrWWAA.text: A little on the pricey side, but well worth it. The restaurant is a wonderful celebration of Hispanic culture. The chili pepper is the superstar here. I love the patio dining. We sampled all the sauces each one handcrafted and delicious. They have agua frescas and elotes locos. loved it.

9WTGgOQg9ZANos9W2TF5uQ.text: I have been to this place twice and have been disappointed both times. Coming from the south where this is great Mexican food on every corner this is a vague interpretation of Mexican food and not for the better.

gsfxFiQebCxpb_AeBK8XEQ.text: I love this place- the chips and dips that come free on the table are so good, and the mushriom spinach enchiladas are off the hook. So amazing, and a mo ths worth of cheating in one meal. Just have to mention a couple of things that have disappointed me in my last few visits. At least the 3 most recent times that I have decided to go to Leticias have been based on the awesome weather, and wanting to sit outside on their patio. Every time, Ive been told that they have no server for the outside. Its not like I went there once a week for 3 weeks. How can this be? The patio is amazing, and so cute, and when the weather is good, to sit outside and chat and eat does not compare to sitting inside with a/c and a loud restaurant- so that was a bummer. Multiple times. The other thing is that I got my world rocked by the vegan tamales on a previous visit, and tried to order them on the next few visits, and was told that they were out of them. If it werent for those things- it'd be a 5 star. Please Leticias- get some people to man the patio. The weather is amazeballs right now, and Im getting the itch! Dont let me down!!

izmLIIJmo82fxDgzfdYwRA.text: We snuck in to this place back when it opened, and are good for once a month trip. Without fail, one of us ALWAYS gets the El Molcajete, not a better dish in Las Vegas.  Ever thankful it survived to now THRIVE in this economy!

klL3Qa-3qWcM-vIPlTC_5g.text: 3 stars.  Cold food was sent back.  Kinda snotty waitress. BUT - if can get passed that, the food was AMAZING! Completely traditional Mexican food.  I ordered a Paloma to drink (2 of them) and potato filled Flautas with Mexican corn.   The green salsa will make you reminisce of GTO. Ay mi comadre, que te adoro!

iAt1UrJs6xhrrAYmyTt1og.text: Right of the bat, the food at Leticia's is the best Mexican food I have ever had in Las Vegas and I'm a Vegas native. I consider Leticia's part of my weekly nutrition plan and actually buget monthly to eat there.  The staff is always awesome and helpful. Sometimes they get very busy and the food many take a few extra minutes to come out, but I understand that happens sometimes and it's worth the wait. The prices are fair and I'm always more than satisfied when I leave there. Management is always friendly and will go out of their way to say hello and make sure all is going well when dining at Leticia's. I hate when I see negative comments about Leticia's on Yelp. People just like to complain about anything. Stay home and eat Taco Bell if your an unhappy hater! Thanks Leticia's for the great food and service every time.

Yxcau8MOyWCKUa-L7BoL5w.text: Not a great place for the kids. Limited menu for them and nothing American kiddie food like other Mexican places.. My oldest tried an appetizer instead Mexican sliders on a bun... Gross. She didn't touch it an neither did my husband or I. I had the carnitas and they were OK. Nothing to rave about. Service was OK and they weren't even busy. I think Roberto's down the street taste way better for a fraction of the price.

Md6dD2pfJUxlbKcKqmN4Zw.text: Another great dinner. This place is by far the best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas! The dips and salsa is amazing and the food is delicious. Service can be a little slow at times however.

0OD57VshvwLkt_LgdnkeWw.text: Taking toddlers out to eat is a training exercise. Seriously. We are so thankful for the restaurants that are understanding of this. Leticia's is one of those places. We go there regularly for this reason. They are patient, tolerant, welcoming and gracious. Juan is regularly our server, and a True gentleman. And the food is amazing, too! Highly recommend for families.

og6GB9PuVnsSpeUQmCWyEQ.text: Morri runs such a clean, well managed floor! The steak ranchera was excellent! Moist and flavorful, with the perfect amount of heat. Free mimosas on mother's day was the perfect touch!  Thanks for everything, guys!

mityC85h7jTOLsgiCOeB0w.text: The food and the service was very good and the staff was friendly. Best Mexican food that we have had in Las Vegas so far.

Bw0EYeuJV0J_daQ73j1hIg.text: I'd say more like 3.5 stars.  We tried this place for the first time Friday night.  I am always happy when a restaurant opens up here in Centennial.  Now let's just hope it can STAY open!  There were good things about Leticia's and a few not-so-good things.   THE GOOD Our chips and salsa and waters were brought to our table right away... like within 3 minutes of sitting down.  I like that.  The chips weren't anything special by any means, but both types of salsa were very flavorful.  I especially liked the chipotle based one.  The menu had a lot of variety, lots of things I would have liked to try.  It was hard to decide what I'd try first.  The prices were very reasonable for big portions.  My shrimp tacos were excellent.  (The rice that came with them was a different story, but more on that below.)  I'm embarrassed to admit that we ate through a whole basket of chips and a whole cup of that chipotle salsa.... but happy to say that we didn't even have to ask.... they just brought us more as soon as we were done.  The service staff seems to work very well together.  They seemed on top of things everywhere we looked, and were definitely good to us.  THE BAD My husband's seafood enchiladas were definitely "meh."  Very bland tasting, with more of a pasta-type sauce on top.  But even more bland was the rice that came with my shrimp tacos.  UGH that was some nasty, dry, tasteless stuff!  Our desserts were very fairly priced, but just kinda "meh" too.  He got the fried ice cream, which had a kind of stale-tasting shell around the ice cream.  I had the sopapillas, which were ok.  I mean it's just fried dough with some cinammon and sugar.... there's not a whole lot you can do with that ... but I have had better.  If I were going with my kids, this would be up in the "good" section, but because we were out on "date night," I'll put this here.  This place is VERY much a family restaurant.  Like I said, that can be a GOOD thing if you have kids... and I would definitely think of taking my daughter here ... but if you're going for a date night type atmosphere, I wouldn't choose this place.  There were LOTS of kids... pretty noisy.    And I'm apparently in the minority here since it seems that every restaurant is doing this now.... but I don't understand why there has to be TVs playing sports on every wall.  At a sports bar/pub?  Yes.  At a Mexican Cocina?  I don't get it.    All-in-all we liked our experience there pretty much.  I won't be rushing back, but I wouldn't mind going again to try some other stuff.

CbvSi0sb2iWl9Ue29Z7sgA.text: My third time at Leticia's and my third time enjoying the food.  Good number of late lunch customers. I had Birria (beef & goat) for the first time--good choice.  Will try the chicken mole next time.   My friend enjoyed her chicken taco salad. Guacamole could have used a few squeezes of lime.  Our server was Walter--very friendly and upbeat.

ueQ5JHkCfA3bAmxn3srGjw.text: food was wonderful and i love the their house margarita.

DB-ABjpn1JaJ3WWP78lvqQ.text: With the economy how it is, it's great to see a family business thriving. The house is always packed but I still receive great service. The owners are always there talking to customers and even serving the food! The food is fantastic and reasonably priced which is always great paired with their signature margaritas!

w2fwUMlVxaN2hwK351u2yA.text: The food is awesome for a great price!  The service could be a lot better.  The location is alright, seems that most of the businesses nearby are closed down.    I would eat here again for the chiles and mexican corn, but only because it's close tot he casa.

kohN63OpSfx4qKlazl1VdQ.text: One of the best Authentic Mexican Restaurants...Food is Amazing and large portions! Salsa and guacamole dip delicious. Waitress was attentive and friendly, thoroughly enjoyed the experience. My son and mother loved it...they couldn't get enough!

fz0U8W-VvWWwBLUFjmZfEw.text: Best I've had in Vegas. If you're looking for good, authentic Mexican food, this place won't disappoint!

I9VRduNZdSxYidLLQXJzXg.text: I wish I could give it 0 stars. This is the worst food I've ever had in my life. I'm the type of person who will eat anything handed to them, I'm definitely not picky, but this place is trash along with their customer service. Half of the good reviews on here must be fake, don't come here. Save yourself.

kjnJEP-H8IQEp3vZGHx_Tw.text: Great food, knowledgable and attentive service. Too bad it's very far from my house, but they are open until 2 am (despite what it says above). You have to get the cochinita pavil appetizer!

sGuUC4VqWC9gdzpcf59iVA.text: Dislikes: greasy food. i mean, GREASY. running fat all over the place. is it how mexican food is usually like? you tell me. but i am not a fan of the food.    Likes: refills for lattes!! NICE.

S0VoSbyO8LC80u_AO-W6eQ.text: This place has some yummy chile colorado. I had their Tamarindo margarita and it was amazing. Our server was very nice too (can't remember his name...maybe it was the margarita ;)). I will continue to go to this restaurant as it's nearby and has a good selection. Try it out as I'm sure you'll love it too.

nIo_5wBfrpe8QdEmykvYFQ.text: The wait to get in was "35 minutes", told to me by the hostess... Actual waiting time: 60 minutes... Was I supposed to" read between the lines"? The food was ok.. not the best ever, but the waiters and waitresses were sweet.

M81sqHtEV4OKJmqS9i_mUw.text: Service was absolutely fantastic. Quite possibly the best I've ever had. It was my first time here but not my last. The fried ice cream drew me in and it didn't disappoint.

UkI9kfONWHHTmoe9RTU4mQ.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas! Their chips and dip are amazing, and the meals are wonderful, as well.

IBh5ytccU6goBS7oq9-09g.text: This place is a local favorite so we never visit on the weekend because of the wait. But the food is always worth it. The beans are the best! We have never had heat lamp tortured food, and everything has always tasted fresh. This isn't your tex-mex average cuisine, it is so much better.

W_Zc9yl60Lux7iaDDy_9pg.text: Great food Awesome service. plus free fried icecream with check in!

WQyL4b-C3_7bqr7JHKbNTA.text: My family love  Leticia's! Whenever they come to visit this is on their list of "must go to" They usually request a 2nd & 3rd visit time allowing! The food is excellent, the staff are extremely friendly!

GM8og4pljcoKFLSOxrbguw.text: This place is awesome!  I love the rice- the creamy one and the cheese potatoes with the steak....  love love love this place!  Thank you Leticia!

_JGFrbhdlJaOEbV_nMbxHg.text: I  love Leticia's! Great Mexican joint just minutes from my house. Tasty chips and salsa, delicious margaritas, and nice bar area.   So many menu items to choose from.   I still have to get there for the karaoke and weekend brunch, but really looking forward to it!

H8NMrcPu0q32LjYZ5HHzmg.text: The atmosphere was great, great location, and excellent service. The was also GOOD, but the grilled chicken could've used a little more flavor but the overall experience was good.  I would definitely go back, and the server Mario was excellent.

nB_GPzkETwNGhT0f54s7fA.text: This is actually a really good authentic Mexican restaurant. I would reccomend to anyone. Their street tacos are ALMOST as good as real street tacos from the taco stand in the hood lol. If you go you gotta get dessert.! Best fried ice cream I've ever had! Yummy! Great atmosphere. Servers are friendly.

p_LTj8aNCdPw2mFoJjyD5A.text: My wife and I come here regularly and always enjoy the food and the sangria. The evening always starts the same with the hostess Sophia seating us in our favorite seats with a smile. We come here for the staff more than we come for the food. Always a solid choice.

Njc-Cj0_7my0Vj_utqmQFw.text: I've died and gone to heaven. The food here is so flavorful. Service is great! Shrimp tacos are a must!

q2J_Vi-xMuehudLs0hnRZg.text: An absolute gem. Everything we ordered came out exactly as ordered. Our waiter was atentave but not a bother. Drinks were generous and we'll made. Will definately make this a go to spot for Mexican.

mj1_D-BuN0y2G0DsC0kIaw.text: Have been here several times and it has never disappointed. First off, the service is amazing. Every employee here has been extremely nice, professional and knowledgeable about the menu. Second, food has always been great no matter what I get and you get three dips along with the obligatory chips before the meal. Third, they have great happy hour specials. You can't go wrong here!

vyDuBJrBMAakzYA4tyCaCw.text: We happen to be in this part of town and decided to try Leticia's.  We almost didn't go in because parking looked ridiculous, but then we discovered a large parking lot in the back.   We were seated promptly and our waiter was very attentive.  We told him that we'd never eaten there before and he made some recommendations to us.  This was not your average Mexican place, and we had a hard time choosing from the menu.  I went with the 2 taco plate.....one with chicken tinga and one with pork carnitas.  Both were excellent and unlike anything I've ever had before.  The cilantro rice was delicious, also!  Hubby had a build-it-yourself burrito and he really enjoyed it.  We will definitly go back.

22ucvv2xQZqWuHcoVmV45g.text: Really nice location. There's a nice atmosphere and friendly staff. It's pretty busy here right now. We ordered the nachos and choose the ground beef. It was really good. I think the carne asada or grilled chicken would be better. Ordered the carne asada tacos and the fish tacos. Both were really good. The fish tacos are some of the best I've had. I got them battered instead of grilled fish.

Eukl0qSBTOg0Ymq_E4Xzdg.text: I was hopeful that this would be our spot for Mexican food but........the restaurant was clean and cute but very loud, even at 4:30 on a Sunday as they are busy.  The food was bland, sorry to say.  Nothing jumped out as being flavorful and quite honestly, for the price, we've had better food elsewhere.  The portions are a good size, so that is a plus and service was good.  The red sauce on the enchiladas was really potent as I would not recommend it at all.  I would say give this a try, but as this was a hike for us to get to, I would rather go the opposite direction to Mi Casa where the beef enchiladas with red sauce are delicious!  Sorry, I wanted to really like this place but not worth the drive for us.

G7IbK_g8Ij84ROrLqwLsYg.text: On May 5 my husband and I went to have lunch to celebrate Cinco de Mayo.  The chips and salsa were good but I will never return to a place that served me a spoiled shrimp cocktail.  When I told the waitress that my cocktail was spoiled her reply was "you're not the first one to say that".  Than why was it still being served.  Lucky for me I noticed the fowl taste and fizzle in my mouth that I immediately discarded it.  It's probably the only thing that kept me from getting sick.

k7DRTdY0jdDa3kANYsG7ag.text: Friggin love this place!   Camarones el Diabla is smokin hot sauce draping bacon wrapped shirmp!  Guac comes in 2 sizes and is awesome! Margaritas aren't shy either.  Service is great but be smart..if your goin for dinner this place is hoppin.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Street Taco Mondays!
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Street Taco!!!

EeEKohw6vkzeLOr4zq8aNg.text: Best Mexican food around the valley. Been here several times for lunch and dinner and have never been disappointed. The staff is great and the food is fantastic. The chips are fresh and they bring you 3 different dips, bean dip, avocado dip and a salsa. All of which are great. The fajitas are the best I have ever had. They also have several award winning dish that when you try them you will know why. Margaritas are perfect too. Must try this place. You won't go wrong.

UqFLuEa9_KIzsybBKz-Erg.text: We travel a ridiculous distance to get to Leticia's (according to our friends)...  But we used to live a couple of miles away in Centennial Hills, and now that we have moved to Henderson, our "couple of minutes" drive changed to a "little over a half hour" drive.  But, um, we still do it...  Here's a quick list of why: 1) Best Margarita in the valley.  Well, if you like them... I know, every place makes them differently, but here they use multiple fresh squeezed lime slices and that works with the pattern of fresh food here, and it's really tasty. 2) Best interesting drink - the Pomegranite Margatini is totally unique and I can't even list all of the ingredients here...  But it's one of my wife's favorite drinks of all time! 3) Ignacia - oh, yeah, the Margatini is generally only a good drink if she's the one who makes it.  Everything she makes is awesome, even if she's taking care of the bar and the entire dining room at the same time... 4) Ignacia again - sorry to be redundant, but beyond drinks, she knows the food and what mama's making, and knows what is good, and very quickly learns what you like!  Which is invaluable... Even if you don't know what to order, just let her do it. 5) To be fair, even if Ignacia is not working, the food is all fantastic and the drinks are awesome.  I just wish they'd open a place in Henderson!

JqW7XB07LNSCuHcbmeFuVg.text: Love this place. The food is fresh and delicious. However, the prices are grievously high and the service, although friendly, is very slow. A pet peeve of mine is waiting to be seated when there are several open tables. I will still go back as the food and drinks are to die for, just fix the wait time and lower your crazy prices please. $15 for a burrito is insane!

6TiYCwgIEzsMjgB1dL3EcQ.text: Fabulous service and wonderful bar staff! The chicken green sauce enchiladas are to die for!!!!! I'll definitely recommended my friends and family.

vtRxVruad4v15TWLNwhp0g.text: Hands down, my favorite Mexican restaurant.  And I'm from San Diego, the land of Mexican restaurants.  We've been to Leticia's more times than I can count in the year that I've lived here.  We've brought every one of our house guests to Leticia's - and that's a whole bunch because when you live in Vegas people come out of the woodwork to visit.  Everyone we've introduced to Leticia's has fallen in love, just like we did.  Some of our favorites include: Poblano White Rice Casserole (I order it on the side no matter what else I'm ordering), El Molcajete, Quesa Tacos, Sopa de Consomme (which I get to go every time I'm sick) and their bean dip.  The chips are dangerously addicting.  We've never had anything that was bad.  Also, the service is great.  The first time we went our waiter, Mario, was so fantastic that we request to sit in his section every time we visit Leticia's.  He know's the menu inside and out always gives the best suggestions!    Also, I have to say, I am allergic to MSG and normally stay away from ordering anything with sauce and almost never order soup in restaurants.  If I eat anything with MSG in it I get a horrific migraine the next day.  I have never had a negative reaction to their food.  Before I ordered the soup I asked if they made it in house.  The chef got on the phone and said it was made in house and from scratch.  I wish there were more restaurants like this one!

M-VSJ3jXDkFbDL9o8pq8tg.text: Waited 25 minutes before 2 seats opened at the bar, we were quoted 15 minutes for a table.  We waited for a long time before we got our food.  About 45+ minutes.  The food was tasty but my wife's was too spicy for her.  Granted she does not do spicy well, but she couldn't eat it.  The bartender didn't even ask us how we were doing or how the food was, but did appologize for the wait.  The drinks were expensive as was the cost for the food.  $85 for 2 people at a mexican restaurant is pretty pricey.

efC00NxUYtGIEjM0tXMcew.text: My wife and I had a great experience here. We live about as far away from this place as you can without leaving Las Vegas, but we were in the area and decided to give it a try. We are so glad we did, but sorry they are so far away. I had the shredded beef burrito and my wife had the carnitas. While we were asking the server questions she offered to bring us some samples of other meats. What? Hell yes. I was so impressed.  They chips and salsa also hit the spot. We highly recommend this place.

je1CbG1boTOUpP0Ij7Ggng.text: Awesome!!! Loved our night there. We met up with Leticia and some friends. The food was very good. The environment is nice. The tacos are award winning and worth the order. Also, get some Mexican coffee. It is very, very good. We were staying on the strip and vegas and this is worth the 20 minute trip out.

Gb5ZPSqtIxjV5NPrED3ICQ.text: I've been going to this Restaurant every Saturday for months! It became almost like a family tradition! The main reason my group  went is because of the superb service we would get from JUSTIN! We were at a loss for words to hear that he was no longer there! Justin is such an asset and will truly be missed by many!! What a loss!!!

0D7YFf3so2ptOjINBNZSaA.text: Love it here.  The chicken fajita's are some of the best.  One of the only places you can get Mexican corn.

dz_HwTnflP5C1enBl8__eQ.text: I had my retirement dinner here.  I was able to reserve Leticia's El Patio.  It was perfect.  I had a little over forty people in attendance.  Andy the manager, worked with me and I was able to get exactly what I wanted. I was able to have my own bar and the waiters and bartender for my event were just wonderful.  The food was great and drinks kept coming.  This by far is my favorite restaurant. I love the atmosphere and the great customer service I always receive.  Thank you for making it so special!

d-QDOjYqKuueK9Q8MevMbA.text: The food is bad and the service is worse. We've been there 3 times hoping it would get better but it never did. We will not be back. Michoacan is also nearby and the food is 10x better! I wish Leticia's was good because it's right around the corner from our house but sadly it's not worth the time. Such a bummer since we love Mexican food.

r8qAU2gmAFqPPihAps2gVg.text: Yelp gave this place 4 stars so we went. Bummer. Chips are average. We ordered two cheese enchiladas beans and rice for one plate, not very good. Other plate was street tacos, al pastor and carne Asada. Al pastor was real good but not the carne. They charged me .75 cents for extta slices of lime. That is laughable. Prices are high here for less than average food. TV kept blinking in and out every minute as well. Service was very slow.

o6-chDdGgYorkh8Xzq0s7w.text: We tried Let's and this restaurant did not disappoint we ordered the tamales the Mexican shrimp cocktail the poppers which were hot to trot, we ordered the Mediterranean dish which included mussels clams and the lobster with fish and shrimp, our meals did not disappoint we ordered margaritas which were amazing. At the end of our meal we stayed for dessert the Ambiance was beautiful we ordered the sopapillas and the churros we had our 12 year old son with us. I give leticias a five-star the food did not disappoint we will definitely be going back. Our waitress was amazing the staff was very nice and helpful and we're attentive. Thank you for a beautiful meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c8Fz9S2uYq0XF1PTBcEtAA.text: Yum yum yum.   Very different yet excellent recipes.  Had us talking about the food all the way thru the meal.   Waiter was a pleasure

rFJYFFd_sM5OI7COmHD0yg.text: Best mexican food I've had west of Sadie's in Albuquerque NM. And in my own back yard of N Las Vegas. Wow the flavors and the staff are great. It proves what a good recipe and the proper management can do to set the tone for a great restaurant! Fieri may have to rate it better than his own! Just say'n!   Traveling North America with an average of 160+ flights a year, I focus on good food where I go and have been fortunate to come across some of the locations I do. From clients proud of their favorites to hearing local banter about this one or that one...   We found out about Leticia's by someone at the local Shuck's raving about it. So craving Mexican food, and wanting to stay near by, I searched until I recognized the name.  So glad we went!  Unbelievable flavor and with potato which is a rarity. The latter was something I learned from the locals living in Tucson and working over the boarder in Nogales in the late 90s. (Thanks Maritza). I've craved this combination of flavors and have sought it ever since.  It is tough to find... But, Leticia's has it! Way to be authentic and True! Thanks!

-0JnA5_tajQgar5ht19hEA.text: On September 21,2017 I went here for happy hour to celebrate my 21st wedding anniversary we were told the patio is closed and we couldn't sit outside. Drive by a few days later the patio is full of people....white people! Today November 11,2017 I went here at 5:35pm and was told immediately by the hostess NO we can't sit on the patio it's closed. Please see my attached photo of all the people sitting on the patio! Who closes a patio at 5 o'clock on a busy Saturday? I asked for the "manager" Ricardo and after waiting forever for him to come to the front he said it's closed because it's chilly. Again it's full of people sitting out there. So now the weatherman/manager determines customers chill factor when it comes to sitting on a patio? From what I gather the patio is closed to African Americans so if you're black don't ask to sit on the patio. Better yet go through the back door so you want scare away her white customers!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1sdO8fT61Abaf37QpJZueg.text: Ok got to start off with the service.  Great personal experience. Our waiter was very helpful. We asked and he got it. No waiting. Second the drinks were great tasting, strong and very smooth. The food. OMG!!!  I ordered the shrimp cocktail. They should call it the endless shrimp cocktail because every spoon full I had shrimp. No need for extra salt nor pepper. It was just right. And the price was very good not to expensive.  Will be raving about this place for a long time.  I've been to a lot of Mexican restaurants and this place has the music and the taste of being in Mexico. Very clean. Also the decor was very cool and just enough lighting for a family dinner or a date night. All around can't go wrong

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Leticia&#39;s Cantina Bar

85NBggaXHpiL00FGY9LYeQ.text: This place must of been having an off night when I came because it seems to be pretty popular. When my girlfriend and I arrived there was quite a wait . Thing is we had terrible service. They were having staffing issues so our waitress who typically bartender was having a hard time keeping up. The chips and salsa were just ok and it took a long time for her to even take our drink order. Once we finally placed our order I made it clear I do not want beans . Sadly they showed up right on my plate with my chile releno .. Overall it was just not as good as I heard. My friends quesadilla had issues too but I didn't try it . We did have her apologies and I understand sometimes these things happen. Hopefully if I get the chance to try it out again they will wow me but for now it's just meh

tx8dxuhQHgYiP0LkexUd8w.text: So so for Mexican food I guess if you want to sit down at a decent atmosphere you can go here but food wise I'd rather go to Roberto's

FxbcuFLR4x3s3YYm2fciTQ.text: i loved this place!  the menu was huge and went with large family group; everyone loved what they had.  My favorite is the grilled corn appetizer - messy but worth it, and i had their specialty tacos - delicious and also so big i couldn't even finish 2 of them.

YcMDxDj9EMBQthF3M5nHYw.text: Some of the best Mexican food we've ever had! We love going here. Great atmosphere, wonderful service, & the food is delicious! Everything we've tried is so good!

BilOJQHZZb9v1Vb_UZUsxw.text: Excellent!!! I had a last minute wedding to cater for about 30 guests. Leticia's was referred to me by a friend. The staff was very helpful and courteous and the food was top notch. I asked for the order to be ready at 4 and had some time to spare so I decided to pull up a chair and order a plate while I waited on my catering order to be completed. Boy, I was NOT disappointed on my first experience at Leticia's. Also, the wedding guests were similarly impressed.   - Friendly staff, great food, awesome prices, and a great atmosphere makes for repeat customer. Thanks again Leticia!!!

o8F3m8mQiuWYTbJEmFIyyw.text: I was here once a long time ago and then again about 6 weeks ago.  Apparently in the interim the management changed?  It was pretty solid the first time, but on the second visit I was waiting for a friend to show up (he did not, dork) so I had two baskets of chips with their amazing salsas, a couple of margaritas, and eventually a small dish that is escaping my memory at the moment (maybe more than a couple margaritas). It was delicious and amazing to the tune of "why have I not wandered into this place?" It's literally up the street, about a 15 minute walk, which comes in handy post-margarita...  Tara and Rudolfo behind the bar Monday and Tuesday, they were very cool, and the whole place appears to be stocked with nice employees from what I could tell.  Good stuff!

0gWbWwjjyXErRj9WX0VWJw.text: Coming from San Diego where for 37 years real Mexican food was just 30 min.drive across the border or at a few select places downtown SD..this place is not even close. Salsa is everything and this restaurant has 2 types. Tasteless and Inferno. Refried beans with chorizo and mexican rice with cheese is not real Mexican nor is the pico de gallo which is virtually tomatoes with very little onions even less cilantro and where's the lime juice ? Las Vegas doesn't have many good Mexican restaurants but of the few they have this is not one of them .

FhT-RBbfdRQHrs3sf9dpyg.text: Stopped in today, always great food and service from the staff and bar! One of my favorite spots to go! Thank you Kindra, Morri, and Demi for the great service!

jJHGeIYrnSrI1Et3LvNNZA.text: The food was okay, but the bartender made up for it with great service! She was friendly and really helpful with the menu, since it was my bfs and I first time. She makes awesome margaritas as well. Thanks Kindra :) !

N9-n2-5AP7yMea3ShBQzqg.text: This place was so great the first 2 years it opened but the only thing we go there for now is the queso fundido. And that has been inconsistent lately. Went tonight and WOW the prices have gone up!! I ordered a Taco salad and a margarita. We just missed happy hour and the $9 house margarita was weak and watery. A lackluster start....I ordered a taco salad with ground beef (like a taco) and my husband had the queso fundido with chorizo which was good this time. When the bill came, my taco salad was $10 with ground beef $3 more?? so my husband nicely asked "why the up charge on the taco salad?" The server told us "Oh it's $10 for a vegetarian taco salad, the taco beef is $3 extra"  LMAO! Really??!  Isn't a "vegetarian taco salad" just a SALAD? Now, I am happy to pay the price for good food but don't like getting "nickle & dimed" on dining out. Also, if you don't order a full meal or a bar beverage the complimentary chips and salsa are $4.50! Sorry Leticia, Michoacan is way better.

a-GdscLVtcObf1kyL4VnOg.text: Love this place! It's a family owned restaurant. Food great! Very authentic! I think by far the best Mexican food here in Vegas.

miysn-xWrZD0dA7UuWmX-Q.text: Waited forever for our food to come out for a Sunday lunch. Had shrimp tacos-good and Chili rellenos w cinnamon beef inside-good. Cheese sauce was very bland. Red sauce was better on it.  Beautiful presentation Great server Get there when they first open if you don't want to wait 45+ min to get your f

uzMUXB6zdd7bQF6tq1HiKA.text: I've had one of those weeks. I've had a terrible flu, my kids have the flu and I needed a pick me up. I saw they have Posole and I had to have some. We have lived in Vegas for a year and a half and have heard about Leticia's. We live close so it was time. I had my husband pick up the following: Mexican Corn, Salsa Macha, Pozole, Ribeye tacos ala carte and a boat load of churros for the kids.  For me, this was almost a religious eating experience. My husband feels it is the best Mexican food in the city and we have eaten around. It was one of those meals that makes you rethink every five star rating you've given before- because now you have a different standard to compare it to. Well done. I now must eat my way down the menu. It was worth every penny.

5jDzJ3R_dx525xwlwzIM3g.text: Food is great, bean dip is not vegetarian friendly (contains meat) but other salsa dips are good.   Been here a few times, food usually takes a while to come out. We waited for approximately 30-40 minutes to get our food. Our waitress (Susana) seemed to be distracted, we asked her for water at least 3 times and never brought it to us, a bus boy was kind enough to listen to us and bring our water right away.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JW8RByxE-jxVWngizw4pdw.text: Was a little nervous about eating here. I was so pleasantly surprised! Service was excellent! Thanks Alex! Margaritas were strong and tasty. The food was fresh. Nothing frozen or pre made tasting. The queso Fundido was so delicious with the homemade fresh tortillas. Ours meals were just perfect! Highly recommend. So glad we decided Mexican rather than steak house!

2VpRhEsrjP52q2TKyn6iag.text: Been here a few times and I'm still just not impressed. Their prices are so high for Mexican food.  I am not ever impressed with a server I get, they are always busy doing other things except tending to their tables.  The people who help with drinks and food runners are better!  Food comes out hot, but ask for everything right then or you don't get it (sour cream) It's a nice change from where we usually go but hats about it. Too pricey for what you get all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kid menu

epaR7hKNTDIH1Xy06dGVFQ.text: Excellent! For the past year or Leticia's has been my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. I've probably been to every other Mexican Restaurant in the valley, this is the best! The chili colorado and Chile Verde took me back to my childhood! If you go to this location ask for Susana, she's awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile verde with their world famous white rice, chili colorado in the background. Delicious!!

14V07iRC0oK42paqQdTUsw.text: Ok...... first of all, I dont remember the last time i gave a bad review. Three of us were there Friday night to eat dinner before a 730 movie. We got there at 6:05. They said it would be 20-25 mins wait...ok.. we can wing it! We got to our table at 7:03. Ya... one hour wait. We sat down and just ordered our simple drinks because i didnt want to take extra time ordering a margarita. Ordered our food right away.. told the waitress we had a 730 movie. She said it would probably be 25 mins before the food came out... im like... we can inhale! There's always 25 mins of previews!!! Now you have to understand i am a Chairman at Station Casinos and am there(quite a bit) i've eaten at the formally known as Cabo restaurant quite a bit...and it was good! I think its the first time since they redid it as Leticias that ive eaten there. The food was horrible. My crunchy chicken taco was soggy and obviously left under the lights... how do i know this??? Cause my cheese was melted on the lettuce of my taco.. simply nasty. My boyfriends fajita was the most bland ever... with i think 4 pieces of chicken in it.....and an assortment of things i have never seen in fajitas like zucchini. Nothing had any flavor and im pretty sure they stuck pork in my almost nonexistent cheesy chicken enchilada that im used to. If we weren't in such a hurry i would have spoken to someone... point is... i wont eat there anymore...it isnt the same food and it is not better.i rather eat at the cafe of go to the Charcoal room... i rather eat at Robertos which is 4 star compared to this restaurant..... sorry.

tgTq8rzGs4ldYoMqZSeHZQ.text: Not very authentic mexican food. Margaritas are good. A bit over priced for the quality of the food.

P-uRWN7mGE0ijflHKSVSHA.text: Amazing food, great service, always friendly Can't say enough good things, just wish they had more locations

o6FBon9iiaMhtInMqhEu4Q.text: Three strikes and you're out. We gave Leticia's three tries and the last time made us decide we would never go back. So here are the pros and cons.   Pros: the chips, bean dip and sauces are wonderful. I especially like the tomatillo salsa.   Cons: my salted Margarita was served in a mason jar. Seriously. When I asked for a regular margarita glass the server brought a glass to the table and wanted me to pour my current drink into the new glass. Bad, bad manners. I had him just take the whole drink away.   3 out of the 4 guests ordered the hard tacos. There was nothing spectacular about them. Neither one of the orders, one chicken and two beef, were seasoned very well. It just tasted like fried tortilla. I've had better tacos from Roberto's.   The third person ordered the beef enchiladas. The tortillas were gooey, the meat was runny (too much sauce) and the sauce tasted over cooked. The only good thing was the onions on top. But they couldn't even finish the meal. It was that bad.   For anyone who has had actual GOOD Mexican food knows this is not it. Sadly.   My search will continue for good Mexican food in Las Vegas. If you are ever in Carson City NV, the best Mexican food I have ever had, consistently, for over 30 years is EL Charro Avitia.

4ADPaEQP2NaZZTZPDXXC9A.text: My husband and I went on their opening day, today at the Santa Fe for lunch and as usual, Leticia's delivers. The entrees were delicious and the salsas to die for; offering so much more than "American" Mexcan that you typically find in a Mexican restaurant.  Atmosphere is lovely. Very happy they are offering lunch, as the former restaurant located there did not. If you were a fan of the original Leticia's at Norman Rockwell Lane, you will get the same great service and food and not be disappointed. Speaking of service, Tami does a fabulous job as bartender and server. She is attentive and knowledgeable and makes you feel welcome. So all you Leticia's fans, go visit them at the Santa Fe and support a locallly owned business.

_cWIZtpiIbHLQhniIe65QA.text: UPDATE: After coming here quite a few times... food is still great, but service is very slow. There's usually a wait later at night, and they seem short staffed on weekends. Every time we wait about 20-30 min to get seated, a long time to get our drinks and food ordered, then even longer to get the food. By the time we are given our check we just want to get the heck out of there cause we've been sitting for so long! We come for the food and the convenience of location, no longer for the service.   My go to Mexican restaurant ever since I moved up in the area! I've been here quite a few times.   Most of the servers are very accommodating (minus one experience). So many options on the menu! Many of the appetizers are great for sharing amongst friends. And my usual go-to entree is the Taquiza dinner with grilled fish or shrimp. Large portions. A decent amount of tequila options, although I usually just get beer.   Be prepared to wait if it's later during the weekend. This place is pretty popular, so just be aware that there may be a wait time, but it's worth it!

xNaP6qPK9_3vpBJKnWAWvA.text: OMGOSH.., GREAT dining experience!! The food was EXCELLENT!! I had LaTicia's award winning tacos, a MUST have! Already anticipating my next visit!

NbMYMrE2mmNEL8OY07-gMA.text: Tastes delicious, I wish the patio was cleaner and more visually appealing to have lunch or dine outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V5BIu44UejYE2HKyvwvAqQ.text: Food is always great. Love their blanco and red pozole and shredded chicken enchiladas with tomatillo sauce. Great place.

RM-g4XjR5Ct76rgvnp1uUQ.text: We don't come here often. But it's pretty darn good Mexican food. Pricey. Price is prob what holds us nack from coming more often. Beans and chips are so yummy. The horchata is bomb. Their signature cheesy taco things are heavy but yummy. Tortas are on point. Prob one of the better places to get Mexican food that's not on the east side of Vegas and def better than the other Mexican chains in Vegas. Parking is a pain. Had a banquet here as well and it was not spectacular, but it worked for the event we were having.

64tsNzzhTc91xU4kCFKIyA.text: Looks like a great restaurant but after 45 minutes of sitting there being ignored we walked out.   A large party came in after we got there so I guess our waitress stopped caring that we existed.   She eventually came to us with the expectation of giving us our check but we hadn't even received our food yet. We never got our drink orders either.  Won't be back. Too many choices in this city to put up with bad service.

1onkv2Mt5CbUTw1kUzcc9A.text: I have been here twice within the last year and a half, both times the service is great and the servers/waitresses are always polite and accommodating. Also I came in on a Saturday evening with a party of 5 and were promptly seated within 5 or so minutes.

JXh-zi19mte8w6sHSdVKPQ.text: This message was just pointed out to me and I can tell you Chef Leticia's response was a bit underwhelming and obviously defensive. I actually have been back quite a few times and haven't posted - yet - on the long wait times for seating and service. The food has improved, and I'm glad we gave it a chance, but based on this response - which was written on time when the food poisoning occurred - I'm DONE.   We hadn't even seen the Dirty Dining bit until after the food poisoning happened. We have quite a few friends who also love this restaurant and updated me that things were "back to normal" in terms of food quality this summer, so I did give it a shot. However, considering this response, I'm a bit disappointed that Leticia herself would respond in this manner like a petulant child instead of a professional.   Since seeing this response, I've been consistent in telling others close to me to avoid a business that treats its regulars with such disdain. I loved your food, I really did. But your reaction says to me that you don't need my money nor the money of friends and family.

xb0_NIRK3lSkdiDZin2XoQ.text: Great food! The Spicey margaritas aren't bad either .  Never disappoints and a great place to catch up with friends

aAZX5NeH5QUg5NCWEwlP1g.text: This is the real deal, imagine authentic Mexican food at an affordable price in a clean and welcoming environment.  I first noticed this place in a food show where this restaurant competed against some top notch restaurants on the Strip and they won!  A bit of warning, this is not Tex Mex, so the flavors are more on the milder side. If you need to, they offer various hot sauces.  I ordered the soft tortilla soup and it was great with the subtle tomato flavor with a squeezed lime is a good balance to bean and starchy flavor.  You can also appreciate the care they put into their chicken enchiladas, it's baked perfectly without being overcooked, the shredded chicken is moist and seasoned perfectly.  It's a great deal for $11 and change.  If there is any drawback is the drive here from the Strip, it would take 30 - 35 minutes to get here.  But that won't detract from the great food.

WeXi_W_vVNFPqmmhroLgeQ.text: This place is FANTASTIC!!! My husband and I always go here when we want Mexican food. Reasonably priced, great service and friendly staff! A good 35-50 minute wait sometimes, so be prepared to wait for greatness!! We've tried the enchiladas, tamales, burritos, and tacos!! All delicious!! Next mission is for breakfast!!

tliHVxczP1BA5vo68VDlGQ.text: Went in tonight Tara took care of us at the bar great food and drinks. Tara was awesome.

yRAPFpJrKKNVoH-WmNfmzw.text: The food was delish and fast.  I've never seen food cone out quicker and it was a Friday evening.  And by the time we left around 630, it was a line outside.  It's a hot spot and a place I will definitely be returning to and bringing friends and family as well.  Two thumbs up.

ZmN-LdzXHZ0quHXpA_xhuA.text: Wow!  The food here is not only original but delish!  The ambiance of the restaurant makes you feel like you could be in a little restaurant in little Mexico.  Amazing experience and the service is the best.  Very attentive,  knowledgeable,  helpful and willing to go out of their way to keep you happy.  Definitely coming back.

VHuMKAXZQK3v8ihGntwQSQ.text: I hadn't been here in about 4 years. I loved it 4 years ago. Don't know what's happened. After ordering it took over an hour for food to come out. We didn't order anything complicated. It was not busy. When we asked for a Box to pack up our food it took another 26 minutes! Asked multiple times for water with lemon and NEVER got it. One napkin at the table. We will not be returning. What a shame.

ofZGVDadGNRCJL_Xn3glOw.text: A favorite of our family! We usually order for pick up - order always correct and packaged nicely. The food is awesome and they have the best fajitas!  We have been coming to this restaurant for years and will continue to do so!

CMa0jy_5wDr1oxOyM_I_4A.text: This place always delivers!! The food was excellent as was the service! Excellent food at a reasonable price.

dUwMbi0toW6oymlGAT-YSg.text: This is by far the best Mexican food in town!  I recommend this restaurant to everyone.from the appetizers, to entrees, to drinks I've never been disappointed.  I especially love the Mexican corn (which they offer to cut from the cob for you), Molcajete, and the michelada.  Awesome Happy Hour too!  Very friendly staff!

_KCLQriZyaAHdWi5qxAKKg.text: I know everyone loves this place but our group of 6 left deciding never again. Good came we had no silverware. Ask 3 employees and 4 minutes later someone brought it to us. Yea, we timed it. So we sat there looking at our food. No one refilled our water so finally my husband went to the busser station and brought back a pitcher of water and filled our drinks. Our food was way too salty. Our friend ordered an appetizer that never came too. Like I said never again. For the price we got bad food and no service. This place is over rated.

nK4VtoyZAe0LocpE0rLFVA.text: Heard great things on this spot so I had to try it out. I'm new to the area so I was quite surprised that I could walk here from my home. The first time I went, the food was remarkable. The second time, not so much. Guess it depends on the cook! I'll give it another try just to see if the second time was a fluke

3iqvCkbSAOncgTaw07jHZQ.text: This is the second time here within a month.  We were referred by a friend in the area.  We sometimes travel to have good eats!  This restaurant is in a cozy area that kind of resembles the beginnings of an Old Pasadena.  It was busy just like the last time.  There were a lot of staff.  Everyone of them, friendly.  Particularly Dulce and Walter.  We had five in the party, so we had a lot to order.  The food arrived promptly, was very tasty and eye pleasing like last time.  Check out my photos.  The atmosphere was lively and the restrooms clean and in order.  When I checked into Yelp there was an offer to purchase a coupon that would save $10.  I purchased it on my cell phone and Dulce redeemed it for this receipt all within 5 minutes!  Also what was cool is that the owner came around and talked to us and other patrons throughout our dinner experience.     We will definitely be back for more and tell a lot of friends!!
