aBVvaYkYi2KljzPLxtxdEA.text: Best Mexican food I've ever eaten! Chicken Tinga quesa tacos are to die for! Also try the Cabo Azul Margarita.

GfdobH45r_ybdXL6w3CTbQ.text: The food is very good and the service is the best I've seen in a long time. I had the enchiladas and the tres leche cake. All very tasty. The server was VERY attentive and the asst manager stopped by to make sure we were happy. I will be back!

k8UGoookMSBgPhNrChAzGw.text: My girlfriend, friend and his wife came here for dinner on Sunday night and Rogelio was our server. The service was great! Rogelio was quick with drinks, and very personable! The food came out in a reasonable amount of time, and it was delicious. We got the build your own burrito, taco salad and carnitas. I would highly recommend Leticia's, and would definitely come back to see Rogelio again! :)

KjsOPAuIicI4muD_NT0UPw.text: My husband and I love coming here. They have the best Mexican street style corn on he cob! Also love the tamales. The service is always great and pretty quick. Husband loves to sit in the bar area, they do have some Tv's hanging around as well

i1c9bMojeFtHVI3J3qJUOw.text: This is my favorite mexican food restaurant in Vegas! The chips, salsa and dips they give you complimentary never disappoint! I always get enchiladas or build your own burrito. The portions are huge so it's usually 2 or 3 meals for me. Their bloody mary's are delicious too.

20w2U8T0gu4ef34BuBCQzg.text: Horrible! We went here for the first time today & were less then impressed. With 4 stars we expect both better service & better food.  First we were seated in a corner booth with no light, then we ordered Margaritas & our food came out before we even got our drinks.  Then, we got our food & the disappointment continued.  The Carnitas were supposed to be a favorite, but were not edible. The Carne Asada was edible, but still disappointing.  My son has a cheese Quesadilla that was good thankfully & the chips were very enjoyable.  However, to say the least we won't be returning.

u9eGlWhqCthzmgxESabG2A.text: Great food great service and everything was done on a timely fashion wait time was next to nothing what a wonderful dining experience!! The food was absolutely incredible!! We ate there twice already and we definitely will be coming back again and again!!

-UwsfnE_ncjeXqRSj0ILJg.text: I used to love this place back in 2015. But now is just awful last time that I went with my husband I ordered beef enchiladas and the waitress scrub my order and got me cheese enchiladas instead, I was so mad because that was tasteless, and not to mention the atrocious services. My husband and I decided that we won't be back ever. You can drive a few miles and find way better places to eat.

f2BezKN3HZdwqbUm3KUaSA.text: At leticias with the family. Celebrating my husbands birthday. This place is amazing so far....We are hooked- haven't even gotten our dinner- and the salsa beans and chips are to die for! Not to be to mention the fabulous people. Great service- friendly environment. Authentic and worth every penny.  This is a must go to restaurant !!  All the Donayres

ig0PZ_xLP9vjhdoYo4DIqQ.text: Always love it here. Best margaritas and Mexican food in town, hands down!! Don't miss out. The enchiladas are my favorite, any style!

e_tFQr9oUwVWAyRur0vwOQ.text: I went here a year ago with a date and we both got sick, Hershey highway kinda sick. So I had the opportunity to go again and I'm glad to say neither of us got sick this go around. We went for an early dinner late lunch 3pm, just thought I should mention that since maybe they weren't into the full cooking swing yet. I ordered the chicken fajitas and she ordered cheese enchiladas. It smelled great with the peppers and onions. Unfortunately the chicken had no seasoning, it was as if they just bought the chicken from Albertsons and grilled it with no spices. The beans tasted like Rosaritas straight out of the can. The cheese enchiladas Were hard on the tortilla edges. So we both agreed not to go there again. We could of cooked that same meal with more flavor for less. Just my opinion. I know others like this place but its just not for us.

aiCmrk0YQ7C4XNpR3lFiMQ.text: Had to try it after seeing the taco challenge on the cooking channel.  The hostess was a little confused right at 11 when they opened and we were a little worried but our fears quickly subsided when our waitress and bus boy took excellent care of us.  We loved the chips and the three dips and both got super fresh salads with the taco lunch special.  My husband had the ground beef taco and I had the carnitas and it was filled with lots of delicious meat and we loved the beans and rice too.  We asked for some hotter sauce and it was hot but tasty.  We also had some delicious margaritas.  We live in CA but will definitely make the trip to Leticia's the next time we are in town.

daM2h4EH4GyP-LmrS1R7Kg.text: Excellent place for Mexican food. Service and food has always been good. Very friendly people and staff.

yTYWjXtfOed0lEJTKtlZfg.text: My wife and I got a gift card for this place from a client, so we decided to check it out.  First off, we don't live in Centennial Hills so we were already thinking this place better be good if we're driving 30 minutes for Mexican food, but then again, that's a reasonable drive as long as the food's good.  I must say, Leticia's did not disappoint.  It was pretty busy when we got there so we started off with a couple of Leticia's Margaritas at the bar.  They definitely hit the spot after a long work week.  I ordered the birria, which was delicious although maybe a bit salty for my taste.  The puffy tacos with chile verde my wife ordered needed more flavor, but were otherwise decent.  The highlight of the meal had to be the Mexican grilled corn we just had to have after seeing the table next to us order.  We will definitely be back again with so much more we wanted to try.

_MhrzhVTAYhvDAV9rOm1Tg.text: Leticia and her staff does not disappoint. Phenomenal FOOD, DRINKS and SERVICE. Everything on the menu is extremely fresh and has the taste of traditional home cooking. Drafts beer, full bar and one amazing bartender. Sal constantly gives remarkable service and great drinks.

uZxhHCarwbG459EX3UXy4A.text: Im not sure how this place has a 4 star rating because the food is the best mexican food in nevada. They start you off with chips and 4 types of dips and salsas. Everything ive eaten here from the fajitas, carne asada, chili colorado, tamales its all so delicious. Its a very far drive for me and i try to get here at least once a month. Easily my favorite mexican food ever.

TKbPV35pSMaU_eK4n53GIQ.text: The excellence begins with our competent server, and continues with the separate tomato & roasted peppers salsa, smokey refried bean dip and salsa verde for the fresh tortilla chips. Both our entrees immediately transported our tastebuds back to our dining memories from the late 1980's when we traveled by train and bus across Mexico. My chile rellenos was exquisite, and my spouses tamales were off the chart. We will soooooo be eating here often.

eKoB1NDoqXXQNvPI9m9vCA.text: We have been going to Leticia's since they first opened....everything is homemade, fresh and DELICIOUS! The staff is very friendly and you can tell they really enjoy themselves! The entire menu is great! Enjoy....

nj1dbqjKqYYuZ5ARiYyS9Q.text: Come here quite often, in my opinion this is probably one of the better Mexican restaurants in town. Prices are a bit high but you get what you pay for. I love the complimentary green salsa as well as the red salsa. Only complaint from me is service. Bartenders are awesome but wait staff, is not always the best. I work as a server as well & I just believe you should always make your guests feel welcomed rather than a nuisance. Our server Dolce (i believe was her name, didn't get a receipt) was extremely rude. My friends and I sat without water for about 20 minutes. we consistently tried to get our servers attention & she just kept walking away from our table as we were trying to order a drink. & then when I finally got frustrated and went to the bar to order my Bloody Mary, she asked me why I didn't order the drink through her! & when I responded saying that I had tried to, several times, she told me I didn't. Whatever, I just kept to myself but when it came to paying we had asked for separate checks & she brought one check & then disappeared for another 15 minutes & then split the checks with the wrong items on each bill. TWICE. I can understand that being confusing had there of been 10 of us or something but there were only 3. It's not that hard. Needless to say, my friends and I got so frustrated that we just paid the bill and then figured out the proper amounts later on. Overall experience... Disappointing, but I will be back nonetheless because the food is good.

rQR-34aILvzBNS61M8dVLg.text: Best Mexican food in Vegas!  Have the leticia's special tacos.  They are the best!!!

8E8oSoJPrTkB3O7eyPFEFg.text: I love this place.  It is my new favorite in the Northwest.  Everything is fresh.  No canned foods and prepackaged ingredients.  You can taste the difference.  Had the grilled fish street tacos today and they were excellent.  I am still craving them tonight!  My husband loves the puffy tacos.  They are tacos in shells similar to the shell you get on a Tostada salad.  Looked yummy.  Carnitas and Carne Asada platters are great choices as well.  Large portions so you can take some home for lunch the next day.

UB4UZCSv-wD2HuV5JgFfMA.text: I love this place. Great atmosphere! Sophisticated and charming. I am on a restricted diet and I was more than impressed by  our waitress's friendly, and positive attitude towards all of my substitutions. Food was excellent, and I am picky!  Everything came out fresh and hot and I will be back often.

FXt7F4e-ncrq5pYstUVwxw.text: We were really looking forward to liking this place. We live in the neighborhood and have been meaning to try it out. So tonight I read some Yelp! reviews which sounded promising. The listing said they were open until 10pm. I called Leticia's at 8:30pm to double-check their closing time (this IS Vegas 2011 afterall). "10pm" the lady told me. We arrived at the restaurant at 9:30pm only to find the "closed" sign up and the staff sweeping the floors. I spoke to a lady and reminded her that they had just told me 10pm and she shrugged. So we took our business to nearby Lindo Michoacan who stay open until the hours posted on their sign. We won't be back. What a shame...

pdk-Lh9rEzjRd0dqCW2GVQ.text: Just had our 5/10 year anniversary and shared the carne asada for 2, and it was the expected level of awesomeness we have come to love from these guys. This place never disappoints

e1VwbXTN-ZOSyDM3jx5YVQ.text: went there for dinner order a simple quesadilla . the cheese was not even melted. The service Was bad. I took some friends there with me and after spending over $50.00 We left very unsatisfied and hungry. Would not recommend this place to anyone..

6_lZG0jyCduPZ8r2QbTEAQ.text: Good food. I had the street tacos. They look small but they fill you up good. I asked for the hottest sauce they had and they waiter told me you have to ask for it cause they won't bring it out unless you ask. It lived up to how hot he told me it would be and he said it's made from scratch. Like this place gonna go back soon.

qtXIwe8GPiK0fDzCZAHkjQ.text: Loved the food here.  Probably the best mexican food I've had in a long time.

BprAepBSU4XqGjLRnFUnzA.text: Great service, So  Friendly! Everyone was able to answer questions we had about the food, how it was made and what came with it or on it. Every detail to our request was met. The atmosphere was casual, fun and ethnic. Although we sat inside, The patio looked very  inviting with it strung lights and cozy tables.  And the food....WOW!! So Authentic, Fresh and tasty. This place is right in my neighborhood and I will definately recommend and return with friends.

rXoQYG8bnlgZUAH1n62qSg.text: I ate here last Sunday for lunch and the food is absolutely AMAZING! True, authentic Mexican food. I went with a friend whose husband is 100% Mexican, and is use to his cooking, and she gave it two thumbs up! They greet you at the table with fresh homemade tortilla chips, 2 types of salsa and homemade bean dip. We had the Queso Fundido as an appetizer and it was glorious, cheesy goodness! As for entrees, I had the Quesa Tacos and they were unbelievably delish! I highly recommend Leticia's, and make sure to get the strawberry-jalapeno margarita! Yum!

YPtIMUqMXteYM5jb0eUJUA.text: My wife and I loved this place when it opened. The last time we ordered from here was take out and this happened a few months back.... She went  there and was waitning for our food and saw a man putting food into a bag, he was putting the lid onto the soup and his finger went into the soup... he then licked his finger and finished putting the lid on the soup and put it into the bag, Then the manager asked for the name on the order, she told him, he went back when the finger licker was standing and grabbed the bag with the soup in it. My wife told him what happened to the soup and the Manager said and I quote," Oh yea that's happened before, he's been told not to do that". My wife said she wanted another soup, the manager hesitated and said," oh of course" he got the soup and that was the last time we ate there. We live 3 blocks from this place and we  will NEVER GO BACK!!! BEWARE

vD-ZnNAtkZ8n_W04b9_DQQ.text: This place is typical for Vegas. It sucks. Great music and nice decor can't make up for a shitty plate of food. I got the red chili burro "enchilada style" and I can tell canned red chili when i see it.  Wont be back.

hS4J97NJ6VU2sK7epiYNSg.text: This is hands down my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. It's extremely close to my house and I love that I don't have to drive down to the strip for good food. Their elote, guacamole, and crispy tacos are my favorites. I've been coming here since they've opened and I highly recommend it!

bjVkLzC8-xREEIjSouI2cQ.text: The only reason why I was on this side of town was because my best friend was working over here and he wanted to have lunch. I haven't seen him in forever and he said he wanted some mexican food. I chose Leticia's because my sorority sisters suggested (and they are mexican) this place! They said it was a nice sit down restaurant with some really good food. So, of course we had to check it out!  It's located in a beautiful area (super far from my house) in north town. I was surprised! The outside atmosphere looked like a really nice place to sit outside. It was really hot weather at the time so we went inside and got greeted right away from two beautiful ladies! We were seated immediately at a booth. It's really authentic looking decor. Lots of awesome designs and fun things to look at all around the room. Our booth was kinda small for the three of us, but we managed. The two waiters we had were super nice! They spoke in spanish (and my friend spoke spanish as well since he worked in Chile the past two years) so it was pretty awesome to watch! I love mexican food! They started us off with a bowl of chips with two different salsas and beans. They even refilled it if we ever wanted some more! Now time for the hard part. Choosing what to eat. The menu is filled with so many options!  I decided to go with the lunch specials. There were a bunch you could choose from, and I got the burrito lunch special enchilada style with verde sauce on top. It came with lettuce, tomato, beans, and mexican rice. Boy was it super yummy! The burrito was smothered in sauce and cheese. I had to use cholula sauce to add a bit of flavor. The atmosphere inside was really fun. The waiters constantly checked up on us. They even had me try the spiciest sauce there, and MAN was I burning up!!! You should definitely try it if you want a KICK!  They were kind enough to offer dessert which looked delicious, but we turned it down because we were so stuffed from our entree. If you are in this area and want some awesome mexican food other than a chain fast food stop, definitely try this place out! Definitely glad that we did.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrito lunch special

A9RBMQw6x4gKsKxQfrf31Q.text: We were very excited to take my husband out for dinner here..waited 30 minutes to be seated..the restaurant looked very nice, the chips n salsa, bean dip n guac was good and our server was nice..they sang happy b day to my hubby..but unfortunately those are the only compliments I could give..our food came cold, my husband's Chile Colorado was really salty and it seemed like it could have been reheated from a big pot..tasted old..he could not eat it. My older children did not enjoy their meals either..my fajitas were ok..not very flavorful..very dissapointing..after seeing everyone else's rave reviews I realize it might have been an off day.. $100 check..not sure if I'd give it another try for that price...

nDTESSSQ7tMy9RuR8rOvlQ.text: The molcajete was very disappointing hardly anything there one piece of fish and four shrimp come on really. $29.99... Second time going there and trying to take advantage of the happy hour shot down again there's only eight seats at the bar and they were full they would not bend on that again. Service took forever not happy nor coming back.

Jw5qFHcLuEXmrVj_qRxM8g.text: Very good food. We all had different items and were all happy leaving. The quest tacos were great

tiJS3SgqCG5lPN3rkJKlCA.text: I've been frequenting this restaurant for years. I have always been impressed by the quality of the meals, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. It's one of our "must" go to places when friends/relatives come to visit.

7rioUHQro5Dxt-BpYl0wDw.text: Sad this place is on another down slope.   Not busy, slow service and no attention to detail.   They need to get it together, I get tired of driving to Summerlin for good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not worth $5 each, try $2.  The shells,we&#39;re overcooked and a few were broke!  Happy Cinco rip off

NO-FNO82e-zPlyqXaZn_GA.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant.  The food is seasoned very well. Reasonable prices, especially during Happy Hour. The Margaritas are fantastic you actually can taste the tequila instead of just margarita mix. If you order from the Happy hour menu you will be able to taste more than one dish for $3.00 each. You get three different dips with your chips, one is beans. They are like down home tasty beans ever.

dxqpBOHtvVfbe2gxkz5QAw.text: We LOOVE Mexican food and having just moved to the area we were so excited to see that this place was great she had amazing reviews. Wow what a disappointment!  The service was awful even with two women handling our service. My husband got a combo meal and the tortilla on the enchilada was so hard he had to send it back. My mom and I shared the beef fajitas and the meat was actually some how cold! Like they had already cooked the meat and they just heat it up a bit and put it on a skillet. Very disappointed!! Really needed to find a good place.

5nNZJiEChYnmur3j5qByMg.text: So one Sever on a Sunday afternoon? Wow they just opened another location in a casino, but they can't have enough employees to keep this location up and running. Maybe this was not the time for an expansion. I have been sitting here waiting for a table with my family. I have seen maybe 3 to 5 groups all turn away once they hear "sorry we only ONE sever till 5pm". Is this restaurant doing that well to turn away so many paying customers?? Oh wait no more then half of the restaurant is empty due to staffing. I have been here before only the food was great the staff was awesome--- what happened??? Management/Owners remember the folks that made your other location inside a casino happen!!! Once we sat down our sever was nice, But not very knowledgeable on what they had as far as drinks. So the fresh Mexican waters---- we where told the "lady that makes those waters didn't show up". Then our real sever showed up???? We had a person just filling in??? Can't wait to place our order!

69tiMaZ4sm_vjXIvk2MSXw.text: I absolutely adore Leticia's, the Mexican corn is the best I've had. There are also lots of choices on the menu to chose from. Do not be afraid to try something new when coming here

wyMM7tEDQ--s6t9Rua_PAA.text: This restaurant is amazing! We have lived here for about a year and just discovered it. We had the lunch special and then came back for dinner. Our group had tamales, enchiladas, carne asada,, tacos, tostadas, a burrito, chips, and salsa. And everything was amazing! The food is of the highest quality and the service was terrific and the price's are very reasonable. I am picky with the cleanliness of restaurants, and this place is extremely clean. The decor is fun and lively. There is indoor, outdoor and bar seating. I will definitely be returning a lot!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_y5jxPx7acTUX5JQtt7Scg.text: Probably one of the best mexican restaurants ive been to. By far the busiest as well because of it. Id recommend if you visit vegas to hit this spot for sure.

wJuL6UTFtx_B8BJJby64RQ.text: The drinks are always great and the food is delicious! Not so great for big parties, but perfect for just a couple people at a regular table. Even better if you sit at the bar! Margaritas and micheladas are wonderful and happy hour has some great stuff! They even deliver through GrubHub!

gChf0zyE1LHQOWXFzii4Hg.text: This place is awesome. They probably have the best nachos I've ever had...! If you come here, I highly recommend the street tacos menu. You can get three different ones for about $12. The tamales are also great but for best value, opt for the half dozen or a dozen and take some home!  Our server was super friendly and helpful. I really wish this place was closer to town. It's probably a contender for being the the best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas in my opinion.

oqu62HGUYxkZnt1fEMFkaA.text: I've tried to like this place. It's hit or miss. They say they are authentic but I've never seen authentic pozole served with lettuce instead of cabbage and tostadas instead of tortillas or bread. The pozole was very thick with red chile.

3qjZMHLxVL3MI0_Hc2f9Eg.text: We were very disappointed in the food. We were there to try the "lunch specials" and were surprised at the prices and the small amount of food. The music was so loud we could not have a conversation with our other two guests. I ordered what is a taco salad which you choose the ingredients. I asked for the tortilla bowl and then told the server what else I wanted. When it was served it was a salad in a dish, no tortilla and my refried beans were missing. My husband ordered the carnitas. The rice was too salty and he could not figure out how they cooked the pork. It was dry and he thought it had been deep fried. he was also, supposed to get "fresh, handmade" corn tortillas. They brought his lunch, he asked for his "corn" tortillas which never came out until his food was half gone and cold, and they were flour, not corn. One other friend ordered the two tacos, which were served on a coaster sized tortilla with a small bowl of beans and a scoop of rice. There are too many Mexican restaurants here that are much better. This was the newly opened Fiesta Henderson location.

XXNPZmrAfv8T7-X9MZVoIQ.text: This restaurant is close to our home and got good reviews so we tried it. We waited extra time to eat outdoors in April. It was a very nice atmosphere except for the guy we were sitting next to who was vile, discussing something personal and X rated about his girlfriend, and very loudly, of course. That, however was not the restaurant 's fault.   The wait person we had was very nice. The food was mediocre and over priced. I won't eat here again.

MNMpqGzXFhMVp0KvEFZC_A.text: I love Leticia's for lunch, for dinner, or for a quick bite.  Their green salsa is something that others dream about.  I always get the lunch combo.  It is reasonably priced and a good amount of food.  Their service is always above average.  If you are in the Northwest, this place is a must.

Z_f0Q6uL6I1Z0MAGM3HIlg.text: I have visited both locations, but the Norman Rockwell site is the most frequent.  I began when it was relatively new, and you could be seated without waiting.  I have never had anything that was not superior!  From the chorizo and talapia puffy tacos (one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth), huevos ranchero(best I ever had), unlimited chips and salsa, queso puffy tacos, and the list goes on.  Tamales, enchiladas and tacos are all homemade and be sure to try the cilantro rice!  Very authentic, if your idea of Mexican cuisine is Taco Bell you may not like it, but if what your looking for is excellent, authentic Mexican this is the place.

7UyZnY7G524LlCfKHfggQg.text: So just some back ground here. We haven't been here in a long while but for good reason. A ways back we had placed an order for pick up. Called in for some soup and salsa and chips I think. Anyway... my someone goes to pick up the soup and left with some degree of burns down her side and stomach. When the people packaged it on on top of the other... the soups were so hot that it melted through there insufficient styrofoam and plastic lid containers... spilling all over my someone. My partner turns around and walks back into receive help and needs to have the order filled as it's now all over her and the side walk. Here is where it gets worse. Not only did the staff not seem to care she was burned.. but they never even said "sorry this happened to you". We don't have expectations but I guess you would just think human to human you might show some sort of compassion... so the customer service in this moment was terrible and disappointing.. honestly very below standards. So let's flash forward to the present. Being as vegan as possible here we try to order a vinaigrette salad with no cheese as well as potato taquito with no cheese and no crema anywhere etc. they also bring over two salsas and some refried beans. A second server comes over for some reason and we ask to swap the refried beans for the black. Mind you this is a complimentary spread with the bar service we also ordered. We get DENIED this request and told there would be a charge. Then dude disappeared. Our original server returned later.. our food runner comes out and guess what is all over the food and salad... cheese. Oh and instead of the rice and black beans that came with the entree, it was black beans and refried beans?!? The server was very polite and very efficient, apologized and returned quickly with re plated food. Technically the rolled tacos were cross contaminated at they did end up in the refried beans from the first plate.. but we caught it so not too big a deal. When you check in you get a free margarita.. flagged down that guy from earlier who blew off our dietary request for black beans with the comp spread.. also blew off my second drink request. We went to the bartender and her ran it out directly. There was also a nice gal who refilled our chips and salsa. So aside from the inept, rude guy who seemed to visit our table for no reason other than too blow us off... our needs were mostly met and salsa and chips were good. The potato option is nice for vegans and veggie eaters. But I don't think we will be back all the same. It's the bad apple and the 2nd degree burns that kinda ruin it. But you might like the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salad with avo
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato rolled tacos cilantro lime rice black beans
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salsa!!! Get the hot stuff habanero

3WubInXMnJNTCCzv5xtW_w.text: This probably the best Mexican restaurant I have been to in Las Vegas.  The drinks were tasty, the food was out of this world and the service was great.  What more could you ask for?

Uwnhg-mDsF906ARaVqJXDw.text: On the very northern end of town and as a result lots of hikers stop here after a very long day...food is always good and prices fair as well...whats not to like after a long day in the Spring Mountains...

peYems4vo2nwYIWMzCy98g.text: Great Mexican restaurant in the northwest.  The food is fresh and good quality.  It has a little of a 'high-end' feel but prices are reasonable.  The restaurant is a good size and can have large parties.

He8Bi8T3CAmt1ze4WIOExQ.text: Never disappointed here!  Had the menudo and my son had a combo plate.  We both left fat and happy!  We always come back!

7IQaBYR7hxb_XLkE4KXbQg.text: Yummy food, cool restaurant, large menu, kid friendly, yummy drinks, and decently short wait times! I just wish it was a little cheaper.  It's quite expensive for Mexican food.

GN3Kb06gW53a7dpxVLXiJQ.text: As always the food was fantastic. Every dish I try is great. Service is always solid, but Deborah is a gem. She's been our server the last two visits. She's fun, friendly, professional and knowledgeable. I have a food allergy (wheat) and she expertly navigates the menu so I can safely try new dishes.

Z6iTGY-KlqEZ2nSNnWWJyA.text: Great bar area. Been coming here for years. Great 5 de Mayo events! Love the margaritas, micheladas and chips! It seems like shrimp ceviche recipe changed recently; tastes more like cooked shrimp versus ceviche. The service is always great.

CBkc3swMnePq2TUUwRjQeA.text: Went there for lunch on a Saturday.  Got there at 11:40.  It wasn't busy yet.  Sat in the bar area.  Took 10 minutes to even be acknowledged.  It was the worst service I've ever had.  Didn't get out of there until 1:15!  The food wasn't even good.

upSQtiE-ZafgHsqoMx48Bg.text: Worst service EVER. Went when it was dead and still spent about 1.5 hours to get everything. Absolutely ridiculous.

nJj4xo0g5_V80UYEBbqHjQ.text: Not my first time at Leticia's and I'm really a terrible yelp reviewer. I absolutely stand by my fellow yelpers and their guidance has always done me justice, but, I am typically floored or utterly disappointed before I write a review. Food has always been excellent here but tonight, Luciano made me want to come out and share the experience. Hidden off the Las Vegas strip but a must come see for some Mexican food, take the service to a whole other level and ask for Luciano!

UDmOHfYTtebu0iyqvFFQVw.text: This is our go to highland Mexican restaurant. Always great food plus fantastic margaritas.

Odisf--bcB64efrBVDlTOw.text: Great Food. This is my go to for Mexican food. The first time I came in here, I saw Chef Leticia wiping down tables, and bussing tables. She even took time to answer my questions, and personally made my special request! Any Chef that will take the time to do the bussers work, and then wash up to do a special request and personally deliver it to the table to make sure I am satisfied, gets my vote. Try the house specialty, or the Huevos Ranchero

ePm_LWpHQ12dCWDC4YHgjQ.text: Over priced inedible garbage. They cover the dishes in a disgusting amount of cheese to hide the fact that the food lacks flavor and quality. Such a disappointment after seeing 4 stars. I wouldn't go back if I was paid. You are better off going to Robertos in the gas station if you want a decent meal at a reasonable price. Being from the southwest I like to think of myself as a decent judge of Mexican food, and this place just tanks. My whole family left hungry and gagging from the gut bomb this place creates.  Never again. If you decide to go here, don't say I didn't warn you.

nzNKR1KWpI_wOUTFpnvtVw.text: Wonderful service with Ignacio. He was very attentive, nice and just one good server! We will definitely be coming back soon! Food was amazing!!!!

n9GSPoYW1KHPBMxSlO4ZKQ.text: The food has no flavor. I got a pork quesadilla and it had a huge pice of fat it in and not enough cheese. Service is always slow even when it isn't busy. Would never recommend.

CxxD99NzfRLWBDfgne8vqA.text: Great food, friendly and attentive staff. Lots to choose crime pricing was a tad bit higher than expected compared to similar restaurants but so worth it.

owDD9mNq87ZTwBkBm1EYrw.text: Great place to get together with family and friends. Great service and welcoming people in all areas of site. Super busy place, but no one cares. Just all around fun. Thank you.

sAbNzLbGgVHEexrnX-Mg3w.text: My Mexican friends don't like this place. They said it's not the food/flavor they grew up knowing. I find the food here real salty. The times I've been here, there's more gringos and gringas than Mexicans.  I do love their chips, tomatillo, chipotle and bean dips for sure. I can eat 2 baskets of their chips. 5/5  I've tried their signature dish: Quesa Taco. Loaded with cheese, very flavorful and very salty. I asked for no tomatoes since I'm allergic, they gave me tomatoes anyway. I scraped the tomatoes off but I guess not all since my lips were puffier than their puffy tacos. 3/5  Puffy Tacos: Fried flour tacos. Greasy. Rice was salty. 3/5  I love horchata. They don't have free re-fills though.  The wait can be ridiculous even with a reservation. There are parts of the room that is dark and warm (to the left of the hostess' booth) and bright and freezing (to the right). Bring a scarf/jacket just in case.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish Puffy Tacos
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quesa Tacos with sautéed veggies instead of rice
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cecina A La Tempiquena

63yqNHCEUZasGRVoTCxZOw.text: The staff here is always so friendly and warm!!!  The first time we went my guy had ordered the menudo. It came out with a really pasty consistency, almost like gravy. Really odd considering the more broth like soup I had been accustomed to. I later learned there are various ways to make it and this was one. Either way we brought it to out kind waiters attention and he took it off the bill and was very understanding.  The food was too authentic for me to never try it again...... So I've actually been back numerous times since... For business meeting, lunch specials and just for fun.  It's fast becoming my FAVORITE Mexican restaurant !!!!! It's a little pricey, but this can be avoided mainly by going during lunchtime! :) I'm sure they'll get another start once I've tried more on the menu.  Love love love this place!!

kyKOnL3BnigrKrnTI7VLlQ.text: The staff is friendly and the food is great! I gave it 3 stars though because the prices are a bit high and our food took about 45 minutes to get. Fortunately however we weren't in a hurry and decided to order a Margarita while we waited. The Margarita was very well made and tasted delicious. We'll probably go back.

mEoNPKvGfM3A-uhteGXh8g.text: I'll keep it simple and short for the Bottom Line: you want good DF Mexican food? This is the place.  Had the Mexican grilled corn and the house queso tacos. Grilled corn was okay. Tacos are amazing..!

3l1o5qpv1-t_c6WXJjzqzQ.text: Well, where do I begin! I saw this restaurant pop up on my Instagram feed, so I figured I'd check it out when I got into town. Of course I was a little hesitant because good authentic Mexican food is hard to come by. Anyway, the first thing that caught my eye when we pulled up was people were already lined up waiting for tables outside (presumably). Must me common place for a Friday evening about 7pm. Once we parked and got in, I think we waited maybe 30 minutes. During the wait, we took the opportunity to look at the pictures on Yelp, so we had a pretty good idea of what we wanted. I recommend you doing so as well because the menu has a lot to choose from and it all looks good. Once we were seated, Luciano greeted us and took our orders. We shared the guacamole with crab and shrimp (minus the spicy, but still a bit spicy) and the quesatacos!! Both we delicious. Authentic flavors and everything. By the way, the chips and salsa were great too.  We actually over indulged in the chips and salsa, so we barely touched the guacamole. Don't get too full on the chips and salsa, you'll miss out on the food!! Overall, great place. I'd recommend it and definitely done here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole with shrimp and crab added!
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp quesatacos!

33siHfAINkIeQQqldWXSDg.text: I will never go back here again. Rudest customer service ever. When there's a party of 8 that's a lot of money you lost and my business forever. I will make sure to tell everyone I know to never go here again. If I could give you negative stars I would.

LD7Qx3MqFQRO54X13UcojQ.text: Love the food! Portions were great! Ambience, traditional Mexican decor, tasteful done. Missed going to bar, but it appears to have all sorts of tequilas and all other kinda spirits. Definitely making it a regular place to eat at. Since our new home is nearby. Note, al pastor tacos were spicy, which they should not be. I did notify the waiter but no response from the kitchen. Other than that, my shrimp cocktail was great and all the other food plates my family and friend ordered were very tasty. Also, loved the salsa and chips!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Welcome sign!

1SQI5Zd8cHbRAleRR5YuSg.text: Great atmosphere and decorated very cute. Food was very good. Definitely will be going back.

J4JFy8S0kSbtY1rmvm1R5A.text: I really enjoy their happy hour.  Good drinks and good food what more can you ask for.  Karaoke night is fun and very entertaining lol.

a-NytsJAx1NxfuwcHzclTg.text: This was hands down the worst restaurant we've been to. From the time we got there to being served, took two hrs. The waitress kept promising service would be faster but it wasn't. The feature tacos con queso was about a 1/4 of nondescript cheese melted heavily over everything else to block any flavor. The rest of our party's food was cold, blah or gloppy. We got there at 6:30 and we're served at 8:45. The place was not crowded. We were tired and done but the waitress spent time yelling at another waiter behind us instead of processing our bill. He seemed ok and was at our table more. Totally shoddy. And the drinks weren't great either!

fFuzeLuEmaSbAuyC2SqqVg.text: I know I'm in the minority here, but this place just wasn't that good.  The service was slow, the food was sub par and there really isn't a reason for me to go back.  I went here with some family and tired a few different things on the menu and wasn't impressed.  The tamales were bland, the tacos were cold and the salad not impressive.    In a city with lots of good Mexican food, I see no reason to eat here.

fxLCak9msdUTVdt2O89ruw.text: The quesatacos were AMAZING!!! Maybe it's because I'm a big fan of cheese!!! Good, good food!

Ghwr5g4sP2l8nkUAf_jl0Q.text: This place is pretty excellent. They have big portions and you can pretty much share with whoever you're with because it's that big. They have excellent customer service. Only reason why I put four stars is because it's kind of expensive. My boyfriend and I don't really order any appetizers or desserts or anything like that, but we still on average spend at least fifty bucks.  It's okay though, because we only go here once in a while and the good is good.

ZzxsYDmWRG-SGaksLA1gvA.text: Great service, great environment, great suggestions and even better food and margaritas.

SZ-mtWF4eLAoJ9h0uhyiJg.text: Leticias has become my favorite Mexican restaurant. Everything I've had has been excellent. The burritos are the best anywhere, and are huge. And I highly recommend trying the QuesoTaco.   The staff is very friendly and are very helpful when you have questions. My family will definitely make this place a regular visit!

hJDSikLMHgI-HM2N_A_KHg.text: We are long time customers that visit weekly.  My wife loves the molcojete and l enjoy everything.   Food is amazing and the service is amazing.  We request Isela .  She is the best

bWD2EiI9dp1zOzKRgqPt1Q.text: The lunch bill was reasonable. There was a choice of five or so meats and 6 sauces for the enchilada dish i got. The mole was excellent and perfectly cooked. The beans had cochita cheese like i like. The chips had three sauces to dip red, green and bean dip and all were excellent. Some of our party raved about the soup but i didnt try it. For really reasonable mexican quizine that is tasty this place is good. And childrens menu helps.

t_59Y4LPopoJyYlDHc1ufQ.text: We Happened to stumble upon this cozy Mexican restaurant while driving around. I Yelp it and it has good reviews, good price so we went ahead with no hesitation to try it. We got our food in no time and Viola! love at first bite.  Everything tasted fresh and the unique taste just out do the other Mexican  restaurant I had tried. They have put a lot of effort in cooking and preparing the food that you can taste it (you know what I mean.)It  tasted like you really in another country so authentic. Nice ambiance, great service. You are welcomed as soon as you walk in. Overall all it was a great dining experience for my hubby and I. And most definitely be dropping by more often.

cp88fECYlP8kKszq13_tLw.text: This was my first time here. .best place for Mexican food in Vegas. .I ordered the chicken fajitas..The portion size was huge could serve 2 .The salsa and bean dip were delicious .loved the atmosphere although Friday nights are very busy will be back for more

9yxfdp2Rqrhs0c_UjmA5aQ.text: This is my favorite Mexican Food in Las Vegas. How did I get so lucky to have this restaurant so close to my home! I have eaten here since the day it opened and it never disappoints. Large portions, friendly service and great margaritas. You must get there before dinner rush or there will be people out the door! I go about 5:00. But no later! Leticia the owner is a sweetheart!

2Hag9cHarq9N_M_K-knIiA.text: Love this place. The waitress was very helpful in answering my questions about the best plates. There is a Dayroom, but I like the area closer to the bar. It has a better feel, and you're not so close to the tables next to you.

_Of6ZDVuUk_sG5rqwBFNBA.text: I give 3 of the stars to the waiters since they do a fantastic job. The food is FORSURE overrated compared to the yelp reviews (I'm always weary when a non-minority person comments on how good a minority food restaurant is lol). I had the Quesa shrimp tacos and they were just really cheesy with no flavor. Did I tell you that at least the waiters were on point?  You Vegas Yelpers failed me again as usual..  Tip: Go visit South Gate, LBC, Lynnwood, any hood SoCal area for better food than this.

sQ2NkrNMy2IUH0jOH4QrLw.text: By far...the most exceptional Mexican dish you will ever have. Great staff, service, to match the quality of the food!

K128Uyv8xyl3Zhef39x0mw.text: Being from Mexico, it's hard to find good places like this one where they serve actual Mexican food.  The best thing was the Cafe de Olla, it's your average coffee with a hint of cinnamon flavor to it.   Definitely a breakfast / brunch place, definitely worth the drive!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Café de Olla

PorOPCq84ymyU8tVSOmWjA.text: This is one of our favorite, if not favorite Mexican places in town.  It is very cozy and family friendly. I always judge a Mexican restaurant by it's El Molcojete. This place has the best one in town. Very spicy.   We always ask for Rogelio fir our waiter. He is awesome and we love him!  He has been here as long as we have been coming here. Great food, great Margaritas and always a good time!

cSQoY3OCBgbkgC65ouWqXA.text: Used to best Mexican restaurant but not anymore after my husband and I made reservations for Saturday. We didn't get served til 20 min after we sat down. And it wasn't busy at all. A table who got seated after us got there drink order taken and got chips and salsa before we got anything. Food portion were so small idk what happened. I would of asked for a refund but highly doubt they would do that.

jtxKktSb3FpMoQcM9hRpRg.text: We decided to drive across town to Leticia's simply because I have heard so many great thing about this place. We were highly disappointed. The food was just average and the service was absolutely horrible. It's been a long time since we have had service this bad anywhere. The waiter Miguel was very friendly, but horrible in regards to service. Every single contact from the greeting to the time we received the bill seemed to be at his convenience. The best thing about today's lunch was the Mexican Coffee.

koKFnEUIbZ5S3kLiQaIioQ.text: I've been here several times and have never found "my dish" that I always come back for (until this night).  I come back for the ambiance and to keep trying to find that one dish that makes me crave coming back.  Saturday we brought some out of town friends here for dinner.  Looking for somewhere they haven't been before we thought this was the place that wouldn't disappoint.    We were greeted by the hostess as soon as we walked in.  There were people waiting but we were seated right away.  The waiter came to take our drink order.  He was very friendly and offered up some recommendations.  He brought out the complimentary chips and salsa.  There was two types salsa - one smokey (not good) and the other was a tomato based salsa and was very tasty.  It also came with a warm bean dip which because a favorite of the table.  The chips were an "eh".  Nothing special and not even sure if they were freshly made but with the salsa/bean dip you didn't really notice.  We did order some of the freshly made guacamole.  It was pretty bland and was in need of salt, but I would rather put my own salt on guacamole anyway.  The BF and I both ordered the street tacos.  The waiter said they were what he usually ordered and so we thought we were good to go.  I ordered ground beef, chicken and carne asada on flour tortillas.  They were so good and I think I found my craving for this place.  It really was so much food though.  I only ate two and picked at the 3rd one.  It came with rice and beans and I only had a couple bites of rice.  I do love the rice here...its a no nonsense rice-tomato sauce and diced onion is my guess.  The BF and I also split a Mexican style corn on the cob (they cut it in half) that came topped with a white creamy cheese sauce and seasonings on top.  The corn itself had little cornels so it was just blah to me.  I might have to try this corn again because I'm not quite sure how I felt about it.  It was much different than I've had before.  The middle of our meal the owner stopped by our table to make sure everything was going good. I think he has done that every time we have been here.  I always appreciate an owner or even the manager that can take time to acknowledge their customers.  A simple effort but not many do it.  As our dinner started to wind down the karaoke crew started funneling in.  I had forgotten that they do karaoke on the weekends.  So we extended our drinks and our stay to watch some people strut their stuff.  I believe the starting time was 9pm.  Pretty smart to bring in a new crowd just as the dinner crowd is thinning out.  I hope it brings in some added business for them.  Really fun to kick back, catch up with friends with some good live music in the back ground.    Overall, the service is very personable and caring, the food is a delight, the ambiance is cozy and after 9pm on the weekends live karaoke lovin.  Score!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My amazingly yummy street tacos...carne asada, chicken, and ground beef!
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not even sure what this is.  A friend ordered it.  Said the fish left alot to be desired...
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Um hello.

PIeGmw09jxRfsyW0NviLOA.text: For a Monday night it was pretty busy. The waiters and bus boys were prompt and friendly. I was told to get the Chicken Fajitas so I did.  The salsas that they bring out first were amazing. I loved it! The green salsa was pretty baller. When the fajitas came out I was excited but when I started digging into them I tasted oil and butter. I'm not a huge fan of buttery veggies and chicken. My taste buds aren't quite up to that. The flower tortillas weren't exactly my favorite either. Too cakey. Overall the chips and salsa that were brought out were the best thing for me. The rest, well let's say for a chubby man that never leaves food on his plate there was plenty left when I left.   I recommend swinging in for the salsas and if you like buttered down veggies.

Yu0BWf6noMuHM8Ie2oVskg.text: This is a wonderful Mexican restaurant. My husband and I have just moved into town and that made ya feel like family.  Our waitress was so delightful (Luna) and so very attentive.  We also have met the chef and owner Leticia who is also so wonderful.  This is a keeper.  You must go and visit yourself.  The food is delicious.  Cheers.

9Iq-udZ6fv4aRSewHml10A.text: It was our first time here for dinner.  The place was busy, however we were seated promptly.  Our wait staff was quick to greet us and bring us very warm fresh chips and salsa.  The salsa was a little lacking in  the heat department but overall passable.  Perhaps the lack of sting was obvious reflection of the demographics of that part of town.  As a third generation Mexican American, I've had the privilege of growing up around the culture and experiencing some of the  most authentic of authentic cuisine on both sides of the US/Mexican Border.  I ordered the batter-less chile relleno stuffed with nicely seasoned shredded chicken. The beans and rice were fresh.  The 2 for 1 Margaritas were also  well appointed if you know what I mean. Looking forward to coming back.

0NYsNReCA4Wg9DMoDbajkw.text: Best Mexican food we've had in Las Vegas! Service was so great from the time we walked in. Jacob the bartender was not only attentive, but very friendly and talked with us about our son's sports. Home-made tortillas were absolutely amazing

oBORGLFrrfYKMj8OS0XyOw.text: Excellent food very tasty. Great atmosphere and was packed on a Friday night of course. Ordered the family style carne asada steak with delicious cilantro rice and black beans. Thanks for the free margarita!!

Bf2HF3LC7VdA6hfDImBfFg.text: This place used to be my favorite Mexican food restaurant in the Valley, but I found another--- Juan's Flaming Fajitas(see my review). Anyways, more about Leticia's: the food is eclectic; however sometimes the basic ingredient of salt is missed and the food comes out a bit bland. The flavor aspect, especially from a Mexican restaurant is missing. Additionally, the prices are pretty exorbitantly high for the quality of taste that has dwindled over the years. Their Happy Hour makes me want to cry, *whispers* It's expensive, too! Honestly, I have come to the conclusion that Leticia's survives as well as it does partly because of it's location. It sits in an upper middle class neighborhood within the upper middle class part of NW Vegas. It's also the most authentic Mexican restaurant for miles---of anyone says Lindo Michoacan is authentic, I'm going to remind them of their cheesy and stereotypical atmosphere, their bland food and their salsa that tastes like a rip off of Heinz Ketchup. Also, I think Leticia's survives so well is also because of their puffy tacos and green salsa; yes, I'm dead serious. They have this amazing green citrusy/avocado salsa that craves the attention of most pregnant women, tacos lovers and salsa fanatics. Anyways, Leticia's will always have a place in my heart, especially because I live 2 minutes away not the NW Valley , but I will now drive 40 minutes to Juan's for my Mexican food infatuation

0UgB6bahkdeo7UFT9U88cg.text: I have been here a handful of times-each time with a different size group. My experience has been excellent. The longest wait time had been 30 minutes on a Saturday evening, but was accommodated with in 20. The servers, assistants and hostess' have provided exceptional service each time. Ive ordered a variety of things off the menu and have not been disappointed by the flavor or the portion. The atmosphere is clean with a nice design throughout the restaurant. They absolutely take pride in their work.

edypsGmvMiJTKdXm4yMBmw.text: The green chili is spicy and full of flavor-but a bit too spicy for me.   Chips and salsa are very tasty,  service was friendly and quick.  Mom ordered an red chili enchilada and it was not bad.  Rice and beans very average.  Nice restaurant.    It's not a place I come running back too but I was nearby and wanted to give it another chance.  Sorry for the boring review but it was just a bit of a boring lunch.

bZllHNFWDJ5KSnUWfx-Ivg.text: Just wanted to give some props to Luciano! Thanks for the 5+ years of great service!!! Thanks Luchi!!

ZUd71Sw5fXFesHNItsU8jw.text: Never had food here I didn't like. There was one visit where the service was incredibly slow, which was extra annoying because I was pregnant and starving, but other than that, no issues. Food is always great and reasonably priced.

0VVNkhs-dqqZ-AF3RrXRqA.text: Leticia's...one of the best places that you can eat in the Northwest!  I've tried a little bit of everything here...but my favorites are probably the Burritos and tacos!  You can essentially customize your own food here, from the salsa to the ingredients, and of course, the meat! My particular burrito was made with Al Pastor and Red Guajillo, Black Beans, and House Blend Cheese. This was a BEAST...had to take the other half to go! Really loved the salsa...it was actually a bit spicy!  I also liked the Queso Fundido : Chorizo, Gouda, and Menonita Cheese. Super cheesy mix, with tons of oil and fat...just like chorizo should be! It was almost too cheesy actually, with it being super stringy and a little difficult pulling apart! But that's what friends are for...to help you with your cheese!  Even the complimentary salsa and chips are great, and bottomless if you enjoy them as much as us!   Prices seem a bit steep at first, but the quality of ingredients, taste, and portions make it worth it.  Wish the portions were smaller with more reasonable prices to reflect that...ie a burrito at half the size, but around the $10 mark vs $15.  Took plenty of pics, check em out! :

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ensenada Tacos : Battered Fried Fish, Shredded Cabbage, Leticia&#39;s Chipotle Cream Sauce, Pico de Gallo, &amp; House blend of Cheese
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso Fundido : Chorizo, Gouda, and Menonita Cheese. Super cheesy mix, with tons of oil and fat...just like chorizo should be!
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Chips and Salsa

VVzzAa1uxm13pImbOpxaWg.text: Its been awhile since I've been to a Mexican restaurant and seen something on the menu I've never eaten before.   Today the clouds parted and the Sun shown down on my new favorite Pork Chop dish in Vegas. The Chuletas!  I was a little nervous as I am a bit particular when it comes to my Pork Chops but as soon as the waitress placed it in front of me and the intoxicating aroma hit my nose I had to fight the urge to dive right in and wait until my entire table was served.  Ooh the Humanity! The wait was killing me but once I started I couldn't stop. If it wasn't a business lunch and if I wasn't there with my colleagues I may have just ordered a second Pork Chop!  The chips salsa and refried bean appetizer was delicious but might not be touched on my next trip. Will want to save room for that Pork Chop.  Their salsa is a mild salsa with great flavor. For those looking for something a little more spicy ask for a habanero salsa dish to be brought out with the nachos. It was hot and had great fresh flavor. I couldn't tell if was from a can or not as my coworkers and I made that dish disappeared in less than five minutes but I'd guess freshly made.  The Staff was amazing and had a lot of personality as they interacted with my group of seven. One even went so far as to call me a Gringo for ordering flour tortillas. Was not expecting that and I played along making it an ongoing joke throughout the meal.  All in all I loved this place and can't wait till I have the opportunity to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I found this in the men&#39;s restroom? Its good information but I think it would be better in the female restroom?

cK8m1GaS0c5iPBd2Dao-SA.text: Quickly and comfortably seated with reservation. Food is plentiful and amazing! Service is excellent! Our favorite place for Mexican food. Patio dinning is a plus.

4P_ydvVC1NsgHrMJ2rulrg.text: The food was delicious, the service was superb. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

yA9_4EtH1QOeisBmVvCrgw.text: Leticia's is a great Mexican restaurant that is located in the northwest side of town! It's located in a little downtown type atmosphere. They offer outside seating as well as inside dining. The establishment itself is very clean and comfortable inside. They have a bar with gaming, but that does not take away from the full restaurant experience! I have visited Leticia's about 6 times since I moved to this area of town and every time I have had a wonderful experience. I'm a creature of habit, and tend to get the same things every time I go to a place. I love the build your own burrito! It's very filling and the portion size of everything here is giant! Everyone that I have brought with me to this establishment has loved it and ended up returning with their friends and families. I will definitely continue to come back here when I'm in the mood for good quality Mexican food!

xX3s6Vv3Ky4DDOCQq72PJg.text: Husband and I came here yesterday based on the reviews. The service was stellar! Received lots of attention and amazing service. I would give that 10 stars. The food, however was not so great. I ordered the fajita tamales, and my husband ordered the street tacos (not sure of the Spanish name). I specifically chose the tamales being that according to the menu, these were "award winning". I have to say, this is far from True for my dish. I couldn't finish it, and my husband, a human garbage disposal-took one bite and refused to finish it. It truly tasted like a can of old Campbell's soup wrapped in cheap masa! Yuck! The carne asada on hubby's tacos were so dry, that no amount of salsa or beans could have made it easier to swallow. I'm a pretty seasoned (well-traveled) foodie, and Mexican is one of my favorite cuisines. Flavors were totally off and disappointing. Although I appreciate the amazing service, I don't think we'll be making a trip back anytime soon.

Hfyx2Cgl1ekmiEbBf10xCA.text: loved the margaritas here..... the wait was a little long and my server was shabby but the food was great

9XazBJ8uodZA1hZy3wih2A.text: We went in on Thursday night this was our 2nd time there and just like the 1st time it was incredible worth the 20 min drive off the strip we had the best Chili Rellenos I've ever had and the EL Mojecte was incredible we will make it a point to go there every time we go to Las Vegas wait staff was also great

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HPYSCwiw2iZSKiFK2aG7fw.text: Fantastic!! Great food and service. Great bar with lots of drink options. The area has a cool "city" feel for being out in the burbs. Patio is pretty is comfy as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty!!!

-DdHxMb2Q12qtLZznP39YQ.text: I used to love this place.  It looks like they have an entirely new staff now.  They were really friendly.  It made you feel like you were at home.  Now the service and the food aren't nearly as good as they used to be.  A big disappointment.

udYykx1n9T1smBrnGmbXsw.text: Free margaritas yelp check in. Bomb molcajete the original carne asada and shrimp  homemade tortillas. We will return many times yum

NXSmiSrP5--kJeO7fuCufQ.text: Two business associates took me here for lunch.  I can only say it was THE BEST Mexican food I have ever had.  Simply exquisite.  The tastes, the textures, and the hospitality of the owner were exceptional.  I had her award winning shrimp tacos. "Oh, my" they were over the top.  I had them with heat (and they ask you how hot).  They were fantastic.  I also had her award winning margarita made from tamarind (tamarindo).  It was great, too.    As per the owner, we even sat in Santana's booth, as he visits monthly to get some great food.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

jMFgT0B_WOqbDEDlg9olWQ.text: Horrible food and service! It took over an hour to get our food and it was not even busy. On top of that, our waitress seemed bothered by having to serve us.   I ordered the Asada and chicken enchiladas, which were far too salty. My dad ordered the birria, which he also thought was too salty and greasy. I would not recommend this place.

b2fj4InpmN4TVVAH-YgIvQ.text: Saturday evening we used a YELP reservation and were seated promptly. The place was packed with a large line of others waiting for a table!  1) Excellent service that "deserved" more than a standard tip.  2) Broad range of interesting menu choices.  3) Every item we ordered deserved a minimum of a "B" with most of them deserving an "A"!  4) Price was more than fair considering all the above comments I've shared.

NDe3bzk0U9Wv-XCZHKmbtA.text: Spent Cinco de Mayo there,  their margarita was very good, very authentic.  The food, delightful,  very good for Mexican food,  ordered carne asada (a little overpriced,  $16.99),  margaritas (it gets better by the glass) and their street tacos (I had carne asada and carnitas)was very good, very well seasoned.  If you are a margarita connoisseur, try one, you'll thank me later (if you remember). I recommend this place to anyone who enjoys traditional Mexican food,  with an authentic flavor. Oh,  did I mentioned their margaritas?

THBA5m9QQ7C70uqOtAXT9g.text: Great Mexican food and much better than Lindo. It was packed but we still got seated in a reasonable time frame. Service was on point and quick. Our food was delicious, reasonably priced, and the portions were generous. This was our first time here and we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crane asada for two!
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small guacamole
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chips, beans, and salsa. So good!

JMQo4zgEbYSEAMU_V_wdDA.text: I'm a vegas native and I have had mexican food all over this city my entire life, and I must say that Leticia's food is by far some of the best I have ever had!  We ordered their signature tacos, some tostadas and the fajitas!  All flavorful and amazing!  The carnitas taco was amazing, seasoning just perfect!  Their ground beef tostada was to die for!  Their ground beef has to be the best in Las Vegas!  I can't wait to come back to try a beef burrito!  The fajitas were piping hot and everything was succulent and juicy!  All white meat chicken!  We are waiting on sopapilla's and im more than positive I'll be mind blown by these as well!  The service was amazing, our waiter gave us the most amazing recommendations and I am so excited that I finally got to try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fajitas!

BF0hYgvbrPhXl5B4wwI9Rw.text: Visited Leticia's 8/3/12-  Been wanting to try Leticia's for awhile now but they are a drive from our house so kept putting it off and I'm kicking myself in the "trasero"!  We took my niece there for dinner.  We got there a bit early so seating was no problem but when we left there seemed to be a wait.    Started off with their chips, bean dip and salsas.  LOVED the salsa verde.  My niece raved and she is 8!!  The beans and other salsa were just fine.  My niece ordered off the kids menu and had the chicken burrito (came with beans rice, a beverage and dessert).  She really liked the burrito.    My husband ordered the Latecia's Quesa Tacos which had a blend of melted Oaxaca cheese stuffed with shrimp cooked in Leticia's Abuelo sauce "and topped with a chipotle cream sauce.  It came with a  small individual cheesy rice casserole  topped with crema and chile and a side of beans (he picked refried).  I stole that tasty little rice casserole right from under his nose!  I would come back for that and their grilled mexican corn on the cob!  That corn was super tasty!  I had their Taquitos dinner which gives you a good variety to choose from.  I chose the beef picadillo, chicken, and the most delectable  Potato and Cheese wrapped in  corn tortillas and fried crispy. All were topped with guacamole,  Oaxaca cheese, cotija cheese, crema and pico de gallo.  I had a side of black beans and cilantro rice.    Service was good and the decor was really nice.  Wished they were closer but they are worth  driving out to.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kid&#39;s meal
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YfmB0O5qOOgru5AtN-LI7g.text: Finding great Mexican food is Vegas is harder than one would think. Leticia's is our "go-to", primarily because of the fantastic drinks, fun atmosphere, clean restaurant, and friendly service. We've been here enough to know what we like to order, but I'm docking them a couple stars because we've had a few misses on our entrees over the years. The carnitas, carne asada, and generally anything on the family style menu have been delicious. Some of their other dishes, (such as the pork guisados) have been lacking in flavor, or overly greasy.  So, give Leticia's a shot, but ask your waiter for his or her recommendation.

DHbEYU1fsmW8eyLXV_m5BQ.text: Wow. What a great experience!!! The waiter and the water server where very attentive and kind....they answered all our questions and even gave me extra chips for home.  The food is amazing and I had a peach margarita.  So delicious.  We will be back again and again

hxhoa6D0pqCIStu-z4JOEw.text: This is my 3rd time here and I can definitely say their food is on point, so delicious and authentic tasting I definitely think if you like Mexican food you need to checkout Leticia's!

jhaaWkHOPFK1UX6F_gimWA.text: Great food and our server was the best, find Morri at the bar. Was my first time in for dinner, Morri was great, he took time explaining some of the many things offered on the menu, answering all our questions. The food was great and very traditional. I know I will be back, and if Morri is working I will be sitting at the bar.

AW4G8DmKkb5HCwXHEwyWfw.text: This place is right by my mom's house so we go regularly. Go for lunch if you don't want to wait for a table.the staff is always really nice. Never a long wait for the food to arrive. This place is just good cheap Mexican food! The pork tamales are a must! The sopapillas are a great desert! I love the street Tacos..everything I try here is awesome! The yummy salsa and bean dip are complimentary with any order of food:)

k7cqggtuR8l8k0gKbl6L-g.text: One star is too many. Terrible service and disappointing food. Third time trying it because it's close to home but won't be coming back.

YUslUgXWMWjimYy-P5er6Q.text: It's a shame they closed .Their food is delicious and the service was as well.Hopefully they reopen near the area .

ZIbZHMUbA_aGPh0g4mz-WQ.text: Have loved this place for many years. Makes me sad to say we will not be back. We had an early dinner just now. First ordered 2 black teas no lemon with extra splenda (yellow packets of sweetener) they bring all sweeteners but that one. AND two teas with 2 lemons in each. Okay. Shoulda just figured this is not going the way it normally does here.  Husband ordered fajitas with extra seasoning sauce they use. I ordered taquitos with no guacamole. Fajitas come no extra sauce. My taquitos have guacamole all over them. Husband eats his cause the three employees who came over had no idea what he was asking for. And I can't stand guacamole so I had to have mine redone. Well 27 minutes later they come out (way after hubby was done) I stopped one waiter at about 20 minutes and said just forget them I don't want them and they came anyway so I ate 2 of them and they're cold.. ask for the check. I really couldn't fathom they charged for mine. Honestly I wouldn't have asked for any discount cause we just don't do that but the fact they didn't offer or anything just put it like it didn't matter. I think we'll have to pass on our go to Mexican restaurant for quite a while. Seen a lot of new faces and maybe they changed management or something. We come every 2 weeks and it's on point usually but not now.  As of today 8/3/2018 we just found out there is a 3% charge to pay with a card. Smh.

Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tortilla soup.
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Virgin pins coloda,,, yum

2gV1TVNKR6irjFKi3gBEBw.text: Decided to stop by after a long day at work because my boyfriend and I were hungry! I checked Yelp before I came and saw that the happy hour goes from 6-7pm if you sit in the bar/lounge area (score!!). We were greeted by three people at the front immediately with smiles. Right of the bat, loved the decor and ambiance of this place. There was tons of Mexican-inspired artwork and the lighting was a nice mix between natural and dim (made for a romantic/chill vibe). Our server was quick and made sure we had everything we needed! He recommended the Peach Margarita, and I loved how it wasn't over powering with sweetness, but it was balanced enough that the tequila didn't hit me right away. You get complimentary chips and 3 salsas. I wish we got bigger chips, our bowl was mostly crumbs, but the salsa choices were awesome. Definitely something for everyone if you like spice, beans, or green chilies! My boyfriend got the Carne Asada plate. He said it was alright because he wanted more seasoning/spice, but he enjoyed the rice and beans. He said the rice tasted similar to his mom's! I ordered the Ensenada Street Tacos with grilled shrimp. I loved the spicy sauce and the crispness of the cabbage with the juicy shrimp. Definitely a flavorful bite. I'm pretty happy with my experience here and would recommend for a group lunch for some of my coworkers because they have so many different choices of entrees. I'd love to check out the happy hour menu too because the prices were so reasonable!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach Margarita
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Chips and Salsa
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ensenada Style Tacos with Grilled Shrimp

UOgrolOIucVmOpzReIurQw.text: This place is great! The staff is friendly, the food is always good and the location is nice and clean! I always order something different and they always accommodate my request.   I have a lot of food allergies and am not able to eat corn. They were able to accommodate my soft taco request by substituting the normal corn tortillas with flour! That was so nice. No extra charge and the food was amazing!   Parking is easy, menu is big, food is delicious.... and I can't wait to go back!  Great job guys!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flour tacos!

QdRkF7uswnTN2vmm1ZnA8g.text: I found Leticia's many years ago at a taco festival.   I keep coming back for the street tacos but everything in the restaurant is amazing.   The mole is hands down the best in Las Vegas and I drive 40 minutes just to get some of its deliciousness.

52AdyCOs6fQLnJJUjm1_jw.text: Have been going here for 7 years.  Came in last month and as I walked to restroom I saw 2 doors covered with plywood. The men's room urinal was covered with a black trash bag. It was dirty. A busted up wooden cabinet was by the door. Gang writing on the mirrors   The food is usually good. I ordered the shrimp ceviche. It's a total JOKE. I'm an honor graduate of Le Cordon Bleu.   Our server never touched the table. We would have ordered 2 more drinks each. We couldn't get anyone to take care of us.  Despite what appeared to me a excessive amount of staff milling about.   I discovered a break in occurred a few weeks ago. That explains the wood on the doors. Apparently they got into the safe. My opinion it's an inside job.   Sad to see a once great place deteriorate.

BbtK78LNKY6LeTyBYKpFvw.text: I've had take out here before but I finally got to dine in one night after finishing up what seemed like a very long and hard semester. Me and the beau wanted to celebrate so I suggested to come to Leticia's.  Located right off the freeway in the Centennial area, it reminded me of Tavoli Village actually. It was a very cute location and secluded. Upon walking in at 6pm it was pretty busy. We waited only about 20 minutes though. When you check in you receive a free house margareita so I took advantage of that. The beau got a guava jalapeno margareita. Oh that was delish!  Of course a red and green salsa and bean dip w/ chips came out. I always appreciate that because sometimes you just have the munchies as you wait for your food.  So I ordered ceviche with crab. oh my goodness, that was one of the best ceviches I ever had. The crab just made it extea amazing. It wasn't too sour because I hate when it is. It was the perfect amount. I had to order fresh guac of ocurse. Their guac is topped with a slice of queso which is apreciated also. You can also add crab on the guac, we didn't, but that sounds like a good idea! i love crab.  I got pork/beef pozole. I honeslty have had authentic home made pozole so in my mind I always compare it so Leticia's pozole didn't really cut it for me but the beau really liked it. It didn't have all the spices that I craved in it I dont know what was missing.   We also ordered carne, chicken, shrimp Molcajete. That was a lot of food. It was sooooo good! that is something I reccomend if you are dining with friends because that could be easily shared.   The waiter, I forgot his name, was amazing. He really helped us in information about the menu and ordering the right foods. He was awesome! everything came out in a reasonable time. We did order a lot of food for 2 so it was appreciated it did not come out all at once because we wouldn't have room on the table and that was all due to our waiter.   I ordered a CocoFlan to go because I was so full but I needed dessert for later. That was amazing. The chocolate cake was very moist and the flan wasn't too sweet. It was perfect.  Overall, it was a good dine in experience and I can not wait to return.
