Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margaritas
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salsa

yN494wWvp4ZjQ1JnahgkWw.text: The food and service was great.  The cilantro rice is amazing, must try and the guacamole.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajitas were very good

HQcF8HVPSc_qjDUgPJz2LA.text: I just can't say enough about how much we love this place.  The chips and salsa to start are delicious, and all the food has such a unique twist with such robust flavors.  Everything we've ordered has been phenomenal.  Our favorite are the QuesaTacos.  We've tried them with 4 different meat options and they just get better every time.  Arrive early, they get really busy at night!

3Wv1NL7ppfq_8ztBsr3QqQ.text: Great place for higher quality Mexican food in the northwest.  I have been here a few times and the dishes are consistently traditional and flavorful.   Service starts with chips and salsa both a red and green along with refried beans for dipping. All three are  delicious and made fresh in house. The tortilla chips that accompanied  the salsas are also delicious.  Menu prices are a little high I feel but the portions and quality help to justify the price point. Daily specials that highlight traditional mexican home style dishes are very good. I had the Bisteque  and it was very good.  Tender beef with potatos, corn, peppers, and onions in a thick gravy like sauce was very good. I really enjoyed the white rice and beans. The white rice was prepared with sour cream and roasted peppers....Amazing!   One of the best parts of the meal was the free Margarita with the Yelp check in. It's always good to be a member of the club. Great beverage.   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp empanada
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bisteque y raja&#39;s special
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful tile mural

f3OBxly0mS8EQbGW8B_N6g.text: Pleasantly surprised. This was a really nice dinner! This side of town doesn't have a lot of four and five star places to eat. Complimentary Chips, Beans, and Salsa were tasty and arrived very quickly upon being seated. Cadillac Margarita was super yummy. My hubby had the Queso Shrimo Tacos which he loved! I had the Flautas. One Carnitas, One Potato and Cheese, One Carne Asada. All were delicious! Rice and Beans came with each entree and were surprisingly above average. I will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Street Corn, off the Cobb
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flautas.....Delicious!
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso Shrimp Tacos

U1GMf_lDDsCpp8hjnucI9A.text: Love love love Leticia's. The staff are always so friendly, the food always hot, fresh, and authentic. Even when they're busy(and that's like always), the host/hostess are very attentive to people waiting. The Tuesday 2:1 margaritas are a great way to start a week, too

knKN4A_OL4EB3Q4eRNFjbA.text: Outstanding service and food.....period.  Even the chips and salsas are wonderful.  There were three that were installed on the table.  One tomato based, one bean, and perhaps the last tometello based concoction.  All are delightful.  I ordered a meat and cactus sauce meal.  Sounds off the wall but it is to die for.  Read through the menu carefully and you will find it.  Again, outstanding is that the price is reasonable for the service and food.  We had four adults.  Two ordered margaritas and with the food, the bill was under one C note.

_NtsZAFmVSDbnLJDH_-kew.text: Quality Mexican food with a great bartender, Morry!  We share the house special which was a mix of proteins served in a hot clay bowl with a really good sauce. It's their version of fajitas but better.

3GmnvmZ4_OXxleLhCG5OmA.text: My husband and I have moved to Rhodes Ranch in the Southwest area of town and now go to the Tivoli location. Although we miss our waiter Luciano at the Norman Rockwell location LOTS! We have frequented her original location since it first opened and have developed a warm relationship with Leticia...we just love her.  The food at Tivoli is just as delicious and I absolutely love the ambiance. We were there the week she had the soft opening because again for me it's my all time favorite restaurant in the valley for a delicious home cooked meal and great margaritas.

vjwxdIlEQeMhZGvIz5coZA.text: This review was strictly on take out.  We ordered chicken Enchiladas, beef Enchiladas, fish tacos, Carne Asada tacos, beans, rice, and chiveche.   They really packed the take put order perfectly with pans and lids and utensils. Food was perfectly heated when we ate it.  Ill be honest I'm not the most professional Mexican food critic because we have limited selection in Hawaii but truthfully the food was solid and very tasty.  The portions were generous and very filling.  Great place to get take out from for larger parties.   Only thing I wish was better is that for the amount of food we ordered they should have provided more chips and salsa. They only gave us a small sampling of their salsa I felt they should have been more generous with that.  Other than that the good was solid.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Refried beans and Spanish rice
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Enchiladas and ground beef Enchiladas
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada tacos and fish tacos

2HNOS0MQrJ0KPicgA61Hyg.text: Stopped by Leticia's again for a quick eat. We had the Buritto carnisada and split it and we both Loved it. It was BELLA. Beautiful. Of coarse they brought out the chips with 3 different dips with them and they were great. Our quick meal turned out super and we left with another Big Smile on our faces as we have in the past. The staff is always very good and service wonderful. The owner must be a good person as we always come out of here well fed & happy.

ScDY80EPYubH6lgYHAJ5iw.text: I'll start by saying that this used to be my favorite restaurant, since moving to Vegas.  Tonight was a different story!  The $12 greasy "melted cheese" appetizer was not worth the price. Most Mexican restaurants offer a small portion of queso, but we were told this wasn't possible.  The timeliness of our service was also disappointing. What really took the cake, was receiving my meal that apparently came with no sour cream...lettuce...pico...zero, zilch, notta!  I was charged  .50 for asking for a small dressing sized cup of sr cream.  My favorite part of all....was handing my card off to pay our $38 bill, to receive the receipt and my card ran for $43 because "they forgot to add our drinks on before". I'm sorry but you don't run someone's card for an amount other than their receipt shows, without permission! We brought friends in that were visiting from out of state, and raved to them about the food & service, before we were all disappointed. Not sure if we will be back. Leticia may have gotten too big for her britches.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ch-NP4Zoo2iLFEjAh-7cYQ.text: This is the best Mexican food in Vegas, my husband and I come here often and we always have the best service. Come here and try it out. You won't be disappointed

nFiRr1HVwNWZ4N3m9jGJ6g.text: I have been here a couple times and could say the food is good every time. The serving size is definitely a lot for one person! My family always enjoys coming here for the food. Now the service is what makes it three stars. The service is not so great. Last time we had about 3 different waiters and we didn't get checked on at all. Then we had got our food with out any silverware and waited about 10 minutes to get them. This is the only negative thing about this place. However, the food is always great and is the reason why I will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile colorado burrito enchilada style
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile Verde
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchiladas

be-Vk7arpNSqskdxS3tzRg.text: This is a better than your average bear Mexican restaurant.   The food and the service are a few steps above most, but also are the prices. I don't mind paying the extra when the service and the food warrant it and this place has it spot on.   I haven't been there during happy hour, but now that I know they have a good happy hour I am planning to go.

ZnVCWLahIfIi1FWIlCFslA.text: This may have been one of the worst restaurants I've ever been to. The Margarita was horrible, the food was extremely bland. Check it off the list for trying it, won't go back.

Wg4l6bWaSwSAfNQbjCRP5Q.text: This place has been on my radar for awhile. And sad to say but was disappointed. Atmosphere is amazing but everything in between fell through; menus with food still on it, slow service. It almost seemed as there was 1 server for the whole restaurant. I was craving the Mexican corn. Now I've had this before, not here, but I was familiar with the taste. The corn arrived and looked amazing however the corn tasted as if it was sitting in a pot of boiling water. It was soggy and very watery.  The entrees were okay. I didn't order it but had a bite of the grilled shrimp cheese taco which is a must! Unfortunately I'm one of the few that will say I probably won't be returning. Not my favorite for Mexican food.

5wP-PIOCVyukJHpQief1Jw.text: I have been here for both happy hour and regular dining hours. I must say I prefer the happy hour menu- especially with children as the portions are perfectly sized.  I can't say that I've had one thing here I do not like but can tell you to get the happy hour nachos- best $3 ever spent. We have never had a problem with service, cleanliness, etc. Great place to go for a night out with a date or when you don't feel like cooking. Only took one star away as I usually don't mind dim lighting but have had LASIK and now to me it's a tad dark.

VcCJci_4QR0UAYmWPWd1Iw.text: Terrible customer service took over 10 mins to be seated. The restaurant was empty and plenty of seats available . We requested a both of which there were plenty and told we had to wait an additional 5 mins . When we were finally seated over 10mins had passed and we weren't even offered Water or seen by our waitress . We got up and walked out . Sorry but based on that alone I won't be going back .

iWan8QKHfu9cpITEP13rug.text: Love this restaurant!! It's always our favorite to bring our friends and family to! I love that they give you bean dip LOL... Can't wait to celebrate my boyfriends birthday here next week!

gJuppjWArSL4l60txQ-pIg.text: Always have a great experience when we come here, food is always delicious. My husband ordered the Queso tacos like always & I decided on the molcajete with steak & shrimp ... my son had tostadas & they were huge!!! Our waitress was excellent! ( I just can't render her name... it started with a j..)  We made reservation on Yelp & our table was ready when we got there ... we left happy as always & will be returning soon !

2ed-bOWGzxBLQjDnPOk-yg.text: I'm a huge HUGE fan!  I was raised in Southern Colorado, and went to school in Santa Fe, NM.  I know my Mexican food. This is some fantastic food. The flavors are carefully crafted along with exceptional textures to create a symphony of Mexican perfection.  Especially impressive is pretty much any sauce.  I love the Picadillo.  My go to favorite dish is a battered Chile Relleno stuffed with Picadillo and enchilada sauce.  DIVINE!  The combination of the smoky ancho in the enchilada with the rich savory picadillo is wonderful.  My aunt always said you can judge a Mexican restaurant by the refried beans.  Leticia's passes this one with flying colors.  WOW.  chips and salsa is wonderful with 3 different awesome salsas.  And the margaritas...  THE MARGARITAS.  Go for a premium tequila.  You won't be disappointed.   Gracious service and a completely welcome atmosphere.  I had the pleasure of meeting Leticia briefly.  You can tell this is a passion for what she does and creating a great experience is her drive.  She does indeed succeed.  Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.

_SY4hQZatAMsVTu_hvXEAQ.text: Some of the best Mexican food I've had. The cocina is located in a charming shopping center in North West Las Vegas with other eateries, shops, and businesses. The service here was good our server was a delight to talk to, and funny. My only complaint was maybe the service may have been just a tad on the slow side, so if your in a rush keep that in mind, not that I minded cause the chips and sauce just kept coming. When the main course gets to your table the first thing you'll notice is the aroma of cotija cheese, lots of cotija cheese. The taquitos, rice, and beans were wonderful, and to cap this scrumptious meal was a dish of their fried ice cream with chocolate sauce, this was simply incredible. All in all this is a great place for lunch and dinner, I can see this place being very crowded on a Friday or Saturday night so you may want to call ahead. Also I received word that their going to tack on a surcharge for debit or credit card use, so you may want to bring some dollars with you, we'll I hope this helps with your future lunch or dinner plans.

jS70CZp-1E8STneEzWuSpg.text: Been coming here for years and have never been disappointed.   You need to try the Guava Jalapeno Margarita.  It's to die for.

9WMMg8tNH9aYefS27iTJAQ.text: I am a huge fan of Mexican food. I've tried just about every spot in this city and can say this is my absolute most favorite. If it wasn't across the city from me I would be here at least once a week. Awesome staff, and seriously the best Mexican food ever. I highly recommend the shredded beef enchilada with tomatillo sauce. Just writing this review has me wanting to go back already. Totally worth the drive

_V3Otq3v9I183s_D-1hXiw.text: salsa and chips great. Rest of food was prepackaged or microwaved and tasted the same.

KTc-KSpRY1OoI83uPwcCxg.text: Terrible. New Years Eve and the place is a ghost town. More employees than customers. 20 minutes to get tortillas (really its a Mexican restaurant).   The best thing about this restaurant is that I know I'll never set foot in there again.

8Hj4NPkyXbsTGrQdvbaI2w.text: Tried to place an order to go and a big fail.  First, I was placed on hold for over 6 minutes and no one ever picked up the phone to take my order.  I can  understand the wait if I called during peak time but I called at 3:45 pm on Wednesday.  I hung up and called back again.  After being placed on hold again, Jake answered.  He sounded very irritated so I told him to cancel my order and I will go somewhere else.  Don't need an attitude when I'm trying to do business with you.

LSKHLCudQnC37Krha0LJNw.text: We had another great visit last night and brought family from out of town. Even though the restaurant was crazy, busy, our drink glasses were never empty and the food was served hot and super good! We will be back!!

JtcJICfwtWw7JDcaXMpvkg.text: we come here a lot but today will be the last. we kept coming back even though service leaves much to be desired the food is usually outstanding except the last 2 times  today we ordered a 16 oz ribeye and what we were told was an 8 oz lobster tail the maybe 10 oz very thin steak was overcooked and the lobster was maybe 4 oz . even the corn which is usually superb was like mush. I recommend this place to people all the time which I will no longer do. it's too bad I hope they are doing better at Tivoli but I'm not chancing it.

nvbjvRZuPRkvqfKkIk_vtw.text: This was our first time eating here. The customer service was amazing, the wait staff worked as a team taking care of us, our drinks never ran out. The food came out fast, and had great flavor.  The meat was juicy and tender. We will definitely be coming back and telling our friends about this place.

JjiXIUm-emTTv0j-7ykn9A.text: I wish I could say I liked or disliked this restaurant but we sat for 15 min without a waiter talking to us. We got chips and salsa and water, the bus boy was great, but no one came to talk to us. However the people who sat right beside us were taken care of right away.  It is unfortunate as my husband was quite excited to try out this place out.

K7XzTkJnR9qgaiFxFmOHKA.text: So good. So, damn good.  This is, by far, my favorite off-strip restaurant in Vegas. I've had about 2/3 of the menu and everything was perfect. Never a bad dish. Ever.  The Costillitas are so good, you'll want to kiss the chef.  Seriously. Dude. Just, dude. So good.  If you get enchildas, ask for the Tinga with white sauce and thank me later.  The chips and salsa are all handmade and excellent and irresistible.  It makes me sad to think it is not longer just down the street, since our move to Spokane.

pu2oVmI0yEi4VoFeNG53nQ.text: My husband was so excited to take me here. I really do feel bad for him...although we checked the reviews before we came to verify that it would be a good experience. After sitting for an hour and not receiving our food I can not in good conscience rate this establishment more than 1 star.

x3HKIuDYikTGV97EtTu_0A.text: Over the top. Cheese chile relleno with hint of cinnamon, green chile carnitas enchilada, mole cheese enchiladas, amd salsa and chips are to die for. Great ambience and price is right.

knvcZOvJbtgV9jOZeL1hDQ.text: I don't know if Leticias is under new management or just has a new cook but the food quality has gone extremely down. I really hope this was a bad night for them. This was one of my favorite restaurant to bring my family.

ZUZR-45zY_-fqiFvkWOVXg.text: PLEASE THINK TWICE BEFORE EVER VISITING THIS RESTAURANT........AWFUL.....since yelp removed my other review ill get to the point.....32 demerits for this restaurant which was on the news and in the lvrj..... disguisting.....service, slow and horrible....food was luke warm....staff very unfriendly...better places to eat like mcdonalds

JRpaLSQQCfp3ZSY0pS3I8Q.text: Absolutely amazing!! My faves are the quest fundito  and the potato and cheese taquitos. Absolutely love love love the salsa.

pH_l8nDwYnS_8JFfm69JpQ.text: Beautiful building inside and out.  Nice relaxing atmosphere inside.  Service was good and quick.  They serve chips and salsa while you wait for your meal.  They were delicious.  They give you three different homemade salsas.  I loved the green one.  I ordered the carne asada tacos.  The carne came in a bowl filled with sauce. Only thing I didn't like about it.  It was like a stew and hard to pull the meat out to put on the tortilla.  Tortillas were fresh and prices are reasonable. Overall it was a good experience, had a great time  and I'll be back.

1vbNvSmxqTdI1rh_bUSzxA.text: place was a bit dirty in my opinion fruit fly in my water and received a dirty dish to use for our appetizers. probably wont be back, rather drive to Lindo Michoacan which is maybe 5 minutes away best thing about this place was the food runner, he helped us more than our actual server.

g-p3Vlbij5567fAQQlPRnA.text: Absolutely the best in town! Beautiful restaurant and Chef/owner Leticia is top notch! Try the Molcajete with a Plaza Fresca Margarita! (Tamarindo Margarita with a tamarindo wrapped straw!)

ferdR4UGalJPnEzcdsKVSQ.text: I haven't even eaten here yet & at this point, not sure if I want to. I called to make reservations for 7. They don't take reservations (pet peeve #1). A friend called closer to our scheduled dinner time to find out if there was call ahead seating. The snippy person on the other line said "we don't take reservations or call ahead seating. The current wait time is 25-30min & it will get longer the longer you wait and btw we won't seat your party until everyone is here." Well Leticia's you might be loosing out on business from 7 paying customers.

oK3KiCMAMSsTmgB3Y-tpvw.text: Sometimes when I'm craving that mexican food. I'll go here. Few places can beat them. They are a hidden gem

MImf6Zq2pu4pU8uWjWzWIg.text: Today was our first time here! I am so happy we came! Great service, amazing flavors, and full stomachs!  They even took the time to explain the menu!   I will definitely come back! Very authentic with a modern twist!

IR7XOdXgynl1DVdHGbJrXA.text: Good, main course excellent.  However the tortillas are dry, the beans and rice are wrong, definitely not alta california origin.  However i will go back again because it is still the best in Las Vegas.

KYQ16zBo5W9hpr8eYtIOcw.text: I'm normally not on this side of town but I came here with a friend who was swearing by how great the food was and I wasn't disappointed.  I never knew there was a little nook of restaurants in this area but it's a nice area and the restaurant is big and completely Mexican while being interesting.  The bar area also has TV's for watching a game and enjoying a meal if you're so inclined.    When I first sat down I was welcomed with chips that were still warm and toasty along with red and green sauces, and refried beans.  The lunch menu is a nice sampling of the dinner options and served with great proportions to be filling without overwhelming.  I had the Carnitas "Ma Pita" which was pork prepared in a way that I hadn't had since I was back home.  The spanish rice was warm, moist, and spiced with a nice tangy flavor.  The food was authentic and the service was attentive without being annoying and it was great to see a team effort of everyone helping your table and not just those that were assigned.    I will be returning whenever I'm in the area and possibly even drive out there for dinner, and that says something since I normally don't exceed my zip code.

vq108mv9CkEHD911E3XjXg.text: Decided to come here for my wife's birthday dinner and we immediately remembered why we don't come here anymore. We waited for 1 hour before being seated, after being told the wait is 30 min and seeing a ton of people go in front of us who came in after. The service was terrible, one person in our party didn't get her food til 15 minutes after everyone else. And the food is way over priced, a burrito with 3 items in it is 15 and .75 for every additional item and 2 tacos are 13 for just meat and a side of beans and rice! The only bright spot for this place is the chips and salsa. Awesome chips and 2 salsas plus beans. All in all I will not be back just for the chips.

Jc7-sMxE4VdBC1KZzZvodg.text: This place has delicious Mexican food. Love there chips and salsas and beans and rice. The restaurant is Nicely decorated and the service was amazing. Highly recommend coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination plate cheese enchilada with green sauce and chile relleno very delicious!!

Kbxe8RP_rXe1KD8OjUQMvg.text: Sooooo good! The friendliest service and homemade and delicious food. The owner is always out and about visiting with the customers. You can't go without having the Mexican corn on the cob. I don't know how he does it, but any time of year, they serve the most tender white corn with all the delicious street-vendor white sauce and cheese. I sometimes order two of these and soup - they make delish albondigas soup. Great chips and salsa, free of course. Wonderful fajitas and sopapillas too!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fajitas for 2 at Leticia&#39;s are the best in town!!!

euTgL3PzUrOsuxhz_e8dsw.text: Went here with low expectations and it didn't let me down . Bartender was odd to put it nice . If I had a staff member that said is food good or bad I would let then know it isn't cool to put negative thoughts in customers heads . Also shouting out soy sauce is secret ingredient was super lame because that's all I tasted after it was said . Place has potential but needs to get back to basics of customer service.

TcXpxDH3LLljDHFZt0gG3Q.text: For starters the service was great but slow. Waitress was very friendly and the executive chef discounted our overall bill because we waited over 45 minutes for our lunch entrees.  The pop and lemonade tasted dirty. I sent back a total of three drinks and stuck with water. The chips and salsa were decent. I ordered beef and chicken fajitas. Beef tasted like teriyaki and the chicken was dry. Didn't really enjoy the overall taste of the beef and chicken combo. Most likely won't be going back.

0HJkVIE_65jG5d03eM9_Og.text: Love love love this place!!!!  Fantastic service, came from Phoenix to see my brother and we were treated so well here. Food was amazing, presentation was visually pleasing.

lATIpuH_CC663r6YhKLUaw.text: Won't be back, been here a few times and keeps getting worse. Went for lunch today, waiter forget our tortillas with meal. Also asked what kind of meat I want, but they only put cheese ...duh... One entree, the menu description said comes with CILANTRO RICE, but they served with Spanish rice, and we asked about it they said we were wrong and CHARGED US FOR A SIDE OF CILANTRO RICS. We checked the menu on way out to be sure were didn't miss read it, but it did say CILANTRO rice. Instead of arguing we decided it WOULD BE OUR LAST TIME !!!! NEVER AGAIN WILL WE GO THERE.

I3pDMNTRNTfK_zxRNed5rw.text: This place was decent when it first opened but something happened..... I just don't get all the people that eat here and like it.  they can't possibly know real Mexican food.  What a disappointment! DO NOT EAT HERE! The carnitas were bland, the tacos unbelievably salty, the taquitos were so over fried I could just about bite through them and the meat was dry and tasteless.... service was terrible - the waiter brought the wrong food... tell me, does "TAQUITOS" sound like "FAJITAS"???? Then by the time I actually got my taquitos the rest of my party was finished. What was offered to make up for this??? Oh, fried ice cream.. As if any of us wanted anything else fried. We ate outside. The table was filthy - chair were full of food crumbs - it looks like they have never washed the ground with a hose... people are banging into your chair as you eat to walk by...   This is truly THE WORST Mexican food I have ever eaten.... and I have eaten Mexican food in NJ and Hawaii - and even there it wasn't this bad! I don't know where the other people posting have eaten, or what their definition of good Mexican is - but you would do better at Taco Bell.   To add insult to injury, it is WAY over priced.... two street tacos were $13... three burnt, small taquitos also $13... save your time, your money, and your stomach and go elsewhere.  My husband, who has a cast iron stomach got sick and could wait to get home to run to the bathroom. Next day - he is still sick.  Food is certainly not fresh. Not tasty. Not cooked well. Service is sub-par. I honestly don't know how the place is still in business.

-IN4l2u4nlZAdS7GDwVW2A.text: I love me Mexican food! And being Latina and finding great traditional Mexican food is very hard. This place has won my heart with Mexican food! Delicioso !!

zUcgksa3YwashkSTH2Gb1w.text: Went back again about a month after my first visit. I'm starting to see a trend here. Once again the food was great, but service was non existent. I could tell our waiter was busy(only waiter for 6 tables). But, we literally only had our order taken, food brought out and check delivered. Didn't see the waiter but twice. I'm through expecting good service from this place. Not worth another visit.

0yqdO7rymsQsDzxCYdy9mQ.text: So glad we found a mexican restaurant on this side of town!  Was pleasantly surprised...cute shopping center and decor. The place was busy for lunch on Saturday with no waiting time.  The chips and salsa/bean dip were good.... The husband got the Street Tacos (chicken and carnitas) which was excellent served along side beans and rice.  I got the Mexican style Hamburguesa (because we just had mexican the night before!) and this was like a torta, but so tasty!  Not like a regular hamburger and big enough to share!  They have a  great happy hour M-F which I can't wait to try when I'm not pregnant and can enjoy some margaritas!  :)  Can't wait to go back. Fun atmosphere and would love to sit outside next time.

ftw3JUT7jNlsOwUuXXmgJg.text: wow...WOW...W O W!!  this place is fantastic! i was impressed with this mexican food place. the horchata is divine!!! (no rice water powder here) I had a carne asada burrito and that was spectacular, and my husband had the red posole and i couldn't stop eating from his bowl. FIVE stars well deserved. the waiters were very nice too!! its about 12 miles from the strip but if you want some great authentic mexican food come here!

ta3tltGUeED7NU6RnDkUhw.text: Recently moved here from east coast. First time eating here. We had great service and the food was extremely good. Loved the tortillas and salsa. Could barely finish our meals. Will definitely bring our east coasts guests here when they visit.  We will be eating here more and sitting outside as the weather gets warmer.

Wk2oRDlhjRf-mTZhsD_1fA.text: My wife and I have recently become vegan and vegetarian. We weren't sure what we would be able to find at Leticia's, but we saw quickly that the veggies only fajitas would work perfectly. The fajitas were amazing! We ordered one plate with extra veggies and it was super filling! We barely finished it! Highly recommend Leticia's even if you are "off the meat"!

7zKoQYagMyhUNvB5lzExjg.text: This place Sucks.! The carne asada was terrible. They just grilled a piece of top sirloin and called it carne.! The margarita was so water downed that I couldn't even drink it.! Chips were stale and nasty.! F this place..!!!!

oFtS6N6Z8HvT9p14XFmb0A.text: Awesome place cant say enough. Great food, Great Service. I will recommend this place to all my friends and family!

b6vibYkEcKiaFajtipMcvQ.text: Solid mex food and solid drinks, especially if you live in the Northwest Valley.  This is the upscale mexican you are looking for , some would give it 5 stars, but I wouldnt as while its authentic, something is missing, maybe it just the fact they have to produce more, it misses some of that motherly love from a tiajuana street house or a few leaves of cilantro, or maybe its missing a lime.  NOt sure, but its really really good, I would rate the food 5 stars, value 4 stars, location 1 star, unless you live up here in Canada Vegas, and 4 star service, 4 star atmosphere, so 4 stars...If I could give it a half star I would....give it a try...undalay undalay yee ba esa...esa..........OH, by the way, the drinks are 5 star!

l0iIOxpgDKsCxVsM7WQ8fQ.text: The staff has always been on point every time I dine here and has always provided the best service. The food brings back memories for me from when I used to go to a particular restaurant in long beach California when I was a kid and it's nice to know that now I have somewhere in Vegas that has the same type of great atmosphere and amazing food. The fried ice cream is the best I've ever had so far definitely recommend Leticia's for anyone that wants some quality Mexican food. :)

jffmFouZZ_Bo73uUW0XwHA.text: Leticias is simply THE BEST Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas! Previously a big fan of the Michoacan Mexican Restaurants, Leticias raises the bar 10x. Our waiter told us that the owners of Michoacan eat there! You can't go Wrong eating here!!!!

gjUVNDysr3Y3K6DLoVCn6w.text: It's so sad cause this place is in such a beautiful ambiance ,  the atmosphere is wonderful... But the food is horrible...  But u can get a pitcher of margaritas for a good price!  So don't go there if you are looking for good food...

3UTh_ZHsmG3lmhHEBso7wA.text: The service and the food are amazing at this restaurant. My favorite dish so far are the enchiladas. The karaoke on Saturdays is so much fun with my friends and the appetizers are amazing and easy to share with my friends.

4tIod3DFDU1pDzK6qGZbYQ.text: Very good chips when you sit down and order. I had the bacon wrapped shrimp and it was excellent...definitely be back. Nice little neighborhood gathering spot

8WR5Ebsjr6L4wgL0Up_-zw.text: Wow.  Third visit and this place gets better each time.  Very friendly people.  The food was delicious.  Shrimp tacos, goat burrito (yes goat), al pastor street tacos. Everything was seasoned perfectly.  You could taste a hint of pineapple in the al pastor tacos.  The salsas are very good. The avocado salsa had a nice bit of heat/spice.  Great sangria.  Many Mexican beers on tap served ice cold.  A very nice atmosphere. Did I mention friendly and delicious food. Oh, and the best part. VERY REASONABLE PRICES.  We felt like many items were under-priced for the quality and portion. Fabulous!

J1f-1U-ZEGlEn8OX4q87iA.text: Im going to have to agree with the negative reviews that have recently been posted. Went their this morning at 10:45 to beat the crowd and that was about the best thing about our visit. Chips and salsa took very long to arrive along with our extra bowl of bean dip that we had to ask twice for. My wife had the street tacos and I ordered the pozole. Her tacos came out lukewarm and she was very dissatisfied with the taste of rice and beans. My pozole was lukewarm as well when it arrived and i had asked for extra radishes when I had ordered and I received three pieces of a radish, seriously. They gave me about a tablespoon of cilantro and onions for my large bowl of soup, seriously. This is just being down right cheap not to mention that the radishes were dry. Now onto the fact that my water was only refilled once and I had to ask for that to be done. When refilled it had no ice so I was drinking warm water, I could have gotten colder water out of the tap. I honestly hate to post this because we have had good food from them before but it looks like that is a thing of the past. Oh yeah, they also overcharged us on our bill. Pick it up Leticia's or you are going to lose other customers.

9ruoTgg1ta3tAxu1uQX4Dg.text: THE WORST "DINING" EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE!!!   Me and 2 others walked in. The girl at the front of house was unattentive, all over the place, and annoying. We asked for a table, after 10 minutes of her walking around in a circle she brought us to a booth. "Oh you wanted a table?" Not a good start.  Two of us ordered the fried whole tilapia, one ordered the special, a Mexican stew. After an hour of waiting, the waitress came and told us that there was only 1 whole tilapia in the kitchen. Couldn't she have told us that before? I ordered the cod special, instead, since there apparently wasn't enough tilapia.  After 2 total hours of waiting, the food comes out. The stew has burnt beef (black!), the whole fried fish is salty and old, and my other cod special that I ordered was so greasy I couldn't eat it. Our entrees also had this fried potato thing (unpeeled raw potato inside) and "rice casserole", (undercooked white rice mixed with cream cheese and spinach), both were appalling.   After a half-hour of "negotiating" with the manager, he took most of our bill off, and offered us free flan desert. OK flan, nothing special.  Overall, wasted 2 and a half hours, food was disgusting, and we left hungry. I've been here before and it was pretty good, but this was so bad, we are NEVER coming again.

cvdkJHd0Q8ViHEvvryDnSQ.text: My search for the best Mexican food in Las Vegas is over!  Friends introduced us to Leticia's last Saturday and we will be forever grateful to them.  The menu is amazing with a nice balance of traditional and contemporary dishes.  The chips are fresh and very tasty and they are accompanied by a couple of different salsas and a warm bean dip giving everyone something to enjoy.  The house Magurita was reasonably priced and enjoyable to taste.  For my entre' I ordered the beef enchiladas and I thoroughly enjoyed them!  If you order a combo, be sure to ask for the white rice instead of the traditional Mexican rice with tomato sauce.  I have never had anything like it in my life.  It is delicious! Our server was attentive and made sure we were happy throughout our dining experience.  I plan on visiting often.  Leticia's is a treasure!!

Bbshsf3Yr9Ma1zTQUeknsQ.text: We've lived in the neighborhood for a while and have passed Leticia's several times but never stopped in. Now I'm kicking myself for all the wasted time and mediocre Mexican food we've put up with elsewhere.  I was a little worried about how crowded it might be for a Saturday night, but we were able to sit down at the bar without a problem and our wait time for a table was reasonable. The staff were all very friendly and attentive, and it never hurts to have the bartender card you when you're nearly 20 years beyond the drinking age.   The complimentary chips, salsas and bean dip were delicious. The food was good, though the only complaint I can come up with was not being able to find much of the guacamole in the enchilada I ordered. The shredded chicken was extremely tender if not a bit bland, but the lettuce and salsa on the plate were fresh and helped to pick things up a bit. The rice and beans (usually my favorite part of a Mexican dish), did not disappoint.   Unfortunately the portion size was so large that we didn't have room for the fried ice cream we had planned on getting, but that just means we need to go back again soon.

neF4L2I7QSpk1P3K4gu11Q.text: Ordered a family style asada dish. Had two drinks each. Tres leche desert. Bill was less than $40 a person. Also we got a side of fresh queso. Interesting flavor.

EPz4ZvoQP0CxsWnN_ijSIQ.text: I've heard some excellent things about Leticia's, and I finally went to try it out myself. It's a drive that's for sure, so prepare for a roadtrip. The place itself and the area where the restaurant is located are both very cute. It's not a huge place, but the decor is really nice. The bar area does have gaming, and there is a separate restaurant side as well.  We sat down and were immediately brought water, chips, and 3 dip options: bean dip, a smoky mild salsa, and a very cilantro-y smooth guacamole. All were very good, and the chips were fresh. Our server Saul came to take our beverage order (2 Dos Equis), and then disappeared for at least ten minutes, if not 15. When he came back, he had no beer, ran to the bar, came back and said they were out of Dos Equis.... Not okay with that delay, or paying for the Pacifico that I didn't really want. Anyway, the service got a little better from here on out, except that when my mother ordered her chicken enchiladas, he tried to push a different style chicken on her, which was very awkward. I kind of interjected and said no, she's good... Very strange interaction.   I consider myself quite the connoisseur of cheese enchiladas, so of course this is what I ordered. They were very good, not the best I've had, but very good. The beans and rice that came with the enchiladas were great, extremely flavorful. My mom loved her shredded chicken enchiladas, and my dad loved his steak fajitas.  Loved the decor/restaurant itself, liked the food, and was unimpressed with the service.

tOUzxhU6w1wUunDudq353Q.text: Everything was amazing the service is a little slow but gave me and the wife that much needed time to be together. The food was absolutely amazing. And the drinks hit the spot of a random craving. I say A must come to spot

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing the flavor was exactly what I was looking for. Me and the wife shared it and my daughter loved the lobster.

uDTLZlnLxaVwQHisgGq5Qw.text: Slow service. Seriously, getting full on chips because the appetizers are taking so long. Waiting....waiting...waiting. Staff not very visible and it's not that busy in here.  Disappointed.  Just told the kitchen is backed up. Still, 25 min plus wait for apps is not acceptable. It's 2 in the afternoon. Not like we were here during prime lunch hours.

LIpnwrXDaBkNZB7ZcOHbHw.text: Came back because we had such great service the first time. We got seated right away but it took like 10 minutes before we got service and that's because we mentioned something to the bartender. We spent about 45.00 for 2 people. Kind of high to me. Rice was mushy. Next time I will go across the way to Michoan

o5CpSQJGE0xHuVsbNZVZig.text: Since this review was written I have returned to Leticia's and while the food remained delicious, the service is very inconsistent. I've had 5 star service at Leticia's.  Unfortunately, the last time I was there a larger party was seated next to us and we literally did not get any attention from our server again. Someone else dropped our food off at the table and we had to wait several minutes and then chase someone down to get our drinks refilled. Finally, we had to ask a busboy passing by for the check. Even though he had to approach our server in order to get the check, she still did not deliver it to us, apologize for the wait or say goodbye to the table. We were so disappointed.  Although my last experience was extremely bad, we had noticed on previous visits that the service was not always awesome. The failures in service and inconsistency are too much to deal with and I probably won't be returning to Leticia's for some time. I think it is very unfortunate because the food is just so good and we were so excited to find that restaurant nearby. I am updating this review in hopes that the management will realize that great food isn't worth much if it is delivered to the table cold, late and without a drink.

atd8fXmxC0PfY6goMkNjPA.text: This is easily my favorite Mexican restaurant.  I have eaten here so often that this review won't scratch the surface.  Instead, I'll concentrate on the items I have eaten in the recent past: the Molcajete de Mariscos & Pastel de Tres Leches.  Molcajete de Mariscos, served spicy -  Lobster, clams, shrimp, mussels, & fish in a special sauce, white arroz poblano (rice, peppers, & cheese casserole ).  Served in a hot Molcajete (three-legged round bowl, which has been carved out of basalt).  The seafood was all perfectly cooked, the broth was spicy but not too hot.  The broth was flavored of roasted peppers, tomatoes, & seafood broth (not fishy).  The arroz served as a balance to the bold flavors of the broth but very tasty in its own right.  Something that impressed me was the white fish being flaky, the shellfish being tender, not rubbery, and the lobster meat being easy to pull out of tail, but not overcooked.  I highly recommend this dish  Pastel de Tres Leches - A very moist desert cake topped with citrus & whipped cream.  I am not a great lover of cake, but this is sublime.  Moist & flavorful, Leticia also infuses some type of cordial or liquor in the cake.  The flavor is creamy with a mild citrus flavor.  If you're a choc-o-holic, maybe you should look elsewhere, but, I consider this a great desert.  Standard Margarita - Buy them by the pitcher, on the rocks.  They put the ice in your glass and the pitcher remains un-diluted.  Every drink is good with their perfect proportions and better than average tequila.  The Cadillac Margarita is expensive, but excellent.  The only problem I ever have at Leticia's has been service.  Since I am a regular, that typically isn't a problem, so I may not be the best to assess their service.  Regardless, the staff is always warm & friendly with many regulars, and very friendly regulars at the bar.    Of special note: During warmer months on Mondays, street tacos are available in front, on the corner of Norman Rockwell & Farm Road.  Reduced price and, in my opinion, even better flavor.  On Saturday nights, after 8, there is karaoke in the bar area. Gustavo (restaurant partner) typically sings and gently cajoles the regulars into giving it a go. Very fun.   The restaurant itself is very clean and is in the location that was previously Joey's Seafood Only.  Parking is generous with street parking on Norman Rockwell and a well lit parking lot behind the restaurant.  That's all for now!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What 2 Carnitas Street tacos should look like :-P
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres Leches. Huge &amp; tasty...
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles &amp; bloody Mary!

6BCEgpTJefJ7MF5uMP76ig.text: Awesome as always! Me and my family have been eating here for a few years and I'm just getting around to writing a review. Customer Service is top notch. This last time we dined in we had Lucian as our server. He is FANTASTIC! He was very courteous and polite and brought out our daughter's food first so she wasn't starving. He made sure our drinks were always filled and had extensive knowledge of the menu. We ordered the Nachitos Fritas as an appetizer and built our own burritos. Everything was perfect!! We couldn't finish everything so we got the rest of our burritos to go. I have to say it was just as good the second day!

Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own burrito with red sauce
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own burrito

03soDBTA4yVMMYv57VNZHw.text: Love this spot. This is the best mexi in vegas for me. The line out the door is proof. I pass the resteraunt on my way home in the evenings and there are always folks waiting out side. I try to go during off peak hours. The service is always good and I have never had a bad trip.

ocY_hofvkkI8soTEzGVt0w.text: Absolutely my new favorite Mexican food in Las Vegas. Literally everything was fantastic. The house margaritas are awesome the chips and salsa are great and I love that you also get beans. The queso fondito with chorizo is amazing. I had the byo burrito and got shredded beef with beans, rice and cheese inside and the white cream sauce on the outside. The burrito was TO DIE FOR!!! Ahh that white cream sauce is so good. There was a bit of a wait on a Friday night but it was totally worth it. Oh and our waitress was the sweetest lady ever!

BD_JZ9jKtIK8L9fYOoDogQ.text: Homeade mexican food close to my home! Affordable, very good. Place is open until later hours wich is a great choice for late dinner! Friendly staff

SMij2l5WHwiWGml2rPjj0w.text: I'm lovin this place. came here as a recommendation from a close friend and man I was happy I went. First time was with family and the 2nd time for happy hour appetizers. The service staff has always been so sweet and kind. Very attentive and are right on time to fill up our drinks. Never an attitude about getting more chips and three dips, as well. Unlike other places. Food is reasonably priced and AWESOME. I'm also happy with the atmosphere, lightly dimmed and not too loud. We are able to talk at our table to each other and not have to yell. ;)  I will continue to go back and look forward to the great food and service!!

MaQU-pVHMyTOHEs9meEfGA.text: Well I gave Leticias a 2-star, so disappointed.  When they first opened I loved it. Food great.  But went this past weekend with my daughters and when they brought our food, rice/beans were a bit cold but the tacos were pretty warms all our plates.  I noticed the rice and beans was cooked and left for awhile in their pots. I'm a cook I know. So, you need to get your money's worth, my daughter paid for the dinner,  I am teaching her that your paying for this food, don't ever accept what it is.  Your a customer and food needs to be hot and cooked well.   So I asked the waiters about it and they were very understandable did take it back and gave us a whole new hot plate of food.  It looked fresh.  But there are no excuses to ever bring your customer a cold plate. I didn't get that.  That's my point. I hope that when I go there again it doesn't happen.  If it does I will walk out and not come back.  It's a shame because it's really a nice place to enjoy your food and great atmosphere.

wmwhzFWAfzm6wWM1-LFN5g.text: The best tortilla soup you will EVER have! Seriously, even though all of their food is delicious, I go just for soup most of the time.  They also have excellent drinks, a friendly staff, and the ambiance is pretty cool.  Complimentary chips, beans, and two different kinds of salsa is the cherry on top. I recommend this place very strongly!

Ydk65d1bv7pTOysI6DdJHw.text: My husband saw this restaurant on the cooking channel and wanted to try it out! We loved the atmosphere and the staff was great! Everyone was friendly! We went on Valentine's night so it was super packed! Worth the wait!  I am very picky when eating "Albondiga" soup and these were so delicious! My husband had the carne asada plate and he couldn't finish it! Which is a first, since he can eat! The portion was definitely not small!  I tried a Strawberry Jalapeno Margarita and now I am hooked!  We are definitely coming back here when we go back to visit Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Jalapeño Margarita

6C0WTY9He_TGddjj4GW6-g.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.  Food is awesome.  My favorite is the Stuffed Chile Relleno.  Drinks are good as well.  Sangria is top notch!!  You will not be disappointed.

S3h04Pl6KaHNhfIhAqtlJQ.text: For awhile I was loving this place until I consistently started ordering . I called in and ordered the soup to go and instead of someone simply telling me that they are all out they just game me a bowl of soup juice !!! I was so pissed there was literally only residue of the soup contents . My advice if ordering the chicken soup  ask if they have enough .

3tbMlo9l6W89mZY-ZXKOkA.text: Tara is the best margarita maker in town!!  And she's friendly -  Chad also rocks too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j5Cc1FqiNqW3bGZu_9rX2g.text: I have been coming to Leticia's on a consistent basis since they opened. I have always enjoyed the food and consider this to be one of the best Mexican restaurants in the valley.   The food remains good, however I have been noticing a steady decline in the service. Good establishments get busy and Leticia's is no exception. Today we came in for lunch, took a while before anyone came and got our drink order. The waitress was confused on the fish tacos when we said we wanted grilled, she said "okay so soft" as if she was referencing the tortillas. On top of that I never received any drink refills, despite the wait staff telling me they would bring a refill. The service is really disappointing and I hope that it turns around because I really enjoy the food.

DVSdELl9VruBoXABrGJxGA.text: Service and food are always fantastic!  Best guacamole I ever had!   Order it this way... large guacamole, add shrimp and crab, add the abuelo spice.

6pABWMMEqczPzoVNIPR_eg.text: The portions are big and good. One of the best Mexican restaurants in town. Whatever you order in the menu is goin to be good. The prices are good too

u4G7L9TbzUqNSc7vzgC_Sg.text: I love this place. The food is so good, margaritas are on point, micheladas fresh everyday, best thick salsas. Just deliciousness!!

lU31lN3jqcNhzzTpd7x8AQ.text: This place is the bomb!!!!!! i would recommend any and every person in vegas come and get authentic mexican food.... trust me your taste buds will be in heaven!!!!!

Oi16_5j87SUkLQlKceFe4A.text: Great food!! Great margaritas!! The people make you feel like you are at home, and are very polite and welcoming! So nice to find a family atmosphere in such a huge town! A well kept secret!!

kuRkOeatKS5DZH5B_0BNkw.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in town. They have the best sangria with apples in town.

RomBWXiRWtQvA-kdEAXOLw.text: My friends and I had breakfast at Leticia's, and we were very satisfied with the food and customer service. From the moment we walked in, the hostess greeted us and quickly took us to our table. Three salsas and chips were served as complimentary appetizer. The quality and taste of the salsa said a lot about the expectation of the entrees. My friend and I ordered menudo, it wasn't the best I've tasted but it was a hood portion. My girlfriend ordered a wet green burrito, and loved it. Our server was extremely professional and friendly, and so was the rest of the staff. I will definitely be back. :)

I8p15E04aENSRhJNkprM7Q.text: Have I had better mexican food? Yes!  I will start by saying I love the decor on the inside and outside and the bar area looks great.   The waitresses were very friendly and were doing a great job at serving our table of 7. The menu was okay but a bit pricy.   I ordered 2 tamales rice and beans dish for $10.89 my hubby ordered the chicken enchiladas rice and beans for $13.89 + a beer with tax and tip included came to $35, which was a little too high.  The meal itself wasn't too fresh or tasty. My tamale was a little too spicy and no taste, the rice was dry and looked like it was sitting around for hours under a heat lamp. The portion sizes of the sides were just not enough.  In a nutshell I don't mind paying good money for food, but this was definitely not worth it. I'm only giving this joint 3 stars because the service was friendly and the tamale was edible but that's all. If I ever come back I hope this place steps it up a bit.

_ba0k57Lcu6Onln9S8rz2Q.text: Our server Saul was amazing! He has excellent table presence and is passionate about the menu. Fast and friendly service. I would definitely come back with him as my server!

hU68qDRNgU0akmG2i0kBtQ.text: Simply delicioso! Was looking for some authentic flavors with a home-cooked comfort-food feel and we definitely found that here. Chips and salsa to start- the green salsa was so good that we finished off two baskets of chips before our food even came out. Rib eye crispy tacos- comes with 2 for an entree. A little greasy but can be good hang over food. The rib eye was very tender and juicy. Yum all around Chipotle fajita tamales- Definitely get the green sauce. Good vegetarian option- filled with onions, bell peppers, and mushrooms.  OMG Churros! Sinfully sweet and coated with cinnamon sugar. Served with chocolate and caramel dipping sauces on the side. Perfect way to end your Mexican fiesta meal.

ars2QuujfFhbULpoCSCcKQ.text: Best Mexican food in Las Vegas. Love, love, love their enchiladas with green sauce.  Only complaint is I have to wait in line on weekends and I am too much of a diva for that.  Leticia's is the best!!

rjir8E63yT3Pu4Mk4jd8aA.text: I love the 3 complimentary salsas and their chips are awesome, super light and crispy.  We tried their fajitas for 2, which were tasty, but mostly veggies and less meat than the competition.  Guacamole was good, but they don't offer table side preparation.  Their Mexican corn was a fantastic little surprise that I never see on most other menus.  Whatever you do, DO NOT order a bloody mary here.  This was without a doubt the worst bloody mary I've ever ordered.  They politely agreed to swap me out for a beer when I explained the predicament.  I wouldn't be surprised if they get similar requests frequently.  The atmosphere is nice, the decor kinda looks like it used to be a Chili's or something like that.  We visited on a Sunday evening, and the place was hopping and fairly noisy.    Overall, this is a 3.5 star review.  There were some high points such as the salsas and menu variety, but the bloody mary, meat quantity in the fajitas, and no homemade tortillas left more to be desired.

DNvzbEb_YQ-V56dhgAsY8w.text: I can't say enough great things about this place.  I seriously miss it every time I go back home to Atlanta.   Things to Know:  - The Salsa Macha is insanely good if you are into hot - Justin the bartender is great at what he does. - The bean dip is not vegetarian - Chips are so yummm - Open late :-) - You should try the cafe olla - All my clients love this place

fY_XjXGZe-_jLhyrVVuKkA.text: While we waited for 45 minutes for a table, we noticed 5 tables around us that were empty.  This is a sign of poor coordination with the receptionist and the staff. We informed the manager Andy about the condition and promised to address the condition. Ironically the empty table next to us was the table we receiver. Funny! Now for the meal. This place has alway delivered a quality meal and very nice server staff. So ill be back but not during peak hours.

b8nb983BFMfFGylmIVOPPw.text: Would certainly go back!!  We tried: Pork Tamales Chicken Enchiladas with Green Sauce Sopes with Carne Asada  I placed them in order of our preference.  The menu is huge, so we definitely still have much to try.  We went on a Monday early evening and we still had to wait for a table. This place does get packed. As we waited we asked those around us if they had been here before and all of them said yes and raved about it.  During our meal, Leticia walked the floor checking how everyone was doing. That was a nice touch.  All servers were attentive and prompt.

omjqTQOpxYMrGVlRmVhpwA.text: This place is the bees knees! We live not too far away, and coming home from work had alway seen it packed to hilt, so we finally decide to try it out. The verdict? Awesome.  And we've been back a couple times now, with each time as good as the last.  We've been in for breakfast and dinner and have tried a number of the offerings here, and everything is amazing.  I've not had a single dish I've not liked. The quesadillas and guacamole are amazing.  We've done the build your own burritos and enchiladas a few times (both carinatas and carne asada) which were also great.  I've also had an amazing breakfast burrito and the best machaca ever at this spot.  Just great food.  Really good margaritas as well.   Service is always fast, friendly, and efficient. And the food is a good value with huge portions (easily two meals unless you're a REALLY big eater).  I just can't say enough good things about this place.  Try it!  You'll like it!

jz-hScDI7YfKUerD5qbRAA.text: I don't know how to improve on the food or the service. Everyone seems genuinely happy to be there, staff included. The food is amazing. From the chips and three types of salsa that arrives immediately, to the authentic, home cooked food.   Even though we've been there 1/2 dozen times, I'm still surprised how good things are. We continue to try different things, but even a simple dish like the quesadilla with carnitas can be a great meal. It's an appetizer, but it's phenomenal.   We're lucky, we live only a few miles from Leticia's. But I continue to meet people all over Vegas that know the place and drive 20 miles or more to eat there.

7Rk0IsnTe_h44umLgd4Pgg.text: Fantastic restaurant!  BEST Mexican food ever!  Our appetizers and entrees were phenomenal and awesome margaritas too!  Ask for Maria, she's the only "Maria" there, great service and she had great recommendations!  We had the Mexican corn, enchiladas, chile rellanos, and this awesome seafood "pot" filled with clams and Lobster...oh soooo good!   Can't wait to go back!
