Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CqqHKvfg9QDSfK34CBQ2Zw.text: The hostess told us it was a 30 min wait but we were seated after 15.  Very busy place.  Chips and salsa are very good it comes with two salsas and a bean dip.  The Eloite was a little overdone but tasty.  The guacamole was not good.  My husband loved his meal recommended by the waiter tampenqueno something (steak mushrooms onion and bacon).  I ordered a chili relleno stuffed with beef.  It was not battered apparently you have to ask for it to be battered.  I did not like it because it was not battered so the chiii was slimy and it was WAY WAY too much meat under it but the green sauce I asked for instead of the normal ranchero on top was amazing!!  Next time I will try a battered cheese stuffed relleno

c-QGhjCfRTVYwk-HT8dqAA.text: Food and service was amazing.  Ricardo our server was attentive to us during our dining experience.  The Chile Verde was excellent.

YIbAf-PR8owzXCZxBIZ4Dw.text: Dreary experience. Came in before 8pm, had to wait 15 minutes for a table in a near-empty restaurant. We ordered, and waited 45 minutes; we were finally served, with a few dishes ignored and the rest cold. 5 minutes later, bright spotilights came up so that they could start cleaning up.  We asked the speak to the manager, who had the lights lowered slightly. She also comped one drink on a $130+ bill.  Particularly unappetizing was the $29 Molcajete De Mariscos, which was a shallow bowl of gummy overcooked riced with a thin covering of fish and a few shrimps.

T0ekTBlHqSuQloLCfsKtuw.text: Leticia's is definitely my favorite local Mexican restaurant.  They usually prepare consistently good fresh food and the price is hard to beat.  Their carnitas, fish tacos, chile relleno, and buritos are some of the best you will find in the Las Vegas area.  Their chips and salsa are also decent.  The atmosphere is very nice and the decor has a warm and friendly feel.  Although I've occasionally had less than stellar service, it is usually very good.  If you're in the Northwest, chances are good Leticia's will be your choice when it comes to Mexican food.

6uBrum-A57NATQputnqLog.text: Last night I visited for the second time.  The first time, I say the service was horrible and so was the food, but didn't want to give it a bad review off one visit.  Well last night made up for the my first visit.    I came in with a friend and we sat at the bar.  There was only 2 other people up there and the bartender acknowledge us right away and said he would be right with us.  Drinks were served fast and once we figured out want we wanted to eat, our order was taken promptly.  While we were sitting waiting, the bartender was nice and chatting with us.  Definitely makes sitting at the bar a plus.  My friend said he would come back just to sit at the bar and hang out with him.  The food, I ordered carne asada tacos with rice and beans.  The carne asada was so yummy with great flavor.  It only had onions and cilantro on top and that was really all I needed.  My friend had a chicken burrito, enchilada style and after one bite he was all about it.  He cleaned is plate!  I will definitely come back now that I have had better experience!

p6HLKEsxVe6V07XQv85bkg.text: Food is delicious and its authentic Mexican food. Prices are somewhat reasonable, but worth the portions and quality of food. service can be slow on there busy days seems they are short of servers when there needed the most..but I guess its worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids enchilada plate combo! Huge portions.
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build ur burrito! Wet burrito w/pastor/rice/guacamole side of rice/beans. Yummy!

ISxOjnHEPTAesp1C5csJiw.text: Came all the way from California to try her queso tacos.. DELICIOUS... would definitely come again.  Service was great.

APym3UNtuVsY5Aez6aAtyA.text: This place was recommended by one of my neighbors.  We should have gotten a hint as they mostly talked about the drinks... not the food.  Went there with a party of 4.  It was a Wednesday night so it was not busy by our food took a while.  Ordered a stake.  It was ok, but nothing great.  I would not order it again.  My husband got a carne asada burrito.   Much better than my stake.  My daughter got a soup, which was ok as well.  Overall the place is good and the food is ok.  Give it a try!

T3vAWGGs5HHuYYjEGnBpAA.text: Tried this place on a hunch. Why couldn't all  of my gamble's payoff like this. Bartender and wait staff were great. Fajitas and tamales did not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sirloin Fajitas

UP5uiFEe5oDzRENdvakzxg.text: Awesome food! Extremely reasonable prices and huge portions! The staff was very attentive and friendly even though it was extremely busy. I highly recommend trying this place out if you haven't already. You won't be disappointed!

B3ytFb5towj7cXYMq-slSA.text: Tonight I tried something new. The "El Molcajete". It's a tomato, garlic, jalapeno sauce made fresh in a scalding hot lava rock bowl with grilled steak, shrimp and grilled cactus. Served with fajita sides it was spicy and very good. My wife and I could share it easily. If you are like me get the habanero salsa as a side and bump up the spice. Great different meal.

N5LQN4iTTBPZIWpwwQjseg.text: Wow! This place is SO good! We came here for lunch, desiring something different. We are MORE than pleased. Every salsa is authentic and delicious and the entrees are reasonably priced and tasty tasty! We will definitely be back. So happy with the food and service.

2AVrlJcW1u_YOe-hLLd96g.text: I went here last weekend & tried their Cecina A La Tampiquena. It's a thin seared seasoned sirloin with sauteed mushrooms & bacon & Mexican cheese with chilies, onions & red enchilada sauce WITH a side of beans & rice, whew! I thought it'd be weird because of the bacon/cheese BUT OMG sooo good! The sirloin, though thin,  was very flavorful & the chilies gave it a kick! The rice was traditional Mexican rice & the beans pinto but they were seasoned well. It could be I LOVE me some Mexican food or it could be that my waitress was such a sweetheart but I will def be back next month for my bday. I hear they have a tequila club (hmmm lol) as well as karaoke on Saturday for those of us that are brave lol, whatever the case I'm a fan :-)

5r_wsowoLIxJZr0kqxSWDQ.text: This place is not good at all. I spent more time waiting for my check than I did for anything else (over 45 minutes.) The food is tasteless... Definitely not coming back...

W8GgewnrN1LhG_yLhszwHQ.text: great service and amazing food!!  I wish we had more locally owned places like this!

7PRnTPu9mS7O9iv5T-anMg.text: Employees don't always come off as friendly. The bar staff is very arrogant. The seafood enchiladas are amazing but a little pricy.

Lt34lT9br83va-H25OBE6g.text: Best Tacos. Best everything. Love this place! The chips and dip are so good. Enchiladas are good. Street tacos are the best. You have to try this. It is the best food!

QhMvqO77tNV3iefpQsd55w.text: Leticia's rocks!!! Be sure to stop in for Saturday night karaoke, 8:30-close. Also, great fried ice cream!! Love the homemade caramel!!

V6Nyp9Ex2tiK4zT13lKMLw.text: I wanted so bad like another review said to love this place. We drove from Lone Mtn & 5th which is not close. From the outside my Man was like are you serious this place is gonna have canned beans (bcz looks like a americanized unauthentic place w/ 99% non-authentic people going in & out)I'm like the reviews say the owner cooks & it's really a family run spot.  Going inside its decorated how my dream kitchen is (style wise). We were seated in "Lucian's " section. He seems bothered by all of the customers demands & months of unfamiliarity with "mexican" food. I ask what he recommends he points out three of the highest priced plates. I choose the "Quesa Tacos" - I get something saucy w meat inside two cold unfresh corn tortillas - the beans were Eh (maybe canned!)The rice was white rice w green chiles & hot sour cream or something creamy (I dunno) Kids meal had cold limp fries that maybe were fresh cut in house at one point- not tonight- the chicken fingers appeared hand made. My man had a wet burrito it was a good size for 13.00 Chips weren't warm like another review said they would be-they had a cold styrofoam texture & salsa being chipotle not my thing but tasted cool. was 55.00 for 2+kid Tacos & burrito... Burnt out server Rest of staff was nice. BOTTOM LINE: Mar Y Tierra = Authentic non-Americanized w the best salsa & chips & Coctel de Cameron & carne Asada !!! For 35-40$ there we would Eat like Kings(& Reynas)!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips n Chata
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso Tacos
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wet Burrito

FcvB0YhlboAT4nX1d2YEVA.text: its our first time here.. ask for Ricardo to be your server.. hes very attentive :) as for the food it was tasty! had their tamales, chile relyeno and tostada ... the salsa served with their chips were yummm too :)

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S9bgJdBndog7wZrgjvrhcg.text: Try the carnitas, and the margharitas. Say hello to Gus the manager, he's very friendly and might encourage you to karaoke with him.

Py6KhqhWsvSYe8aKRoInWw.text: I have been here multiple times but after tonight I will not be coming back. I tried to call 6 times but the phone was off the hook. When I arrived I told the woman and she look confused, grabbed the phone and goes "I guess I didn't hang up the phone after the last call I picked up". I literally started calling an hour and a half before I wanted to arrive because it was my Fathers birthday so I wouldn't have to wait and I ended up waiting for 20 minutes anyway. She said sorry but she didn't do anything else. When I was finally seated there were no place setting or silverware. I asked for the queso, in which the waiter told us they were out of queso. Seriously, how does a Mexican restaurant run out of queso?! It was honestly just an annoying experience and not how I wanted to celebrate my fathers birthday. The food is good but the service ruined it for me.

WK9U9ECzm5ngUAI0qCHzlA.text: My mom is from Michoacan and Leticia's Cocina is like going home with a culinary twist. It's a testament to how authentic the flavors of each dish is when my own mom makes me take her here when she visits. I usually eat at the bar because the bartenders are charming and attentive. I have tried everything on the menu and never  been disappointed.

9H7x10LPwJNVS5A1iice1A.text: This place is seriously the best. Delicious food, awesome service and adorable decor inside and out!

YF-ZCsQrXFTfSb6g1i5f9Q.text: I got the shrimp hard shell tacos. The food was very filling and tasty. The Sopa de Fideo soup was really good.  My server was friendly.  Definitely worth it and I will return!

0deNu6KQzGZF-aXPb5j1Yw.text: Delish with a lot of unique menu options. Staff was very friendly and the establishment was very attractive

tzdk7NdMUTId3DlcivTJnQ.text: There is no excuse for poor service in a slow restaurant.  I came here with my girlfriend and two kids for lunch on a Saturday.  As we walked in, we noticed two other parties in the dining room; the place was not busy.    We sat down, ordered our food, and waited.....waited....waited....  The entire time the manager (I think) was gabbing with the waitstaff about nothing important, right next to our table.  We were pretty much ignored throughout the meal.  The waitress brought out two scalding hot cups of soup, literally seconds before our entrees arrived.  On top of that, she placed the soups directly in front of our 4 and 5 year old eaters.  Common sense isn't always so common.    I mentioned the poor service to the manager, who just said, "Sorry," and carried on chatting with his waitresses.    The food was bland at best.  I know I"m only giving a little attention to the food here, but probably just as much attention as the cooks gave it in the first place.

kCNHOvI4FMhpjSKdzONO0Q.text: Recommended by a friend, so we yelped it. Good reviews. Food was very good, the chips and 3 different salsa they give is also delish. But we got full on those waiting on or meal to come out. Or waiter was great, very helpful with the menu and explaining what was what and recommended some good dishes. A little pricy but worth it. We'll be back.

a1aRhgT6lVMjaxxgCM8UUg.text: Excellent food, friendly service, affordable prices, close to home. My only complaint was that the Margarita's were a bit weak, very tasty though, just weak IMO.

9GjS_2bGDV8B-oyO7A0OlA.text: The food here is okay, but nothing special. The food tastes okay, but it is expensive for what you get. My favorite part was the chips with salsa and bean dip, which are ironically free when you find in.

CdKc66puC9lVnUi-QPOi2Q.text: I was disappointed when I went this time. The tacos were dry. The waitress kept trying to upsale the menu because the tacos were on special for $1.50, the side salad was $4.50.

9k5Ob3PnDdCr487DwjSpmA.text: This place is amazing! Enchiladas with green sauce a must have! I never wait in line for anything but for this place, I was willing to wait 30 minutes on a busy Friday night! Definitely worth it!

vczRfzXky9DP2tzUTSDGOw.text: Amazing food. The only thing better than the food was the service. Worth the drive from the strip for sure. The seafood enchiladas, best I've ever had! Four of us went, we all took leftovers home, and everyone left full and very happy.

wkDsr0Sy8AkktqFTYa3oXQ.text: Yuck.  Roberto's quality with casino pricing. Service wasn't bad but will definitely pass on eating here again.

MetVC3YRQ71hVJSRoYFnsA.text: Sooooooo good!!!! Reasonably priced, love their street tacos!!!! Great little place to eat with nice ambiance.

VkF_cuGUefjH2Y3pzvcl0w.text: This place is excellent! Best Mexican restaurant in town, amazing street tacos (I recommend the Al Pastor) and great margaritas. Never had a bad experience here, the staff is always prompt and friendly, only downside is they can be very busy around dinner time on the weekends so prepare for at least a 40 minute wait.

pHtRf9PEXJ6hX7mmOyx1sg.text: Amazing food! We live in Henderson and routinely drive out there. Get the quesa tacos with or the El molcajete. I promise you won't be disappointed with either of them. Get a side of the rice casserole too.

uBGKF2b5qqJIouOnpkOz5w.text: Try the Michelada which is the Mexican version of a Bloody Mary. It is good if you're ok with Clamato juice. It's so refreshing on a hot summer day. The chips and bean dip are great. I don't eat a  lot so I think it's great that you can order Tequizas (not the cheesy beer, it's their Mexican street tacos). Reminds me of the tacos I could get when I hopped over to Tijuana when I Iived in SD. They're only about 1.75 each. 3 is enough for me. The carnitas & rib eye tacos are the best. I had the grilled fish tacos but I wasn't a big fan - I didn't like the sauce they put on top of it.   Don't forget to check in onYelp! You ge a free fried ice cream which is delicious! I'm so glad there is a decent authenic Mexican restaurant in Centennial Hills. I think this is the best Mexican restaurant I've tried in Las Vegas.

6b7jHbq8gmHY_fBdRePUSw.text: I had Leticia's for the first time last week and couldn't be happier with the food, the service, the prices and the portions. The burrito was DELICIOUS as was the salsa and guacamole.  My co-worker had the carne asada salad and loved it!  We ordered scores of lunches for a Mexican Fiesta event and Leticia's had the order done on time and correctly.  The food was exceptional, the price was reasonable, the service was superb and the portions were generous!  Thank you Leticia's!  :)

FI6QBcyiFh4MppIZI3R_0Q.text: Excellent food and service! Gotta try this place out ASAP!!!!! You won't be disappointed! :) Claudiu is an amazing server.

4LRBOBpzp7cgJ5s7DyZhuw.text: We went to Leticia's on a Friday night. They were very busy, but we went right to a table. We felt the service was just mediocre (Mario was our waiter). One of our 4 people had to send their food back, it was cold. One person ordered enchiladas in a red sauce and received it with a white sauce. When we told the waiter, the waiter said "Well don't you even want to taste it?" NO! we just want what we ordered to begin with. Their red sauce tastes like a mild mole sauce, which was not all that good. I ordered a taco and it was pretty good, but beans and rice were cold. It was higher priced than most places, which would have been ok, had it been good! We will not go back!!!!!!!!!

r1ZTqz4ky1Qc-8jU2Y1Kpg.text: The service was terrible! We came in on Mother's Day. We arrived at 2:45 and was told it would be a 30 minute wait. No problem, they took my phone number so they could text when the table was ready. We were four with a high chair. I specifically mentioned we'd need a high chair. Around 30 minutes later I received the text our table was ready. This is when it all started to go wrong. The hostess was ready to seat us and then says 'oh you need a high chair'. Apparently the table we were supposed to get would not accomodate a high chair or it would have been in the way. So they would get us another table.  15 minutes later we're still waiting. I took my son to the bathroom and noticed a large party had just left and the staff was pulling apart the 3 tables they had used. I figured that one of those would be for us; the space looked perfect to fit the high chair. But no, they took two of the tables and put them together with some others to seat another large party that had arrived after us! After another 10 minutes they  finally seated us at a two top booth that they added a two top table to. It was squished and awkward. Sitting there for almost 10 minutes we still had not been greeted, had no chips and salsa and no drinks. Finally a busboy brought the chips etc and asked if we wanted something to drink. I tried to order a margarita but he said her could only bring water.    Our server finally showed up asking if we'd been helped yet. He said since no one had helped us he would. He also said it was shift change time, trying to explain, we assumed, about the wait time. However since it was now 4:15 and the place closes at 9 we figured that was bs. We gave him our food and drink order right away.  The drinks were brought out then another 15, 20, 25 minutes goes by with nada. My husband had to go to work soon and we had no idea the experience would be so time consuming. We were literally rising from our seats to leave when the food showed up. The food was good but not spectacular. Between the high prices and the piss poor service we were hoping for something better food wise. At one point my husband talked to the manager about the situation. She was flustered and nervous and simply did not know how to handle the complaint. Over all her attitude was 'oh well', (shrug). No offers to comp anything, not my kid's meal or even my margarita. No attempt whatsoever was made to assuage the situation. After we finished eating we sat and waited some more and then had to ask for our check. We chose to go there because of the good reviews and high stars. But after a closer review I've noticed many other reviewers have had similar complaints. Needless to say, we will not return, we will not recommend, and we will let others know not to bother with this restaurant.

GbGpiSYRIs5ul8fYAlJo_g.text: 3 of us went to celebrate Cinco De Mayo  as Leticia's promoted it stating at 3 PM. Our reservations were for 5PM and we were seated promptly which was terrific. The meals and margaritas were great, but there were no Mariachi/Mexican music to be heard. We saw a Mariachi band outside when we left, but music from the 60's was being played. We were really hoping to get into the celebration, but without the Mariachi/ Mexican music, it was a bummer.

ZhtrcT2Il6qhmiMERY7VIA.text: Incredible service, food and beverages. Might be the Mexican Food I've ever had. Tyler is an incredible bartender. Well done to all!

cZXo6nw8N76FlhXhxoJcVw.text: Seriously. Just stop reading this and go eat at Leticia's.   Blah, blah, blah, recommendations, blah... Are you there yet?   I love it here. I love Leticia. Thank you Leticia. Totally worth the drive to the end of Las Vegas every time I go. If you absolutely cant decide, just get full from the amazing chips and sauces.   Service can be a little "come and go" but I get it, that place is always busy.   By the way, I just saw someone write "Maguritas" Get out of here!!!! You dont deserve to drink one if you spell it that way!   Maguritas....

idAh5ZLsr7Er0UGd1EZOGg.text: Food was very tasty. There's always a bunch of people there so there was a bit of a wait. When we got to our table we didn't have silver ware or napkins till after boh our drink and food orders were put in. We didn't get our chips till then either. It was also slightly hard to communicate to the servers and others at the table because the music was very loud. A member of m group order the soup and he said it came out room temperature. He asked for it to be warned up which I'm sure just involved a microwave. I order the enchilada teqitos  which were very tasty. The child in our group gobbled up his chicken and was super satisfied with his dinner. Still love this place.

PG-Zy_6BY6NnB9Z1cdXw2g.text: We have been coming here for 5 years now and absolutely love it. Food is always great and service as well. Weekends can be quite a wait but worth it. Haven't been disappointed with a single meal.

kwfD7IHg5x0ouvdsGhvPqQ.text: I come here often but never leave a comment nor check in... Well, it's that time. I like to sit in the corner what I call and tell the greeter "the dark side" it's more relaxing. I love the Shrimp Ala Diabla, the Steak Salad (dinner portion of course), carne asada enchilada and I never fail to order the  chicken consome. I eat in different Mexican restaurant but being close to work, I make sure I stop by here before heading home of break for lunch whenever I crave for the taste. Great food, Great Service!!!

NPs3-fMrV8EsvFYeVkNoGw.text: The customer service is great! The server gave excellent suggestions. The carne Asada tacos are very good! The meat was flavorful and tender. The rice was cooked perfectly! That is rare so I was impressed! The beans...however just weren't that good... I even tried to salt them... Still not a fan.  The chips at the beginning are fresh and the bean dip...not that great... The 2 salsas they were ok...I've had better. I mentioned check in on yelp...got a free fried ice cream... Now that was Good! I will definitely return...with friends.

ekiYKJnHOiuZS0onrGAf3g.text: Dang that is some good salsa!  I really like Lindo's but not a huge fan of their salsa.  Really like the salsa at Cabo in Red Rock but their food is just average.  Finally.  I have found a Mexican joint with good food AND good salsa.  Salsa here includes a fire-roasted chipotle salsa, green salsa and bean dip.  Ended up here on a Saturday night.  Pretty crowded, which is always a good sign.  Nice lighting, cute little area.  This is a great date spot.  Our server Luciano was great, service was prompt and most importantly, the food was really good.  Although I ate so much of the salsa that I barely touched my shrimp tacos, they had a spicy creamy chipotle sauce which was awesome.

GhpSyAZ75QBhM8-qpX--_w.text: The food is good, it's a cool place but it's over priced for what it is. In all the times I've been here the food is a pretty poor quality. Most of the menu items are gluten free. (Just specify that you need gluten free) the service is ok. It's an average place. I don't make too much of an effort to come here. It's a cute place but I guess it's not my thing.

ClAxlqglDxUOojAN2sLRhA.text: Went for Happy Hour on a Friday at 3:30 and was told bar area was closed down for now. Sat on dining side and was told by server we would not be able to order happy hour in dining area. Spoke to manager and she was unwilling to accommodate so we left. Will not return

joiw_EkMaz9UKYfUovk98g.text: Being Mexican I believe I have a good idea of what good Mexican food is. This place is really good the flautas where amazing and the beans and rice are authentic only drawbacks are the non traditional chips which are not that good and our server only came around once to check on us. And if your Mexican the lack of real Mexican music might piss you off lol no mariachi, banda or norteno only rock en Espanol from south America, it's like if you go to a bbq joint and there playing Techno it's just not the right music lol

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flautas, tamale

gZYQMP03pfeJ7x_cw_OqFQ.text: I go out for lunch every Tuesday with my mother in law and we usually eat Mexican food because no one in her house will eat it and its her favorite. Lately its been disappointing between poor customer service, messed up orders and flavorless meals so we were THRILLED after deciding to try Leticia's.  The service was great, the food came out quickly and everything tasted fantastic!  This will be our new regular spot. Try the shrimp ceviche. It's the best I've had in Las Vegas.

Z0f9AZwkjEzWRcnMaiLciQ.text: Really enjoyed the food and drinks. The steak fajitas were amazing. The steak was cooked to perfection. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

6O8HE282LNY7lgFt46LRCg.text: Yum!!  Best Mexican food in town.  I love the different enchilada sauces and the Macha appetizer!

sGf1KDC0QeaeGRBc77F3JA.text: Used to love this place but the past few times I've been there I've had some really bad service. I love your food and the restaurant. But there are a few bad seeds in there that need weeded out.

L6H8AI2Zr8fY4R_zIl4Flw.text: Pozole was great! Food is fresh and really good! I had fajitas and hubby had pozole. Both excellent. With that being said, they do nickel and dime you here. This restaurant charges for everything! What really irritated me is they never mention the extra charges until you see the bill! The pozole came with one tiny quarter slice of lime. We asked for extra lime, and was charged. Tortillas are not included with pozole, and you will be charged for them. No refills on horchata either. Also kids meal includes a desert, but if you don't ask for it, they won't offer it.

3Yj0oTCas3VUDXeUfvqDqQ.text: Amazing food! Great service! A party of 9 everyone had something different and no one was disappointed.

-furVyafqkkAwRiVesln1g.text: My favorite Mexican sit down restaurant! Love the chips and salsa and anything I've had there. Excellent service!

XXlAQoxUO480XO8jjBcG_A.text: My kids and I eat here all the time the food is great the drinks are tasty. Usually our service is good. Tonight we had the worst server Gladys. I don't know if she was new or just doesn't know the menu. She brought my daughter the wrong sauce then tried to lie that is was the correct one. We have been dinning there for 3years always order the same thing I guess it changed over night. I guess over night drinks are no longer included in the kids meal. Normally a kids cup of fideo is .50 but today Gladys charged us $3. She forgot to even order my other daughters food.  Initially took 10minutes just to acknowledge we where even sitting there. I know helping a mom with three kids is every servers worst nightmare, but my kids go there often and are well behaved. I hope our next visit will be with a better server.

eS29K2jc67WyyASPz66LrQ.text: Right across the street from the salon I work at (The Parlor) have to say it's the perfect dine in Mexican! I love the chips and dip! And their fish tacos are tasty!

U_glCxgOQivah0AHTJnFTw.text: The food is the bomb! The service is good, and it is quite clean. I highly recommend the Chicken Tortilla Soup as it isn't very spicy and is dynamite. I love their food, but they are so far away from the Green Valley Area. They as well have a bar. Why do they close at 9? I suggest they close somewhere around midnight.

fC8XcKu7qDhE_Qrdk4rkOg.text: I love their tacos and taco salad, and their street tacos are legit too. Ask for their habanero salsa with your pre-meal chips if you like spicy sauces. It's worth the heat in my opinion.

ECpzSH6vBGzQ1uMRcY2Amg.text: The food and service are both outstanding!! The portions are very generous as well. Check in on yelp and let them know you did!  They'll give you a free fried ice cream which is delicious! Definitely new favorite mexican restaurant!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ty94JcJ38UQUKKngek7t1w.text: First time here and definitely will be back soon. Came in during happy hour, Tammy, our server was very nice, Introduced us to the owner, Leticia herself.   All the food we ordered were very good and just perfect. Margarita on the house is the bomb. Check in through yelp to get it free.

RcPaZiGM3ohoy5DJ8UpQiw.text: Tyler was an awesome considerate and super friendly server. When the busser came to the table he was unaware of what the salsa was called that he was serving but was very rude about it. It was like he was upset at us because he didn't speak English. His name was Rosalto. We asked him for To-go boxes and he became annoyed because we asked for one that the taquitos fit in as he brought us a bowl for them. We asked for a cup for my moms tea and he rudely said "you can't put your margarita in there" we said it's for our tea. When he came back he physically reached over the table to grab the cup out of my moms hand, then all a sudden he spoke English. We said it's tea, he then walked away and started muttering words to other servers about us and then stared me down as we walked out the door. If, if I went there again I'd demand another server besides him. He's very bad for your business.

7mhFUVnA6Mmjp4Jfx2j56g.text: The food was awesome, from appetizers to desserts. Atmosphere is nice, and staff is friendly. We'll definitely be back!!

JBpLIxbIV_Y8Ah0yZ90JdQ.text: Food is not that great but the service was good. We ordered the Shrimp Cocktail and it was watered down and flavor just wasn't there. My wife wasn't happy with her meal either. We have heard people rave about this restaurant but we did not see what the hype was about.

r5J9H33X1sFIVSfz2AeJ_g.text: Very nice atmosphere. Very good service. Excellent food. Solid five star for an upscale mexican place with a warn ambiance, neighborhood feel and while the food is a little pricey for mexican, it is worth it.

ubsdfpOM1Ut5mdq6WWM4gw.text: We had a family member ask to hold a small wedding in our backyard (with minimal notice). Not wanting to cook - I contacted Leticia's to price having the event catered. The service was exemplary!!! Leticia provided a quote detailing all of the items and the cost. Keep in mind - this was in less than 48 hours. The food was ready on schedule, the cost was as agreed, there was ample food for the number of people in our party and EVERYTHING was delicious!!! All of our guests complimented the food and asked for the restaurant's information! Excellent job - we will continue to support this wonderful restaurant.

-VHdVxMkCoHYOOBYTnZ8qg.text: I went to this restaurant thinking that this will be like any other Mexican restaurant, boy did they proof me wrong. I ordered the grilled chicken taco and this was the best taco I had ever had

Wv6VYD4sa9jXhGly5ZIPWw.text: Came back to try again.. Eh!! Their happy hour food. Not great and over priced for what you get!! Plus kids meals are way too expensive if you ask me .. Never again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An overpriced kids meal!!!

Dbme456TPAa2U1qg-eRTbA.text: Come for the food. Definitely not the customer service. Came on a busy day expected to wait. Unfortunately we waited way to long for our food, drinks and even utensils; yes utensils. Didn't get offered refills and our food took 40 minutes to come out. The server showed up to drop off the bill only after asking the front desk people if I could please get my bill and boxes to go. We were sat at 4:20 and didn't leave until 6:10 pm not by choice. Like I said great food but the service was horrible. Extremely disappointed with te service and I know I wasn't the only one. A small apology goes a long way.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food is very good. Authentic Mexican cuisine with a Mariachi. The service unfortunately was extremely bad.

bctI6tJm1s_lflYnWB3OjQ.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants! The food is excellent, the coconut margaritas are not always available, but the bartender is always willing to mix one up . What a lovely place!

T5uNI5UF53h7LNPn5P0Wfw.text: Another great find thanks to Yelp. A cute little place with an outdoor patio. We got seated quickly and they had a fairly extensive menu so it was hard to choose. We were here for lunch but it was late so we missed the lunch specials. There were four of us and we had a custom built breakfast burrito, two taco salads (one without the shell) and one seafood soup. The food was hot, prompt, huge and yummy. We were all super happy. Our waiter was fabulous and kept our drinks filled. The free chips, salsa and bean dip were great. We would definitely come back!

mlgEUK_-KodwQPPlEUwEgQ.text: This is one of our favorite places for dinner. The food is always consistent and delicious. Very family friendly.

EX38xj-Fg-4YvWn9idF7aQ.text: Very busy tonight. Food was right on point. Try the puffy chicken tinga tocos. They are marvelous.

jg176-kojy52B2BlGbsK9w.text: Feeling like GOOD Mexican food for dinner I had the idea of eating at Leticia's. We loved it so much the time we ate here before despite the ordeal we went through (see my previous review for details) that I knew it wouldn't be long before I had some of this yummy food in my tummy.  I was so pleased with the "Happy Hour Menu". It runs Mon-Fri from 3-6 pm. You can get margaritas 50% off! They have other food items starting at $2.50. We tried the "Cheese Quesadilla" and "Chorizo Taco". Both were well worth the regular menu price but getting them and just a great discount is just a bonus! They had other things like nachos, toastadas etc.  I tried the "Carnitas & Carne Asada Tacos" tonight and they were just so tasty. The rice that comes with it is good but the beans are the winner. The beans are thick and have great flavor.  The "Fried Ice Cream" is very yummy!  My experience as far as service and the food and restaurant are the same. Excellent.  I wanted to update my review to let others know about the happy hour menu and the quality and consistency of Leticia's.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Fried Ice Cream&#34; @ Leticia&#39;s - 1/22/13
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas &amp; Carne Asada Tacos&#34; @ Leticia&#39;s - 1/22/13
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Carne Asada Chimichanga&#34; @ Leticia&#39;s - 1/22/13

wpOXTxkii2IOa7gjNATUFw.text: Oh my!!! Thee food and service is amazing. I had burritos topped with the best mole and my fried the carnitas. The mole not to sweet and carnitas tender. When back in town definitely coming back.

ALEH9XYRpQSAHEwR1TFYxw.text: It pains me to give Leticia's such a low review because the food is incredible. However the service may not be the best - pretty hit and miss depending on whom you get.  Today, however, closed the deal for me not to give this restaurant my business. We wanted to celebrate a going away party so I called for a reservation for 10. The hostess was ok but from the get go gave me the impression that she was not happy with reserving for a party that size. After putting me on hold and asking the manager she told me that they would have to have a $150 deposit which would be not refunded if I do not cancel at least 2 hours earlier or if at least 75% of my party doesn't show up. That would mean that if 2 people cancel last minute, not only they would get the revenue of 7 people, but they would get an extra $150. Since when are local restaurants turning into airlines??  Regardless I said ok here is my Amex and exp, but then they wanted my security code. Say what??? For a reservation guarantee?  I told them that if they are adamant about getting my code I will take my business elsewhere and their answer was ok, I am sorry.  Too bad, the food was good.

Ltq3F3xwMlT1QM641tg4HQ.text: Really cute spot at Tivoli Village. I thought it was going to be another one of those Lindo Michoacan restaurants. I really wanted to try their famous "queso tacos" since I am such a big cheese fan, however, I found them too expensive. I have to admit, the food was pretty good and flavorful. I got the shrimp empanadas. I thought they were also very tasty, I didn't care for the ground beef that was mixed in. Leticia's has really good lunch specials, too. However, if I had to compare it to other sit-down Mexican restaurants, the others server larger portions. I also would appreciate it if they can update their menu, which I see that there are rather an array of mistakes/consistencies. Overall, I would still come back, mainly because I see potential in the queso tacos which I am still curious about. As far as the service, I'd give it a 10/10. The servers are super friendly and attentive.

8z96mLdJzhd-FmuiXiChkw.text: The ambience is great and the salsa is amazing!   The staff is very attentive.  Amazing food. You can tell they take great care on their food and make it from scratch unlike many places in town.  This is my first time here and it was recommended  to me and it's a great recommendation! I'm coming back soon and also understand there is a new location now too on south rampart    I'm going to check that one out next.   Btw I understand for you Guitar fans that some stars love this place too.  Check out the pictures on the wall as you enter.

RCmnjwx57f7w-hBOFcQ3NA.text: I have been to Leticia's with my extended family several times now, and it has become one of our favorite places to go for dinner. The authentic Mexican food is wonderful, and although they always seem to be busy, we never have to wait long. Take my advice and start your evening with a pitcher of mojitos for the table.

ZHvlvcQ6gVnlhE1GZLn9WA.text: Great food, service, and atmosphere. The food is authentic Mexican wonderfully prepared. The staff is friendly and attentive. Love everything about the place.

SS1ytixLdwf4uGtbqi8x9Q.text: Terribly disappointed in Leticia's tonight. Service was horrible. We were told the wait would be 15 minutes for a table, no problem, we said we will wait at the bar. About 30 minutes later the bartender finally got our drinks to us. Another 10 minutes we noticed tables clearing out and no line at the door. My husband went to the hostess to find out if we could get a table yet. They totally forgot about us! Our server was just as bad and should not be in the food service industry. We tried to give her a pass since she seemed to be in pain and have neck problems. It was difficult getting her to come over for a drink refill or even come back to the table but she was sure busy on her phone. Food was mediocre. Hopefully they were all just having an off night not sure if we will come back. We certainly won't recommend them anymore!

t-ExF_UFp-SW-GV_Mqyftg.text: This place is so good. The beans, and two salsas that come with the chips are AMAZING! I love this place ... but I always eat too much. And its crowded, pretty much all the times I go. The staff are super nice ... I've always had a good experience there, but ... it is ALWAYS crowded.

hhPnXTeQ5cT9WxeT1EADLQ.text: I was really looking forward to trying Leticia's after reading the other Yelp reviews, but our food was not good. There were 3 of us dining and 1 had the Milanese Chicken, which was absolutely horrible and almost inedible. The chicken was pounded so thin and pan seared that it was like a dried piece of chicken jerky.  The carne asada burrito was just okay (Cafe Rio is better and cheaper). I had the Taquito's, the potato and cheese was the only good thing about my dinner, the chicken taquito and the beef were both very dry and the meat was tough. Not including the tip dinner was over $60 (only 1 beer).  I would only go back for the potato and cheese taquitos.

DHz2AvguIOMroHH4FPfSgw.text: I have tried Leticia's numerous times.  Each time I am dissatisfied. I kept going back because they are close to where I live. Finally the other evening I have really had enough bad food. I have sent back a simple burrito because the meat smelled funny.     "Only to be told that it is the broth they cook it in" My food has been cold over and over again. The most recent experience is I was given a incorrect meal after waiting a very long time for it to arrive.  During our wait our water glasses were not filled and we were not given any extra chips. I asked to speak to manager who basically told me that there  would be no charge for my meal but my son's meal was still being charged "$20.00 for a build your own burrito". So I waited for him to eat. It was a horrible experience once again. Anyone considering going to Leticia's please look for another place to go. I am not a one time customer who had a bad experience. I am a returning customer who has always had a bad experience.

FhKEbgeGSCNY6Dg6X9miwA.text: Even though we had to wait for an hour to eat, we came with a group of 8 without reservations...so that's obviously not their problem. It was worth the wait! Chips with a variety of salsas, awesome margaritas, build-your-own burritos, and a friendly, attentive waitress made for a really enjoyable night. Even the hostesses were great. We chatted with them while waiting for a table.  We love this place and are even happier it's in Centennial!

7-jV09aKO4wn8Ej2z50Jvw.text: American gourmet Mexican. Very good! The taco salad is my fave but I've never had something here I didn't like!

0R7_m-E9QGC2b1_M60CMQA.text: This place is Great for Drinks. The food is ok but a bit overpriced.

HbJHMlLCxisUT0q7_x2HiA.text: I got a Groupon for this place and we decided to try it last night. YUM!   We had the Shrimp Cocktail, Seafood Empanadas and the Fish Tacos. The food was excellent. Flavorful and Fresh (Although I didn't eat my rice and beans, so I can't say if they are good or not. My experience with rice and beans is my friends Mexican mother makes the only really good authentic ones.)   The service we had was great, the Margaritas were excellent and decently priced. Overall I really good experience. I would definitely come back.

Kj7ZtVChVcYWajdWSbdmhA.text: Was an alright restaurant, I would return here again, slightly overpriced though. The food quality was good though!

c9jkznWoR2ubRsQN4MaL6Q.text: The food is good, the fajitas are a pass, bland.  My wife and daughter's  dinners were fine.  my problem is the service, we ordered an appetizer and received it with the dinner and I ordered a salad that never showed up.  4 different people were at our table at one time or another and nobody could get it right. Every person thought the other was getting what we ordered,  frustrating. The bill came promptly and he remarked that he took the salad off the bill, like he was going me a favor.

uWHOPQFiOfjaU0-MNMQRBQ.text: Today was my first visit to Leticia's. I have had friends rave about their food so we decided we should try it out. I have eaten a lot of Mexican food. I mean, A LOT. You know when you go somewhere and the food doesn't live up to the hype? This was NOT that kind of place. The food was SO good. I have been let down by many Mexican restaurants, but the flavors here were the bomb. I got the Molcajete which is served in a giant, sizzling bowl with your choice of meat(s), ranchera sauce, grilled cactus, and a side of tortillas, rice, beans, etc. Basically, it's like fajitas. The ranchera was a little spicier than I was expecting, but still delicious. Our server was Mario. He was personable and kept our drinks filled. My only disappointment was that they were out of Mole sauce, which is my favorite and what I originally wanted, but that forced me to branch out and try something new. I will definitely be back!

Ta0eK3HpBfQYmvi11a1Bcg.text: Hit or miss. The last time we went here, we walked out. Food is alright, nothing special. Some servers take pride in their work, but the most recent had an attitude. We downed the chips and salsa waiting for our meal and as we were drinking margaritas wanted to continue to nibble. We asked for more. This was strange as they customarily bring new before you are out... They refused to bring more and basically ignored us. They were not out of chips as they continued to bring them to new tables being sat. I went to the bar to inquire again and was told they would be right out. 5 minutes passed and then we were told our food was almost ready so we didn't need more. What!?! We paid for our margaritas and promptly exited the building.

pCGLuZxRLFI3OWFMQjKnXA.text: Looove this place. Usually there is a long wait but it's totally worth it. The food is amazing. Try the Cadillac margarita. Prices are very reasonable. Love the service. We like to sit outside because its so nice

Tu7HZO_SyQ_KNyvZwZ0_IA.text: In Vegas visiting Family not too far from Leticia's, they said its always busy but had not been in to try it yet.  We hit the strip for the day and came back to their pad badly needing takeout so decided to try it.    We ordered a family patter for 4 and went to pick it up after 20 minutes. We choose Carnitas and Carne Asada from a list of typical favorites (Enchiladas, Taquitos, Tostadas, Chile Relleno, Carne Asada, Carnitas, Flautas, Burrito)  it was all hot and packed up neatly in aluminium catering trays, the meal included plentiful helps of each:  Carnitas, Carne Asada, tortillas, Rice, Beans, Chips, Guacamole, Pico, and two types salsa. All of the food It was outstanding!  Great flavor and all the fixens to go with it.  Plenty of left overs for the next day, we will definitely make it a must stop next time we are in town.   Thanks for the great dinner!

iWLCC6K9a_2q_fztY2JfVw.text: Best Mexican in town. Salsas are to die for and their casserole rice is amazing!!!!

DglL9tWF7-VnnEj6D2fWUA.text: Good Mexican food here. Very good fajitas. Chips come with salsa and a bean dip that is really good. Reasonably priced neighborhood spot that is consistently good with good attentive service.

PACr-Z6wPXxD6bs5ch95sA.text: My husband claims this place to be a 5-star and I believe it's a 4-star, so if they had 4.5, we would choose that.  The food is really authentic and the location is in a super cute area.  They host events around holidays and seem to always be busy.  We would always return for good Mexican food here.  Try anything, it's all good!

8soptUyM2Zr1P-XyiTq9iw.text: My girlfriend and I had a great experience here.  We had a coupon for this place so decided to try it out.  Good:  chips and drinks out right away. Some reviewers say the chips are nothing special but they were delicious. Just salty enough and a little thicker than the standard chips. The salsas were pretty good but the bean dip stood out the most. We also ordered a small guac which was huge and it was so good. You can get a side of jalepenos to mix in yourself.   The horchata was super fresh tasting if you like that. I personally like the less authentic manufactured ones but this was also good.   The service here is great. Our server actually recommended the smaller guac when we were gonna order the large.   Bad:   The rice and beans were not that good, which is the case at most Mexican places. I've had authentic rice and beans an leticias dry flavorless rice was pretty bad. The beans tasted no different from canned retried beans.   While we both enjoyed our entrees, thy were nothing special. I had the fish tacos. The sauce was good but the fish did not taste good. There was too much lettuce and cheese. My girlfriend had beef tamales. Everything was good but the enchilada style sauce.   Overall we enjoyed this place and look forward to go back to try other menu items.

Aa50-hXa9ewlNuBCAx15SA.text: The restaurant sits on the corner of a cute plaza with parking at the front and back.  The outside is very inviting and at night the lights come on and make it very romantic. The inside is filled with great South American decor and the colors are warm and comforting. Try the enchiladas and their tacos. The servers and host were very friendly and courteous too.

0wHYQCDM32Lmh1fqBUZ5kg.text: It's taken my wife and I 2 1/2 months to venture back to Leticia's to give it another try.  The food has always been outstanding, but service had always been an issue.  Not only is the food better than ever, the service was exceptional.  Thank you Tyler for such great service and to Leticia for the awesome food.  You'll see us much more often.

jzGNoFx_GLzHr_pKrrzuZA.text: Leticias has a great happy hour menu. And their regular menu is delicious as well. The carne asada was wonderfully flavored. Loved the grilled corn as well. Guacamole is a great start here.

pipQflQCekILM3ItEPuI1Q.text: Not my type of Mexican food.... Im from Texas and I miss my Tex-Mex so much. This place had no spice or flavor in anything my husband and I tried. We had heard from numerous people that this place was great. I guess their type of great is not our type of great. Still on the hunt for our Mexican food fix in Las Vegas...

qiB1mLNognVjb3byyIUb9Q.text: Went on a whim last night and it was fabulous! Mario was our server and he was phenomenal. Fajitas, mole, and carne asada were our choices and all delish. We started with the Mexican corn and their homemade chips and salsas.   I have not one negative thing to say. It was so so good! Our whole experience was perfect.

0vjn7iyLhoSXl1Up3muDHw.text: So sad. Came to Leticia's, our go-to Mexican restaurant. The food wasn't nearly as good as it was the past few times we've come and the service was lack-luster. Asked the waitress for extra sauce for my wet burrito, because it was pretty dry when it came to the table. Apparently, the waitress forgot because we never got the extra sauce. And to top it all off, our glasses went empty a couple of times and we had to request refills. Disappointing, to say the least:(

8U4vUGj-5fi0rNoIfxvQVg.text: Very good neighborhood place. Authentic food and great margaritas. Very convenient location and access. Chips salsa and bean dip always set the tone for a nice meal. Good value for the price. We have been there about a dozen times and it is consistently good.

SpvHk8e5tqMfU6IQFATNZw.text: Wow, this restaurant has the worst customer service! Came in for lunch around 11:30 and the restaurant was pretty empty. We were a party of two and The "host" told us it would be a minute or so, then another party of two comes in and he goes to seat them right away... It wasn't until I spoke up that he then sat us first. Then to make a really long bad experience short, we waited over an hour for appetizers and then was overcharged! When I pointed it out to the "waitress/bartender" she first tried saying its because I got a filling in my taquitos! Really? Because the menu states choice of filling for $6.89, she then said its a glitch in the register system! Whatever, I'll stick with Viva Mercados!

YzuIrgVyQ2XkCHHPM43a8A.text: Once upon a time I would have given this place at least a 4.5 star rating...   Leticias has lost its luster! On multiple occasions they have been out of simple things like bottled water... or a liquor behind the bar.  Items on the daily menu go unavail for days. I have spent many evenings at the bar plugging money  in the video poker machines and enjoying the company of their amazing bartenders(Justin and Liz) . My husband is a fan of many of their dishes or should I say was a fan until here  recently hes complained that the food isnt the same.  Sadly somethings gone terribly wrong we truly hope the management gets the kitchen back in order otherwise the only reason patrons like us will visit is to say hi to the staff and pray they will have our drink- Not a fan of Mexican gourmet but once upon a time I would have recommended. For now we are in search of good mexican food...  Too bad because we live so so close.

14lM6MPx1sidPKGf3LgFPg.text: Food was good...nothing to rave about but enjoyable nonetheless.  The booth we were seated in was darker than normal....even if it was for "mood" lighting.  Our biggest disappointment was the mediocre service....almost snail-like for a relatively empty establishment.  On the plus side, the chips and salsa was good. R&J

1TBvQPOU6DIZ7w7zu9xsNw.text: Update: I went back to this restaurant and had a much better experience.  When talking with the server, she offered to substitute sauteed veggies for meat in dishes, which opened up the options for me as a vegetarian.  I ordered a very delicious burrito!  We dined outside and enjoyed ourselves.  I imagine that we will be back soon.    Original: I have visited this place twice: once with my husband and once with a large party.  During the first visit, the staff was knowledgeable and helpful.  The server was friendly but didn't have it together with my later visit.  There are no vegetarian entrees on the menu -- you have to create your own if you want to eat without meat.  The people I was with who had meat entrees loved their food.  I did not like their red enchilada sauce.  It tasted terrible and ruined my dish.  The rice and beans were good.  My food was just average.  I would have rather gone to a lower end Mexican restaurant and had more vegetarian options and tastier food.  The server forgot one person's dish completely in our large party.  She asked about it, and the server had forgotten to put it in.  When we got the individual bills, they were all wrong and people's drinks and food were mixed up and not on the right bills.  We ended up just figuring it out amongst ourselves since the server wasn't very competent.

IGwZxvXUkFEXndcudTv04w.text: I'm from Texas and have struggled to find decent Tex-Mex food out here in the wild wild west.  I think this might be the best Mexican food I've had.  Well, there is a place in Wichita Falls, TX, called Casa Manana, which has delicious food (even if it didn't always agree with me the next day), but Leticia's is even better than that place, and never disagrees with me!    Everything at Leticia's is freshly prepared (no canned ingredients, apparently).  It is apparent that the chef/owner cares a great deal about what ends up on our plates.  My husband isn't a huge fan of Mexican food, but he loves Leticia's!  The food is great and in huge portions so I often have the next day's lunch as well.  The drinks are great.  The service is great.  I love this place and can't recommend it enough!   Leticia's es la Bomba!!

TO0Q_BtQNFVRprbZl35QfQ.text: This place is great. The food is amazing. The atmosphere is is really nice. The weather is perfect to sit on the patio.

svontV0gZN3nuO_CXMdSFA.text: I just moved to Las Vegas 3 weeks ago, and have been in dire need of a good Mexican food fix.   Leticia's certainly fit the bill for it!  I had the chile Rellano stuffed with Beef.  It was quite tasty and much what I expect from a good rellano.   The salsas that were brought out with the chips were also quite tasty and the fresh chips were muy bueno!!!    My server Dulce was very pleasant and friendly.   It was quite busy when I got there, but I was seated within 10 minutes.  The staff was all very friendly and pleasant.  I will definitely be trying this place again.

9FjozP-1tjra1fIVGCJV1g.text: Friends recommended this eatery. We got there before the dinner rush and got our name on the list with a wait time of 15 minutes. As we were waiting (only two of us) they kept taking parties of two, three and more and left us waiting. After almost 30 minutes and other folks who came in after us, we left and went to Que Mas. Will not be going back.

Ifb8O4SgAxpUflftYBEJPQ.text: Second review:  I had to give this one another shot due to the carnitas being so good, but this will be my last time going there. Food is good so I can't knock them on that, but the service by Saul is some of the worst. I've been in the restaurant business for over 20 years and this guy might be one of the worst servers I have ever encountered. He is a disgrace to people in the industry. All he does is smile like an idiot to your face, because he is clearly overwhelmed all of the time. He went from a buss boy to a server which was a poor decision on behalf of management, but even worse is that they keep him in a position that he will never succeed at. What makes me most upset about this place is the lack of management or ownership presence. The restaurant appears to always be busy, and it's because it takes and hour and a half for a three top to get entrees only. Pathetic!   They truly need the help of a good consultant to go in and show them how to be operators of their business since it's clear that they are not capable of managing this place themselves. It is currently doing good volume, but if another place in the area opens up that is decent I don't think this place will make it which is sad. The lack of ownership presence on the floor shows they have no respect or appreciation for the customer. Good restauranteurs are involved in their business during peak times so they can evaluate what the business needs to improve on. It's clear they aren't watching their social media reviews which are done by customers taking time out of their busy day to tell them either what they are doing well or what they need to improve on. 7-12-16  Update: After this review was posted the GM emailed me with a response to how things were handled. I appreciate the fact that they take reviews seriously, and the importance of customer feedback. Great job! I had to raise my review from a 1 star to  a four star, because they do have great food and that's the reason most people go out to eat.   First review: I frequent this place a couple times per month because the carnitas are very good.  My last few experiences have been less than stellar. Customer service has fallen off drastically, and there is no management presence so the staff does whatever they want. Nobody has ever come back to ask how everything is and if they can get anything else before they bring the bill. The last time I was in which was yesterday the very inexperienced server rang in both orders incorrectly and when we finally had to track him down it took another 25 minutes to get one carnitas taco. How it takes 25 minutes to put pre cooked meat on a flour tortilla with some onion and cilantro is mind blowing. There was no manager to complain to. It took an hour and a half for two people to eat which makes it clear why it always looks busy in there because they don't turn tables very fast.  GET YOUR SHIT TOGETHER!

phfJQ-9mFs0KuHTfXJ2adQ.text: So far so good! Their complimentary chips and salsa is delicious! There is quite a wait depending on when you arrive. Staff is extremely friendly staff.  The wait for food was quite the wait. We didn't get a highchair which was very much needed because the host sat us on the corner which was busy. The host said it was reserved...there were other highchairs too. We weren't happy about that.  Anyway, overall I say 3/5. Based on food too.  The waiters were wonderful!

K8JarP4VW_MeITmwJm_NqA.text: Very disappointed. Chicken fajitas for two because we stopped eating beef about 6 months ago..it was chicken but it tasted like it was cooked in beef broth with broth on hot plate. We didn't eat it and when we questioned it were we told it was because of the mushrooms?

6_hcsxmWfKTtllLodg9ZgQ.text: Worst Mexican food I've ever had in my life. Extremely OVER PRICED! I like greasy Mexican food, but here it tasted like they poured 5 cups of grease on top of every dish before taking it to the table. On top of all that the service was TERRIBLE! Our server payed attention to all other tables but ours. Took forever to get one simple refill. Idk if he treated us bad because we're a young couple and thought we'd tip bad or what, but that shouldn't matter! You should give EVERYONE AMAZING SERVICE, not just the tables who look rich. Yes I will tell people about this place. But I'll be telling them how bad of an experience I had, and how disgusting the food was!!

QNC1YtSaJPDoloSWUUkoBQ.text: We were there on Saturday July 26,   we were sat down at a booth  and good 15 minutes went by.   No one came.  Then, another family came in and were served right away.  We ask the hostess who can help us. She said just a minute.  She went to the front and 10 minutes went by again and nothing.  Waiters keep ignoring us like we were not there.  Of course, we stood up and ask for the manager. The hostess said she is not in I requested to speak with some one.   The general Manager came out which I assume is the owner. We explained what have happened and she only said I AM SORRY!!!!! as we were leaving.................  POOR POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE.  Also, the restaurant was dirty very dirty.   I would recommended not to go to this restaurant.........................

ywdYZZBujCOm2UCkMfdkEQ.text: What makes a good Mexican restaurant, the chip and margaritas...chips were good.  Margarita barely drinkable, Lady at table next to us had return 3 before they got it right...even the waiter agreed.  When ordering, I was asking him what was on the menu, and we were learning together.  The chile rellenos come with a meat inside that has raisins in it if you don't read the entire description. They do give option for cheese. I had their award winning shrimp dish under the entrees, I think it may have had 3 bay shrimp between the 2 enchiladas (sauce was good) a small scoop of beans and rice,cheese, chili "casserole" for the rice which would have been good except it was cold. We were seated  at 6:15, served barely edible food around 7:25, and finally got our bill and out of there at 8:25.  For what you get, way over-priced.  The waiter was entertaining and service was good.  Think he and busboy were scared to come back to the table after a while.  Recommend waiting until every one knows menu and how to cook it.

27pedW54GeujP71gttfpGg.text: I would have given 5 stars because the Service, Food and Drinks were great! But....the end of our dining experience was very uncomfortable. We are new to the area and found this restaurant on Yelp, so we thought we would try it out. Service was wonderful, Margaritas were tasty and they had a wonderful Happy Hour Deal, but we did not realize what time the restaurant closed. So towards the end of our meal these Bright lights from the bar came on that was very uncomfortable. There was a man working behind the bar and we joked with him "do the bright lights mean last call?" He totally ignored us so we finished our meal, settled our bill, and as we were leaving we asked that gentleman "what time do you close?" He replied so RUDELY "NINE!" So Rude! Made us feel so uncomfortable to the point I don't know if we would ever go back.

lc3bOD5cqR0cA9NOhfFWGQ.text: The ambiance is probably my favorite aspect of Leticia's. This place has been on my radar for awhile but I simply don't find myself in this area of town very often. It's located on a cool little street that I didn't know existed. It has a nice atmosphere and I bet it would be a neat place to take a stroll at night.   The service was just average, even a bit slow at times. Nice enough but it took longer than expected for condiments and few other items to show up at our table after the food arrived. I had the empanada lunch special with grilled shrimp. At $9 it was a reasonable portion, served with rice and beans. It was crazy heavy on the onions. I like onion for sure, but I couldn't taste anything else. The onion overwhelmed all the other flavors in the dish. Rice and beans were pretty standard, nothing to brag about.   I also tried the shrimp a la diabla. It was much better than my own meal. Nice and spicy with a good amount of tiger prawns. I didn't try a margarita, perhaps it's the star of the show? With all the good reviews and the cool atmosphere I'll come back next time I'm in the area. I'd like to try the happy hour or dinner and have a few other menu items. This spot seems to have lots of potential. I just won't do the empanada on my next go.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanada filled with grilled shrimp. Served with rice and beans. Off the lunch menu.
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp a la diabla. Spicy.

1112zgt-1G7ifrjvWNpwbA.text: I met a girlfriend for a 'let's catch up lunch" and was lucky that we both agreed on this place.  Service was friendly. It took us a little bit to order because we were chatting and I was getting my son situated and the waitress kept coming over to check on us to see if we were ready to order. A little more time in between would have been better. A good waiter(ess) should be able to judge their table and know how often is too much.  We started with guacamole and it was alright. My girlfriend had raved on and on about it so when we got it, she wasn't that far off.  I went with a chicken finger meal for my son. The chicken fingers were made fresh with their own batter. They came out hot, fresh and crispy with plenty of french fries.  I went with a fish taco and rice. There was plenty of fish on my tacos and they were super delish and yummy. I was really surprised by how much I loved them.   My girlfriend ordered a chimichanga which she shared and boy oh boy, was that sucker huge. It was filled with lots of meat and cheese.   Overall, I had a good experience and definitely need to make my way back soon.  Perfect little spot. I wish I lived closer.

62n9CGV7O2m1tyG882fmqA.text: Great food, nice atmosphere, we always enjoy the same waiter. The people at the desk when you arrive are the worst, we always say good thing we like food, because the service at the desk is so bad you would never go back.

VMKLzCmH5YKLYig0IsD3uw.text: Hours say closed at 10:30pm Sat....I'm here for a margarita at 10:04, no intention of ordering food, but they have the closed sign up. Don't False advertise hours.

0fUBHBF_cTOLUOLqUlfbUw.text: Go here for the blended margaritas only. Don't go for good customer service or good enchiladas. You won't find.

zJlTzHmxwZW-2jd23fUIrQ.text: Another disaster!!! The wait time for Togo over 45 go wait time. Order placed at 738 as I write this review I still have not received my order and it's 805. When I arrived I was told it would be about another 20 mins of wait time. I sat and waited patiently. After about 25 mins of waiting I again asked how much longer I was told they are backed up and it would be another 20 mins maybe more she wasn't sure. I then said well how come I could not get an honest time quote on the wait time for food I was told at that point that next time I'll just say an hour by a blond woman expediting the food. I think they said her name was Corey RUDE I've been here several times and it's pretty much always the same deal. I feel that they don't care about their grubhub/ Togo orders and are more focused on the restaurant food coming out. I find it hard to believe that it would take so long to make a bowl of soup and an order of enchiladas. I would stay away from this places Togo and quite possibly the entire restaurant. Good luck

w7tdnTxgSraIF5cobhC9Yg.text: Visiting from out of town and came here and loved it! The staff was very friendly, attentive and accommodating. The atmosphere was comfortable and the service was great. The food was all made to order, made fresh and delicious!! Would definitely recommend this place to everyone.

ykqkNUVr5MxJwzLm9ZaOqg.text: So, this is just a review of the meal I had. I was a lazy ass and had postmates bring it to me (insert Jabba the Hutt laughter) So, while I've heard great things about this place, I have only eaten their food at home.         We were NOT disappointed. The food arrived and was brought to me where I could chow down in my pajamas like the fancy lady I am. I had the beef taquitos, and they were delicious. As well as the chicken fajitas which were amazing, their homemade tortillas were perfection. There was plenty of pico and guac to go around, they don't skimp on the sauces. I also had their chicharrones (which weren't my favorite, but that was my fault for not reading the description better. When I went back and re-read I realized I had made a mistake, a hunger-crazed mistake.)         All in all we really enjoyed the food and can't wait to go to the actual restaurant to get some more. As soon as I stop being lazy.

ypuY6fLg4NMZ3VyP7yORUA.text: Great service even though they were busy. Great atmosphere. Adorable patio with colorful lights. Tortilla chips were amazing and served with beans which is always a plus. We ordered the carne asada plate for two and it was very good and portion size was appropriate without being too much. Two of us ate for less than $40. Large dessert selection for a mexican restaurant...too bad i was too full to try any.

xMI3HL8oQGOH4lKEUcvEsw.text: Overpriced. Other than that, it was good. I come from Southern California where Mexican food is amazing. Sooo...maybe it's not entirely fair to judge. Las Vegas just doesn't know good Mexican food unfortunately.

ATKiiI4KATI4k3TzxKsmLw.text: Had to get by this place to see what the buzz was truly about. I was not disappointed, from the warm, prompt greeting upon entrance to the restaurant.. next were the fresh chips n salsa/green, tomatillo base salsa and another rojo sauce tasted; fire roasted and beans w a hint of chorizo mixed in for flavor arriving shortly after sitting down and getting situated..wow, were already off to an excellent start.. The flavor of the meat and veggies was really good with the vegetables still having a slightly crisp texture and not mushy as sometimes they can get when not done right.. definitely be back to try more items from the elaborate menu!

Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajitas
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tortilla soup!

2CVyABjbSsFoEvpAuZD18g.text: I had heard about Leticia's and had driven past it a few times while doing other things. When the Mrs. and I were discussing lunch plans on a Sunday afternoon, mexican food was mentioned and we were off to "that mexican place right down the street." The atmosphere was great and we were greeted immediately by a friendly hostess. We were seated in an area near, but away from, the bar. Chips were on the table almost simulatneoulsy with us sitting down with three different types of "dip" to induldge in. The bean dip was outstanding. Great flavor with whole pinto beans, along with a mixture of the standard consistency of bean dip. The bean dip was accompanied by a red sauce and a green tomatillo sauce. Both were very good and full of flavor.  We ordered their mexican style corn as an appetizer. Corn on the cob, grilled to perfection and covered with crumbled bits of cotija cheese, melted butter and thick creamy mexican cream. This is a must have. I would have been satisfied just powering through these for lunch. I chose carne asada tacos for the entree. You have the option of hard, soft or "puffy" tortillas. The waitress was more than happy to allow me a different type of tortilla on each taco. I opted for soft and "puffy." Both were great and I would describe the "puffy" as kind of like the torilla bowl you would expect to get a taco salad in. The carne asada was thee best I have had in Vegas. It was tender and juicy with plenty of spice and flavor.  The Mrs. chose the "hamburgesa." You may be asking yourself "why would she order a hamburger at a mexican food joint?" One bite and you just might say "this is the best hamburgesa I've ever had." I have had hamburgers at mexican restaurants before that are obviously just on the menu to satisfy someone who didn't want mexican but went along with the crowd. or was coerced by family or friends. This was anything other than your standard hamburger. The patty was handmade and seasoned to perfection. It comes on a torta style bun, complete with tomato, bacon and avocado. The french fries were crinkle style and mighty tasty.   The menu says if you check-in on Yelp and show the waiter/waitress, you will get a free dessert. We couldn't take advantage of this, as we were stuffed and in the beginning stages of our food comas. Although nobody was seated at the bar yet, it did look like pretty cool place to hang out, catch a game on the TV and enjoy your favorite libation.  I highly recommend this place and will definitely be back to work my way through a menu that includes "Baja Style Fish Tacos", "Rib Eye Tacos" and "Carne Asada Nachos."

euk5EP1_t_lMKiJXFNf3Jw.text: This is our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! Any chance we get we go here for dinner. The food has so much flavor and we have never been disappointed in any dish we have tried!

y6xmBdPC-mbIdF5bBX-0Sw.text: Super bomb Mexican food. Mole is on another level, if you come here, you have to get the mole that comes in a bowl and tortillas and beans and rice!

Nfw4gyiQdE9sd7imI2mH8A.text: Just saw the report on channel 13 about them receiving a "C" health grade from multiple food handling violations.   We went there a few months ago when we first moved into the area. There were multiple great reviews so we were looking forward to trying it out.   The vibe we got coming in set the tone. We did not feel welcome. Our service felt like they thought we were a waste of time, certainly not as a guest.   We asked for one slight change to a menu item and that was flatly refused.   Asked for some more chips and they took forever to do that, and tossed at us.   Finally got our food, and it was pretty tasteless.   The TV report saying they hid the "C" rating card, pretty much reflects my experience with them.   The food and service were enough for us never trying it again. The volume of health violations are the capper.

uDP29u_3apomU8hnE2Aujw.text: I just adorable this place. Hands down one of the best places for their rib eye tacos. I usually get al a carte cooked to your liking it's delicious and you could thank me later. You really can't go with their menu. I've also tried the sopa de consome (chicken and rice broth soup with onions, cilantro and jalapenos on the side with a mini quesadilla made with fresh cheese) I give it two thumbs up but I wish it was just a little warmer.   I usually sit in the bar and the staff is attentive it only seating 10 and all but I usually play and always leave winning. Can't beat that.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Way to start my 3 day weekend at Leticia&#39;s

5VOXKVzfdK_dwWPKkiI3gg.text: Went there for dinner and my husband and I got the fajitas for two with chicken, steak and shrimp. My husband ordered a margarita and he said it was good. The fajitas were good but I really was craving some chips and queso so I ordered the queso fundido but it was just a couple of melted cheeses in a skillet so it wasn't exactly what I was hoping for and quite overpriced for $10. All in all we will definitely come back but are still on the hunt for a restaurant in the area with some delicious queso dip.

ONBaIdoIxOB4jGNGNmgZXw.text: This is a great place to try in the northwest part of town. Street corn is good as well as the quesa tacos!

AbvSvmhNvbjxMyREW5PVow.text: After hearing so many positive reviews from friends about how amazing the food was, we decided to give it a try. The outside is absolutely adorable and looks like a welcoming place to dine. The inside isn't huge but it's cute. I liked that you can watch them make tortillas!   We sat down and browsed the menu, everything sounded yummy. It took 15 mins before anyone came over to take our drink order. They brought chips and 3 different salsas! The salsa verde was amazing!!!!! That was my all time favorite, right amount of spice but tons of flavor!! The red salsa was also yummy but I am partial to the verde salsa! Finally a busboy took our drink order and then 10 mins later our waiter came by to take our order.   I decided to give the lunch combo a try which was an enchilada, taco and a bowl of fideo soup. I ordered a cheese enchilada and a chicken taco. They give you the option of red or green enchilada sauce. Everything came and looked amazing and smelled even better. Sadly that was not the case. My enchilada was warm, not hot,so you didn't get that yummy, cheesy feel when you cut into it. The red sauce was spicy which I didn't mind but it had a grainy type feel to it which was a big turn off. The chicken taco was AMAZING though. The tortilla was fried perfectly, the chicken was tender, the lettuce had a nice crunch. Just all around yummy! I loved that they didn't smash the beans for the refried beans, it was yummy with the whole pinto beans. The rice was also really good! They had the best fried ice cream also! Omg weakness for me is fried ice cream!   Would I come back? Probably but I will order something different except for the fried ice cream because that was heaven!!

Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u4sCW0lwAamF5ehDSP-e2w.text: We came to try Leticia's for the first time today. It looks so beautiful from the outside so we looked it up on yelp and it has great reviews. So we decided to try it.   Miguel was our waiter, we was very friendly and outgoing. He was overwhelmed with the dining area because it seems that he was the only waiter there.  We were the very first customers to arrive today and once more ppl arrived it was almost impossible to leave. We waited 15 minutes before we were able to catch Miguel to get our check. Someone else picked our plates up 15 minutes prior to us being able to get the check.   Food wasn't all that great, everything had a smoky flavor. My carne asada was super dry and was hardly warm, the taste was smoky and salty. The rice was delicious soft and fluffy but beans were salty.   Chips were good but also very salty. The verde salsa is tasty but has a lot of cilantro in it. The red salsa was very smoky as well. The bean dip was good but wasn't all that hot.   The atmosphere was comfortable and the decorations were beautiful. The facility is very clean considering we found cockroaches outside.
