R2O1U9hpWBGsR_nkbBGlhA.text: Went for a very early Lunch on Sunday( 10:30AM). Being seated close to the bar since not to many people was in the restaurant yet.  The buss boy was right away to the table and bring some complimentary chips and 3 different salsa. That was a great start since the salsa and the chips were delicious.  The server was the Bartender "Morri". He was very nice and definitely acted like a bartender not a server. I usually eat alone and love to eat the bar since bartender are not use to serve food and are always happy to get a larger tip than the couple bucks for cocktail they get. Unfortunately this time it looks like Morri had not idea about food or the menu. When I inquiry about vegetarian or vegan, he had no idea what I was talking about and offer me some shrimp and chicken items. After looking at the menu I decided to go for the "Spinach and Mushrooms Enchilada $15 (add Veggies for $2). The dish was excellent! I am not sure why I had some Veggies since they were almost inexistent in the enchiladas.But one more time it was absolutely delicious and I will not hesitate to come back to have it again. Just for info, I leave close by to the one in Tivoli village and I choose to drive 16 miles due to the review on Yelp.  I am sure Morri is an excellent Bartender but if management decide to give him some table, maybe they need to train him especially if he is going to type the "add veggie button" at 2.89 instead of $2.

The food was excellent and very authentic, the portions are absolutely huge, the attached photo is of their gourmet tacos, to die for!!  If you want to amazing Mexican food in Las Vegas this is one place you have to go to!

faoShXakVOjDd1gwy00DLQ.text: Very impressed! It's a little pricey but they give you large portions and the food is good enough to be worth it.  Next time we will probably share.  My husband had the carnitas. It was so yum!! So moist and flavorful. We got the appetizer cochinita. That was our first time having it and we fell in love with it. So good!! Service was good. They kept up on the drinks. Impressed. I had the enchiladas they were not dry, very good. When you are seated they give you warm chips and beans and salsa - again it was all so good!!

qeWf_ISntjjHD8xJzBCl2A.text: My sister made reservations for my brother in-law's surprise birthday party at Leticia's as it was close to their house and he had wanted to check it out.  They won't sit you until most of your party is there, which is fine, because everyone showed up early so that we could "surprise" my brother in law.  The waitstaff was very attentive and patient while we waited.  They made sure we had enough chips, salsa, and drinks while we waited.    Our waiter was very professional and the other guys helping him were very courteous and made sure we had everything we needed.  Food was delivered in a timely manner and they did a nice job singing to my brother in law for his birthday.  The food was just ok.  The chips and salsa were good.  I did like that they gave you three choices of salsa.  Hubby and I shared some albodigas soup.  It was ok.  Not a lot of veggies, but a pretty decent amount of meatballs.  I ordered the carne asada which was really thin and a little tough to cut.  I'm glad it came with pico, quac, and half a jalapeno.  The rice and beans were ok, but I've had better.  The tortillas were good, but not the best I've ever had.    Overall I think the service is outstanding, but the food is just ok.  I think it's a great if you are craving decent Mexican food and you are in this part of town, unfortunately hubby and I don't come this far north, so not sure how often we would be back.

xpdBkN5NGlvz5A7Mg4UCMQ.text: It's very off putting to see a restaurant with the volume of clientele be so petty to charge 3% for credit card transactions. Most people don't carry cash in a regular basis.  Especially when they don't know how much their bill might be.   I own a small business as well. Yes, we do charge a convenience fee for credit card payment. But our business transactions in 1 months probably doesn't even come close to their daily charges. Unfortunately for small businesses who have very little profit, it's necessary. But for the volume this restaurant does daily, is just petty. I'm quite certain their wholesale cost isn't $15 for the ingredients. There's plenty of profit from the food to cover it.   Since we never carry cash in us, we won't be back for long waits and greed.

XUHAs4v_KEnGSyw3eb1dAw.text: Servers are awesome. You feel welcomed and the atmosphere in general is great. Food is tasteful and have varieties of food to choose from. Portions are enough to make you full and satisfied for the day, hoping you have enough for desserts. . .   Love visiting and eating here whenever I get the chance to drive near the area. Best place for a quick-lunch or dinner.  Thank you, Leticia's Mexican Cocina for your authentic cuisine and customer service.

ZBriSkb-DlSGYBtK-QL2Fg.text: Food was "good" nothing special or to die for. It was dark and not very open feeling inside. Good size drinks for price. Street corns topping were perfect and so right- just wish the corn was a little better (could be the season or a bad ear picked). Tortilla soup was different but good. Fresh chunks of cheese and avocado in it. Chicken chucks were great too (not chewy or over done). Meal came w free chips and 3 sauces. Sadly the "Salas" were just ehhhhha?! The green one takes like chewing on a pine tree... oddly! The bean dip was great!!  I used the coupon yelp gave for a free margarita and they still charged me (manager did fix but upsetting I had to point out the error). Waitress was the best thing about the place- pleasant smile and very attentive.  Over all place was clean, service was good, food was fast to the table, just felt dark and very unwelcoming.

xLAmse7WLRCzN29BOWut1g.text: I really hate to leave bad reviews. I only leave them when my experience has been very negative. And what makes it worse is that I wanted to love this place.  If you're like me, you've lived in places where there is REALLY good Mexican food. You've tried to find it in Vegas and failed.   I'm always optimistic about trying new Mexican food, especially when there are good reviews. Leticia's is super cute, and it was super busy this Friday evening. I was excited and, like I said, I wanted to love it.  The wait was 30 minutes, which was fine. The hostesses were actually a bit ahead of schedule, so I was pleased initially. The problems began when we were seated. It took 10 minutes for our server to come over. It took another 5 or more to get beverages. The iced tea was so bad (it's that taste you get when they need to clean their iced tea maker - kind of briney or something) that I sent it back. And that took forever...  I had to flag the server down to order, as we had been waiting about 20 minutes just to get our order placed. When the food arrived, we were disappointed. The flavors were just "meh," and the tortillas on the enchiladas were so hard that they could not be cut with a fork. I will say that the chips and salsas were decent, though.  I SO wanted to find something good about Leticia's that I ordered dessert. Flan. One of my faves. I LOVE flan when it's done right. Unfortunately, this was not done right. It was thick, gluey, and not very flavorful. Good flan should have a creamy texture to it and not an overpowering sauce to cover up the weak taste.  Even after all of this, I would not have been compelled to write a negative review. I simply wouldn't have returned. It's what happened next that put me over the edge. The server brought the check for something like $38.43. Great, perfect. I gave him my card, and he brought it back with a charge of something like $39.68. It wasn't a big deal, but I did point out the discrepancy. The server then tells me that they are adding a 3% surcharge to credit or debit cards.  This 3% charge was not disclosed to me at any time. Had it been, I could have paid cash. I actually had cash on me for once! I think it should have been disclosed prior to the 30 minute wait time quote so I could have made an informed decision as to whether I wanted to patronize this establishment. Rinky-dink retailers and restaurants that can't manage their overhead and/or profitability do that sort of thing. I thought this was a REAL restaurant! But the main issue is that I didn't understand this would happen. To bring the charge slip back with a different amount than the bill is unacceptable in my world.  I ended up talking with the manager, who blamed it on their POS system (and this isn't True, folks - that was a dishonest move). He also brought over a table tent that said you get a 3% discount if you pay cash. Conveniently, our table did not have this tent until he scrounged it up. Did you notice what I said, by the way? The table tent, which I photographed, said a 3% discount was offered for cash payments. They actually charged me an additional 3%. That's not what the table tent said...  Like I said, if it had been just bad food and service, I would have written it off and never gone back. But the dishonesty and non-disclosure put this place square into the bad review category. If the food had been as good as I was expecting, I would have probably overlooked the undisclosed 3% issue. But all together, yikes. This is a place to avoid.  Incidentally, I tried the newer location at Tivoli Village (if it's even still there) shortly after it opened. I wasn't crazy about the food there, either - though the service was great. I thought that perhaps the original location would be better. I couldn't have been more wrong.  Leticia's is a cute place where people seem to have a lot of fun. There's tons of potential. I hope it gets good management and a customer forward approach someday. Add some decent food on top of that, and you'd have a huge winner.

iWRk8Er0MTGIFtniy5BA0w.text: My new favorite Mexican Cantina! Went to Mexico and had amazing tacos there. So good my family and I ha dreamed about them since. Tried finding a place in Vegas that could do them, after trying three places in town we finally succeeded. They have a great happy hour menu $5 per item. The quesadilla here is thick and taste amazing! Truly authentic!

wExClve6oXHJWzwkbt90-w.text: Leticia's is a hoppin' place on a Friday night. We came in with 7 and a baby and the only hiccup of the night was the fact that the front desk miscalculated another large party so it took us a little longer to get sat. Our server was attentive and the food came out quickly. Pricing was reasonable and the portion sizes were generous. I got the street tacos with shrimp and it came with a decent amount of shrimp and a lot of flavor. Overall my experience was good and I would come back and try out some of their other menu items.

dFgTTSX7ki8av0pAd2wHzQ.text: Made a reservation for 5 @ 6:30.  Walked in at 6:25 and was told there wouldn't be a seat for 20-30 min.  As we looked around and saw an open booth.   Unimpressed with the hostess... and a terrible first impression for a first visit.

eJT8m_dSg2nIqnO873kwQg.text: We had been enjoying getting our Mexican fill, here, for a couple of years, now, and would have been giving 5 stars all the way.  But will not be coming back until a major issue of theft is stopped.  3% charge for using debit/credit card, which I used a visa, and visa's merchant service agreement clearly states that a business is not allowed to charge any fee for transactions over 10$!!!  And there was no way of knowing about the charge until we received our 90$ RECEIPT AFTER I HAD PAID!!  Nickel and dime'n people is not good business.  I own/operate a small business, and I don't charge any fees for any amount, period.   Would never even think about it for a pos transaction.  The only thing Leticia's is gaining from this is anger from a loyal clientele, who in turn, should start reducing the amount they tip the servers by equal or greater amount of the fee they are being charged.    Subsequently, have filed a complaint with Visa, BBB is next.

hZVyu0BRaw3dxBfrxLb4nQ.text: I usually order from Leticia's Mexican Cocina but this time it was horrible to put it mildly . First the food was not luke warm but icy cold. I ordered the avocado fingers appetizer and only finished one. They were disgusting it tasted like it was fried in old oil. Then my entree was the ribs and it was worst. It had some weird brown gravy and was horrible. This whole meal was a bust and a lost of $56. The only saving grace was the corn but that is hard to mess up. This was such a bad experience I can't see me wasting anymore money on their take out.

08i0ZEZXFe9WRvHWvgUBRg.text: My boyfriend and i went to eat here for the first time as a celebration , first they took long to ask for our drinks , i let it go. The food came out and it looked good as i was eating their was a hair in the middle of my rice. I told the waiter her exact words " oh no , theirs a hair im sorry. Do you want to talk to a manager " i said yes . She then walks off to get him but returns immediately and said " let me take your plate" the manager took over 15 mins to talk to me didn't offer to make me a new plate or anything. All they did was take it off my bill . I would have much rather preferred a new plate since I was hungry. Horrible experience for being my first time and hearing so much positive . Sadly i didn't have the same experience and won't ever do the 40 mins drive i did to arrive

P0hMRa3CHbUjEomUk9J_hQ.text: The original wait time that the hostess Aundrea told us was 15 minutes, 15 min has passed and she asked us if we would like to sit at the bar we told her we would wait there until we were able to be seated. She proceed to sit multiple parties and tables of 2 who arrived after us. We waited 40 minutes to be seated even though there were over 4 available booths right behind us. Finally she grabbed us to be seated and shoved us in a corner with a 2 and a half ft table. And then proceed to sit the same size parties behind us in a full size booth. The lack of urgency and respect for our needs as paying customers was not met. This saddens me because we love the food. They also happened to be "out of the appetizers" we order both times and told us after we had ordered. On the second order they brought out a partial appetizer without informing us. Overall very disappointed with the service.

Zx28KQxVc_XVKrlqFuGwCQ.text: Really disappointing service tonight!!  They got my wife's drink order wrong and got my food order wrong.  Our waitress was very inattentive.  Took her ten minutes to get to the table when we asked the busboy to have her come over.  She didn't seem really interested in selling more drinks, odd strategy.  Great food (once they fixed the mistake), poor service!

niEecxDbfokUT3d_VkuQCQ.text: Very crowded table. They gave up a 2 top and there were 3 people. Then they forgot half our order. And I know it's Friday but the place smelled like fish.

1mHsAk1eir53sBBH1ssrRg.text: We had been to Lateesha's on several different occasions and had mixed reviews. The food was pretty good and decent enough for Mexican. We went up one afternoon and left quickly after finding a large bug on the ground by the waiting area. We have not been back since.

af6gKNmF-CD_G04G9NXqzA.text: A few nights ago I found out that The Voice wanted to feature me on their fan spotlight. Of course, we had to go out and celebrate.  The feel and vibe is awesome. The perfect place to sip down a few margaritas and forget it's the weeknight. Oops!  The food was good. The chips and salsa are amazing. We both had tacos. In honesty, the margaritas were a little too amazing and the food is hard to remember.   We'll be back for more food, and I'll update soon!

Ei0ieaUmYhJkl-6bOfzOZQ.text: Leticias Mexican Cocina is fantastic! The  service is outstanding. Our server Jose was very pleasant and professional, he answered our questions and suggested all kinds of dishes.. The plates are just beautiful, I almost didn't want to eat it. We ordered the menudo which was heavy on the meat, very full of flavor and my husband said it was the best he has ever had. I ordered the the lunch combo which consisted of a carne asada enchilada in green sauce and carnitas. Everything tastes authentic, my husband is Mexican and it reminds him of his mothers cooking.The special comes with soup. Their albondigas soup is so good! We will be going back again this coming week.

W656uI-Iqg-e_tUfOYMgHg.text: I really do not understand all the rave reviews.  I guess this is definitely a "love" or "hate" type of place.  And I am definitely in the latter group.  I can only imagine my disappointment and confusion had I read the reviews before eating at this restaurant.  We went on a Sunday around 2:00.  The hostess was unfriendly and unwelcoming, but nonetheless we were seated quickly.  The restaurant look and feel is very average.  No unique decor, no ambiance, just your basic looking food house.  Very misleading from the outside appearance, in my opinion.  As I perused the menu, I was particularly struck by all of the specific rules, guidelines, directives, footnotes, etc.  Split plate charges (even on kids meals!), drink substitution upcharges, different type of rice charges, etc.  I actually read the whole menu cover to cover because it was so silly.  I actually found myself wondering if the chips and salsa would be charged to us, or not refilled for free.  Hey, I understand businesses have to make money, but the food is already way overpriced and expensive, the special rules just make it absurd.  Anyway, so the super tiny basket of tortilla chips and 3 varieties of salsa/dip were brought to our table by an apathetic busgirl.  The waiter soon followed and placing our orders was an easy, quick process.  We ate the chips in about 4 minutes, so we flagged down the busgirl to get a refill.  I was surprised to learn that the chips and salsa were, in fact, complimentary (haha), but we ended up receiving our first refill after our food was already delivered to the table (so about 20 minutes from the time we asked).  Which, hey, great, we didn't fill up on chips and salsa, right?  So, I had an order of ceviche and a carnitas street taco.  The ceviche was fine.  Not good, not bad.  Just basic.  The street taco was absolutely disgusting.  At first, I was impressed with the amount of meat, but when I realized it was very little meat and mostly globs of fat, I quickly lost my appetite.  That was made worse when I smelled my husband's ground beef tacos, which, I swear, smelled like cat food.  My husband, who eats everything, ate about a half of his taco.  In the end, we chalked this up to a "learning experience," and paid our bill and left.  We are not the type to complain to try and get something for free.  I sent in feedback online, because I think it's important for the owners to know the details, but I haven't heard back.  I can't say I'm surprised, and I will never step foot in this restaurant again.

9A3cbDzWGII_RUKvh4Wb_w.text: Salsa and chips are delicious! Puffy taco - I've had it in Texas and it was softer there, so not really what I expected.  Rice is delicious,  so was posole and Carne asada!  Visiting for a basketball tournament and stopped in for lunch. Fabulous wait staff!

Rhm7LXh9x4p-jmN_mB-F7w.text: Amazing food and service.  Authentic Mexican In Vegas!! Walter recommended the Enchilada Del Mar.  Without a doubt the best rice I have ever tasted.  The chips and salsa were great too. Two kinds of salsa and beans were served to us with homemade chips yum!  Everything is made from fresh ingredients.  We definitely will be back!  The best Mexican food in the valley and I am a native.

1kSnz1pIWsliH1mSiy1GnA.text: We were able to eat outdoors and it was perfect, with the patio trees and the lights above.  The staff was very friendly and the food was super yummy. It was a wonderful evening and all of us in our group said we would be back.

f3i7RPSuudlYAX2N6WQIZw.text: 2.5 Stars  I wanted to like it. I really wanted to since the reviews were very recommending.   1 - We came on a Sunday Afternoon about 2pm or so. We waiting for about 15-20 minutes before getting seated only to find plenty of sitting was there the whole time. Why leave your guest waiting when they don't have to? NEGATIVE  2 - The CHIPS were delicious! Not overly done, just perfect as it crumbled very nice.  POSITIVE  3 - Our server compeltely forgot our GUACAMOLE.  NEGATIVE  4 - The no spice sauce was SALTY. Even for me that loves salt! NEGATIVE  5 - Horchata is one of the best Horchata's I've ever had. Delicious.  POSITIVE POSITIVE  6 - The wait time for food was ridiculous. About 30 minutes for, Chimichanga Style Burrito (nothing fancy) & a plate of Cheese Enchilada & a taco (Carne Asade was dry).  NEGATIVE NEGATIVE  7 - The staff was OK - nothing out of ordinary  8 - Decor was nice.  -2  Overall, we were thoroughly disappointed after our $30 bill. Wouldn't drive out of the way for this FAVORITE Mexican of most :(

zi-CpYmF9I1a-w_OXNXMig.text: This is one of the top 3 Mexican restaurants in Vegas. Each and every time I come the service is awesome and the food is amazing. My go to items are Pesole Soup, Mexican Grilled Corn, the Gourmet Tacos and of course a margarita. Each equally delicious and filling. The Pesole soup is the best in town, I have yet to find better! I highly recommend this joint!

cs5u0mpHZ-nu85Br-5FXIA.text: Love the place But the Food is always COLD and it seems like it has been sitting in a Buffet set up

LGUuqQLjTo3zebsejeWCJw.text: Not what I was expecting.  The restaurant itself was pretty nice and had a good vibe.   We were sat in the far corner in a booth but there was low lighting in that entire section.  Good for a date not with kids.   Service was slow, we ordered guacamole and had to wait for another basket of chips.  Water refills where hard to come by as well.  Food was okay but for what I paid I was expecting more.   My wife ordered enchiladas and said the cheese was cold when it came to the table.  I ordered Sopes and the meat was cold on them and cheese wasn't melted or warm.  Not the best experience and I was expecting something equal to or better than Frank and Finos but they struck out with us.

h-IyQWQSSwwMu6v5iegl5A.text: This is the place for great Mexican food. I have yet to go wrong with anything on the menu. Chef is very creative and knows how to put together a fantastic plate. Chef Leticia has my utmost respect, the first time I had the opportunity to meet her, she was cleaning off a table, and expediting food for the kitchen. She took my order, allowed my changes, and cooked my food to my specifics, and then delivered it to my table, to make sure it was correct. How many Executive Chef's do you know, that would put that much effort into a plate, especially during a dinner rush? Leticia's has surpassed my expectations, and actually inspired me to cook better for my own family. The food is brilliant, the atmosphere is great, and the price is right!

fatiC5C-J4jL7G6SA5tfVA.text: I love locally owned restaurants with a casual comfort feel... I enjoyed outdoor dining out in the patio and it's nicely lit. The food from this place is incredible. We went here for our anniversary and our server made our night so memorable and he was very detailed on the food and gave us plenty of choices since it's our first time. Try this place out!

3dSKDmCfiMGZor2qitZQpg.text: I've heard nothing but good things about this place, but I wasn't impressed. I ordered the fajitas and they were overly salty. I will probably try again, but so far I give it a 3 star rating.

mtf1YDbMNAOcj8Q8E7WkPw.text: The food, ambience & service was the best I have ever had in Las Vegas. This is my new "go to spot" for lunch or dinner when in town !!!

aM8mnKQRRHC5ZL-uGuL2hw.text: The food was (again) delicious. I had the chile relleno carmelitas and a small bowl of pazole. Both were very flavorful and fresh tasting.  Unfortunately this time the service was somewhat below average, which was hard to understand  considering that it was not busy at all for lunch. Despite the weak service I will continue to go and work my way through the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious chili relleno carmelitas

uHQ_CkiO64xkQiEdYzYucQ.text: I love this place the food is amazing. I always will and get the Award-winning tacos.Those tacos are so amazing and I love them. I also like they're Elote, Being from California is hard to find a good place to has that in Vegas. I also like they're being dip I always or that to go. The service there is always great I'd like to go in and order my soon to go you take it home and enjoy at home. They have a great special for margherita's during the week came during their happy hour in the margherita's are amazing if you ever want to get a good Margarita as just you go there and get one city at the bar and enjoy. I have yet to find anything that I do not enjoy eating when I go here there menu is very large and very good and very authentic I would give this as 1 of my top places to sit down-and eat some Mexican food. It May be a little expensive but if you have the money to splurge I suggest you go here.

N-Gfk0BHfMfNQg0aP50-_Q.text: It's my aunt Gloria's kitchen right at the edge of a legendary city! Sure, it's quite a trek for people visiting but if rented a car you should DEFINITELY make the trip over the Leticia's.  First of all, the ambiance reminds me of my mothers homeland- MEXICO. The decor consists of pottery and brightly colored paintings along with cheerful tunes. I sense a familiar sound; it's mariachi music- a sound I can only tolerate with a full cultural experience (not one I experience on the radio or anywhere else lol) At last- I am surrounded by a blanket of my mothers culture. Now I am ready for some authentic Mexican food!!! AYYYY YA YAYYY! (I am allowed to do this- It's in my blood)   I love practicing my first language here- makes me feel cool. I ALWAYS order a delicious margarita- done just as my uncle Jesse would make them.  FOOD- ODM (means OMG in spanish- Oh, Dios Mio!) I will only let you experience this yourself...but I have a few key points here that could probably illustrate how much this place seduces me to take another step deeper into the nostalgia it inspires when I pass through the doors...  1. I am gluten INTOLERANT- This does not stop me from having ALL of the wheat based foods. NOW, don't be disheartened ,oh fellow GF kin- there ARE options and they are drooliscious!! 2. Honestly, I think that number 1 fully encompasses my thoughts on the contents of this place.... 3. I asked for EXTRA salsa TO GO!!! You know, the salsa that comes with the chips and salsa at most Mexican restaurants?? YEAH....I went HAM on that salsa. 4. They didn't charge me for it like other places would...super thumbs up.  5. It's family owned to the point where the owner HERself comes out to greet the customers and even cooks some of the food alongside her chefs- GIRL POWER!!

42BPeKcZXVWSDZ9Ujy5x0Q.text: They have really improved over the years. The Al Pastor will knock your socks off. All of the taco selections are very nice.

8lxK4S7G9duly8rcYzIKwg.text: I had the tacos of pastor, asada, birria and they were tasty with some good flavor for the area. I have been all over Las Vegas area there are plenty of other place who have some real deal flavorful tacos.  When in the area stop by and it will satisfy the mexican food craving. The customer service was good. There is a big parking lot in the back.

XYyu1LpN6njTZYGe661b1A.text: Love Leticia's!! I love the soups and street tacos. Delicious margaritas and nice patio seating.

Lqm-rrSpl-Ef8Kz_Bne0Zw.text: I am new to the area and was looking for a nice Mexican restaurant closer to home and decided to stop in.  The service was beyond slow, we couldn't find our waitress, the food was cold when it finally arrived, and was it was relatively over-priced.  We had to stand up to get anyone to notice it was time for our check and then had to ask them to please bring back our credit card after 15 minutes.  Time to go back to Frank & Fina's (Flamingo & 215) where the food is wonderfully delicious and the service is over the top!

dYwVtipueuCS__HPkYbEOA.text: The Queso Tacos are to die for. Let's face it, everything is pretty amazing. I've never had a bad experience at Leticia's!

c9J97GvPBq8TMjLkvoOcJQ.text: Amazing place!! Luciano and Marija our waiters have been wonderful!! Puffy tacos were so great that I could only eat one..rib eye tacos were so tender..the cutest lil old men have been doing karaoke..just a fun lively place once again..a must try!!

rWkbIHmQF__d566riAybSQ.text: Food was fine but was asked to leave table after we paid our bill. It had only been a few minutes. We had not been drinking so it was not because we were drunk, maybe it was because we were not drinking and spending enough $. Either way- first time and last time.

EYpgCD6cxhk9mGmsA8LEWw.text: This restaurant use to be a 4.5 star but now I rate it a 2 star because of the diminishing quality of the food.  We are regulars sometimes even going twice a week and the food the last 3-4 times was just ok.  We wonder if they are having problems with keeping a kitchen staff?? Seating, I have read earlier reviews that you have to wait along time for a seat only to find out seats are open.   I am commenting because we love this restaurant and we want them to get their act together.  Just a note, this is my VERY FIRST YELP REVIEW.  I just signed up to write a review for this restaurant.

838T1LNdNjalmJrv5--Ufw.text: My husband and I only sit at the bar when we go for Happy Hour. Their appetizers are good, and Liz is the best bartender ever.....she makes a mean margarita and Im picky! Only reason it is 4 stars instead of 5 is their machines are the tightest Ive ever played. I ve never won anything there and neither has anyone else. But Liz is still great.

U6jpoOmMnYed8R94Cy3iFw.text: my husband and I love this place. the green tomatillo salsa is to die for. The staff is so friendly and the service is awesome...

bjhD8FUGXw5dQc5dl-P74Q.text: 1 star = Terrible. Multiple things went wrong. Never going back. 2 star = Not good. I will not go back, but it wasnt absolutely awful. 3 star = Good, not great. I wouldnt go out of my way, but I *would* go back. 4 star = Excellent food. I really liked it. I could be a regular here. 5 star = Phenomenal food. Something truly special here.  This is our new fave Mexican place in LV. We still heart Casa Don Juan, but it's way on the other side of town.  The decor is nice, but maybe just a tad dark on the bar side. They brought out chips, salsa and bean dip, all of which were delicious. Best chips and salsa BY FAR that we have had in LV. The food was really really good. My wife had crispy tacos -- she loved the carne asada but didnt care for the chicken. The 13 year old had the ground beef taco and liked it. I had the Quesa Shrimp Tacos, the house specialty, and they were very good (the corn tortillas were ok, not great). The shrimp was SCRUMPTIOUS! Overall, the food was very good. Warning: the portion sizes are HUGE.  I can see what other people are saying about the service. Our server was somewhat indifferent. It took quite a while to get our food. But it didnt ruin our meal, and I wouldnt let it stop you from trying the place.  It was a bit pricey -- $50 for 2 sodas, a 2 taco plate, a 1 taco plate, and the special tacos.

rHTKWOs-TebunMecTCVzgQ.text: We had a great meal here this evening of enchiladas and tamales.  Great place for great Mexican food and great service!

CkJB8E8oD6_VHa23t9Hadw.text: Name a restaurant that the owner makes rounds to every table welcoming them to his place... Well this is it. It was a great touch to an amazing meal. The margaritas were amazing as well.

OgLNNehrgFN5WS25t7nXKQ.text: Hidden gem with delish food! I could've eaten just the chips & salsa and been happy. The menu was a little tricky with the family style/individual format but we figured it out. The BF had quesataco which was different but really good. I love mole so when I got the option to pour it over taquitos, I was like hell yeah. I'll definitely be back!

MrBZrW7UEv9Y0xpnOavTBA.text: Came here for lunch yest.  Right from the get-go I liked this place.  It's been awhile since I had to parallel park.  The outside gave a cozy feel to it.  I wouldn't expect it around this side of town, took me by surprise.  Walking in, I was greeted by Una hermosa, Gladys.  The waitress, who i found is the daughter of the owner, suggested I try the Carnitas, since it was her grandma's recipe.  Simply delicious!!! The plate was topped with chicharron, and the pork fell apart with my fork.  Also tried the chocolate cake, which was very thick and rich.    Would definitely love to come back and try the tamales.

rrtWlldhEhl47slGuJs5fw.text: The bean dip was yummy, as were their specialty margaritas. Unfortunately it was super crowded and even though she tried our waitress seemed like she couldn't keep up with all her tables. Maybe they are less busy at other times but I for sure think they should have the needed staff for a busy Friday night.

8ITKfsOQBrtAo2nVAGg5zA.text: I have never written a review; however, I can no longer let this opportunity pass by. My husband and I decided to celebrate our anniversary lunch at Leticia's. We have always had consistently amazing service, accompanied by the most authentic Mexican food we have found here in Las Vegas. The menu selection offers a wide variety of mouth watering options. Food arrived at our table steaming hot, mouth watering and very generous portions. We both highly recommend this treasure and will continue to celebrate special occasions here. Absolutely love the environment, service and delicious food!

HMsvAAambpxZfNpmY5225Q.text: Every time I come here the food is terrific.  I always bring people from out of town and they always say it is the best Mexican they've ever had.  Can be very busy so plan ahead.

fIuwoJUqFYYDYEy-RK_-2Q.text: The food is the best Ever and Tara makes the best margaritas. and gin and tonics ..love her

7kIUGRsy0HUrw9bHpSc5XQ.text: This place is always so nice and child friendly. The food is great, I've had the shrimp fajitas, carne Asada, but my favorite is the Oaxaca cheese and shrimp tacos! It has chipotle sauce and cheesy poblano rice. The margaritas are also great.

3sHqSJjYQFrjzW1DJtqRyA.text: Best service and food ever, Maria our server was so good and friendly she made our day.   The food was excellent, lots of it. We were content and hopefully come back soon.  We live on the island of Oahu, Hawaii.  Nothing like this there!  We leave here with a smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome!!!
