The tortillas were rubbery & the fajitas were very greasy. Our very large soft drinks were the best part of our meal. We will never go back to this place!!!

TWvgAKVuM8bEpa7ZMDttIQ.text: Love this place! By far my favorite Mexican place in Las Vegas, maybe even anywhere! Their margaritas are always top notch. Chips and dips are amazing. I love, love, love their tacos! If you're ever in Centennial Hills give this place a shot!

5hz4TauTsTz1jNiW8FHbtg.text: This was our first time at this restaurant. It was a thirty minute wait on a Monday night. But lots of open tables. Horrible service. Never received any drink refills or on the chips and salsa either. Out of four people that ordered, only 1 of us were satisfied with our food. Completely overrated. Would not recommend or go back.

UdVC2XwBH7MWJy8d1OqZPg.text: We've been coming here since they opened, and love it! Better than the family "chains" here. We like to sit at the bar during Happy Hour and get a few items from the HH Menu. Bartender is friendly and helpful. When we get a meal...always request the cheese rice. You'll never want regular Spanish rice again. Also, the Queso Tacos...best ever! Now I kind ownership what we need for dinner tonight.

4Xqzwoh7SrZjIR5CKyo11w.text: I've eaten at Leticia's close to a dozen times over the past couple of years, but noticed that food quality hasn't been consistent. After not dining here for 3-4 months, a group of friends and I decided to meet for lunch today and try it again. The chips, salsas, and beans were great as usual. I shared the empanadas (1 chicken tinga, 1 beef), Mexican corn, and had a bite of carne asada chimichanga. It was all good, but for the prices ($15 for the chimichanga burrito!) I feel it's not a great value.  The main area of concern was the service. After being seated it took 15 minutes for someone to take our drink order (water and iced tea), and an additional 20 minutes for the drinks to be delivered. Granted it was a Saturday afternoon, but it's standard to have at least waters brought out within 15 minutes of a party being seated. When we politely asked our server about the drinks, she made some excuse about the bartender being busy. Not cool Leticia's, not cool.

JUNwPcvITALqA8lp-nr8pg.text: This neighborhood Mexican restaurant is the best. Great food and awesome service. This is our favorite place to eat Mexican food!

fr5-qEjT8zz4oM65uGgNMg.text: Came here with a couple of friends and had such an amazing experience here. The chips with salsa and beans were delicious and the food we got was outstanding not to mention the margaritas were INCREDIBLE!! The staff was very friendly and attentive

wsISTPByPODA0AikSHbJew.text: As we have a new baby we can't go out to eat so decided to get take away.  I got the carne asada fajitas thinking that this is a good rated restaurant with good food and high prices so the meat should b of quality!  Well, the carne asada was the kind of steak you have to chew on forever before deciding it's not not breaking down so you either have to spit it out or swallow it whole.  The to go condiments for fajitas was tiny and didn't fill much of the container they put it in and didn't come with sour cream either.  My husband ordered Leticias award winning quesadilla tacos and these were really good.  They were filled with shrimp.  The poblano white rice casserole was very bland though.  We got a small bag of tortillas, really should have taken a picture.  It probably was about 15 chips.  Would not order take away from there again,  prices were high and didn't get what expected out of a quality restaurant for the prices.

PwrunvvItaQW4cG4zJlEjA.text: This was my husband's & my 3rd visit here.  It will be our last time giving it a shot.  The style of salsa is not the kind we like.  the beans they served with chips lacked any flavor.  The Fideo soup we both ordered was thick and glupy. The salad I ordered was loaded down with about a cup of too much cheese.  The shrimp poppers were overly breaded.  Hubby did like the Consume soup.  The staff was friendly, but service was slow and they never checked on us to refill drinks.  I do like the decor, but the fluorescent lighting is bad.  The place is always packed so we thought why not give it a try again & it's so close to home.  However we won't be returning.  Sorry Leticias, Michoacan is just much much better.

bea1ZVDRgNXtlAgYxwligg.text: Been here 15/20 times the food is great. Get here early this place sometime has a 1or 2 hour  wait due to the food being do good. The owner is running around here all the time making sure everything is perfect. The servers and bartenders are strip quality.

atYj2ABYAImHzWoH539FWw.text: The BEST Mexican food in Vegas, Chili Verde Amazing!!! the best I ever had....

86MmK9wBn7AY6PWoBFkr1g.text: Will go back . Great service, great food. Burrito are huge and super fresh ingredients

OXT5WAYhy8j9l8Ka9CCa1g.text: As I understand it, Leticia's recipes come from her mother's kitchen in Mexico City.  That definitely explains some of the great tastes found here.  Chips and Salsa start the meal, like almost every Mexican Restaurant here in Las Vegas.  That is not the case in the places I have been in Mexico... but I'm a fan anyways.  And Letecia gives you three dip choices...  A traditional salsa, salsa verde, and bean dip.  All are excellent, though my favorite is the bean dip.   The entree's are excellent.  They boast a variety of creative tacos that will really get your tasebuds firing.  But I was all about the mole poblano on this trip.  Now I have had some great mole's in Mexico and every one is different from the next.  Here in the states, most places get too caught up on the "chocolate" part.  In reality several Mole's don't even include chocolate and those that rank among the best in Mexico don't emphasize the chocolate.  The sauce has dozens of ingredients.  I was really excited to try Leticia's.  Unfortunately, it came across too chocolate for me.  This will probably appeal to a lot of people... but not me.  Everything else was great and all my party enjoyed their food.  It was all excellent.... but I just didn't care for the mole.  Topping off your meal with fresh Churo's is a nice nod to Mexican street food and truly delicious.  The service was excellent and the restaurant is clean and inviting.  I like Leticia's a lot!  I will be back often for the tacos and enchiladas... but not for the mole poblano.  I am glad to have a great Mexican restaurant in an area that is starving for restaurants.  I hope Leticia's sticks around.    Give it a try!

fLwDTcJ4cUYjrguY_BOaIA.text: Frequent diners with little complaints however our last visit was the worst.  Our sever was more focused on pleasing a group of "family/relatives" to the owner then she was on her other tables.  We had to remind her several times to bring us a drink & that we were ready to order.

AHOjJd4yuO2yU88BYxiP2Q.text: Authentic Mexican restaurant with a great happy hour deal! It's a small place so it tends to feel really crowded and close in there which I don't really like. But the signature margaritas are always great!

6B9SOXYDr788ANkU2jXtkA.text: Best Mexican restaurant in town. I have been here many times and never had a bad meal. If you are in the Northwest you have to go

0_SJsXoR2KVUM5TRUDJNHw.text: Went in for a late night dinner. The bartender sat us and another couple at the same time. We were sat at tables next to eachother . We got waters and chips from the busser right away. The bartender Justin came to tell us about happy hour but decided to save time and tell both tables at the same time ..I felt that was a little tacky. Then he got the other tables drink order. When he took our drink order I ordered the Horchotini. The other table recived their soups and drinks before he asked for our order..by that time we had filled up on chips . My drink was great but by the time we got the food we were not very hungry anymore. We had it boxed up to go..they should promote the busser to a server he took more time at our table..

Mav8OiLJhPdZ8kHN6rY9oQ.text: Absolutely awful!!! I am latino myself, so let me start by letting you know the extent of knowledge of GOOD, homemade latin foods (I am Spanish, with Mexican, Columbian, and Guatemalan relatives). My wife, 2 kids, and myself visited the restaurant after just moving to this side of town, in search of a place comparable to Viva Zapata's (North east Vegas), and we found Leticia's and gave them a try. The bean dip was plain, but the salsas were good, although for a family of 4, they really should increase the amount chips they give. We started with the grilled corn, which was good, but you really can't mess up an easy classic like that. My kids ordered the bean and cheese burrito (my son added the asada steak to his), my wife orded the Chile Relleno with an enchilada, and I ordered the Cecina A La Tampiquea. My son was disappointed to find out that they did not ADD the asada to his burrito, but instead, made it a burrito with ONLY ASADA. My son is a big fan of refried beans, so that literally ruined his appetite, seeing as he had to eat chips until they fixed his order (15 min. later). My wive's look on her face after taking a bite out of her chile relleno tipped me off. It was GROSS! Under cooked batter with ABSOLUTELY no seasoning! MY wife had to scrape the batter off to eat it, and worst of all, when I asked management about it, they said they got too many complaints about it being to "egg-e," so they had to change it; awful. The worst part of all, was the sauce! The sauce they add to the Chile Relleno was, without a doubt, plain tomato sauce from a can. There is NO mistaking it, that was NOT a salsa Colorado. My steak with mushrooms, bacon, and cheese was good; under-seasoned, but good. My issue with my plate was, WHAT MEXICAN STEAK IS COVERED IN MUSHROOMS, BACON, AND ONIONS??????? Great if this was a steak house, but that's not what this place is. The enchilada that is paired with it was bad. The tortilla they used for the enchilada was far too thick, over-cooked, and taste-less. What really ruined it all, in the end, was the customer service. After complaining to management about all those issues, all they told me was about all the praise they get from their clientele, and looked at me like I was nuts. Seeing as I was the ONLY latino there, was that a hate crime? Anyhow,  In conclusion: bland, un-traditional, non-clever, and SEVERLY overpriced "Mexican" food. Save money, and go down the street to Roberto's or Chipotle. They may not be the best, but on this side of town, they're much better.

CcngOniDLHGNCaJK_gOEuw.text: Food was good, but thought it was a little pricey for the meals as delivered.  We were pretty astounded when we got our bill and were charged $1.50 x 3 for "extra" Pica de Gallo.

_3Us1roi6w52Gc8kBZfxlQ.text: Vising my friend in LV, she took me to her go-to for Mexican food.  Some of the best Mexican food I have had and I live in Los Angeles!  I gauge a Mexican restaurant by its chips and salsa.  Chipotle and green were delicious.  Plus, you get a bowl.of creamy beans.  Never had that before.  I really had to control myself.  My girlfriend had grilled fish tacos so moist and we'll seasoned, not to mention a generous helping.  I had Camarones al mojo  de ajo.   Sauce was so good, I dumped all of my rice in to soak it up.  Their drinks are terriffic as well.  Strawberry Margarita with chopped jalapeno had a nice kick.  The people who work there are all really nice.  It is obvious that they take pride in what they do.  I look forward to visiting again!!!

cfLhIHuEIMZdw-u2gdtvFg.text: We went for Lunch.  The lunch menu is great and the prices can't be beat!  The free chips, salsa and bean dip are tasty to start your meal.  We had cheese enchiladas and grilled chicken tostadas.  Food was great, my portion was a bit large, so I brought home lunch for the next day.  Our server was attentive and always around when we were looking for him!

heXevOCPImuUYQU4SYtbLA.text: I went to this restaurant with some friends.  I ordered the Carne Asada, BUT specifically asked the server if it was lean.  His answer was "yes".  When it came approximately 1/3 was Fat, which I won't eat.  When he took my plate I pointed out the fat.  He sent the mgr. over to speak with me.  I told her what I asked the server and a few of my lunch mates verified his response.  She offered a reduction in price.  Needless to say I was shocked when the "reduction in price" was 90 cents. And yes you read that right.  Not good business in my opinion.

wr0Zn-NAwMlNg5BZ2Cs35Q.text: Service was horrible. Yeah the staff was nice/friendly. But they didn't come by much at all. Took forever to get our drinks. Didn't bring the hotter salsa, side of jalapeno or silverware like we asked. Then waited forever once we asked for our check

tL_CO47sv7NnnPrzn0C8Mg.text: Food and staff were amazing. Our go to place for some amazing Mexican food! I love the atmosphere and the lighting outside it truly is a great, unique place. Especially for a first date!

VwGcY_PNbwXSvMGW2nv-5A.text: The 2 salsas and bean dip they bring, hits the spot. They have 2 for 1 margaritas on Tuesdays. I tried Leticias cheesy shrimp tacos, they were bomb and hubby cleared his whole plate of enchiladas!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xkRkWtFZ0TC4awoOr1lOIA.text: Great food but they never ever ever get the takeout order right. There's always something missing so make sure to double check your order when you pick it up.

2AQWbyGdOvcdinAh_o2YIg.text: Leticia's is a very solid Mexican restaurant in town that is marred by its iffy service experiences. In my visits to this rather popular location I've noticed that often the experience you get changed on a whim and the server that you get. When it comes to the food however I can offer no complaints as the portions are very solid and the food, delicious. L  It's worth a visit, just pray to the restaurant gods you end up going on a good day for that great overall experience that they can deliver.

erXc2IYpkkNAtQgVTjPwKQ.text: Always amazing... service is good, ambience is casual with music on the background. I love it here.. the food will never disappoint you...

YPJRhpX1vSFnJl88lD5iwg.text: Waited over an hour for 2 tacos and taquitos. When they dropped off our food they said it was 50% off because they "don't know what happened to our ticket" but our server came back and said sorry it took so long and dropped off a bill for full price. We ended just having them box it to go because our baby was starting to get fussy. Got all the way home with our food and realized they got our order wrong. This was a really horrible experience and we won't be back.

JfuiLRm9jSqz97K0E-sUfA.text: We visited today for the first time, and we're seated within a short wait time. The waiter was friendly and immediately took drink orders. I ordered the chili relleno with shrimp and cream sauce. It was divine! Everyone else ordered tacos and no one was disappointed. The puffy tacos with carnitas got very high praise. Looking forward to a return visit.

fvCmbFovqEU1gW9ltB1yhQ.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant period. I live in California.  If this place was Closer to home I would eat there every day . I live 30 min away from Los Angeles and Leticia beats every place there . The Chile Verde is the best I ever had.  And I am Mexican and I know chili Verde.  They make home made tortillas.  Both corn and flour . Very good and friendly.  Bottom this authentic delicious clean and  excellent service

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best Chile Verde I have ever tasted.

hL3o0A0kp_NzzycQVPbg2Q.text: Service here was lovely.  All the employees were very nice and engaging.  I wish I could remember our waitress' name.  Our food came out in  a timely fashion.  They offer a children's menu as well as game mat for the little ones which is a huge plus.  I ordered the empanadas, one chicken and one ground beef.  They were a very good size and super filling.  Perhaps it may have also been all the chips and salsa I ate.  I saw so many things on the menu that I am dying to check out next time, including their margaritas.  Definitely recommend, and will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanadas!

YvmCdBHPBjJeGZ8JeOIF1g.text: This is my second trip to this establishment, and haven't been let down either time.  I ordered the carne Asade quest-taco (again) and couldn't have been more pleased with the portion size for the price.  Staff was quite friendly, the woman making the homemade tortillas passed a fresh one over for my daughter.  The refills were always prompt, I don't think I ever had an empty glass.  When you check in here you also get a free house margarita, which you can choose from a laundry list of flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asade quesa-taco, house chips and the free house margarita.

ebcveeSZGr2XX7fqaQ-lAg.text: Sorry I know everyone loves this place but I just did not like it. I am a salsa snob and just dislike their salsa. I do like that they serve beans with their chips, most places do not do this. I judge my Mexican restaurant by how good their salsa is. My other half loves Mexican food and absolutely was disappointed. He got fish tacos and they were so fishy tasting.

BsmDk0ViH199fRA5iPSqQQ.text: We absolutely love Leticia's. Especially in the Northwest it is in a quiet neighborhood shopping center. However we are extremely disappointed that the prices jumped up dramatically. I honestly don't know if we will return because of the price increase. Same food same menu just more expensive.

sCuuNT7IRDZWuEy-Fp3cxw.text: Amazingly, it has been a very difficult journey trying to find what I would consider a phenomenal Mexican restaurant in this town. I know because I have been searching for over 4 years with no luck, until today. I got a tip about Leticia's Mexican Cocina just yesterday. It is a very long way away from my house, but I felt good enough about the tip to drive all the way across town today to check it out for lunch. I ordered make your own combo which I chose the noodle soup, chicken enchilada with red sauce, beef tostada and added in an extra of Carne Asada. Lunch started two very good salsa's and warm bean dip, and was quickly followed up with a very tasty tomato noodle soup! The main course was nothing short of excellent. My fav was probably the carne Asada, but the other two were excellent as well. The beans and rice were a very nice compliment! The great news is that it is far and away the best Mexican food in Vegas in my opinion!!! My waiter, Walter was also great... Taking care of all my needs! The bad news is that it is 40 minutes away from my house, but I will be scooping up all my friends and diving back over to enjoy often!!! There was a group of 6 first timers across from me and all agreed that it wad thumbs up from everyone. One gal said I am glad I live in Cali or I would be huge if I lived close!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the build your own lunch with chicken enchilada, tostada, and I added carne Asada for an extra charge....Exceptional!!

e-SIUcfrOhLr8NIsubD5Pw.text: Been here a couple times and the food is excellent. The reason for only giving 3 stars is the service. We went on Sunday for a late lunch around 2pm. The place was not busy at all and they had plenty of staff from what I could tell.   First, they couldn't seat us right away even though the dining room was almost empty. Second, it was a long wait for drinks and then another long wait to place our order. After all of that, the longest wait was to get a to go box and our check. There was never an acknowledgement from any staff about the wait time. We were really disappointed considering the food was so good. Hoping for better next time.

6IhOY08gFHBU35FHVVnO5w.text: I loved everything about this place! Reminded me of our favorite Mexican spot in LA.  We sat at the bar and the female bartender ( shucks, I forget her name) was amazing. We were there on a Monday night. It was our first time and we had a blast. The molcajete was a little light on the fixings but the margaritas, tequila and great service made up for the difference. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

12fChGChOcbY9mENjXtE8g.text: My absolute favorite Mexican restaurant! Ive literally never had a bad meal and the drinks are to die for. Love love love it!!!

anMlrz_yJ1fgLEJLtVKKVQ.text: Really enjoyed the atmosphere and quality of good on this restaurant, they start us with the chips and salsa to which we devour. Then came the grandma style Fideo soup, which it compares to none other from any Mexican restaurant in the community! For my main course I had the birria sopes lunch special, which they were just delightful! They had the right spice, correct and authentic birria taste that paired well with a negra modelo. My only complaint if any at all was the service, regardless the waitress being kind it took her a long time delivering our drinks, then I asked for some orange juice, me thinking they had fresh squeezed OJ like in other authentic Mexican food restaurants but they brought OJ that was straight from the cartoon, to which is my fault I believe, I should had asked if they had fresh squeezed OJ. The OJ taste is what led me to order the Negra Modelo and I'm glad I did because it paired really well with my meal! The prices and the food was definitely worth the wait!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nicely decorated and clean environment, I just love this place!

Pu1FyzPMw0H9MdBD10t6fw.text: Wife and I went to the new location she just  opened up in the santefe casino.Let me say she has not missed a beat.This food was awesome the salsa's was fresh home made taste.The food was fresh good.I had the gourmet taco's made out of ribeye steak.they gave me two healthy taco's with  the typical rice and beans.I opted to have the homemade rice casserole for a cpl dollars extra.WELL WORTH IT..  The service was first class.even the night we went was   Was very busy the staffed seemed like a well oiled machine.From the hostess to the wait staff assistant please do yourself a huge favor try this place u wont be disappointed

-N5C3u5iPnCke7ZDymSldw.text: Dear Sirs, Lately my family and I have witnessed a decline in quality of service, taste of foods & accommodations to customers at the Henderson location. We have been a one year customers and grown disappointed the last four visits, at this time we have no plans of going back under the current conditions. Respectfully submitted, Richard M.

EM-twuGuPS0S0WHy0x3mwQ.text: My first visit here. Been meaning to try it since it opened. Busy late Friday night but the servers were very friendly and helpful.   First thing...chips and salsa. Pretty standard stuff with the exception that the habanero salsa was awesome. It was thick, flavorful and packed with the beautiful kick one would expect from habanero. I ordered the rellano with chicken tiana. Although it's not something Jose Andres or Aaron Sanchez would boast about but it's a very sturdy dish. Add some of the habanero and chipotle salsa mixed together on top of the dish and it taste very good. Choose corn tortilla over flour because the corn tortillas are handmade in house.  The Diet Pepsi tasted authentic too   I'll be returning soon for the fajitas....

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili rellano with chicken tiana
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AWESOME HABANERO SALSA
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and salsas: they have an awesome habanero one!

6-cfPpHEdk0LGBBb8sYbaw.text: Really enjoyed Leticia's for the food, service, and atmosphere. Think more upscale Mexican food and atompshere instead of local dive.   Our waitress was great. She checked in on us frequently and was friendly.   The chips, salsas, and bean dip to start were delicious. I could not keep out of the chips. The bean dip had a great flavor and texture. Both salsas had a nice flavor. My virgin margarita was good. A margarita obviously is best with tequila, but the bartender made it perfectly for my request.   Since I couldn't stop with the chips I went with the Enchilada lunch special for a smaller portion. I'm so glad I did because it was plenty of food. The shredded beef I chose for the enchilada was tender and I loved the flavor of the tomatillo sauce on top. It had a slight sweetness to it. The sides of rice and beans were tasty too. My friend ordered the Carnitas which came with tortillas making it like fajitas. He loved it and also thought the lunch special was plenty of food.   The lunch specials were very affordable. Two lunches and a virgin margarita came to about $25 with tip! You can't beat that. The food was delicious so I'll definitely return even when lunch specials aren't available.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchilada Lunch Special
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas Lunch Special (also includes tortillas)

VwLwkhWHfWa4diZ0aoTAwA.text: A coworker of mine mentioned this place was opened today. I decided to check it out with a friend and mine. We each ordered the Chicken Tinga Empanadas and they are delicious. The delicious flavors took me back to my childhood and that was nice. The bar was clean and the bartenders were nice. I believe that the drink presentation and taste could have been better, but it was a huge deal breaker. I mean I could get just a beer next time. There is always ample parking, since its location at the casino and vibe at the bar was chill and relaxing. I saw the they have a Mariscos Trio Enchiladas and they looked really good. I am hoping to try those on my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Relaxing bar area
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What a delicious find

ewbbs279fAf5Gn4h1wpQwg.text: The decor is super cool!  Feels like you're eating dinner in the Alamo, after the battle!  The walls separating the booths simulate crumbled and broken walls of an adobe building.  The ceiling looks like a cannon ball hit a bullseye.  Okay... there's my attempt at describing the interior of the restaurant!  Pictures would have told a better story.  The atmosphere is nice.  It's not too loud, not smokey, and it's cozy!  So let's talk about the food!  It's delicious!  I had the street tacos!  Pretty simple, yet delicious!  My gorgeous girlfriend had the Sopa de Mariscos with a lobster tail!  Yes I tried it and Yes it was amazing!  In my opinion, it's very similar to Cioppino, which is one of my favorite dishes ever!  I'm betting the drinks are great too, although I didn't have any.  And of course, your server will get you started with warm tortillas, salsa and bean dip.    The restaurant is located inside of the Fiesta Hotel and Casino.

cLwG7tnRvbjpjOhwGz5uWg.text: We stopped in the cute little area for lunch after volunteering at a foundation near by. The area is super duper cute and makes you feel like you're in another city (Portland or San Diego). We popped in and asked to sit on the patio. The wait time was a little longer than what we expected considering there were plenty of open tables.   The service was really great. Our waters were never empty and their tequila selection was pretty good. Chips come complementary to the table with three different salsa options. I could only eat two, one had meat in it. I ordered the salad bowl... picked my lettuce, vegetables, protein (black beans), rice (jasmine cilantro), and guacamole. Small or large option... I recommend the large, So you can have some for later ;) it was delicious. Nothing I couldn't make at home... but for a healthy choice in a Mexican restaurant, it was the way to go. My boyfriend ordered the burrito... it was huge. He enjoyed it and had some for later as well. The prices were fair, and we will be back again when we are in the area. Definitely give it a try!

0uz7eb3PcLAuuelOBD8aIg.text: Excellent food with excellent service. Lots of leftovers since we can't stop eating their great tortilla chips and salsa. Love the hours!  We always eat early, which is good because when we left at 5pm there was a line waiting. Plus we can use our coupons from the casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada tostada
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada enchilada
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 shrimp tacos

D1hokvqqrE4uRGT0NbJeiw.text: Great place for some authentic Mexican food with a traditional Mexican aesthetic. The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated with traditional Mexican art, pottery and furnishings and it really gives the sense that you're about to dine some really good Mexican food. My motto: if the restauranteur doesn't care about their establishment they obviously cant care about the food.  We were seated promptly and had 2 different servers come up to us asking us if we were ready for drinks or to be served. That's a big thumbs up for prompt and attentive service.  The chips, beans and salsa they serve you before your meal are amazing and we almost filled up on them. lol. The menu is vast and filled with many goodies and everytime I come here i am never disappointed in my selection.   The prices are reasonable. So don't expect to break your wallet. But remember to tip well. The staff here is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A lot going on in this dish. You can see the colors, the textures and the different ingredients used in Mexican cuisine.

m50vRxDA7VeJmV_R7hgM5w.text: LITERALLY THE BEST MEXICAN RESTAURANT FOOD! I highly, highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who is thinking about coming here. The drinks are fantastic and the food is impeccable. Your taste buds will thank you!  Their chips and salsa come with a bean dip which has chorizo inside. Yummmm!!!

_Mlvv5vA_9xl2T-bbgyK1g.text: We had a fantastic dinner at Leticia's! I dined here at the recommendation of a friend who couldn't stop ranting and raving about how great the food is. When we arrived, it seemed others agreed with him as there were a lot of parties waiting to be seated on a Saturday night.   After about a 20 minute wait, we were seated and promptly greeted by our friendly server. He got our drinks to us quickly and loaded us up with fresh chips, salsa, and a tasty bean dip (all free of charge!). The salsa was a bit too spicy for me and also a little runny, but the bean dip was just so addicting and delicious. My friends and I were all but fighting over it!  When the time came to order, I chose to go with their "award winning" quesa tacos with carne asada. I was so very pleased when they arrived. The tortillas were so soft and fresh, the cheese was stringy and flavorful, and the spicy sauce tucked between the two tortillas was insanely good. I don't handle heavy spice well at all and this was just perfect for me. The steak was tender and juicy. It was all great!  The included sides were the meaty beans (similar flavor profile to the bean dip) and a cheesy rice casserole. Both were yummy but the tacos were quite filling, particularly after loading up on all of those chips and bean dip!  Overall, this is a great place to stop for some delicious Mexican food, very much worth the drive. Good food, good service, and good prices! Just be prepared for a bit of a wait if you come on the weekend...but it'll be worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The award winning quesa tacos were delicious and the beans were so addicting!

jyZ6s4t06u6UIoROC2y4tg.text: I have been coming to this restaurant for the past year and have gotten nothing but good service. But as of recent it looks like it's getting run down. The last two times I've been here the bathrooms aren't clean and urinals don't work. Two of the buildings door windows  are broken and covered with a piece of plywood we hope this gets fixed soon.   As for the food, it is fantastic I have no complaints.

al4ph6kQoQCCi2I96Ldiew.text: Wow what a great bday dinner with my beautiful wife and fantastic grandson. Only a 20 min wait, food always good. Thank you baby for a great day today and always!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me and my gorgeous wife about to eat
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A wonderful meal on the patio outside with the wife and grandson . The weather is perfect and the good great !!!

N0-frBUi950MGNOnCFxPig.text: This place always has great food with excellent service.  Their chips and salsa are tasty and the entrees are very authentic.  The steak and lobster is quite a value as well.  Stop by and enjoy a margarita with your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada lunch special
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips, salsa and beans

dkMpxTRy8kKjD_m734Yl9Q.text: Wow this place is worth communiting across Las Vegas for!!  The only thing I wasn't a major fan of was the thick house chips. But the salsa that came with it was 5 stars!  I ordered the famous quesoteca tacos... These things are serious! I had one with shrimp and one with carne asada. Both was so savory with the melted grilled cheese combined with the fresh tortillas and flavorful meats. Omg the best taco I ever ate.  The side of Pocono rice was unusual, but very addicting. Also the service was on point and so helpful with navigating the massive menu. I can't wait to get my grub on again here!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ordered a temale on side.. meh stick with the queso tacos!!
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side view of quesotaco
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That poblano rice and 2 quesotocos are the best

9m3LIzhKy8A9Ec8cfgc9pw.text: Best Mexican food ever! The tortilla chips are soft and crunchy. Best queso and sauteed mushrooms were an option they were amazing. The bacon wrapped prawns battered and fried served with the sweet sauce were incredible! Check out the happy hour they serve food 1/2 off. Great drinks and a fun location. Super good service too! Clean restaurant and restrooms. 5 stars good job.  I'm from Texas and I know Mexican food, this place is the best ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zK58zRTTrmJkfSjHadEZjQ.text: Yum yum yum yum yum!!!! Just had to get that out of the way. I love this Mexican restaurant and it's one of my favorites on this side of town. I've been here multiple times and each time I've left so full and happy.   I always try something new when I come in and I'm pleased to say I haven't been unhappy even once! From the chicken, beef, pork etc whatever you choose is marinated in a delicious blend of spice that will have you craving more. I took my mom here for the first time and she love it as well.   First off the beans and salsa they bring to the table to start you off is so good I usually ask for a second helping. I love that they have Elote as an appetizer choose and for $4 I always get two orders. I forgot to take a photo because I devour it it so quickly. Haha!   Both my mom and I decided to try out the Chili Rellenos. She went with the recommendation of our awesome waitress and got the white sauce seafood one! I on the other hand choose the pork and beef. Both were amazing! OMG we both ate our entire dish with no left overs.   I was to full at this point to order dessert but usually if I don't pig out to much I get the fried ice cream which is also awesome!   Overall, amazing food, great ambiance, and the staff is friendly! I wish I knew the name of one of the bus guys because he is hilarious and makes me laugh every time I stop in.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ye3SSQ3cPVBfpp40k0K6ZQ.text: Avoid this place during happy hour. We were told there was a few minute wait. The restaurant probably had 5 tables TOTAL being used. After 20 min of waiting we asked the hostess what the wait was with such an empty establishment and we were told that the kitchen was backed up and she wasn't sure when she would be able to sit us?! Okay- we will take our business elsewhere. Ridiculous. See previous review to understand that this has been a continuous problem. It was my mistake giving this place a second chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lh3kJ5vX4ISEblFmmiwX_A.text: Lunch here the other day. It was so good. Tortillas homemade. Three salsas on the table ... well two salads and a bean dip. Hubby loved the beans.  They had a ton of gluten free options. I had carnitas and hubby had tacos. The part that stood out to me was that the beans and rice were not dried out. They were fresh on my plate.  They can do a few options without batter to accommodate other meals for gluten free.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4Vj_1RqbNKFDMKAl2CNLaA.text: I know I'm in the minority here but I just don't enjoy the food here.  We've tried this restaurant three times because it consistently gets such great reviews and it's close to my home, but each time I left wondering why I went there.  The service is inconsistent, last time we didn't get our guacamole until after our entrees arrived.    The descriptions of the food sound amazing but it fails to live up to the promise.  The chips, salsas and bean dip are really good, and the tortillas are hand made...so those are always a highlight.   The atmosphere is fun and both the inside and outside dining areas are very pretty.

2_bYcZGNt3GQcj9MWIQ5IQ.text: This place is probably my favorite when I want to splurge on good Mexican food. The only reason I say splurge is because their mojitos are to die for and I always get their El Molcajete with a cup of tortilla soup. It is certainly worth the price as it is an abundance of delicious food with the potential for left overs.  The only reason I give this place four stars is because there have been times when I have gone and my service hasn't been great. Usually they weren't during busy times and the majority of times I have been in for lunch or dinner, the service has been good.

KWXVDPk7tfJd22WlCpkBCQ.text: Friends raved about this place. I was unimpressed from the moment I walked in. Staff was rude and seemed uninterested in providing service. Food was even worse and was a solid 4 out of 10. Rice was over cooked, beans were hard, and chicken was dry and tasteless. Will not be back.

RPdpuWgcDb4CywMD31aJrg.text: Pretty standard Mexican fare, but the chips and guacamole and sooooooo good. The portions are pretty big and the prices aren't bad. Staff has been great and we haven't had a bad experience yet  We've been here twice, and it was great. We will keep coming back!!!

rMSk0NTTz0C13s1QbxeHwg.text: Love this place the cuisine is amazing and their staff is so friendly and happy. The margaritas are to die for and the Nacho appetizer is my favorite. Love the new renovations that were done to the waiting area. Overall it is a great family restaurant and love how you can now make reservations online so you don't have to wait long times until seated.

yy6lj7xfmFprudsIiGZ3xQ.text: Great food. Good atmosphere.  The lines speak for themselves. Haven't had a bad dish here yet.  Staff is super friendly and attentive.

6LrfWS2_0rtH2j2-09OLaA.text: So so disappointed... The music was big band, the menu seemed to have changed, one of our orders was wrong and the sauce tasted too strong, and my sons kids meal hamburger was burnt and half of the bun was rock hard. They did offer me another meal and I declined and they brought my son out a bean and cheese burrito.  Just so sad because we really used to love this place! The menu is so expensive for what you get and the food isn't even good.  They did try to make it right but just wasn't good. And it makes us sad cuz usually the food is good and reasonably priced. I think I'd rather go to Lindo Michoacan.

9JWuOKGZGxeyB-YluXtfbw.text: Glad to find a more authentic Mexican restaurant in the north side of las vegas. I  love the bean dip that comes with the chips. My favorites here are the cochinita pibil and the pazole. Took 1 star away because service seems to be hit and miss for us so far, and I think it depends on which side of the restaurant you are sitting at.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cochinita Pibil
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pazole

3KlqdUGtglaA4vol6JzxUA.text: I'm not one to give out five stars unless I feel a place earns it and honestly this is the best Mexican restaurant in town, considering this is the only Leticias in town. This isn't your typical chain restaurant.  The environment inside is very nice. Decor matches the obvious theme, the lighting is at a slight dim and the bar has a sort of cantina look to it. Every time I've been the staff has always been pleasant and personable, always willing to strike up conversation besides the typical "What can I get for you?" routine.  The first thing they bring out are tortilla chips made in house, along with bean dip, verde salsa and a black salsa. The chips and dips are so good that you can get full from eating so many, they are that delicious. They have a crisp airy taste and taste like they just finished making them. When I say the chips are baked in-house, you can genuinely taste that they are. Amazing way to start a meal.  My first visit there I ordered the Milanesa and man was I blown away. Everything seemed to be cooked perfectly. The portions are huge so unless you come with an appetite plan on leftovers. My second visit I ordered the quesa shrimp tacos and just when I thought their food couldn't get better these tacos proved me wrong. The only way I can describe their food is to let your taste buds do all the talking for me. I decided to try out their dessert and their tres leches is delicious. I was given complimentary coffee with it which was an amazing gesture in my book. Be sure to check in as sometimes you'll get a free treat to top your meal!  Overall, this place takes the cake when it comes to Mexican dining. Prices can get a tad steep but I'm okay for paying a little more when the food is well worth it. A++ in my book.

o00jLIYvHInd6q0_pzKMkg.text: Amazing!  Great Service just moved to Las Vegs looking for a Mexican place to eat and I give it a thumbs up! Food was good especially the Elote, our servers were super Nice! Great place to Dine

8imyXgKvGLu7JyyPo9lUmw.text: Came here because of the good reviews... Was not impressed. The food was okay... The service was okay... The location is nice. Will I be back anytime soon? No. I'll probably just stick with authentic places on the east side of town...

h3p-efDCTx4OBruP_r6qSw.text: We love this restaurant! The owner is wonderful and the food is so authentic and delicious! We need more local restaurants like this.

Q-azpB1H0ktSEHTi9eAqlg.text: Our car club made a trip up to the orchard and decided to eat here for lunch. We had 20 people and they were able to accommodate us very easily!  The chips and salsa were excellent and the food was so hot and fresh!  Our server took great care of us with ease. I will definitely come back and recommend them to my friends!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ldDU1jrxETKQKdZ7STGzaQ.text: Oh, wow.  Where to begin?  We saw this place on Cooking Channel's "Best in Chow."  My son and I were out and about and I decided to check the place out.  I always like to try the local eateries highlighted on TV.  The tacos she won with were the Quesa Tacos.  From their menu:  QuesaTacos wrapped in a blend of melted Oaxaca cheese, stuffed with our grilled shrimp cooked in Leticia's Abuelo sauce "Mild, Medium or Spicy" your choice of tortillas and topped with our chipotle cream sauce, served with our Poblano white Rice Casserole with crema, cheese and rajas, Additional filling choices of gilled Chicken, shredded Beef, Carne Asada, Carnitas, Birria, Chicken Tinga or any Sauteed Vegetables.  I had two original shrimp tacos.  My son had regular tacos: two Al pastor and two Birria (goat).  I gave him one of mine and took one of his birria.  FMR, they were delicious.  The Quesa Taco was superior, and the birria was tender and sweet.  When we sat down, we were brought chips and three bowls of dips: one fire-roasted salsa, one bean dip, and one an avocado-tomatillo sauce.  Excellent.  Even the beans and rice which accompanied my taco plate were spiced and cheesed.  I've never had rice in a Mexican restaurant as flavorful.  This place is in the extreme northwest, about 45 minutes drive from my house, but the drive was well worth the trip.  In a word: go.  In two words: go now!

OvrlNVwJe_OINbS0D7CHjg.text: The food is definitely good,  and of good quality,  but the service is lacking a bit, don't get me wrong the waiter's and waitresses are very nice, but they are helping way too many tables at a time, so you hardly see them, and they take forever to come out with your food,  I can understand that the kitchen is backed up,  but it's always that way.  They need to hire more staff.

XxICTzRZ01eJkVDtMDJYtA.text: Authentic Mexican pleasure all around. Today I had fish tacos and they were amazing. My husband looks like he's in heaven as he's eating his pozole. You must try this place. It's our FAVORITE for margaritas and Mexican food.

rLqf-Xs3G_6-xSk3vHEUOg.text: I had heard rave reviews about this spot, so thought I'd surprise my hubby with a new place. Got there a little earlier than their 11:00 opening time, and so we walked around the little shops until just a few minutes before 11:00. As we were standing at the front door, I looked again at the open times sign, and there was a tiny (german) cockroach actually crawling between the glass and the sign INSIDE! Needless to say, we high tailed it without going in.. If there is a cockroach that usually hides from the light in full sight on the door, I can only imagine what's inside!

MxljxT9OsaOmppM0tv2mcw.text: I'd like to comment on the food, but for the second time in a row, they are closed before their posted time. This evening however, not only are they closed early, but their open sign was on and when we came to the door she told us they were closed. When I commented that the sign was on and the posted times said midnight, she proceeded to turn the sign off and slam the closed sign down. 5 paying customers....apparently, things are going so well, they don't need our business.  And we've eaten here before. The food was great and this time we brought newbies to try it out. Guess they'll never know.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1J2KcXUjG-2CEEQSZl1YoQ.text: Possibly the best Mexican food near me! We all love this place and visit regularly. Amazing drinks, many choices on salsas, lots of flavor... We've never had a bad experience there, and we go quite often!

DJwuOH0sIy-7jaBP9Sff2Q.text: This used to be one of the top Mexican restaurants in town. No more. Went last week, ordered a taco salad and was told they had no ground beef. Went back on Thursday, ordered the cheese enchiladas and the cheese was cod, not even melted. We've noticed this decline for several months and have finally decided it's time to try other Mexican restaurants. This place just isn't good any more

jTmGpVNLSvKltZ1jwyoRwA.text: I went here on September 14th for dinner with my family, my mom joined us and this was her 1st time dining at Leticia's.  Our server was Ramiro and he was very good.  The food was good and it was a nice atmosphere for a family gathering.

Y4vv9F2u1aYvam5cDJTbYw.text: Great food, service, and company.  Highly recommend for mexican food.  Comfortable for kids, too!

RF3OS_Nd8JpXNjUNAYol8g.text: This place is very different so you have to throw out your typical Mexican expectations.  Once you do that, the food is delish!  Awesome margaritas.  Love the tortilla soup and hubs is a big fan of the build your own burrito.

qdTmRcALbe2QZq3m-LelbQ.text: Nice restaurant, comfortable outdoor seating, very good service.  I liked this place, I would definitely come back for a drink and some chips and salsa.  My problem with it tough; is the prices.   Not that it's wildly expensive, but I ended up paying around $15 per entree, for the same Mexican food I'd get at a mom and pop shop for like $6.  Go for the atmosphere, not a quick fix to satisfy a Mexican food craving.

IQGiWrnoLNg0pP5t1wCXOw.text: Great food, great customer service, all you need to bring is your self and  company. They will take care the rest.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No words can explain

DBahnzCfth7yTMj8APJ1hA.text: This is one of my all time favorite restaurants. Food is always amazing. I'm partial to the shrimp quesa tacos. Heavenly! Every entree I have tried is amazing. Great serving staff. Always willing to help. We are a very low maintenance family but they always go above and beyond. We eat here several times a month. Always a great experience. When we have friends in from out of town, we bring them here for a unique Las Vegas dining experience. No chains for us!

_0Nq70IwM_TtYDLTLcl3zA.text: We eat here often for lunch. Everything is just delicious. I love the chicken dishes. My husband likes the pork and beef. The salsas are so good with the hot chips.  The service is best. Prices are good too. We like bringing our family here for special occasions.

347evrxSbSwFqNEIVm1IDQ.text: Amazing food, ambiance and fabulous service... worth every penny!! Our new fav! We will be dining here often.

O_I2AioY4StTUA4NlQKegA.text: We have been going here for a while, food is always good if you stick with the traditional stuff, a little pricey but a great neighborhood place to visit.

gFE4dq2_xqx2aWX9tyuiNA.text: Been there a couple of times, it's just ok. Nothing extraordinary. Their margaritas are good and they are in my neighborhood. To be honest I would rather drive to another neighborhood to have something better.

jykQP4H2mslum_C4cQVpFw.text: SMH!!!!! I know it's Cinco de Mayo but wait for food was ridiculous.  We get it not mad at the staff but when you wait this long and the food is below average still Shaking my head!!! Been here before and I remember it was good but tonight...NO NO NO Well at least I caught the back end of the young mariachi group. Not so happy Cinco de Mayo

K6m9vXhW0WCBrEQEmon9JQ.text: I was very excited to try this place. My friends have raved about it. The food was pretty good , I tried the puffy tacos with chorizo and chile verde, very good. The service on the other hand, was horrible. Having worked. The service industry( ok Dairy Queen ) I appreciate good service . I am diabetic.. The waitress came within 10 minutes which was fine.. and I was sitting outside. But I felt like I was ignored. But as soon as I went in another 15 minutes later I was promptly served my drink and chips and salsa. I would recommend hiring busboys.. or maybe you have them. Anyway, service is big to me , so  disappointing,  I won't be back .

qsrVNV0Z8WGHd6mdvSImzw.text: I have lived in Las Vegas for over 13 years and have yet to find any Mexican restaurant to come close to this establishment.  For starters the owners are wonderful people.  The food is absolutely spot on every time flawless and as authentic as you can get.  Nothing on the strip or anywhere else in Vegas comes close.  I travel to San Diego for business and I visit a section of the city called old town. It's filled with Mexican restaurants and cafes and none of them come close to this.  How sad to be so close to the Mexican boarder yet we have better Mexican food in Las Vegas.  Try this place once and you'll be addicted just as I have been since the day they opened.

QnUzdkDngSrWo55NZfjBnA.text: Our favorite Mexican food place HANDS DOWN!!! Being here is like dining at an authentic Mexican restaurant in Rosarito!! All the staff is friendly, expedient, and the food is to die for .

vJTYwHIrpoXk6mpMNwHjvg.text: Laticia's is a place built around comfortability. From the moment you walk in you are embraced with an ineffable sense of home and heart. The staff, no matter how busy, goes out of their way to let you know you are noticed and appreciated.   That sense of comfort translates over to the food,  where your party will be greeted not with the typical dry chip and bland salsa affair, but a hearty trio of red and green sauces, along with a surprisingly filling bean dip. My first time here I gorged myself so heavily on the preamble that I had to take my main course to go without tasting it!  The food comes out in the traditional large portions you'd expect and this leads to an occasional problem of saltiness or slightly dry meat,  but i have never once left anything other than satisfied.   P.s the spicy crab guacamole is a spicy food lovers dream.

sC2-xZ1exmjS5OEazm7X4A.text: We used to love this place, and for years would have rated it 5 stars. Recently it has unfortunately changed for the worse. The food hasn't changed too much, but the service has gone down hill. There used to be a guy named Gustavo (if I remember correctly) he was awesome, and a really nice hostess, But I don't remember her name. Since they left everything changed. We have given the restaurant many chances, but we probably won't be back.

tJOXqz8OgLex_hhUXcdCzg.text: So I decided to take my family here for lunch for the first time on a Saturday afternoon was greeted and sat at a table promptly, was brought the tradition chips salsa beans and avocado sauce, all the 3 were good.  So we order our appetizer shrimp cocktail pretty decent and our meals, cocktail came out first as it was suppose to then this is where we ran into the PROBLEM. my wife and sons food came out and I was told mine was to come out in a second, so I sat their patiently until it arrived 20 min later. After my family was done eating.  So I had them box it up and took it home.  We did not receive any apologies or anything.  I will try to go back 1 more time, I understand accidents happen. 1/21/16

1ixdDUYanrCd_yYJ1ta6Gg.text: Very disappointed with the service. I rarely go out to eat Mexican food but today I was craving Menudo. We were seated right away at a booth right by the bar. The waitress asked what we wanted to drink since we didn't know she brought us water. Upon her return with the waters we told her we wanted a cafe de la olla and a cafe con leche. I was in the middle of asking her what the different bowl sizes were when she interrupted me to tell me she would be right back because she wanted to put in our coffee order because it would take about 10 min to make. She left and it took her a while to come back. She came back because I flagged her down because I wanted to give her our food order. My sister and I ordered enchiladas and a small menudo. We waited a while and she finally brought our food out. She asked how everything looked and I said it was ok but we still needed our coffee. She left to check on them and after a few minutes she came back and told us that she had forgotten to put our order in and that they would take a while more to come out. Our coffee finally came out by the time we were almost done eating the menudo tasted old by the way. We sat at our booth finished our coffee and the waitress never came back. Finally after a long wait I flagged her down and asked for our check. That took a long time to get when she finally brought it to me I handed her my credit card without looking at the check. This woman walked all over the place with my check and card and I had to wait a very long time just to pay. I finally got up and walked over to her and told her I needed to leave and that she needed to run my card and give me by receipt and card back. I have been here before and I have never seen a waitress that is this disorganized she is too busy yapping and sticking her nose in other customers conversations. She did not charge us for our coffee but I would have rather she put in the order when she said she would that way we could have had our drinks with our meals. The restaurant was not busy when we got there and our order was easy. I just don't know why this waitress can focus.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complementary chips and salsa

BxM32I5mdjmcrpJeBaCX7Q.text: Fredy (Saul) and Tony were really good waiters. They gave us free sopapillas for my friends birthday! And they gave her the option of wearing the charro hat, which of course she did! Awesome food too!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8Qf1RnTJO0CBwD3bk9nrCw.text: My partner saw the head chef on a local #LasVegas tv show and wanted to try it.  Since then we have been twice. Great meal both times! I have had the shrimp diablo, bacon wrapped shrimp tossed in a spicy tomato sauce. YUM! Bacon and shrimp...come on people. Magic. Homemade guac! Delish! Pozole - Hell yessss! The only thing I have had here that I have not loved was the shrimp ceviche. Kinda meh. Everything else! perfect!

7VWKgCgt46RoWglveJ8GxA.text: It doesn't hurt that it's a mile from our home (actually that's probably a good thing considering the margarita situation), but Leticia's is one of those local gems of LV. Everything we've had here is excellent. Be careful with the spice... It can creep up on you. BUT. It's obvious from the mouthfeel of the spicy food that they use extremely fresh ingredients (habanero, green chilis, etc). Maury is our favorite bartender (we normally go in the middle of the week). If you're going in the evening, plan to get there early as there is usually a wait.

hJpsTdWVjJE1By3VtALDWw.text: Loved the salsa and chips. Shredded beef enchilada preferred over the chicken one. I followed a yelp suggestion.

uOi0geXHsJ18UKTRF2Ikvw.text: I loved in southern Mexico for two years eating in the homes of the locals. The pazole was very authentic and took my right back to the dirt roads. Definitely will come back to try more of the menu. I wish they had a sopa de lentejas con res Y guineo.

4g4s3eDoxUEBc15dReeUHw.text: This is a local fav of the area. Some items on the menu are a hit or miss. Chips and salsa/beans/ tomatillo salsa are also great. Atmosphere in bar area is pretty and relaxing. I recommend making a reservation on nights and weekends, they get pretty busy with wait times around 20-40 min. Definitely recommend this a place to try for yourself!

w_uu4JQ6AAqj5qh_yW2Ocg.text: Every time we visit Vegas from Hawaii, we dine here. The place is the dope for authentic Mexican food. From 3 salsas w your chips to killer everything else. Fish Tacos & Shrimp Fajitas are stand outs! Can't wait to return!!

ChYA-f2TrRKAVwoBHX-fOA.text: I was craving birria at lunch & didn't wish go to usual spots for it.  Its an upscale restaurant w authentic food that isn't watered down or Americanized. Their chips come with  homemade salsas that are outstanding.. avocado & fire roasted  are standouts. I wanted something w some more heat & my server Natalie suggested the homemade habaneros salsa, which filled my desire. Its not on their menu and they have something else also w more heat, the habaneros did it for me.  The birria came w rice beans & tortillas, the meat was was wonderfully seasoned & tasty w no bone or fat w the tasty gravy. I want to experience the rest of their menu because it was the birria was perfect, easily the best I've had it cooked. My server Natalie was on top of every need or request  as well the others on her team.. Definitely will explore their cuisine again.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade salsas
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birria lunch size

LCDA2AVdXMe3khqTM7RyXA.text: We LOVED Cantina Laredo before it became Leticia's so we were hoping for the same wonderful Mexican food.  It started out quite well with tasty salsa and bean dip but the goodness ended there.  My husband and I ordered the chicken fajitas.  Ugh!!! Worst fajitas ever!!  They arrived on the usual black grill plate only they weren't steaming....lukewarm at best in a soupy juice of zucchini and tiny little bits of "cooked chicken" not even grilled.  It reminded me of the chicken you get in chow mein.  There was absolutely no Mexican flavor.  We were so disappointed and will not be returning.

N6DYu1f_zI8GyJxvKauNhQ.text: I felt the food was good but I didn't like the service and the constant sweeping near our table. The service wasn't good at all. Waitress was rushed and I felt like I was bothering her for asking for napkins which we didn't have.   I will continue to order" to go" so I can relax in my home without the hustle and bustle atmosphere and lack luster service.

BFEXcXg_CcPpEcFlakOAag.text: Stopped in on a whim and was blown away! This place is so good. All the food is so fresh and delicious. Their chips are awesome and three dips are amazing. I'm so glad we stopped here accidentally, we picked out.

wKwtXs9hCoScvcOXFevsCg.text: First visit here I was very impressed.  Everything we had was great. Especially loved the Juan Julio margarita.  Subsequent visit were very disappointing.  Service declined, and food became very salty.  The second we were there, something I ate immediately made me want to throw up.  Couldn't finish the meal and had to leave.

lryTesLdBV4a1rhTCy_dDA.text: - The Skinny:  Food Quality: 5 Stars -  Real Mexican food in Vegas! Tried the following with my family:  El Molcajete (Mexican style Fajitas) - Grilled Carne Asada, or Chicken (you can add chicken), Tiger Prawn Shrimp, seasoned grilled nopales (Mexican Cactus) served sizzling in a molcajete salsa Ranchera , chile & onion toreados, Queso Oaxaca. Served with mexican rice, guacamole, pico de gallo and choice of tortillas. We had the carne asada & added Chorizo.   Tasty! But not as much meat as other places. A little spicy if you are sensitive. Chorizo was pretty salty. My wife used the left overs to make eggs the next day, sooo good!!   Enchiladas Del Mar (Seafood Enchiladas) - Shrimp And/Or fish in Leticia's white Cream and Cheese sauce or Chile de Arbol spicy sauce. Served with a Poblano white Rice Casserole with crema, cheese and rajas.   This was really good and different take on a Mexican classic!   Pozole -  tender beef and pork, slowly cooked with a blend of red guajillo sauce and Leticia's special spices and hominy. Served traditionally with a side of tostaditas, lime, chopped onions, cilantro, chopped lettuce, radishes, oregano, crushed chile and avocad (Chicken Pozole also available).  I didn't try it but my brother enjoyed it.  Quesadilla - Large flour tortillas with house blend of Oaxaca melted cheese, served with guacamole, pico de gallo and sour cream.  There was A LOT of cheese in these, easily shared by 2 people. Well made and tasty.   The table Chips, Salsa, and beans were really good too!  Drinks: 5 Stars - The Mango "Agua Fresca" (Fresh Fruit Water) is AMAZING!! The Horchata was also good with a little creamy instead of watery taste most other places have.    Pricing: 5 Stars - What you would pay at most sit down Mexican spots. Good portions!   Service: 4 Stars - Nice, friendly, attentive, they do a good job! There was a bit of a wait.  Atmosphere: 5 Stars - Really liked the decor of this place, they really have a that Mexican culture feel. Even the Caucasian host was in a traditional dress!    Comfort: 5 Stars - Plenty of seating, comfortable seats and tables.   Location: 5 Stars  Plenty of parking in that area, easy seen from the road and simple to get to.   - The Fat:   Went out to eat with my brother and his family. Only my sister in law had been there and she loved the place. We weren't convinced though because not to offend, but she's a white girl and were all Mexican (our parents were born/raised in Mexico) so we have more a say so on Mexican food ;)     We really had a hard time deciding on what to get cause the whole menu looks delicious! We were pleasantly surprised by the food. My wife and I love "Molcajete" but it's hard to find a good one, none the less, a place that even serves it! there is a lot of "soup" in the molcajete bowl so my wife used the left overs to make eggs the next day, sooo good!!  I really enjoy the "Enchiladas Del Mar" and would get that next time. The Mango drink is to die for! If you want a different Mexican food experience far from the usual sit down Mex chains, go here!

BuCxwc6nMO8m6ka6fAMGFQ.text: Absolutely love it here. The food and staff are always wonderful. Luciano is the best server we have ever gotten there, he's great! I 100% recommend it here but it's always best to make a reservation because it gets busy. Although I don't  mind waiting for a table because the food is always delish! Their chips and salsa are the best in town! Check it out you will not be disappointed. Thank you Letecias for a wonderful dinner last night!

4ntuXC4Tl6BaiNMj4iq9Rw.text: I had been wanting to try Leticia's since I moved here in March. I was wishing I could give them 4 or 5 stars, but I wasn't impressed with the food at all. I ordered the fish tacos, while my hubby got the shrimp cocktail to start with the Chile rellenos. The shrimp tasted a little too fishy and not very fresh. The rellenos were good and seasoned well. My tacos were ok, just ok. I did like the variety of salsas and tasted great. I do have to say the customer service was excellent.

wITHeH7A0K8CKUGHySliTA.text: Went here because the bf loves Mexican food so we wanted to check this place out.   When I checked in I was happy to see the yelp deal which was $15 for $25.   The service was really good, we got our drink orders placed as soon as we sat down and got a basket of the delicious tortilla chips. Oh man, those were prob the best tortilla chips I've had in Vegas. We had to have our basket refilled twice. :P  I got the chile verde which is a green chile sauce stew with pork and potatoes. Seriously so delicious and tasty. The pork was full of flavor and tasted really marinated. The dish came with a side of beans, rice, and flour.   My bf got the carne asada burrito and that too had really tasty meat.   When we got the check we were happy to see that there was nothing to pay apparently the yelp deal covered it!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile Verde
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile Verde

PSYzvqHRDfRSCHtGywVLtA.text: My daughter recently told us about this jewel in the desert. We've lived here for 19 years and have searched for a GREAT Mexican restaurant since moving here. It is located in the far northwest of the valley, but luckily we live within 10 minutes away.  We dined here last night and it was everything I had hoped for.  We were seated right away, and we had our drink orders and chips served almost immediately. Our food server (waitress)  was wonderful, the margarita's were delicious and the chips/salsas/bean dip were freshly made (a bean dip, a smoky mild salsa, and a guacamole/cilantro smooth dip). When the meal arrived, I knew before even taking the first bite, that it would be great. And it was.  We both ordered the shredded chicken enchilada's with Ranchera sauce (they offer other flavor sauces but we have been looking for Ranchera sauce with enchilada's for as long as we have searched for a restaurant.)  Our rice (Mexican rice) and refried beans were very tasty with a lot of good flavorings.   The quaint little street the restaurant is located is designed beautifully, and the interior decor was very nice, and colorful. We will definitely be coming back.

ZTgVxiKB_ZlLFh6EIwrA_w.text: Food is fabulous!!! Almost as good as my moms... The flavors from home. The service is always excellent!!

OADmIyJ2oAa6RS85cHDw6w.text: Tried this place for a second time and the service again was poor. Drink orders and food took a long time to come out. The food was good but by the time it came out we were all tired of sitting there. I'd stick with only so-so and would certainly prefer to go somewhere else.

E3WjlvX3b7vTcacejDD4UQ.text: I can assure you that there are much better places to eat Mexican food. I can also assure you that there are places with much better service and real authentic food. It's too pricey for its service and variety. It took them about 45 minutes to bring out the food my family orderd and when they finally did bring the food it turned they didn't have what I had asked for and asked me if I would order something else witch took a another 20 minutes to bring out. The quality of the food was good but this is not authentic Mexican food. (I'm Mexican) If you want 5 star service and real authentic Mexican food go to "The Original Lindo Michoacan." If you don't have a better experience I'll have to bite my own finger off.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The only thing that would make the food look good is the fact that i took it with my iPhone 6+. Lol

AY93dntUeWpMnq3ukkQvJA.text: We stopped by again for Leticia's 1-year anniversary, and this time she had the street closed off block party style. Food and fun for the whole family!  There were fun and games for the kids, a mexican candy tent, alcohol tent for the adults, and tasty food by Leticia and her team. All kinds of entertainment filled the night. From Zumba dancers, line dancing, and some cultural entertainment from Rancho High School Ballet Folklorico, and Chapparal High School's Mariachi Band. Another group was planning to play Rock en Espanol, but it was getting late, and we bailed when they were dealing with sound check issues. all in all, a good night out with the wife.  Congrats on 1 year Leticia! May you be around for many more years to come, and hopefully take over all the Lindo locations in Vegas.....ALOHA!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

djb5XTDW1lHBnTV4gXtYaA.text: So so good! We were wandering through the Centennial area and found this awesome restaurant near the freeway exit. We didn't know what to get but our server Rigelio was very very helpful. We got the enchiladas and that you build your own burrito. The cream sauce and the Tinga chicken burrito was delish! I also got the burrito half mole and half cheese cream sauce, enchilada style which was good so I could try two sauces. I live in central Las Vegas but believe me I will be back with more people to try this place :)

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own burrito

6azLZfuFpb-assx5I22YUA.text: We eat here all the time. My favorites are the pozole (either one), and the empanadas (chicken tinga or beef). The bacon wrapped shrimp & the ribeye are also super good. My favorite desserts are the fried ice cream & the churro. Yum! A little pricier than some Mexican restaurants & although I love the salsa, the chips are just ok. That's why it's a 4 star & not a 5 star.

Cf4X5_dVM90qSaa9XSwxMg.text: I used to love this place. The last 2 years its gone down hill. Service is horrible. We always order the El Molcajete which is AMAZING when it's made right! I always share this dish with my husband and we ALWAYS ask for extra cheese. This last visit it was missing the cactus and Xtra cheese. I informed our waitress and she was very apologetic so that made it better, all was forgiven. Then a lady came over and  stuck a plate of cheese in my face. This RUDE lady was the manager, she felt like she needed to give me a lesson about the types of cheese and informed me I asked for the wrong cheese. We never even got extra cheese so not sure what she was talking about. By this time I was finished eating, she ruined my night. I asked for extra cheese inside the dish so it was hot and melted when it was served, which the waitress understood but I guess it was miscomunicated to the kithen. I've never been so insulted. We won't be back.

aOC55hhOCRPpOQvyfHC_Lw.text: Great Mexican food, and always  great margaritas, Good times with the festival's and party's they put on, Gaming at the bar & close to home. This is a great spot for fun & great Mexican food!!

8QIEKlBPD0X1isd5gOa21w.text: Best Mexican food in town. If you are looking for a deal, their happy hour from 4-6pm is great, too.

HFoK-1-UIIrYE0BMlpB0eA.text: Ok I dunno what's happening but this place service wise is going down. Appetizers are ordered to eat before you get your meal not at the same time or mins before. It would also be nice if someone would come by to see if you need a water refill or more salsa. The owners would come by no matter how busy it was to see if everything was fine. Now its get in eat and get out.  So sad. Sometimes it's not always about quality food

x0lRYS0IfINbmK5NPO-b4Q.text: The service is always the best and the food is delish! Fresh ingredients you can taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Eye Tacos!

n4HN7RADmS7Fed9J3y7Aog.text: I love this place. Best salsas, margarita menu is pretty good, food is delicious, atmosphere has a very authentic Mexican feel. I eat here all the time!

n3g_kAjF00antV9cw9g6ow.text: The salsas are ok needs a little more flavor but the different options are good. I asked for a spicy margarita I was at the bar and asked the bartender he said he can make one. All he did was make a lime margarita and chopped up jalapenos and put them in there. It was terrible I couldn't finish the drink. The rest of the food was good. The service sucked I had to keep reminding the server of things I asked for and needed. Not to mention I never got a refill on my drink until I was paying the check.

F9rWbFx0n2WS7NcV4Y5pCw.text: Though the service is very good, and owner, Gus, is a great guy, this place is a "Rich Man's" Taco Bell.  Food is very, very Gringo. That would explain why there is always a wait, and why you won't find one real Mexican eating there.   Portions are large, but so is the price. It is way over priced for Mexican Food.   Quality is just ok.   I have a friend who is obsessed with the place, so I will go back if "he's buying".  I did take my neice and nephew, from Korea, who never ate Mexican Food. Gus was nice enough to spice up their food, and they did like the Carne Asada Soft Tacos.  So, if 'it's someone who's never eaten Mexican Food, sure.   If you want quality and value for your dollar, go to an authenic Hole in the Wall.

i17EAExgx-hp_SX5Rvy5cA.text: We were pleasantly surprised by how flavorful the Mexican food was here and wait staff were friendly and attentive.  The bar area is great if you want to avoid children but it can get noisy which is a problem if you actually want to hear what your dining companions are saying.  Next time we will ask to be seated near the windows or outside.  We really liked the Happy Hour menu choices.  As we were leaving we noticed that there was a quite a few people waiting to be seated (in the middle of the week).

Cvs0EjJgjSltcpqVrKfRzw.text: I would give 0 stars if possible. What a ripoff. My sister and friends are regulars here and always talk about how amazing it is, so I was really looking forward to eating what I thought would be good Mexican food. We decided to order takeout on Sunday and were shocked at the poor quality of the food as well as ridiculous prices, which did not match the listed prices online. An order of 3 queso carne asada tacos, guacamole, french fries (for my nephew), and one lemonade ended up costing $68.  That would have been fine if the food was gourmet-level, authentic Mexican food but it tasted like Roberto's. If I wanted to eat subpar, greasy food I would have just gone there and paid their prices. One of our orders was supposed to sub a side salad for beans but the order included the beans with no salad in sight. The boxes had no markings to distinguish the spicy tacos from the mild. A few bites in, my cousin bit into a hair baked into her food so everybody was grossed out and that dish had to be thrown out.   We also notified one of the staff that the prices aren't accurate on their online menu and he said that they already had 3 complaints about that earlier that day. Seems like they should either honor those prices or change their online menu so diners aren't in for a nasty surprise. The food was cold when we picked it up and they were very stingy with the condiments. When we asked for salsa, we were given a miniature to-go sauce container and told that if we wanted more it would be an additional $5. Don't order take-out from here unless you want to be nickel and dimed for every little thing.  The restaurant itself looks cute and has a nice atmosphere but the experience of ordering take-out was so frustrating and unpleasant that I will not be returning to dine in. I don't know if they had an off night or whether this is a common occurrence but that entire experience was completely unacceptable.

iw2GXvqZ-RHX2kIVn358tg.text: The food was good, the service was very attentive. Enjoyed the atmosphere and the bountiful servings. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Even the drinks were refreshing. All-in-all, I'd come here again and bring more people to enjoy their wonderful offerings!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good food. Carne Asada burrito w/rice and refried beans.

T-Mh78kDVn2f-VXPtDqb6w.text: First time here... Long line on a Friday night, but they seated us within minutes. Place was packed!! Luciano was our waiter and we absolutely loved him!!! He wouldn't let me order just any old dish., instead he recommended something way better. We are definitely coming back as long as Luciano is our waiter!!!

daqk32b4RzyzkQjtZUDclw.text: Decent food. Not great service. Very expensive. Look to spend at least $120 for 4 people. Also always seem to be out of a lot of items.

XdrZRyO2MiwdLVZY1VMKug.text: I don't like thus place. The best thing on the menu is the free salsa and margaritas. I've been here 3 times and I have tried 3 different dry tasteless renditions of Mexican cuisine. I would have never going back after the first time however my husband likes to please. However after this last time I refuse to go back. My burrito was cold I did not like the sauce on top. It also seems as if the food has been sitting under a heat light and drying out. Worst meal ever. The service sucks after a long wait for my order the least a server can do is refill my water. But I guess that's asking for too much.
