qx_mMMaQMGeu6Q35Sljiow.text: Fantastic food as always! And great waiter.  But the front hostesses need to pay better attention to how long patrons are waiting. For just 2 people - took over 2 hours for dinner!  Told us about a 15 minute wait. 45 minutes later asked how much longer.  All I got was a "woops".  Even though food is great, won't go back. Front staff really needs to be much better.

8c4_xGDIpcmgw4bFtDuxCQ.text: This is sad Mexican food, I feel bad for the people who have to eat this, or choose too.

ujWHkaI-a6u6AarEDQNuaw.text: Love the food, have been here many times.  Lighting could be a little brighter since the menus are a parchment color with fine print.

evnY_uzbA5ljbBA52I_LbQ.text: Wonderful and attentive service!  We usually don't eat Mexican food out of our own area very often because we have so many fabulous places in our town, but we didn't want to eat at McDonald's.  This place was pretty authentic and though it had a different flavor then we are used too, we enjoyed the food.  Would definitely recommend it and  would like to try there award winning margaritas on another trip where we didn't have to drive afterwards

hoB6xwIwO_Fn_ULb8Sx99g.text: Best Mexican food in town!   Ice cold beer, great margaritas and amazing appetizers.  We've been going here regularly since it opened. We've had a couple times in 5 years an order came out not to our liking and they've either fixed it, replaced it or refunded it without hesitation.  There's often a wait (for good reason) but it's worth it.  Don't look for ground beef and yellow cheese here. The authentic recipes come with queso and shredded beef.  They make a rice with green chile's and cheese that's to die for!  Yummy!  Given a choice by the family I always choose Letecias.  Quite honestly, I would have given it 5 stars but the servers are hit and miss.  There are a few there, Luciano and Amy for example,  that are exemplary.   But others are only mediocre in there attention and service at times so for that I took off a star.

zEYW_rubsL2cePg2AIHHCA.text: The customer service here totally rocks! We had a super nice waitress.  The servers and the bus boys work well together.  Chips, salsa, beans, drinks, never went empty! They were totally on top of it.    I had the famous shrimp tacos.  It's grilled cheese/shrimp in 2 corn tortillas.  Pretty tasty.  I felt like the food was better than average, but the service here was so great, they're getting 5 stars.

EAHjNZTBHTATA_JXYFIpzA.text: Great food, atmosphere and the flavors of homemade.  The staff is attentive and friendly.      I had the shredded chicken enchiladas with the white sauce. Hands down the best white sauce I've tasted.  Oh and we can't forget the great Margaritas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i32J6-YbFTnINDLai1HuPw.text: Excellent. The norman Rockwell location is delicious. KENDRA THE bartender is the best. Her skills are A+

8q8cWGGgQCsuMALbap060g.text: Leticia's is my go to Mexican restaurant when I'm in north Vegas. I typically try to get new things but I can't bring myself to break away from their tacos. The taco I get is a quesa taco which is stuffed with cheese I either get the  carne asada or  shrimp. They are sooo good! It took me a while to get used to the rice that comes with the taco plate because it isn't your usual Spanish rice. It has cheese in it and some type of pepper in it. The first time I got it I really needed to look because it was so dark in the restaurant . It is different but it is tasty!  The guacamole is also a nice size for the price you pay.   The service is attentive and quick. They will fill up our chips or drinks before we have to ask. It's a great spot to sit and relax while getting a bite to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada quesa tacos

sUzmYPdqZL-YlrQjgFcVsg.text: I only go during happy hour because it's amazing. They make great margaritas and food is always good. I find the service tends to be better if you just sit at the bar!

5sgwv5qdqbb8GT6aNOebOg.text: I've been to this place a few times know, it's a 45 min drive for me.  I wish they would open one near southwest.  The food is amazing the service is incredibly friendly.  If it wasn't very hot we would have sat in the patio.

jw9RI6pAtVtiIMO2GPk1ew.text: Awsome Food. We have never been here  before so we didn't know what to expect. We both tried a dish that looked totally different from what we used to. The Fajitas presentation alone was impressive. They tasted as good as the presentation was ! I was surprised also with my Burrito. Very tender and mouthwatering. We will be back.

RrpSHQ9aZau_PkMoCDZehg.text: I'm not sure what happened. The first couple of times I've been here, I loved the food. Now the past two times I've been here I don't feel like it was worth what I paid for. I feel like the food is almost losing its authenticity. My family and I don't even finish our food there anymore, we just take the rest to go and don't even touch it anymore. The wait time has gotten ridiculous too. They just stuff you with chips and dip until your food comes hoping you don't notice how long you've been waiting.

R6knD3znmnprAaH5Y_C76A.text: Fantastic, service, amazing and creative Mexican food that tastes authentic. Fresh made tortilla rolls.  This is the place to go for good quality Mexican food.  Lived all over town and by far this is my favorite.

WX7_O5f25i-tV1RDz1AUFQ.text: In our current time and culture full of negativity, this place always lifts our spirits! Tara makes a BOMB La Plaza Fresca and the kitchen is so consistent! We love the patio when it's nice out and the bar when there is a game on. It's great for families, couples, or just on your own; we have experienced all three and each is great! Come try it now! Don't forget to ask for Tara in the bar!!! She will make you smile then make you an amazing drink...Every. Time.

jWj7CNcT_r3AHDwz0q35nw.text: This used to be our favorite Mexican restaurant.  While we used to love it everything started going downhill ... the service, the quality of food and especially the cleanliness.   When you can see cockroaches in the restaurant one can only expect them in the kitchen as well.    We did try a few times but nothing ever got better.  It only seemed to get worse.   We no longer choose Leticias

IYgFBiW5ky41d9UfG0B2tw.text: Leticia's.....My go to "sit down" Mexican restaurant in the NW.  A True dining gem and one..knowing what I know now..would drive from any of the three other points of the valley to visit.  Parking has never been an issue.  That being said depending on when you arrive,  the wait could be an issue.  My advise is be prepared as the inside and outside waiting area's are small.  You could opt for a seat in the bar to wait or dine.  But is you have to wait..where ever that might be..hang in there because it it all worth it.  The inside of LMC is full of character and when you are eventually seated, creates a vibe where you can focus on your family and drown everything else out.  The chips, salsa, and bean dip are divine.  Many a visit I have sabotaged myself.  DON'T DO IT!  It might take you a few visits to learn this and STILL on my most recent visit I failed to heed my own advise.  BALANCE!  Don't spoil the meal with a belly full of this mana.  My personal favorites (so far) are as follows...  The Queso Fundiso, it's fun to say and fun to eat.  Make sure you add the fungus (mushrooms).  It's makes this gooey and cheesy combination with the delicious tortillas POP!  Next up is Leticia's award winning "Quesa Tacos."  This consists of a blend of melted cheeses cooked in a delicious sauce.  You can choose shrimp, chicken or beef, carne asada, or many other meats.  The beef and the shrimp have been my favorites.  You can control the heat of the meal to your liking.  The Pobalano rice is phenomenal!  On my last LMC adventure, I thought I would try something REALLY different.  "El Molcajete" is the prehistoric version of the popular flaming fajitas. Primal but even more delicious, it comes in a smoldering bowl which looks like it was made out of volcanic stone.  A slab of tender carne asada, cheese, ranchero sauce, with shrimp. There was also some greenery hanging off the side which I thought was poblano pepper.  WRONG! After looking at the website, it was a delicious piece of Mexican Cactus.  The Margarita's...............................You will just have to experience them yourself.  The service though one time or two seemed overtaxed.  But the other staff tries hard to fill in making the experience seamless.  When everything IS in sync, no one cane beat it's tasty and friendly efficiency.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El Molcajete
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cadillac!

2-v-h-udugkfGOHrVT_QcQ.text: "What do you feel like eating?" is probably the most difficult decision my bf and I ask each other all the time. Sometimes it takes us forever to come up with a decision, other times it doesn't. But thanks to Yelp, we found this place and both agreed on it right away.   Right away, our drinks arrived along with our chips and dip. Dip was beans, tomatillo sauce and a chipotle roasted salsa. All delish and packed with flavor. I don't usually like beans, but these were pretty good. The bf also put in an order of guacamole with crab. Their guacamole was also really good. It was thick and chunky with big pieces of crab on top.   Now for our main dishes. Since I was getting full from chips and dip, I opted for a cup of chicken tortilla soup and a side salad. My cup of soup was a huge serving for it being in a cup. It was ok, nothing special. It was a little on the salty side so I wasn't able to eat it all. I also got a side salad, which was AWFUL!! When it arrived at the table, there was so much cheese on it. Then I noticed the reason why it was covered in so much cheese was because the lettuce was old and wilted. I asked our server to just take it off the bill and she was shocked that my salad looked the way it did. She was nice about it and took it off. The bf's carne asada burrito was the highlight of the meal. The meat was so tender. Although the burrito was on the smaller side, it was packed with so much meat, cheese and beans that we both got full from it.   Definitely a good spot for Tex-Mex food! Since I live so far away, I doubt I'll be eating here any time again soon. If I'm in the area, this will definitely be a one of my options though.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole with crab
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tortilla soup
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada burrito

tVZNODRbFMkGgSE5byCHyg.text: I was stoked to try this place tonight after reading a lot of the good reviews and mainly pictures of food that looked really good.  Unfortunately the experience went bad pretty quickly for us.  We showed up around 4pm on a Saturday night, nobody was waiting and half the restaurant was empty tables.  We were told it was a 10-15 minute wait.  Marginally confused by that we assumed it was because of a lack of servers or because we were 2 adults with a baby and stroller and just maybe they were waiting for the right table for us. After 15 minutes we were sat at the first table in the place that didn't look like it was normally used, it was missing stuff that other tables had and one side was 3 inches taller than the other.   This started our discomfort, it also was very hot being right near the door.  Overall we didn't think this was the end of the world and were excited to try some hopefully great food. We started with a pitcher of margaritas and chips and salsa.  The chips and salsa were very good, we thought we had found a great place.  It came with 2 salsas and beans with excellent flavor and the chips were homemade.  The margarita was so so, a little sugary and didn't taste alcohol but definitely not a deal breaker. Everything went wrong with the food and how they handled it.  I ordered the Hamburgesa Poblana and my wife ordered the Leticia's Award Winning Quesa Tacos.  The tacos were OK, definitely not what a lot of these pictures showed.  Our server forgot about us a lot and they seemed like they had sat under a light for 10 minutes before coming to the table.  Not near as good as we hoped but edible.  The Hamburgesa Poblana was one of the worst things I've ever had.  At first I noticed the bread was dry and it was forgetting the sauce it said it came with.  I waited ten minutes for the server to get some sour cream hoping to make it better.  After finally getting that and adding it I realized it was missing the bacon, avocado and toreados.  I figured oh well at this point eat it and move on.  A few bites in I had to stop.  The meat was pink and barely cooked, everything was soggy, the bread seemed days old and somehow this burger tasted fishy.  I couldn't do it.  I waited another while to tell the server I was sorry I couldn't eat this, it was missing things and not done right and we'd appreciate our check,  She was nice enough about it, did try to push us on dessert (I have only ate chips and margarita at this point and just wanted to leave) but then came back with the check.  On the check was a charge for the sour cream which was supposed to be on the burger in the first place.  I ended up grabbing a manager and she tried to help but I still left spending $45 for some sugary margaritas, a stale meal for my wife and a burger that isn't making me feel well.  Overall I appreciate the manager at the end trying to help (She did offer to comp the burger next time to try it again but I can't bare the thought of a next time honestly) but I can't recommend this place or come back.  Maybe we just had a bad experience but it isn't a good feeling leaving a place paying $45 for what we got.  I guess we stick with Lindo Michoacan, never had bad luck there!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charged for sour cream that was supposed to be on food that was sent back for missing a ton of stuff and tasting rancid.

CNmLATRqa_k3_UtT2f4sfQ.text: The food was very good but the service not so much. We were seated promptly. But then we sat and sat, and sat. Finally about 10-15 minutes later someone came over to take our drink order. And it's not like they were super busy, the resturant was only probably at half capacity. We finally ordered and got our food. But the waitress never came back, our cokes were never offered to be refilled. One guest in my group finally got up to go refill her own glass of water. This would be a super place if the service matched the quality of the food.

LIGT7UnfAk_NKVPxsCnPwA.text: While I was at work, my friends surprised me with my favorite tortilla soup ever from Leticia's. I assumed that when I got home it would be good, but that the avocado and tortilla strips would be gross after sitting in the soup for several hours, but to my surprise, they changed!! Now the avocado and strips are in a side container so that when I heated up that wonderfully delicious soup I could add them at the end and all is well in the world. Thank you Leticia's for apparently changing your ways.

km6a_q8MMUJZiO-Y5DEyVg.text: A definite favorite. Service is great and the staff is friendly. Outstanding food and the Pomegranate Margatini is the best.

JaWKDxMUSoxdWqKHhBs8OQ.text: My fiance is grotesquely addicted to Mexican cuisine. Wether it is authentic or TexMex, he craves it. If he could have a burrito everyday, he'd do so. I, on the other hand, find Mexican food on the same level as a Wendy's hamburger. Which is why I was delightfully surprised when we stumbled in here and found some great food, along with the warmest and most inviting decor I've encountered in North Las Vegas. Walking in was truly an eye-pleaser. We were immediately directed to a comfy booth, and then confronted with the traditional basket of complimentary chips and salsa. Two salsas, and a bean dip, all of which were tasty.   The fiance ordered the tamale plate, which was delicious, and I had the bouillabaisse, which was divine. The tamales were smothered to perfection. The meat inside could melt in your mouth. The sides complimented the overall flavor, and the plate was fairly large, though not enough that the price was justifiable. The bouillabaisse was delicious. The broth was warm, not overly tomatoe-y (if that's even a word) and the amount and quality were about right for the price point. ($25.00.)  Laura and Oscar waited and bussed on us Sunday evening around 7:00pm. Both were incredibly nice, considerate, and honest. The service here would have been perfect had our food not taken over half and hour to get to us. Laura had to check on the kitchen a couple times before anything came to our table. I was feeling very sick that day, so my irritability came as swift as the drink refills did. I cannot at all blame either server, though. They took care of us and did everything in their power to make us happy. Great personalities.  After forty minutes the food arrived. I then ordered the flan with chocolate cake, however they were out of the cake portion. So I settled for the flan alone, instead. I like most flan in general, I'm not picky. I think it's all pretty smooth and wonderful. So when I took a bite of this dense little mound of rubber and water, I was so horribly disappointed. I thought maybe it might be due to me being sick (messing with my tastes and textures), but nonetheless it was just...not great. Presentation was bland. Flavors were off. Texture was just awful. The little gross place on the college campus provides better flan in their little plastic boxes (I'm 100% not over exaggerating).   Overall, I was a tad bit agitated. More like disappointed. The food was so good, excluding dessert. And the service was great on the waiting staff, horrid on the kitchen. If you don't mind a wait, and want a hearty, romantic, authentic meal, then Leticia's is definitely the place for you.  UPDATE: The business owner was kind enough to explain their situation in the kitchen that day, and reached out to me asking to drop in again. That was insanely considerate and very sweet. I bumped my review up a star and definitely intend to stop back in for a bite. Nothing is more awesome than someone who is passionate about their business and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fiancé walking into Leticia&#39;s.
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior. Really a very beautiful place.
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dips and chips.

ovZzyS0iJ8qUZ8AtH9guLA.text: This is a family owned place with delicious food that treats its employees right! The food is traditional Mexican, huge portions, and absolutely delicious. The decor is exciting yet tasteful. The employees are so friendly and it's obvious they love working there which makes dining a pleasure. They've gotten more popular lately so expect a wait if you go on the weekends. Highly recommend!

ujCOng22MaCeUlUdl5d2mg.text: Love the chile verde and white posole.   Last time I went I asked for a recommendation to try something new and it was a dish with French fries and eggs I was not impressed.  Usually they have open tables and a long wait.  Not sure why that is.

nVaNLcSa8DJNezssAkBxCQ.text: Great service , amazing authentic Mexican, Guacamole is awesome! Will definitely return, we had a carne Asada torta , a Mexican mule, and some ice cold SOL, fajitas, flair as, and much more. Great time!

z0L8qgTCpF9Bb9hDNVhCVg.text: Eh, it was just okay.  I really wanted to LOVE this place, but it just wasn't what everyone cracked it up to be.    The chips weren't warm, and the salsas all tasted the same.    The chile rellenos (I had the cheese and also the beef stuffed rellenos) are not even worth rating as average.  They were severely undercooked, and normally you don't need to take in a knife to cut rellenos.  I was literally cutting through what seemed like raw chile.  The rellenos we have at our employee dining room tastes better than theirs.  And Leticia's is not cheap.    Their award-winning tacos were delicious however, and that's what warranted them that extra star.  Their fried ice cream was also very good.  Their tres leches cake was not as moist as it should be -- weird.  That's what tres leches cake is about.  Moist and milky.  It tasted like boxed cake with milk and slivered almonds poured over it.  Other than that, the middle was somewhat dry.    Will probably never go again.

z58P0SUkXJWNqm2bUdp8OQ.text: I have been in Vegas for 7+ years and easily tried 25+ Mexican restaurants.  My search has officially ended.  The salsa is very good, the service is always spot on.  Portion size is enough to take home left overs.  Fried ice cream is wonderful and the menu choices are varied.  And of course the margaritas are always a hit.   It is nice to see a 'neighborhood' place that is usually busy 5 nights out of 7.  I imagine this encourages the staff to stay on as there are many familiar faces there week after week, month, etc.  Also, love to know that Leticia is in the kitchen--this is not some phantom great Aunt twice removed on the brother's side....who passed down her recipes.

f_vmBA_Ej9UZNApfoLvJhg.text: EXCELLENT food! The chips and salsa are the best and I have had enchiladas, tacos, chorizo and eggs in the past and they are all delocious. My family and I will keep coming back to this neighborhood gem.

DiEqTTyUvrRrCmedzFdSrg.text: OMG! Can you say, the best pork enchiladas EVER!  Come early because you'll be waiting if you wait to long. Have been coming here for years. Service is great. The owner is often on the premises. And if having Carlos Santana as a frequent customer isn't a selling point, I don't know what is. Dining inside or out, this is a place that has become a favorite.

yFxucGHjKFAlY4xDgse31A.text: If I could do a 1/2 star I would. I've eaten here before awhile ago and enjoyed it. I was really looking forward to it so I brought my family. We sat here for over 30 minutes with no acknowledgement from any wait staff. Finally left since it didn't appear anyone really cared. Very disappointed.

6dTrQLncMyr4n9Mrgye9qw.text: I was there with a group and everyone said their food was excellent.  One in our party has been to Leticia's a lot, so she obviously has had a track record of good experiences - enough to bring a group of 8 there.  I will vouch for the deliciousness of the Pozole Blanco.  I loved all the fresh veggies that you can add in proportions to your own liking.  I also learned (from having leftovers - the portion sizes were generous...  I had leftover soup from ordering a small) that the avocado in the soup (this soup, at least) was still bright green the second day when I reheated it for lunch as it was the first day.  Cool!  I live down in the Anthem area and can't think of any Mexican restaurant that quite met up to what I saw or experienced this day.  Although I do love Las Cazuelas - gave them 5 stars, too - but their menu is pretty tiny compared with Leticia's although it has the mom and pop atmosphere.  That's really the only possible complaint about Leticia's - its success means they're no longer a mom and pop place - not bad, just not as personal as it undoubtedly was when it first started.  Anyway, I will be looking for a reason to be in Centennial so I can go back sometime.

v87-3VOXfQ-wmA5LjQi04Q.text: The food is very good but our experience with the bill was not a good one.  My husband ordered the beef and chicken fajitas which came with 3 small flour tortillas. He asked for more tortillas and some lime. They charged us $1.50 for the tortillas and $.75 for the slices of lime.  We have never been charged for these items at any other Mexican restaurants.  The waitress (Aarika) should have a least informed us of the extra charges.

bXq2FNM05wNWO8RPrnv_Qw.text: The food was great the atmosphere and service were good.  The only downside was waiting 15 minutes for the bartenders who had 2 people at the bar to make my drink.

9-TSjqw2LlAirGgwgeUlHA.text: It's good but not the best mexican I have ever had.  I was not a fan of the lime-y tasting tortilla chips although they were homemade.  The salsas were good but not out of this world.  I had the shrimp tacos quesa and they were a very generous portion - I could have easily only eaten half, and they were good but so rich with cheese and sauce. The best part of the dish was the white cheesy rice casserole - it was sinfully divine!!! Their food is overall pretty decent but it's a little pricey for mexican that is just ok.  Margarita was good however.  The owner is typically around and that was very nice to meet him and to see how much he cares about his customers.  He did everything he could to ensure we were happy.  I will go back but perhaps try a different dish.  The atmosphere is cute and exactly what you would expect for a nicer mexican restaurant.  Entrees were $16-25 a piece though and I thought that was a little pricey for the area and for the food.

vOI4Z6LcujVUQ4cI7HNSCA.text: Great place to come and have margaritas food very authentic where else can you get a corn on the cob with crema,  chili powder, lime, cities cheese. Justin the bartender is great always attentive tasty drinks

VQ_Zx-RyBRBEef6cSG4Jig.text: Saturday nights from 8:30-11pm is karaoke. The ambiance and service are exceptional!! They have the most amazing bean dip that comes free with chips and salsa! Great food!

PG_EmUS-VkX2Jwkegmj3ZA.text: My wife and I moved here 3 months ago from San Antonio and this is as good as you get in SA if not better.  The first time we went I told Walter our server that we had just moved from SA so would be hard to please.  His comment was "let me order for you" and it was fantastic.  Several trips later we decided that we could try their Tamales for Christmas.  Tamales are a Christmas tradition but we cheated and had some last night DELICIOUS!!  The Chipotle Tamales were fantastic.  Not sure where some of these reviewers ate cut could not have been here and thanks Walter for all of your help making selections.

ZqvpDh1_CloCimZvv9BGxg.text: We eat Mexican food all the time. When we travel from Summerlin to eat here all the time believe when I say this is outstanding Mexican Food! I can't survive without my weekly fix of puffy tacos. The service is excellent and the atmosphere is worth the drive!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6tNfI9jhtkWSonA2m_pscw.text: This is my first time giving 5 stars.  Our friends chose this based on a food network program they had seen. I don't usually like Mexican food AT ALL!  This place is terrific.  Luciano was our waiter and he was a wonderful as all the food we tried.

MRaAdXFC3rzOyWlZaglVbg.text: Me and my wife came here for an early lunch after leaving an appointment. We have been here before and it is always a really good eat. For lunch we both ordered the Carne asada. I ordered one of their house margaritas and as always I was not disappointed. The chips and salsa are really good, I would like for maybe a more spicy salsa as well though. Once our food arrived we both dug right in and devoured the steak because it's so delicious; juicy, tender, and easy to eat. I always love coming here and for a lunch meal it wasn't to bad only spent $30.

OkJmm8gv9B7GGToF5fVGjQ.text: My family used to love Leticia's. It was our go to Mexican spot and the food and service were always on point. Sadly, I must downgrade my past review. Over the years the prices have slowly gone up and I get that. I don't expect a restaurant to keep the same prices forever. I am a vegan and my husband is a vegetarian and we have limited menu choices at any restaurant. I have always loved their vegetable fajitas. On our last visit the price of veggie fajitas was $19. $19 for a hot plate of sizzling veggies, rice and beans??? I realize you get the fajita fixings and guacamole on the side but $19 is just too high for something I can make at home for a few bucks. Yes, I can make fajitas just as good at home with a flavor that's not just primarily salt. So, goodbye Leticia's...even though it is about 2 blocks from our house.

_oW1QX36BuDoli88b9eDnw.text: Food is amazing. Love the street tacos. I wish I could remember our server's name because he was so sweet. The only thing we LIKE but not LOVE is the salsa. But when it comes to salsa, everyone is different so I wouldn't count them out just for that.

ptMlP8QyxJnezUGBto4zBQ.text: Our favorite place for Mexican. We thought lindo was up until we moved over to the fair northwest. We save this for special dates nights just my husband and I. Love love the rice casserole.

-PPmGpq733Nlpj91vm0dzg.text: We live in the Centennial Hill's area and there are very few family owned restaurants.  Some chains are good but they do not give you the feel of a mom and pop setting.  We recently decided to try Leticia's because it looked so appealing from the outside.    We were NOT disappointed when we walked in. It is very cute and gives an instant feel of being in a local, family-owned, neighborhood restaurant. We were greeted warmly and were immediately glad we had come in.  We have now been there 3 times in 2 weeks.  We have sat at the bar each time.  The food is fresh and delicious and the carne asada has the most amazing flavors.  It was instantly our favorite!  The staff, including owner Leticia was extremely welcoming.  The bartenders are great!  Ignacia is friendly, very attentive and seems like an old friend when she chats with us.  Wendy is the epitome of friendly and always has a smile while she is giving us her full attention.  Saul is a mixologist.  He has won awards for a few of his drinks and when you taste the strawberry jalepeno margarita you will see why.  He is friendly, professional and knowledgable of the wide variety of tequila's.   We are going to take friends there next week and cannot wait to show off our new favorite place.  The only downside I can see is that it has become an addictive pleasure for us.  We look forward to going frequently!

nSfz6rSSI0bNW7oVzBsdCA.text: Try the Mexican Roasted Corn, it's DEEEE- Family karaoke on Fridays & Tuesdays! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Peppers &amp; Onions, Roasted Corn &amp; a Dos Equis!

MHqt6zD2jjSnLibKZdmOQQ.text: If I would have written a review the first time I came here they would have gotten 5 ***** since I thought I had found the best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. I really did think finally authentic Mexican food. BUT the 2nd, 3rd, and even 4th trip i had to call it quits! from being served spoiled orchata, bland rice and mushy tamales it will be a big while until i give this place a possible 5th :(

TbIYjqxgcgl8D_QgxTbJLA.text: The food is authentic and makes you want to come back for more! Never disappointed! I must add they have Great costumer service!

9tHPSwTllVzyRMi_AafbtQ.text: Apparently, after three consecutive days of being on hold for no less than eight minutes before frustratingly hanging up, ( and thinking " OTRA  VEZ! No mames!!!) while only trying to order chicken posole to go, I have decided that this restaurant REALLY does not want my business or money. Wish granted.

Des5Z0RebpknnfeLHsPGlw.text: This is by far my favorite place on the NW side of the valley. Never disappointed with the enchiladas, fajitas and I like their chips & salsa. Must try the rice!!

Csm2uk8cG0RlVW2Gwgb-Xw.text: Over the last year or so my taste in Mexican food has grown more sophisticated.  Circa 2009 if it had cheese and Mexican spices I was generally happy, but recently I've found old favourites like Guadalajara at Sunset Station and Cafe Coyote aren't hitting the spot like they used to.  My wife and I went to Leticia's for lunch today with a groupon and I've gotta say that I've found my new favourite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. Even though it's a huge hike north to go here, the food was so good I am sure we will be back often.  The chips looked worrisome, but looks are deceiving, they are fresh as can be and absolutely delicious. They come out with some very good bean dip, and a pair of excellent salsas (one red, one green) - No "spicy pasta sauce on a bowl" here - these salsas taste how salsa should taste.  We started our meals with the Mexican corn which was very tasty without being overwhelming and I followed this with a plate of Nachos. I was really pleased with the use of good quality Mexican cheese and the options available so I could tailor my nachos to my specifications. I went with carne asada (incredible quality for a nacho topping) and chiles toreados.   Now, I'm something of a nacho connoisseur - if I see them on the menu then chances are they are what I am ordering - these were some really special nachos. It wasn't just the quality of the cheese. It wasn't the delicious carne asada and the fresh and tasty chips. It wasn't even the wonderfully roasted and flavourful whole green onions that laced the top of my food. It was a combination of everything. The best nachos I have eaten in Vegas by some distance.  My wife ordered vegetable enchiladas with mushrooms and spinach which came with a white rice casserole with crema, cheese and peppers. A real change from the "Cheese in a tortilla with sauce" that's often her only vegetarian option at Mexican places and we both really liked how Leticia's offers more to have with your meal than just rice and beans. Thought has really gone into this menu.  Overall, a great meal in pleasant surroundings. An absolute no brainer to award this one 5 stars.

IFWnf_OLuUbfhxczDuxnhw.text: The food wasn't terrible but was bland. The service wasn't bad, just slow. We were seated pretty quickly and even had our order taken quickly. The numerous amount of staff kept our drinks on full. Even often times refilling or brining new drinks when our drinks were still 75% full. In the end we felt that it was a cover up to how slow their food serving was. It took forever for our food to get to the table. We have been told that the timing is solely about taste and delivery but when we received our plates we wondered why they still lacked taste. My two cheese enchilada in red sauce plate was disappointing in all areas. The cheese was cluttered and not melted and the red sauce was overbearing. My husbands fajita plate was alright to his taste yet he said it was a little bland. All he received was a tablespoon of guacamole and when he asked if he could get a little more we joked about how he better not be charged for the additional tablespoon sized guacamole they brought to the table yet we were charged $2.50 which was ridiculous. Only saving grace to my disappointment was the two child plates. We ordered a child chicken enchilada meal and a child beef taco meal. Granted my kids both skipped on the rice and beans, they both ate their main dish which was a plus for me seeing as how my WHOLE plate went untouched and I was still charged and had to pay for mine. Definitely not worth it and won't be back. Which is really disappointing because upon being seated, another couple was raving about how they've been driving from Boulder City to come to this place for awhile....

AjbxGlRyruNq7zajbTz7NA.text: Expensive for the food they make. I mean its okay but they do charge for a refill on horchata!

u1-6bBDvj6KzijKL2arcug.text: Came here after a long hike to refuel and left very full!  Leticia's is a solid Mexican place to stuff yourself silly.  I'm not a Mexican food expert, but everything I had was yummy.  Some may quibble at the lack of authenticity or "overpackaging" (regarding presentation and decor), but the atmosphere is fun and the food is good.  On my visit a couple of days ago, service was a little bit slow, but waitstaff were still nice and fairly accommodating.  Portions are large, prices are mid-range (i.e., not cheap but not wallet-breaking), and the free salsa and chips are really quite good!  Try the meatball soup for something warm and differently delicious.

SnX_w3pI-Hfr-Kf-wYvHyA.text: Leticia's is my longstanding go-to Mexican restaurant in Northwest Las Vegas.  The location is a bit obscure, but worth looking for.   The margaritas are very tasty, the tamales are delicious and the mole enchiladas are wonderful.

GoDzi7bWg5ltqiTFPF-ZOA.text: Best fajitas in vegas.  By far!!!  Queso fundido is great too.  I loved visiting this place as a resident.

mu8YcxhO6EsQt0NHdtAsYA.text: Stopped in today for a margarita and chips while waiting for an appointment~ had tasty green and fire roasted salsa and seasoned bean dip went well with my cocktail.  I look forward to going back when the weather is cooler so I can sit on the outdoor patio.  Will go back when I have time to eat a meal as I have heard nothing but good things from friends who live in the area.

v-oSLAQW9YO9Cmdy97VZRA.text: Wow - what a great Mexican place!  First, margarita's are super sized!  Love that and not stingy on the tequila.  Food was delish - we honestly tried a little of everything - very authentic, tasty, beans, red sauce, green sauce, pork, beef and the little corn on the cobs....all just awesome.  Great service, atmosphere and reasonably priced.  Found our new Mexican place and close to home.

SEthUjCB4yaPHyhyoevK8g.text: I live in summerlin so this place is a little out of the way but way worth the trip. The pablano stuffed with shrimp is so damn good! I wanted to take a whole other one home to eat later.  The salsa's here are authentic and have just the right kick.  Gustavo is an absolute gentleman and makes you feel like you are eating at his home.

Xy-G-hbpIhmhuerckXcF1A.text: Maybe I came on an off day? Maybe my expectations are a little too high as of late? But seriously, how does this place have this volume of ratings and maintain this high of an average?! I'm not sure if I'm more pissed at the restaurant for being sub-par or this many yelpers being fooled by such simple bullshit. It's my fault for being on my dying cell phone and not taking the time to read the reviews. Otherwise I would have dismissed this place IMMEDIATELY when I realized  "multiple salsas" was the CONSISTENT 5 star standard for a quality establishment!  Are you frickin kidding me?  Food.  I'll try to take my shitty experience out of this equation for the moment and ask why people love this bland cookie cutter On the Boarder franchise-esq, no heart, soulless food? After finally be able to put in the order (after 20 min wait) we waited another 20 mins (I know because I timed it) to get a cold to semi-warm plate, the carnitas was over cooked, tough (that's a HUGE accomplishment if you know how to make it) and bland. Had a nice piece of bone in there too. The beans had that nice dried crust layer on top like it had been sitting under the heat lamp a little too long but was too far to get the heat.  That salsa everyone loses their shit over, was okay. El Torrito and On the Boarder has that too, so does Rubio's technically.   Service: This was just stupid. And I'm kicking myself for not walking out. Went on a late Sunday afternoon after hiking Mt. Charleston (needless to say, hungry). The place is hardly busy. One girl comes over to take drink orders, says she can't take beer orders, but the the bartender can who will also be our waitress. I don't know why she couldn't have given our order to the bartender when she informed her of our table. 10 mins later, bartender comes (Natalie) "You want something from the bar?" Place DRINK order. I've been watching her from my table 15 ft away flirting with some douche face at the bar. Beer comes out in a glass so cold the beer is slushy. I'm not only a pretentious dick, I'm also a beer snob. I like to taste my beer, frozen glass = no taste. In spite of my annoyance, I asked nicely If I can have a glass that isn't iced. Natalie "They all come like that."  Me, "how about that (soda) glass that isn't frozen or run one under some cold water?" 10 mins pass, flirts with douche, comes back, replaces beer in different frozen glass. Now takes FOOD order. Food comes out like it's been under a heat lamp and the beans have that nice crust on them. We pick at our food. Flag  Natalie down for our bill, and get the hell out of this pit.  This place sucks. The food sucks, the service sucks, the menu sucks. there isn't any thing redeeming about this place. Someone please correct me if I'm out of line here.

wk-JMozNtiyHYvI_6MTfbA.text: My family loves Leticias. My favorite meals are the gourmet tacos and their fajitas. For a unique spicy kick to add to your meal ask for a side of their Salsa Macha. The service is always excellent. The servers are very knowledgeable about the menu, attentive, and friendly. Leticias is a wonderful family owned, local restaurant that prides itself on good service and great food.

-FDcZupCtfyZVCWNXYgXbA.text: Parking is an issue if arriving after 5 pm on a week nite.  That image fadded quickly.  The quaint authentic decor is highlighted by the hand painted mural of the owners home kitchen. The story was facinating.  The wait staff were prompt and accurate with our drinks, apetizers and entrees.  They knew when to be there and when to let us enjoy our meal.  I cant wait to share this wonderful eatery with my foody friends.

KXNuE5Eyle9OnTydIk6bUg.text: Love this restaurant. Excellent service always. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because they increased some prices- $19 fajitas? They're super delicious and have a unique flavor but that's too expensive for some meat and veggies!

r8TkRLFRaZY6np2zuN7a5w.text: Food is awesome! Customer service is not unfortunately. We were told a 15 minute wait and were seated 45 mins later. Our waitress rushed us through the process and was very pushy and loud. Luckily the food saved the night! We will definitely be going back, but will be requesting a different waitress and will try to go earlier when it isn't as busy to get seated. Definitely a gem in Centennial Hills!

88yp76jE1CtTubT8yBxoKA.text: The owner Gustavo is absolutely amazing! Such a sweet and genuine guy. Our server was absolutely wonderful thank you Aarika and the food was very tasty.

pyVf3UIOpcqkjBVNmUerWA.text: Omg the best !!! The Bloody Mary mix with red salsa is to die for  sometimes the wait is a little to long especially when your starving but the food is worth the wait! Also I never found a restaurant that serves the corn so fancy lol LOVES IT

3ICBf41ssnoDlIKrto5uYQ.text: Second visit during dinner as opposed to lunch: different experience.  Our server this time around was not as available as we would have liked.  slower service, took quite a bit longer to get our food and the place isn't THAT big of a ln establishment.  Shrimp cocktail appetizer was yummy.  The hamburguesa with the salad is keto friendly.  Margaritas were  tasty

-H9QdnIz8dgbENnuljCETg.text: When we first got our place in NW Vegas this was a place recommended by friends.  We love it, great food, cold beer, nice people.  We have been there several times and have never been disappointed.

vZ2YYrH0gSVF8aQ5Wjah9A.text: My mouth waters thinking about the dark, smoky salsa a server brings with warm, salty tortilla chips, beans, and a green salsa as soon as I'm seated at a table. I have a theory that you know how the rest of the meal at a Mexican restaurant will be based off their salsa and chips. No American-style Mexican food here, we're talking about Mexican food with depth of flavor and spice. I've taken family from out-of-town here and then had them ask to return the next time they've visited because the food was so memorably delicious. Items my family, friends, and I have tried and enjoyed (in order off the menu) - quesadilla, volcanes tostaditas, queso fundido, Mexican grilled corn, carne asada, chile rellenos, camarones al mojo de ajo, spinach and mushroom enchiladas, chile colorado, Ensenada style tacos, el molcajete, and mole chicken. Long but not exhaustive list. Also worth noting, I've always had great service here and am sorry for those that haven't. I think those experiences are exceptions and not the norm. Anyway, I highly recommend this place.

2xbX-62r9LYZEKEqPyGxmA.text: 4 for now. The food was good! Definitely different than what we're used to but good!! They dealt with my child which is enough to say the least. Margarita on the rocks was bangin!

qrs4nho5E6oTsn2CycGkUg.text: Loved this place! Food, ambiance, and service.  I'm originally from orange county in Cali. And had been looking for a good Mexican place and thanx to yelp... atlast, a delicious and pleasant place to eat at.  If you love spicy food... I highly recommend the " habanero salsa!!!"

bAbk9T-ysnFjMAVyQGbwXw.text: This place is a drive for us ,but was well worth it. Leticia's is almost like mexican fine dining w/o the big prices . Plates are beautiful.            I knew when the chips and salsa came we were in for a treat.  The chip are a little thicker and  served warm with two salsas one red and the other tomatillo and beans. Heck the refried beans were tasty.           I ordered  a small guacamole , it had a little cheese stick on top as a garnish and sprinkled with cojita cheese. It was impressive to look at and tasted even better .            i got the combo plate with carnitas burrito and chile rellano stuffed with steak picado i think thats how u spell it. The chile came with a red sauce and drizziled with sour cream , it was very good. The carnitas burrito was a little dry, jus carnitas and tortilla nothing else in it. Maybe i should have gotten it enchilada style , maybe my fault. The plating again was beautiful, the rice and beans tasty and fresh. I think i saw chef leticia's in the kitchen she looked busy ,if she was not i would have complimented her food , bravo.

UiKt9vESycQh3AD1z-QdkA.text: We went on the recommendation of some friends and Im glad we did.  The food was delicious, large portions and at a great price.  Even on a Saturday night the service was friendly and fast.  I was a little worried when they told us they had karaoke going on, but we sat on the left side and it was no louder than some background music at many restaurants.  Really have nothing bad to say about the place.

mrM4fi1V0izStF6yb_-piQ.text: Great place for dinner...  Nice setting and friendly staff!  The food came within five minutes of ordering and it was phenomonal!

GUzYYIEMwVrg_ZRGvbaLYg.text: I expected more... the food wasn't great. It didn't taste like authentic mexican food. The service was great and the place is nice.

TtVTWIeYcLvbYZMOXQeyDQ.text: So yummy! Great staff and awesome authentic mexican food! It's off the strip and well worth the drive.

6ddwxVPlHHH_HnodAMQ84g.text: I enjoyed this restaurant. The fish tacos were great, but I've had better rice and beans. Anyway, now that I know about it I'm sure we will dine here frequently. If you are close I recommend giving this place a try.

mJmmb-49ubF4QNdkzuNPlA.text: My wife and I finally tried Leticia's for lunch at the recommendation of our friends.  First I must start by saying that my wife makes the best authentic Mexican food around and we tavel to Mexico a lot as well so we are quite picky in this area.  After all the dissappointing experiences and attempts at finding good Mexican food in Vegas we had all but given up...until now!  Leticia's was a pleasant surprise with great food and awesome lunch prices.  It took a little bit to get noticed and seated, but after that the service was great.  There were a lot of items on the restaurant that you just don't see at other Mexican restaurants, and my wife commented about seeing dishes that her mom used to make...and her mom is where she got her skills from so great sign!  The chips and salsa were great, and lots of roasted options and good selection of heat.  My wife had Sopes and I had Carne Asada and Carnitas combo and both were great.  It is a great place for a lunch date or family and friends...we will definitely be back when we don't feel like cooking at home!

Fjg4Y6NcIUGF7Kwj2mwpqA.text: First impressions were a bit rough- ambience is just like an On The Border or some other chain Mexican place.  While waiting, we tried to get a drink at the bar, but it was tough getting a menu and a space at the bar.  Once we were seated, though, the whole experience changed.  The service was awesome- prompt, efficient, knowledgeable, not over the top.  The food was great, too.  The guacamole w/ jalapenos was fresh and fantastic.  The small was plenty for 2.  My wife had the "something" casa chili verde.  The pork was tender, the beans were good.  I had the "something" Quesa- their house special.  I had one shrimp taco and one shredded chicken.  It was awesome.  I would get the shredded chicken again and try a different filling instead of the baby shrimp.  Oh, and we each had a margarita that was top shelf ingredients and quite good.  Maybe I'm still a country bumkin' adjusting to big city life, but I thought this place was great.  5 stars for food and service.  3 stars for generic ambience.

ujb8_jk_OVYbZytRs32Lew.text: My family, coworkers and friends visit regular for both lunch and dinner since their opening, great food, service and atmosphere.

lAfe0cIWnklNeYDwUsCX_g.text: I've been here a few times and to me the food isn't bad but not the best.  I do have a problem with the frozen margaritas.  On two occasions, the same thing: the margarita is liquid and not frozen, along with being not very cold.  I felt it sat in a blender all day and the ice melted and it was served.  I may go back, but I won't order a margarita.

BUQpPLaTQeZYgL7D0h5VMQ.text: Very friendly and very tasty. Worth the trip . And it's nice to have a nice restaurant up here 95 & Durango for a change!

o5HlG3XcggPcZPB20adzWw.text: We ate here about a month ago. I'm writing about Leticia's now because their service and food was unforgettable!  Let me tell you this place pays a lot of attention to detail. The glasses were chilled, tortillas warm, and our waitress was so friendly.  It was the small perks of eating here that went a long way. We came here on our cheat day and I wanted to give up my diet for good after eating here. I would recommend this place to everyone!

y3lFQgrPF8ASQECaeqc51g.text: I was in Vegas last week and Leticia's was on my food list to try.  Here is my review on my experience:  Leticia's is a nice-looking restaurant.  The decor is pleasing to the eye and they have patio dining.  I opted for the inside.  To start, they offer chips with a tomatillo sauce and a darker salsa which was really good.  They also offer a small dish of refried beans.  I ordered the Carnitas plate which comes with your choice of soup (they offered two) or a salad.  I got the salad with the house vinaigrette.  That vinaigrette was fabulous!  The Carnitas plate came with refried beans, rice, guac and pico de gallo.  The pork was fork tender and fragrant.  The corn tortillas were warm.  I totally enjoyed my meal.  The service was good, albeit intrusive.  I like attention to my table, but not so much where everyone was stopping by the table to ask how everything was.  The waiter stopped by, the busboy stopped by, the host stopped by.  I fully expected someone to walk in off the street to stop by and ask about my meal.  I don't know if they have gotten some bad reviews and are trying to rectify the problem.  All told, the experience was good and I am glad I went.  I took a carryout and headed back to my hotel.   I will definitely go to Leticia's Cocina my next trip.

QZw9AfPBzAwwNwCfmlY7aw.text: Leticia's is by far the best restaurant in the area. I have tried several of the items on the menu but my favorite is the "Loaded" quesadilla. It has spinach, mushrooms and chicken. this quesadilla is AWESOME. It is listed under the appetizer section of the menu but it is big enough for an entree. The other item which i think is a must try is the strawberry margarita with a hint of jalepeno (I dont recall the name on the menu) YUM!

PNsMjx42GNElHjrT2T6H6w.text: Everything we had was outstanding!!  I don't get the Del Taco or Taco Bell reference.  Wow way off base!!  The chili relleno sauce has a hint of nutmeg that makes a nice touch.  The mole enchiladas were also very good.  Great location that you can tell the owner has a passion for making real Mexican food the real way.  To top it off the salsas are very authentic.  The first was a black salsa that was mild and very flavorful but we asked for a hot one and out comes one of the best salsas I have had in Vegas made with chili habanero!  All in all very highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mole enchiladas with cheesy potato taquitos
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chili relleno with carne asada

AEQTtCqEP1VlGvUuLqUGDQ.text: Great vibe and good food. Chile relleno came out awesome. Definitely recommend it for the for the margaritas. It's in a really cool shopping center as well. The only reason it didn't get 5 is because of our order being incorrect initially. It happens and I would still go back.

wId5ooV-JAk1IwFOE54GFQ.text: Best margaritas in town!  Make sure you sit on the bar side as the service is much better. Some of my favorite dishes are the street tacos, quesa tacos, and the build your own burritos enchiladas style with the white cream sauce.

l0xTg7wpYzoyN2HnRIwATQ.text: If you can get past the exceptionally slow service and the long wait times.... You'll find the food to be excellent.... Very flavorful.... Their "house " margaritas were very good....

BNb0WZj0TprF146Lvg9QTA.text: Food was sooo delicious service from Crystal was great. We will definitely come back.  Salud!.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q06DRNZnF9il1QkGaDyYog.text: Gladys, my favorite waitress. Everything............ I mean everything is out of this world. Puro Oaxaca, Viva Leticias, Viva Mexico.

bKp_lGeFlCX-pntRcTr4TQ.text: Half way through lunch my wife looks up at me and says "I just found my new favorite Mexican restaurant".  Food was fantastic, service was friendly and the Cadillac Margarita's were (almost) as good as mine. O.K. My new favorite as well.

0HL98t06r24W__DrgQjEqw.text: Thank you, Leticia's.  I have been to the restaurant twice.  Both experiences were excellent.  The food was good, the staff was as friendly as they could be.  Friends had recommended the restaurant and it lived up to expectations.  That would be enough, but Leticia's also sponsors community events.  They are having a cinco de mayo festival and concert in the neighborhood on May 6.  It is a great restaurant but they also build the community and get people together around where the restaurant is located.  Again, thank you for what you are doing.  I will eat here again.

ea1h2UQimrlYUm3ZpQ_-mQ.text: One of the best things about living in the Northwest is that we are down the street from Leticias.  Great service and the freshest, best Mexican food in the City.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White sangria...
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great bean and cheese burritos for the little ones!!!

vZNn8WjeyVwqs6-zHFzRWg.text: My mom was in town for a weeklong visit and we wound up making two trips to Leticia's! The first time we sat at a booth by the bar and a college football game was on so it was a little loud but we could easily carry on a conversation. Our waiter was extremely helpful in answering questions, and we were promptly served our beer, waters and chips with salsa trio.  You can choose from family style or individual selections and we each chose seperately. My mom got Guisados de Casa -chile verde which was really good. The pork was super tender without being mushy or fatty and was seasoned well. I got chicken fajitas which were excellent....two people could easily share this. My husband got spicy chicken quesatacos...they were okay but the poblano casserole served alongside was awwwesome.   Our second trip was just as successful. We went on a weeknight and it was much quieter. Our waitress was helpful, although not quite as prompt. Very friendly however! My mom went with spinach and mushroom enchiladas which she liked but I probably wouldn't order...I felt like they needed something to brighten them up and cut the heaviness of the creamy sauce. My husband and I each ordered grilled fish tacos with soft flour tortillas. I have had fish tacos from Ensenada to Costa Maya to Belize and I can say 100% that these were the best I've ever had, and it's hard to top eating them while sitting on a white sand beach with turquoise water staring at you.   The fish was perfectly seasoned and light, super fresh tasting with a perfect fish to sauce ratio. The veggies were also perfectly proportioned and every bite was just as perfect as the first.  We mentioned to the server how much we enjoyed them and she told us on Monday nights their street-sized tacos are all available for 1.25 each!   It's five minutes from our house...super close proximity to pick up after-dinner cupcakes from retro bakery (prior to dinner, retro closes at 7 I think) and both our visits yielded both stellar food and service. This will be a regular stop for us.

jtM4_Z90JsHwnyWwCUwQDA.text: Chips and salsa were great  I got 2 cheese enchiladas one red and one with ranchera sauce when it came out I had one green instead of red but they caught it before they brought it out and brought a third red a few minutes later.  The ranchera was great went with the cheese perfectly.  The green would have been better with chicken or fish.  Tons of food didn't even eat the third but the red sauce is tasty.  Left overs are great.  Will be back sometime.

Abcgj83VWXy0OiXiF644aA.text: So this is now the 4th time that I have been here. The food is always pretty good but the service is ALWAYS really bad. The waiters and waitresses are very nice but the service is extremely slow ALWAYS. Waitress passed by our table multiple times and never once asked if we needed our drinks refilled. I had to ask 3 times for chip refills. Appetizer took forever to come out. Chimichanga was great!   I have come here when it's been busy and slow and on different days and at night and the service always is sub par.  I understand the high star rating for the food but not for the service. I give it 4 stars for the food and a 1 star for the service.

lU4vumtnOAMZRJ6w8yS2bg.text: My husband and I ate there with friends Sunday. Our friends believe this is the best ever.  I disagree.  The Worst ever. I had fajitas and they were Greasy and not Fresh. This food was worst ever I see why they were closed down a few weeks ago with a C rating. Their food sucks. I didn't say anything didn't want to embarrass our friends. My husband says we should go again and see if this was an off night. I think I would rather go to del taco or taco bell

b0BpRzWaJutGdC9V_pwnwQ.text: I like this place a lot. The quesatacos are amazing and very different than normal Mexican plate. The pepper rice that comes on the side is amazing! The staff is friendly but sometimes a little slow. The pumpkin spice martini was interning to try during the holiday season but I didn't thing it was all that great of a mixture. I like their margaritas.

KR9ylEIzRpnM0fxc_Q4VzQ.text: Had lunch there and expected more. not happy at all. food was not all that good. And my table was by the serving  window and could hear owner yelling and screaming at employees was not professional  at all. Tortaco is better and cheaper.   Thank You for your condescending reply Leti! And yes I will continue going to Tortaco where they have REAL mexican food. And don't forget respect your employees!

uuGgqAc130jmlpfqDSSkoQ.text: Very good I highly recommend this nice clean place ! The Mexican corn is to die for! Delicious

czO2SbN3dkwD1nv_STZOPA.text: Went in for lunch today. Could not believe bad service I received. Hostess seemed confused that should have been a sign to leave. Got seated but was 15 minutes before  someone came to take my order. 15 minutes is not good. Not like they were busy, only 2 other tables were seated. Finally got my food. Food is there is always good. Was surprised that didn't get my drink refilled at all. Normally service there is awesome. But didn't recognize any of staff today. Very disappointed with experience today. Will be awhile before I return.  Hope they work on service...

4yMn_-cR6id8W5nUVO3dgw.text: We only went there once and sat at the bar for chips and margaritas, which were both very good. The place was busy and their plates looked good.

Uqr8bW4gL70N8DkLkEGvJA.text: Well let me start off by saying if their was zero stars I would have chose it. When I arrived today I found the Hostess Melissa to be quite rude. I've never felt so unwelcomed when walking into a restaurant. BAD FIRST IMPRESSION!!! I was seated fairly quickly but had to wait a while before my drink order was even taken. I was served chips, salsa, and bean dip, thank god because my food took forever to come. And when it did come it was wrong WRONG!!! The server who's name I cannot recall but will post if I remember took care of it though, but not without a little attitude. The food was good but slightly over priced.   Being who I am I still leave a tip, but thought I would also leave a review on here. I will say that I will not be back to this place ever again. It was the first and the last time.  I had already made my mind up when I had to deal with the Hostess. It's unfortunate to have to experience that when I'll I wanted to do was simply have some lunch.    I will end with saying that you should really watch the people you hire and have working for you. Our maybe have a talk with them. If they are not happy with their job they should find another. It's not worth losing business over.

aRSIn3Iy7_YPC-U7UZPNBw.text: My husband and I had one of our first dates here....and we just about LOVED everything about this place. The location, the service, the quality, the ambiance - everything!  The service was amazing. I am not a big margarita person but I had quite a few that night and I didn't get heartburn. Plus the street tacos I had were so delicious!  I had their beef tamales and they were AWESOME and the most authentic I've had in Vegas.  Unfortunately, we now live on the other side of town but we always are looking for an excuse to go back.

Bo9wBG5A8-bA83PuxeXD4g.text: Don't ever order a cake from here.  I loved the chicken Tinga and thought ordering a Mexican cake for my birthday would be unique and something to try.  Worst mistake and cake I ever had!  Lopsided, and tasted like black pepper (ass) and they dug a huge cardboard box out of the recycling bin (36" x24" box) to put a 8in cake into.  I had dinner reservations on the strip and this cake was a complete embarrassment.  Should of ran it over.

1ADChgIvHKiVBzqNza3C3w.text: Great food, and great friendly service. Our server, Jerrod, was awesome.  We enjoy every visit.

ekX4SJXe04fdTYI5MOTxIg.text: I'm a regular at Laticia's Mexican Cocina restaurant. Best Mexican food in town. Great margaritas, happy hour and friendly service. Tara makes unbelievable drinks and is a wonderful bar tender. Check it out. Enjoy.

pkdGvdkHx36MLeQY4sAGyw.text: We came here on a friday night and the place was super packed.. We had to wait about 25 minutes to get our table. The service was awesome, everyone here was very nice and very attentive. The food was pretty good but nothing special.. The decor and the environment are pretty nice, the best thing is that they are open until 2am! I would probably come back and give it another chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad

H6ZAtRjAWMnlSzrXlafJtw.text: Closest Mexican restaurant to me. Authentic Mexican food. Love going here to eat and hangout with family and friends. Great atmosphere and everyone that works here is very nice.

qgId19jGOy-VXogvKvhlXg.text: Grrr, I have mixed feelings about this place. The food is great, the service is usually good, but they always always get something wrong with my order. Tonight it was bringing my order without the avocado that comes with it. Then charging me for it when I asked for it.  They fixed it, but really? Every time? Also, HEAT UP YOUR BEANS. Geez.

5N4vWqoyFVUYm0-o-Z16Iw.text: I had purchased a Yelp deal for Leticia's so it was a great reason to visit once again. This time around we sat at the bar where we were helped by Tara. We had a great time.. She was attentive and very friendly! I ordered the famous cheese tacos with rib eye and shrimp. Wow.. They were very tasty. My other half normally doesn't eat much meat but she loves the rib eye! She was disappointed she didn't order the tacos! The melted cheese is what makes them so good along with the chipotle sauce! I have no complaints and will continue to frequent leticias. Next plan is to come on a Tuesday for some margaritas and tacos! Doesn't get better than that!

9sxZqw8-C4wmpRp3GBAzDg.text: Stopped by here one Friday night around 7pm to celebrate the end of the work week and this place got so many recommendations from friends that we had to give it a try. The wait time for 2 was only about 10 minutes and we were seated in the bar area which was a bit more cramped and loud. My drink of Cabo Azul was great! The tortilla chips and 3 sides of salsa were great. The food we ordered was just ok. Nothing great or super fantastic. I ordered shrimp ceviche and the mexican corn. The bf ordered carne asada enchilada. When the food came out is was almost like we read each others minds. Not very thrilling. I guess we were expecting a big old wow factor of taste. One thing that threw me off was the girl who first took our drink orders. She was under 18 so she couldn't bring me an alcoholic beverage which is what I wanted so there was some mix up with who I was supposed to order the drink from and how it was going to get to my table. My mexican corn was like something that I could make at home. The bf's enchilada and sides were a bit dry and overcooked. I think we will skip Leticia's and stick to the regular places that give us a bit more yay when it comes to the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican corn on the cob and shrimp ceviche
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cabo Azul

PJekVoCv6HEVFAkefFTAGg.text: Service was great. The waiters were friendly and attentive.  I'll definetly be going back next time im in the mood for some Mexican food.

Bf5wbLsqxPY_S_Yjr-IZuA.text: One of our favorite places to eat when we want old world Mexican cuisine. Love the atmosphere and the service. Please, don't ever disappoint us.

c-bfzxvWF2OVkfbSlAEXEQ.text: My boyfriend and I are Leticia's regulars, and we are both Hispanic and know good Mexican food when we have it. I have to say the overall atmosphere of this restaurant is what really wins me over. Everyone is so nice, the decor is very appealing, and its just a comforting place to pig out on great food.   The service there is GREAT, I have an attachment to the older man Hector- he is ALWAYS so incredibly friendly and always makes sure that we are all set with chips & salsa and our waters/soda are filled. He is such a sweet heart.   The food...authentic. From the Pozole (which I just had a week ago because I was recovering from a flu and it was SO GOOD. ) to the enchiladas covered in salsa- everything tastes like I went to Mexico. For real. Its some good stuff.   All in all, its a great place to grab dinner and have a few drinks with your friends, family, spouse...whoever. Anyone will love it.   I should be a Leticia VIP hahaha

qTACIwfs1xz8kUmY5eiCeQ.text: Went there really wanting some chips and salsa and was not thrilled with their salsa at all. Also their queso was more like fondue cheese very thick, not like a dip. We ended up leaving the rest there because it was practically a skillet full of thick, stringy, greasy cheese. Their food was alright but pretty plain, there was not a whole lot of flavor which is what I want when eating at a Mexican restaurant. This was not what we were expecting, but worth a try.  Service was good our server was very kind, but we don't see ourselves ever going back.

1Jihm9PoiMFJ8GvbHXUpLg.text: Place has gone downhill since my first review. We have been back several times and it's always hit or miss. It really depends on what server you get but even when basically empty the service is slow.

Q0EUkg-Fy_kuLl6dPjcfKg.text: so soooo good!! Service amazing..i just cant express how amazing it was. Our new favorite place!

-fCLC-M3wnctipW0xpYh9g.text: We were in the area from out of town and happened upon Leticia's.  Extremely happy with our choice!!!  Food, Sangria and Tyler's service were all great!  Get the Gourmet Ribeye Tacos!!  Would definitely recommend Leticia's!  We will be back the next time we are in Vegas.

1ZqBqiIDRxIT3pVdFe_TRQ.text: High quality, authentic Mexican food. Friendly service and generous portions, Quesa tacos with shrimp and  poblano white rice casserole as a side is a knockout dish!! Prices are a little higher than similar restaurants, but it is worth it. Great lunch specials also are available.

_BCwsOOYp8gC44aOfUToKw.text: I always enjoy visiting Leticia's. I love that they're located in my area.   I especially enjoy going in the fall because they have outdoor seating.   The food is always good. Typical menu...  I don't usually order margaritas, but I do enjoy them here. Their soup is always good.   The service is friendly and the server comes by frequently.   Worth checking out.

eTjPxNQoJCljZyaePQhbfA.text: Chef Leticia has created a little slice of Mexico here in Las Vegas.  Some of my Favorites are Cochinita Pibil absoutely superb, Elote Mexican Grilled Corn, Fresh Salsas & Chips, Mini Empanaditas.  They also offer Family Style meals great for everyone.  Really lovely Margaritas and you can dine outside when weather permits.  Great location right off freeway and well priced with sizable portions.  Tell Chef Leticia that Chef Sandra sent you!

8ynpVgYkz-nUxWrSno9izQ.text: Love this place!!  I've never had one thing I didn't like!  Get there early because the place is small and fills up quickly, even during off hours.

m8UAVYTwnvTvkx9VJG1LAw.text: Good food and jack Daniels margarita but it is really slow at the bar for drinks, card and paying your check. Seems like the bartender needs help since there is only one and they are trying to make drinks and serve food (Tuesday night). I guess not many people gamble here since the bartender had a very hard time making a card.   Seems like a good place but needs more efficient management and servers. Good people though!

YuXmHuSwIgCGQ75mpLVQ5Q.text: Good food and service; busy on the weekends, however. They make all their tortillas and chips homemade! Very tasty. The portions are huge however, so I recommend splitting for two (unless you are both super hungry) ! Even on busy nights the service was accurate and quick - recommend for a stop especially in north Vegas.

nE5-z61Hwte_aGJoMgj4-g.text: We took my father-in-law there and he ordered a steak burrito. He asked them if there was any shrimp in it because he is allergic to shrimp. He was told no. When the food came (after about an hour wait), he took a few bites and realized there was shrimp in it. Luckily, he had some benadryl with him and took it immediately. We told the waitress and she apologized. No manager came to talk to us. No owner came to talk to us. If he hadn't had the benadryl with him, he would have ended up at the hospital. Not good.

2eUSqw_lh0qWrjDR05VdrA.text: It wasn't very good I'm going to keep it short and sweet my husbands urging me to be nice. The hostess was very nice I never thought our waiter would ever wait on us and it really didn't matter because when the food came it was terrible.

nms7FJcMQiIkIHo-bRDAjA.text: We have been going here since it opened.  Last visit being 5/26 and we received NO bean dip with our chips.  One of my favorite things. I hope this was just a mistake. I was definitely disappointed!

jKbHLL7wgMw2BECOz8oPqQ.text: I love Leticia's! I've been several times. It's consistently tasty and fresh. Everything I've tried--from their specialty dishes to normal old tacos--is fantastic. Wait staff is always friendly and attentive.

8Q6RP37K4FRnz8ofmoXBDw.text: We go here all the time, love the food. Last night, we waited over 30 minutes for a table. There were over 10 empty tables but supposedly you did not have enough servers. Really, you have good business, buck up and hire more staff. The table we ended up sitting at had been empty and cleaned for 25 minutes.

x5p3r2YsFR9GMzJfqi3-Vg.text: Really a great place service is great. Street corn too pricey but really good overall best in the area

4aKpVOWtktQ2cxVYBG9OeA.text: Have given it a few chances - not impressed.  Family suggested dinner.  Willing to try it again.  Around about 7:55 on a Friday evening.  Lots of empty tables but were told it would be a 45-minute wait because they were waiting for servers to arrive.  Seems that we could have been seated and ordered drinks while waiting.  Probably will not be back.

mYRqpL38ZS52pYZ1ZT4LnQ.text: Went there for lunch today.  What a disappointment compared to our last visit.  Hostess said 20 min wait.  In the room to our right there were 2 booths and 2 tables open.  Only 2 women in the room.  The room on the left had a few people in it, but I could see 3 empty tables.  I don't know how many more places there were open, but that was what you could from the waiting  area.  Waited almost 30 mins and then was seated at one of the empty booths.  Waited another 30 mins for food and the order was totally messed up.  I don't know what they would do if they were busy.  I'm sorry  this happened.  The food wasn't worth the wait and we won't be going back.

pVfiFn1uZVnTR-MOTNmsIQ.text: The only thing I actually liked about this place was an employee named Hector, nice old guy who was really working hard. I should have known this place would be trouble as soon as I saw the bartenders pouring premade margaritas out of a jug. So gross. The food was also not good, not good at all. It was over priced and very generic. Having lived in Mexico for a year, I was expecting so much more. We moved in right down the street and had been excited to try this establishment, but we will not be going back.

AGQGPqUd56MSm30LM-S4Xg.text: Based on a tip from someone else, I was anxious to try this place. Unfortunately, I was extremely disappointed  There were several large groups that arrived before me. I had to wait literally 30 minutes for my food.  My server was nice and apologized several times for the delay.  When my steak tacos came, they were dry. Luckily, my server Joanne, checked back with me fairly quickly and offered to change my order for something else.  Luckily the replacement order came very quickly. Joanne chatted with me briefly when I finished my meal. I would have liked to see a discount (or even a dessert on the house) placed on my final bill for my inconvenience.  A while back, I went to Red Robin and my burger was overcooked.  Not only did the manager come over and offer me a soup while I waited for a replacement, she took the burger charge off the bill without me asking. This is the service that I come to expect.  I'm not sure if I will return to Leticia's again. I've been to Michocan Gourmet Mexican restaurant twice and both times, I've gone the food and service was excellent.

misCT0u737bLnUkV5S10tg.text: This place is a ZERO! I took my husband there for his birthday dinner after a few good reviews. Well, this place was just awful! We waited two hours for a table they do not take reservations. Went to the bar to wait and waited 20 minutes for someone to notice and ask us if we wanted anything** another 25 minutes to receive our drinks a bottle beer and a house Margarita with no straw! Asked waitress to check on our table witch she never did, Three times my husband got up to check, apparently we had been skipped even after checking 3 times.The staff was very roude and unwelcoming. The food was nothing great it was exactly the same as my neighbor hood taqurilla but ten times more expensive. I was very upset ruining my husbands dinner. I will never go back and I will give bad reviews. Do not come here if you want a great Mexican place go to Lindo Michuacan, they should take tips from them*** I hate this place!

T6x2Hp0BBuRKCwaeGFZO9w.text: The Chicken Tostadas are amazing! The Margaritas are superb! And if you're looking for some fun while dining they have karaoke night! The owner actually sat and spoke with us for a bit. A very down-to-earth place ;)

rXs-BVacgLaw0P1f3n-cYg.text: We ate at Leticia's for the third and last time. We had a party of six with two children We ordered 3 soups, 2 flautas and one plate of street tacos so not an over abundance of food that should take a lot of time.  It took over 45 minutes for our food to arrive It was 2 in the afternoon and it seems like a normal afternoon crowd. The food was okay but when you wait that long with children it is unacceptable. My son in law ordered a side of jalapenos and onions and the waitress brought them out 10 minutes before his food..we didn't have to pay for them because he sent them back.  Tres leche cake was terrible ..only pineapple was used and canned at that. I recommend finding somewhere else to go..

GugyQy-lKfBhVCI4NZK-aA.text: Very authentic Mexican food.  Our favorite Mexican restaurant in the Vegas area by far.  Good margaritas!!!  We try to take our guests there at least once during their visit.

U1mXj-EVtpXvYCpJVpPH1g.text: I was with a group of 4 on a Monday night. The place was pretty crowded--which is a good sign. The drinks ordered by my group were apparently quite good. The bean dip was ok, the red salsa was marginal, and the green salsa tasted like grass. I ordered the Tampiquena--made from top sirloin which sounded interesting. When I attempted to order it medium rare, the waiter tried to explain to me that it could not be cooked to order because it was pre-cooked ( I assume he meant marinated) in lime juice, but he assured me that it was very good. I was presented with a very thin, tough and poorly seasoned piece of beef with some cold, clumpy queso on top of it. Not at all impressed. The enchilada that came with it was ok--but certainly nothing special. Judging from the other reviews here, I either came on the wrong night or ordered the wrong thing. If I happen to be this far north in LV again, I might give it another shot.

dDl8zu1vWPdKGihJrwQbpw.text: I love this place! My fiance And I go here atleast once a week. The portions are huge! Food is amazing. I love their carne asada. They have great lunch specials... Leticia is super nice and cares about what you think of her restaurant. You have to try their cheese enchiladas too the sauce is different And amazing!!!

s0qpCZCqQqZIin0xsmCMJA.text: The burros were in alignment as we happened upon this joint one Sunday morning.
