Not intending to do a brunch but just had to try the Mexican Brunch menu.  $8.99 for all you can eat ala carte with a fruit and yogurt bar.  Eggs and Carne asada were good as were the potatoes.  Wife had the Huevos Rancheros which were decent.  Portions were a little small but that might have been because they were served on huge plates.  After our first plates the waiter came back around to take another order but we were stuffed by then.  Service could be a little quicker but over all it was ok.  Will definitely be back.

B-zKT_LVRkkHSj4Z_y6gnA.text: Very popular but very unpredictable and uneven.  The bar is always great and a margarita and complimentary chips with salsa and yummy bean dip can fill you up if you have to wait for a table which has always been the case for us.  Only two stars because the last time we went the food was not good, overly spiced, the meal was not served hot and the waiter could not be found after he took our order.  This was in the middle of the week too.  The prices are high and the servings are very large.  I think we will visit the bar and skip the food from now on.

8F4H-FeT3ppDVZkuOcT6JQ.text: The service was great but the food was subpar.  Basic Mexican food is not that difficult to prepare.  I ordered flautas and they were horrible!  Someone in my party ordered basic tacos and they were bland and dry.  Not sure if they buy canned salsa, but it was most disappointing.  Will stick with Robertos tacos for authentic las vegas Mexican food.

7H8qCXVlZTc8Z1tw6ZJy4w.text: nothing bad to say about this place. easily one of the best Mexican restaurants in town. the cocktail drinks are amazing and the prices are reasonable.

0SbLJdHHP3g2XVAMTAgvzg.text: Amazing. Just amazing. This place is covered in authentic Spanish decor with plenty of space for sitting. The horseshoe shaped bar is perfect for a night to watch some sports. The Street Tacos would probably be the best tacos I have ever had. Of course with all of this greatness be prepared for a 20-30 minute wait. This place is always packed with hungry locals

KOiEqV7leRp4qqcJGTeaOA.text: Leticia's used to be my favorite Mexian place - great food and friendly fast service. Went there Saturday eve about 5 p.m., so before the huge weekend rush and the service was horrible. Staff seemed like we were bothering them by wanting a water refill and more chips. One of our party did not get her food until the rest of us were done eating AND we had to ask for her food 3 times. They kept checking, but never came back.   The food quality was not as good either, even with higher prices.   Sadly it's just not worth going there anymore.

oyMMcDFqleKdLYe3qdSNfA.text: Excellent food and great customer service!  Will always come back!  Great staff and the highest level of service. Thanks guys!

UE7Ef7QPoMOKAERxM1Xmcw.text: After reading many reviews of this place, I decided to stop by here for lunch and try it for myself.  I was please to see how nice the decor of the restaurant was.  There are two dining room areas and bar seating.  The owner, Leticia, greeted me and asked me if I wanted a table or sit at the bar.  Since i was eating alone, I saddled up to the bar and ordered from the Bartender.    I decided on the Nachos and a Raspberry Iced Tea to wash it down.  While I was waiting for my order a server brought out complimentary Chips, Beans, and Salsa.  In Vegas, it's rare to get Beans with the comp Chips/Salsa....also, there were two Salsas.....a Chipotle based Salsa and an Avocado/Cilantro based Salsa.....it was excellent!  A few minutes later my Nachos came out.  They were covered in Cheese and had two small portions of Sour Cream & Guacamole on top...certainly not enough for the entire dish.  The Nachos has a lot of potential....the Chips were fresh, all of the ingredients tasted very good....but the proportions were all messed up.  Too much Cheese, not enough Sour Cream/Guacamole/Pico de Gallo.....just the right amount of Beans & Jalapenos.  The Cheese was melted just right, but with some bites it overwhelmed the dish.  A lot of potential here...  Overall, I enjoyed the meal and loved the friendly service and active owner who cares about her restaurant.  Will I return?  I want to come back with my family and try a few more dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Green Avocado/Cilantro based Salsa was the Bomb!
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipotle Salsa....not Spicy at all...wish it was.
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rB3a48OsTt4crzV2Ovnm4Q.text: In the beginning, I loved this place. I have recommended this restaurant to many and have dined countless times here. I am giving 2 stars only because there were some good even great times but the last visit just destroyed all the past. This last time I came in with a 6 so a good size table. I ordered one of my favorites, tostatas but when served, it tasted stale and the appearance looked as if the food was old. My mother and uncle ordered the same thing and it was soggy, bot cooked well and cool, not hot. My husband's order was also cold and he said it tasted old as well. My aunt's order was also cold but also had a bit of rubber feel. When we talked to the waitress, she told us it was because they had a new cook. She did not offer to fix or replace any of our meals. Weeks later, I was watching the news and they were on dirty dining with a C rating based on a lot of thr complaints I listed. I won't go back there and I hope the owners fix this issue.

k0OgjC1P2jW986mssgXJ1Q.text: A great place for tortilla soup. On cinco de mayo the block is off the hook with festivities. Its the kind of place you can bring the family to or have a private dinning. Classy and rustic with great food, pretty authentic.

nFB1YjkYDI0q3dO1F1XuNg.text: Can't say I was impressed with our meal and service. This place is always packed with people, so we forgave the fact that we waited a while for someone to take our drink order. We ordered fish tacos and steak Milanesa. The fried batter on the fish wasn't crunchy. It may have been sitting out on the service window for too long. The steak Milanesa was over fried. Needless to say, we had leftovers and it wasn't because the portions were huge. It was a lack-luster experience. However, I did enjoy my blended mango margarita!

46UiCxcL_PQ-GE12xEVMWA.text: AMAZING!!!   BEST Bloody Mary's EVER!!  BEST homemade mozeralla!!  The food is just perfect!

zq9a-BrOS-jwOjyOGGpfyg.text: Hands down my favorite Mexican restaurant here in Las Vegas.  You can't go wrong with ANY of the menu selection at Leticia's.  Leticia herself can usually be found en la cocina as well!  Great family run, award winning restaurant here in Vegas which I HIGHLY recommend!

s03_gS9zFpRozGwTJ1SsMg.text: First time here, great impression. Service was wonderful even though our server informed us she was in training. I got the chicken tamales and my husband got the Colorado burrito. Very good!  Wasn't impressed by the margarita I got. Bartender definitely over-poured, I could taste only tequila.  I would come back here for sure!

rQn1x9siUKQb2fBpLCwOPA.text: This was our first and last time we go t ok this restaurant.  Way over priced for what you get.  They do not tell you that what you are getting has additional charges. And what you get in the first place is not with the price before or after the additional charges.  Nothing at all to write home about. Just another Mexican restaurant. They say they are rated the number one taco in Las Vegas....no I think not!  We will not be go ok g back. There are other Mexican restaurants that are much better bad more reasonably priced!

Fjw9uJBrMFFl3swrfhcUjA.text: We visited this place for the first time on 5/13 and noticed that we were charged misc fees.  I ordered a jalapeno strawberry margarita which was listed for $8 on the menu.  The check said jalapeno margarita $8 + $1 for strawberry.  Not sure why i was charged the extra dollar.  I also ordered the fish tacos which were $13 on the menu the check showed $13 + $1 for Fish. excuse me? you charged me a dollar for fish when i ordered fish tacos?? lastly the fish tacos came with ONE wedge (for 2 large tacos) of lime which had not one drop of juice so i showed the waiter the lemon was dry and asked him for a replacement.  He took so long my tacos got cold and i ended up using the lime from my margarita cup instead.  He finally showed and apologized for the long wait.  I noticed on my bill i was charged $0.75 for lime :-/ Not cool.  The food was pretty good and the place is close to our house but we will not be returning. Makes me wonder how many suckers (like us) are paying the misc fees without even noticing.  I doubt we will be returning.  CHECK YOUR BILL EVERYONE!!!!!

6IGSPGUHOzrCnecaHikc8w.text: My wife and I went the other night for dinner. This is one of her favorite places to eat but the service just failed us this time. The waitress failed to refill drinks or chips in a timely manner and our appetizer was never brought out and she did not realize until we told her when our food was brought out. The food we did get was good but the service was very disappointing.

W0TYgYn5iIbxThsUgB4kow.text: Our go-to Mexican restaurant. This great family spot serves only the freshest if Mexican cuisine. Everything is good, but the specialties are to die for! My favorite is the molcajete fajitas with flat-iron steak and chicken. The sweet cactus that supplements this fun dish is a great substitute for the normal bell peppers in fajita dishes and the presentation makes for a great conversation piece. As far as the normal Mexican food selection goes, the carnitas is what I get when I am in the mood for the more traditional meal. Always great, but getting through the door can be a challenge. 40-70 minute waits are not uncommon. Hence the ding to 3 stars.

8tI0F3VxNx5K7CzfF4r02A.text: I really wish I could give 3.5 stars to Leticia's. I've been here three times and had widely different service each time. The first time was fabulous and inline with the overall score this place gets on Yelp. Our waiter was very helpful in navigating their somewhat complicated menu and process. It all turned out well. The second time we went was a tragedy. We arrived with friends for a double-date night, signed in and waited outside with lots of other people waiting as well. After a half hour and noticing other, new tables getting seated before us, I enquired of the hostess what the deal was and found out that we'd been totally skipped on the list about ten patrons ago. After expressing my displeasure, we still waiting about five minutes, then on the way to the table, my friend fell due to water on the floor. Apologies? Manager rush over to gush on us? Nope...just a, "Sit here" in a booth a little too small for four grown adults. The food was still good though. Third time, tie breaker, we arrived on a Sunday after church and sat outside and it wasn't very busy. This time the service was prompt and the food delicious. The beautiful weather on the small deck didn't hurt either. So, that's why I'll let the "tie go to the runner" and give a four. We'll see what the next visit delivers. My advice? Go when it's not super busy to ensure a good trip.

V7vOVNVtP2UIi7vRvpnKyA.text: I wish there for 4.5 stars for instances like this... I truly felt Letcia's was better Mexican than Lindo Michoacan (which I gave 4 stars), but being located up in Centennial I can't see myself visiting unless I happen to be in the area.  My party of 8 waited for 45 min on a busy Friday night and were seated outdoors.  Chips and 3 kinds of dip/salsa were brought to the table in a timely manner after we ordered our drinks.  i ordered a taco combo plate of both ground beef and carne asada with the standard beans and rice sides.  The hearty helping came in a double wrapped soft tortilla which I thought was genius so everything doesn't rip through on the first bite.  I felt overall the tacos had a bit more flavoring than Lindo for about the same price point.  I just wish this place was closer!!!

7sGQ2ljAALaagGjA7yKedg.text: Cute little authentic Mexican restaurant. Love the empanadas.

trjCxlc_CknlelenJ81zYg.text: I've only came to this place a few times. It's a little out of my way but it's not bad. It's pretty much legit Mexican food. Tastes good but its a little pricey for what it is. Could go cheaper with my own mother food.

53yXqjGlg0R0keEDdrOoig.text: The low score is for the service.  The food was awesome and the house margaritas delicious but the service was awful.  I could see my margarita sitting and the bar for about 5 minutes before it was brought to me. The waiter took awhile to take my order and at one point,  two servers were arguing with each other. And the manager had to step in and settle it.

_h0OMUC3MYWcMmMCqg1_Sw.text: The reason for 2 stars.  Order accuracy!  My food has been wrong the last 3 times!  I ordered 3 quesa tacos for my lady and me.  We ordered 2 shrimp and 1 carnitas.  We got  2 beef and 1 carnitas.  The server said the ticket was correct.  This is the third time this happened!  Don't get me wrong, the food is great but you also should get what you order the first time.

idOrHwBajm_4CSOs6u-W-Q.text: Haven't dined in, but ordered a to go order. We got the Sopas, tostadas, and enchiladas  with the poblano mole sauce. The food wasn't bad, lacked flavor. Normally sopas and tostadas don't have too much flavor, but I was expecting more from the enchiladas.

Bu5H1YFonJBe6sHGaQZC9g.text: My boyfriend and I have been here a few times, and sadly each time I'm a little more disappointed.   The first time we came was December 2014 and we were highly impressed!  The atmosphere is very authentic and fun.  The service was great and the food was delicious!  We were raving about our great experience for days.  My boyfriend and I thought we finally found a worthwhile Mexican restaurant near us.   Sadly, our most recent experience is probably going to be our last experience for a while.  The server seemed a little overwhelmed and we saw more of the busboy then anyone else.  Being a Tuesday night it wasn't jam packed.  Our burritos were beyond mediocre and I could've made a better one at home.     The menu is a little pricy for Mexican food.  What we were once okay paying, now seems like a rip off.  I have no problem paying more for great food and the experience.  The past few times I've gone have been disappointing and I walk out feeling jipped.   I hope that maybe somewhere in the future my boyfriend and I will go back and will be pleasantly surprised.

YDLoxj0gPY2o6wkIrp6lDA.text: I've been coming here for years and they never fail to supply the goods. Great food and friendly staff

JDKdridy9DRaD05R3TuHrA.text: Decent food but not so much authentic. Very bland when should be spicy. Great service and very comfortable place. For an "authentic" place should be more authentic. Great chips and salsa but the fact that you have to keep asking for more because of the portions get bothersome. For 6 people and one small basket of chips seems futile. They brought more but it seemed a bother. Keep in mind our bill was $216 so I didn't feel guilty asking for more chips. Overall good and I'm sure we will be back after exploring other options first.

VhrUP3d6n9eoXEsioPr7TA.text: All I'm saying is why the hell do they close at 9!? They didn't even give us last call or anything.. They messed up our food and took forever to actually take our order thanks guys.. Then they came and dropped off the check and mentioned multiple times how they are closing yeah we get it. If you want AMAZING customer service and fantastic food please go to Ponchos in Summerlin they'll get your order right not kick you out and make sure they tell you when last call is! Imagine that amazing customer service does exist.

_kEcEehKUnomyY9MgDIjOw.text: This was my favorite Mexican restaurant and everything was so good, so similar to how my family cooks. My step grandma cooked food similar when she was alive and this was the closest to that and my moms Mexican cooking.   But somehow it's lost its way for me. Look at my previous reviews over the years to look at the trend.  It's become inconsistent. It's better during daytime, probably because the owner is there. There are times also for dinner the food is SO salty, SO greasy. Servers are either wonderfully attentive and super friendly or horrible and will never check on you at all. Horchata is sometimes perfectly creamy and spiced and sometimes so cinnamony. It's like being at 2 different restaurants.   Thinking back, out of the last 6 visits, once both the food and service wasn't good, 2 visits the food was good and service wasnt, 2visits where the food was bad and the service was good, 1 visit where food was amazing and service was too. Most of the good food was earlier in the day. These 6 visits have been the past year, I've gone less and less when we used to come frequently.  They also raised their prices from opening to now, by quite a bit. Most of my favorite dishes have gone up $3 since I first started coming here a few years ago. I like the food and probably would still frequent even with their raises every year if it was still as good consistently, but I think some of the items are priced too high for what they are, they are definitely higher than most competitors aside from Lindo which also prices rather high.   Go during lunch as they tend to be better then. Also it's cheaper so that if you were iffy about the food, you just didn't pay $15 for 2 enchiladas.   What is (usually) good here is the carnitas, the chile verde, the mole poblano, enchiladas and I think their mocajete is solid.   I just wish they would up their standards a little bit again. I might look for a new Mexican food place.

Zw4BMsGP3KJdERCBLkOEhQ.text: After trying so many mexican restaurants we finally found the best, Amazing service!! My new favorite mexican restaurant, and the service is the best!  Such a great service from our server Ricardo!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most amazing guac ever

PkTz5lPa_WRPExXjwG6PNA.text: This place went down hill, food was pretty disgusting and the servers never gave us our full order. Not sure why people keep coming back. Overpriced, White washed Mexican food, nothing authentic about it.

5yIQgOOTEzxZzYLWNih7-A.text: I hate doing this, but I feel it needs to be said.   Firstly, I love Leticia's. By love, I mean we eat here a lot. By a lot, I mean we frequent this place at least once a month. That's a lot for me.   The reason for this update is the service. We sit at the bar because we like to play for free drinks. And it's usually just my boyfriend and I. Otherwise, we'll sit at a table. And I have almost always had a bad experience when we're seated. The waiters/waitresses seem so rushed, so annoyed and just generally pretty rude. I hate being biased and I have been for way too long. They are seriously lacking on how to treat clients. They rarely check on you, take forever to get you food or drinks. If I'm here with a smaller or larger party,  it's made no difference. Each time, we have been waiting too long or just had a server that doesn't seem too keen about helping us.   The bartenders are awesome. They have a few new ones that have been excellent. The food each time has come out perfectly and delicious as always. The main reason we come to this place.  Now, I hate referring people here. Each time, they say the same thing. They loved the food but hated the service.   So, I give you 3 stars - for the servers, please...do not ruin such a great place. For the food, drinks and bartenders - I give you 5 stars.

kZC6kSC5xNaOdoP-hy7oSg.text: So I wanted to let everyone know I went back today and my experience was wonderful great dinner great customer service just a wonderful experience from my server I think her name was Melissa and another lady that seemed like she was a manager so the food was wonderful and made how we order it thank you so much we loved it!! We will be back Thank You!!

PI2yyELQ3TfccCeUCqb9jA.text: One word: AWESOME! I've not had a bad dish yet. Everything is extremely tasty and the service is on par with the exceptional food. Friendly, fast, helpful staff. Go for the Quesa tacos. You won't regret it. And their homemade salsas are delicious. Not your typical Mexican food joint. This place is a must-go, put it at the top of your list.

Bi5MKv9ugLZ-s1RKLvV13g.text: Great, authentic Mexican food. Large portions. Outstanding service. Went there for the first time 2 days ago, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

Sjt0O1FEhVbH_Uo_VO7jdw.text: If you're looking for the BEST authentic Mexican food. This is the place to be. From the endless chips n salsa to the excellent chicken, beef or carne asada burritos. You won't be disappointed. The staff is courteous and friendly and they make sure you're satisfied and taken care of. A MUST is definitely trying their bean Dip. If you don't like bean dip, trust me you will after trying theirs! All around excellent place and the best authentic Mexican food around Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchiladas! The bomb.com

M04eBObb7L_f--NDGsVj5w.text: Stop your search for the best Mexican food in Vegas. Leticia's is it!! Their sauces are on point, food with heat, chili verde is green and mean!! They make excellent margaritas!!  Be sure to try their guava, and the strawberry jalapeno. I hesitated posting anything only to keep the lines smaller. This place is delicious!

zmd41W6jO8KAtKJwCkK5gQ.text: It's refreshing to find such great food so close to home. The service is always super friendly, with every staff member wearing a smile. I've been here for lunch, for dinner and for happy hour and can honestly say all were positive experiences. Expect a wait of you're going on a Friday or Saturday night, but it will be well worth it if you do. I've had the carnitas, enchiladas, taco salad, and the fajitas. Their fajitas have a sophisticated flair with the added mushrooms and rich yet fresh flavors. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because of the price... A little steep.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese and carnitas enchiladas
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tortilla soup
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco salad with shredded chicken

3m0LI-XVDHzGUdAuyH-LNg.text: Awesome place I love the bacon wrapped jalapenos ! The margaritas are great, service is great I love this place!

chIifTcvI3P11rZD2zeLlQ.text: The food was delicious and the service was excellent! Our waitress Joanne and servers were on point. Great experience!

YqdCo2z0r6_3e06zfeL7wg.text: Breakfast at Leticia's is absolutely incredible!!  My husband was torn between the carne asada and eggs and the huevos rancheros. The waitress solved that problem--have the eggs on the carne asada plate ranchero style!!  What a stunning plate!!  The machaca and eggs breakfast was delicious!!  The corn tortillas are homemade and thick and wonderful!! The salsas and chips are superb!  They're made in house and are fresh - perfect!

zXCmXk4i2LWrogvxtICbkg.text: So frustrated with this place.. Came in today around 3:30PM Thursday 3/22 for a date with my husband. We wanted to go somewhere some what nice and we've heard a lot about this restaurant. We were seated immediately - which was great. But, we didn't have a server approach our table for about 15 mins. There were only three tables including ours in our whole area.. Soo not sure what took so long. After our server finally came and took our order - we did not receive our food for about 30 mins after that.. Our order was small and simple, and yet everything we got was wrong. For an appetizer we ordered elote - which NEVER even came to our table. I ordered a chicken burrito with guac and pico - I received a chicken burrito with those ingredients PLUS unwanted sour cream and jalapenos inside. My husband ordered a carne asada burrito chimichanga style - he received a carne asada burrito enchilada style.. For someone that doesn't like a lot of sauce, that's horrible. Being hungry and frustrated, and no server in sight - we ate what was given to us. Later, the servers station was directly behind our table, and we could hear her saying we did not receive our elote. She came to our table to present us with our check, pretended to look around our table and asked "oh? You did not receive your elote?" No mam.. And to your surprise we know Spanish and heard you saying you knew we didn't. Don't really appreciate playing dumb. She proceeded to open our check and show that she did not charge us for it. Again, obviously you knew - don't appreciate the act. How about apologizing - or at least asking if we still wanted it or not before removing it off our check?! On the check we were also charged additional fees for the unwanted toppings we never asked for. No idea what her name was - our busser referred to her as Flaca.. I'll at least give a shout out to our busser, who did a great job covering our servers butt refilling our drinks and chips and making sure we had to go boxes. Overall, my husband and I were debating on $5 Little Cesars and decided we should have something nice - I'd rather have the $5 Little Cesars than this $50 crap experience. No graicias.

eeO2nFjxwLdWuotr8k3_3w.text: The quesatacos are my all time favorite. I also love that the fact that most of the items are gluten free. Service was good, quick and even though they were busy our food came fast and the drinks stayed filled.

zqIoLaZ37iWRRD8B0hDZfg.text: Tara at the bar is probably the best server/bartender/entree recommender of all time!! She was so welcoming and as soon as we let her know that it was our first dining there she started giving us options on their most popular menu items. All around great experience and I would HIGHLY recommend eating (or drinking) here :)  Also, make sure you ask for Tara if you can she's the absolute best !

9srQ6357FtMMRe48NQQ1Ug.text: First time in to Leticia's. Great atmosphere and overall very nice meal. Not a big fan of the cheesy poblano rice though. This would have been better as a seasoned long grain rice with diced peppers. I'll come back. Good enough for a second try!

gH1eDwi4dNFbWC8XmSNZwA.text: First time here.  Got here at 2:15pm on a Saturday- not too busy.  Took us 15 minutes before we were approached by a waitress..... Finally ordered and it took more than 45 minutes to get the food since our waitress became the bartender halfway through the meal.   We went up to get the hostess to complain and she sent the manager over. All the managers did was stop by to say, "I don't know what's going on, I'll see". No apologies, no check in, no followup, no listening. Terrible management skills. Thank goodness for Luciano listening and checking because the manager was terrible.   The food was delicious.  If it wasn't for the terrible service I would come back. Unfortunately,

ZZ4in14JI202O6Er6sPObA.text: Service was awesome! Luciano(our server) helped us with tasteful selections. The bussers were pleasant and efficient. The food came out fast and fresh. It was a delicious lunch and we will definitely return. The only negative is the drinks were priced on the high side.

XYkZEln5lCFoUrocJRpRBQ.text: Came here again this weekend. Food was good as usual. My seafood soup was a bit price but delicious. We were told the wait was about 25 mins. We got a table after 7 min wait so, not bad at all. The food took longer to be served though; however, the servers were attentive & kept on checking with us. We got chips to snack on while waiting for our food & sauces were replaced without us having to ask for it. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My seafood soup. Yum!

6oAmR-w04cTNCr8VdbwMZA.text: The food is amazing! But the helpful and nice staff gives the place very authentic feeling atmosphere. I highly recomend this place!!!!

fXks_nr5-eincr5Nvtrcaw.text: lovelovelove the vibe is great here and so welcoming! i loveeeeee their complimentary salsa and chips. theyre all so polite and helpful when making your selections.

yt1-I8Ct8l7xTUo2tGqLOA.text: Great food, great service! What more to ask? This is THE place for Mexican food in Vegas. Homemade tortillas, fresh chips and salsa. The fideo soup is delicious. I have tried different dishes, and have never been disappointed. The carne asada, burritos, tacos, and the appetizer tostadas are my favorites.  We have never had bad service here. Everyone is friendly, drinks never go empty. We come any chance we get!

4z5I6DzHWFGlDGtskzjWIg.text: Leticia, where have you been all my life? So glad I finally stopped in to check it out. All thanks to my sweetie for his recommendation. He knows the way to my heart...Mexican food! ;)  The food is amazing, flavorful and very authentic. Complimentary chips & salsa to start. A few minutes to look over the menu. We decided on the carne asada plate with cilantro rice & beans. He ordered the BYOB (build your own burrito) chimichanga style. Everything was delicious and the staff are super friendly and attentive. I'm pretty sure this is my favorite Mexican restaurant now.   Don't forget to use the Yelp Deal: $15 for $30

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach Margarita
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BYOBurrito chimichanga style
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guisados De Casa

VRn7PsLucA7ybFjDvs0ZUQ.text: Seated right away and served up fast. Tried the authentic fajitas. Different from your usual fajitas but oh so good.

QXnuYQweYlQIkvKMuvCOPg.text: I live really close so I've eaten here a bunch out of convenience. I'm sorry to say that while some dishes that I've had ate good, the service is so slow that the experience is ruined.  Getting seated, ordering drinks, ordering a meal, getting a water refill, getting the check... Lunch will run 90 minutes or more for two. Going through two baskets of chips and still waiting another 15+ minutes for your food to come out is absurd and it happens on the regular.  Happy hour food is not good at all nor is the chocolate cake. Hh food is bland and cake has a bland & oily consistency.   If it weren't for a few standout dishes, I'd give this place two stars, but I'm not likely to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch enchilada. 11/04/15
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of my sisters &amp; bowl of tortilla soup. 11/04/15
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch taco salad. 11/04/15

_fuMnistQHczNSw438qxDQ.text: Tara works the bar and she is so customer friendly and amazing!  She makes Leticias Cocina Pop!

biD059YxmFasRhTry1fuuw.text: This restaurant is used to our favorite restaurant in north west area. Since Leticia's has been busy, the quality goes down and the price goes up.  The new policy is if you pay by credit card, the price will go 3% higher!  Our favorite chips and dips are not as good as before!  I ordered Beef fajitas costs $19. We expected the tastes should be good but unfortunately it tastes so fishy! My husband order shrimp fajitas will add $3 more but the shrimp tastes not fresh!  We are not going back this restaurant any more

CHCyXTw7ZNlqmCy6zFgbtw.text: My family and I came to Leticias after a morning at the pumpkin patch. We had yet to find our spot in the vegas valley for good Mexican food, so we went into this restaurant with open minds. We were greeted by friendly faces, and immediately brought to our table. They brought out a basket of chips (absolutely delicious ones) and 3 dipping options. There was a red salsa, a green salsa, and a bean dip. Both of the salsas were delicious and my daughter scarfed down the bean dip. The menu was large and impressive. Lots of options for all.   My husband ordered the Nacho plate with carne Assad.  The portion was massive, and the plate was overflowing with delicious toppings. I am not a meat eater, so I didn't not try the steak- but he kept talking about how deliciously seasoned and tender the carne Assad was. He really enjoyed his dish, and had plenty more to take home.   I ordered a build your own burrito. I found it to be slightly pricy- because I ordered mine with out any meat. BUT, with that said, I would come back and order it again and again. It was massive. It was so tasty, and I couldn't get over the size. I  got my burrito smothered  in green sauce, which I would totally recommend for any green sauce lovers out there. The beans and rice served with my burrito was equally as delicious. That's saying a lot because I'm not one for Spanish rice. I find most restaurants make it so mushy, but this rice was flavorful and had great texture. Obviously, I was not able to finish my burrito in one sitting.   My four year old ordered off the kids menu and she enjoyed all that was on her plate. Again, the portions were impressive and we had enough to take home as another meal for her.   I would come back here in a heart beat. I live on the opposite side of town so I'm sad that I'm not closer to this yummy spot. I'm certain the next time we get an itch for Mexican food we will gladly make the drive out from Henderson just to experience their yummy food again. Thank you for such a great experience!

njK0-Ff48HCmzzor8EP0yw.text: Every visit here has been a desaster.  It may have to do with the focus on the drinking croud, im not sure.  I just wabt to share that I will never eat here.

pfhRDL71mlDZ8gjlnDnQeQ.text: Good, but a bit overrated, to be honest, the last 2x we ordered from here it wasnt up to par. The first time we ordered take out on a busy night and everything was good...I got the two quesa tacos with cheesey rice and a soup. The second time I got the same and it wasnt as good for some reason? Third time I ordered through  Grub hub and the whole order was messed up. I ended up getting refunded thank God, but I am hesitant to try here again.

3KqFCy5WDUwt04MOPysV8w.text: Dissapointing. We arrived before our friends and saw the C rating health card posted at the counter, but obscured from view behind some free-standing advert plaquards .   We tried to persuade our friends to go elsewhere but they wanted to stay so we did as well.  We ordered elote corn,  a cheese quesedilla and a horchata.  the horchata was too sweet so I traded it for a soda.    The salsas were good but the chips tasted odd. The food took a while to be delivered to the table. The cheese in the quesedilla was too salty.  The elote arrived about five minutes later and was cold.  The service itself was pleasant.  Rating not withstanding, we won't be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AMXmJaCu3x8N3YGupJ1q_g.text: Neighborhood Mexican restaurant at its finest. The food is always good and tasty. I love going there for the happy hour. Can't wait to try Everything on the menu .i usually get the valconitos.

uenjRZ6C0nn4ttJSTeGzNA.text: Came here for lunch and wil be coming here for lunch when craving the Mexican food..its the best I've had in vegas.

f1Cr5rzXjjSUL_4WlcLKBA.text: Best authentic high-end Mexican food in Vegas. This has been a regular spot for me for YEARS. Huge menu, many options. Great service, fantastic drinks. Very busy on weekends, but great for early date night or a weekday lunch!  Have to try this!!

AWI7r_1FJBSBDR0WXNA2xQ.text: Horrible service!!! Not worth the money to go out when you can't even get your server to serve you food or drinks! I ordered a margarita and never received it, yet I definitely was charged for it. We couldn't even get a refill on our fountain drinks. The food was okay but with the horrible service I was not impressed. We have given it a couple of tries since we live so close and LOVE Mexican food, however every time it is a disappointment.  Overpriced Mexican food that could be better with flavor and better service. I did like the decorations they were cute, however I would not go back or recommend.

tk7sGD7lEFV7H6jNifL9Mw.text: I love this place!  Just had my daughter's wedding rehearsal dinner there and everything was was great - Food, Service and Banquet Room accommodations was just what we wanted.   The amount of food for 25 people was more than enough and reasonably priced.  Recommend for for lunch or dinner anytime!

psmyFi1VvNESIfrPQQFU9w.text: YUM!! That is all I can say! The food is fantastic and we've always had great service!! Authentic Mexican food at its finest!! Try the corn and the Queso as both are delicious!!! They have gluten free food and even dishes that are Keto friendly!! You won't be sorry!!

ukB9nmltQVQJQ_tGN4MOUQ.text: I picked up a single dinner order.. my boyfriend and I usually like to come here often and tonight decided to make it to go. We haven't been here in a month or so... online it says it's $13 for two cheese enchiladas so I ordered it. When I arrived they said the total to me before swiping my card.. And i thought I heard $14 something.. when I went to go sign it, it was $18.34. For two cheese enchiladas... I walked out because I didn't want to give the guy a hard time. Walking to my car I decided to walk back in and ask exactly what I had paid for because he never gave an itemized receipt. The nice girl at the hostess stand showed the menu and said "that's weird, looks like we changed our menus and upped the price". I said.. hmmm okay. And went home. I ate the first half earlier and the other half just now... as I'm finishing I see something in my enchilada.... A LONG PIECE OF METAL! This is absolutely disgusting! I can't believe this.. I've only ever written 1 review here before and that was a few years ago... I'm just SO DISSAPOINTED, and grossed out. How could they let this happen?  P.S I know this is really gross i hate seeing pics of food like this but this just had to be posted.. gross.  Really disappointed in you leticias.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c5RZrNWRZ9WNxuuF8kWh4Q.text: This was by far the worst breakfast I have ever had. How does one burn eggs and then serve them. The service was fine, the place was half full, so no reason to burn eggs. On top of that the menu states one price, the bill however showed the menu item as two dollars more. First time going here will also be the last time. Save your money and go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh yummy,  burnt eggs. Ridiculous.

XrNiQwyNP0fkwC4QulHQ2A.text: This was our first time at Leticias! Had the gourmet tacos..BEST I have ever eaten!! I had the  Ribeye tacos & my husband had the Pork Tacos. They were huge!! You can only eat them with a knife & fork. Two Tacos came with dinner with Mexican rice & refried beans. We each brought one Taco home .Best Mexican food !!!! Service was awesome!! Will definitely  go back!!!

PLowuNTXK-pc_2ofW-t5rA.text: Extremely long wait.....longer than they tell you. When you sit down, be prepared to wait some more then maybe just maybe they will take your order. Then just wait a little longer......and get cold food. Disappointing.

SQoVEB_CPCosR7mHd2_9ww.text: I LOVE this place! I have never had something I didn't like. My favorite cocktail is the strawberry jalapeno margarita. It sounds odd but you have to try it.

sVD0HRg40RTRfY06AkK7KQ.text: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants to go to. I love the chicken tinga empanadas .

y7Lo_7xBSw-m_CG_YWcbFA.text: I will start with a few facts about myself on this one: 1. I am a San Diego native transplant to Vegas: anyone who has ever been or lived in San Diego knows what "Real" mexican food tastes like. 2. I am a super picky meat eater. Can not have bones, fat or Gristle...make me gag! 3. LOVE MEXICAN FOOD!!! With that being said...Leticias is heaven sent!  We have been searching for a Mexican restaurant that is worth the money, not americanized, and tastes like it was made with love! The way for me to tell if is going to be good is at the very beginning with the chips and salsa...which at Leticias are always fresh and the salsa is flavorful with a hint of spice. They also serve them with a bean dip that must have chorizo in them...DELICIOUS!!!!  Which brings me to the next most important items...Beans and rice!!!  When I order my favorite dish here my rice is a casserole! White rice, cheese and chilies...OMG...delicious...just the right amount of chilies and cheesy goodness! I have the shrimp Quesa  tacos, medium heat!  My mouth is watering just thinking about them. Packed full of shrimp, melted cheese and the flavor...wow..I have tried them spicy also...and I like spicy usually ...but medium for me was perfect. My man orders the Mojcaete...a hot bowl with ranchera sauce, shrimp, queso, carne asada and cactus...served with rice and beans and tortillas...it is a huge bowl of yummy goodness and you can't get any more authentic than this dish!!! We have been several times...NEVER left unhappy. ALWAYS delicious. We have tried other dishes...but now we go for these 2 dishes! Well worth the drive and every single dollar we spend. Finally a place that may even be better than San Diego mexican food!!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The man enjoying his yummy goodness!!

5oSWWTf5Nain-VVhIJy5pg.text: Cute little Mexican restaurant on the northwest side. My bf thought this was a 3 star place but I am taking a star away due to their food. I don't eat pork and I knew I tasted something greasy and funky in their beans and finally the waitress told me that there was pork in there. Second, I ordered a fried ice cream and what they gave me was a ice cream ball rolled in cold stale cereal. I've had fried ice cream before and the outside was crunchy, hot, and sweet like a churro with yummy vanilla ice cream. Not worth coming back here

UBMQTJ_lwG8RMQsONMuzhw.text: Great selection of authentic Mexican food. I got the birria with grilled veggies on he side instead of rice and beans. Delicious

7fkYZcbXmgDSTil20XJniw.text: This place has the right idea. It's probably the only "authentic" Mexican restaurant on the centennial side of town, however it is far from authentic. The set up is nice, beautiful decor. I've given it many opportunities. It's always super busy & frankly I don't know why. The food is not quality whatsoever. Canned beans. Cheap meat. Need I say more? Once we were sitting at a booth & a lady with extremely long hair was sitting on the other side of the booth behind us.. I mean this lady was the brunette Rapunzel, she placed her hair over our booth. So her hair was literally between my sister & I. We asked her nicely to remove her hair when nothing was done, we brought it to the waitress' attention. trust me I know she is probably very limited as to what she can do but she looked at us, saw the hair, & said there was nothing she could do.

MVzteIwjp_fopMHlxV0YXQ.text: Have been many times in the past. Tonight, after waiting 30 minutes, finally took our order. Of course, had to get another service person to get her. At least 45 minutes later, our food came out COLD!! It was obvious the beans had been under a heat lamp as they were crusted over, however the main dish was cold to the touch. The kids meal came out last, with wrong items. There was absolutely no apologies by our server, Melissa EVER. When a manager was summoned we explained the issues and then left the table without eating!! Will never return there again.

DYtQcMMdpcINza5qWKPkVg.text: I am thrilled with this restaurant. It is rare to have a Mexican restaurant serve such good food and....Sopapias...OMG..A childhood favorite..Thankyou Laticias

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying Laticias. Great food. Thank you...and the bartender worked his tail off....Thank you sir. Stellar job...:)

yye-6ila0ICTkE69MDE5lw.text: Beautiful location and building. Had are group dinner there and everything went great. Food Service atmosphere we're all great fully enjoyed our group event there and highly recommend it for anybody that has a group up to a hundred people. Leticia was easy to work with and flexible and help make the event work specifically for us

Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appreciative daughter with dad
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful outdoor patio dinner for God First Fathers date nite.

7M-ZR4W-_3HqcnipS9iFRQ.text: Went to Leticia's for my dad's birthday and loved it. The chips were warm and fresh and the salsas/bean dip were delicious.   I had a "salad bowl" aka a tostada with shrimp, Mexican rice, black beans, iceberg lettuce, pico de gallo, guacamole and sour cream. Super tasty! My mom had the same except with chicken. Birthday boy ordered the chicken fajitas which he loved. The sizzling chicken came with mushrooms and bell peppers and onions and then on the side was fresh tortillas, rice, beans, guacamole & pico de gallo. Huge platter.  We had made reservations a few days in advance and were seated immediately. Our server was fantastic and very attentive.   Would definitely recommend and we will be going again!

xCdnh4Bfrwtkq0DUn8ling.text: We have been visiting Leticia's for several years now.  In the beginning the food and service were great and we came often, several times a week.  But then things started to go downhill in the food quality and we stopped going.  After a couple of years we decided to give them a try again.  The food has improved again.  The service has always been good.  We love some of their speciality margaritas.  The reason for the 3-stars is price.  Much more than we pay at some of our other favorite restaurants so we only come here on occasion.

3EfYsyf6bdSpu_NfI5ItaA.text: LeticiasTivoli Village.... excellent food, impeccable service. We'll be back. Visited both locations multiple times.  Always great Date night

4orbPvr8cyLjsCkAPKNuDA.text: One star is given only for the busboy(?) who brought us water and chips & salsa.  For everything else, I would give zero stars if possible.  We ate there last night.  Should have known to go somewhere else when they weren't busy at 7:15 pm.  After we were seated, it was 20 minutes before we could place our order. Then waited nearly 40 min for our food.  One order was for the Ensenada tacos, no rice only beans. Menu said they had fish & shrimp.  Yeah, only greasy fried fish. The other order was for shredded beef tacos.   My plate came first.  There was a molded circular glob on my plate. I asked the waitress what it was....some type of cheesy rice. I looked inside the tacos as I didn't see any cabbage. As I lifted the tortilla (with my bare hands), the waitress said "oops, they gave me the the wrong plate in the kitchen" and took it.  Yes, I touched the food. No, I in no way believe they made a fresh plate for the table it belonged to.  My wife's plate came out next.  She also used her bare hand to look inside her tacos.  Yep, wrong plate again.  I am wondering who got the food our hands were on. More on that later.  The shredded beef tacos were good.  The fish tacos had burnt batter on the outside, mushy on the inside and barely a sliver of fish.  They were thoughtful to put a single 1/8th slice of lime on the plate.  The beans were so salty that they were inedible.   The practice of taking a plate back that the food was touched by the customer and then serving it to someone else may not be a health code violation, but it should be.  I was really hoping that we had found a locally owned Mexican restaurant that was close to our home, but we didn't.  The $37 we spent would have bought a lot of food at Taco Bell and Taco Bell would have been better.  We won't be back.

d61zbcM5N0-ZpLxDWiQSNQ.text: Very interesting restaurant  Extremely busy Lots of positive people working there all working together  Plenty of quality food  All around excellent experience   A little far and very crowded long wait you have to time it  Go Joan

lr1nW8P11_CLKt3hygj94g.text: One of the hidden gems on the North side of Las Vegas. It's located near a cute area that looks like it's near a mini townsquare :) The food is awesome and the dips for the tortilla chips are amazing. The service was good but it took awhile for our water to be refilled and it took a while for our hot sauce to come to our table. We were already almost done with our meals by the time our server came to give us hot sauce. Other than that, we had a good experience.

QRU_knCjE9ZXXdjhuEHgPg.text: One of my favie mexican spots! This place is fun and funky with great food! My girlfriends and I went in for a few drinks, and dinner, and were pleasantly surprised with the high quality and delish food served. I appreciated that I was able to order a few different things on one plate, I believe it was an app item to mix and match apps, which made me so happy! The fire roasted corn with crema and some type of amazing crumbly mexican cheese was LEGIT!   Note, they have lots of veggie options! #veggie4life

Cl2PYvxcjPmWepLWTUN3Aw.text: This is our favorite place to eat Mexican in Las Vegas! All of the food is freshly prepared. The menu has an extensive collection of traditional and house specialties. Happy hour is amazing. The queso fundido is my favorite appetizer. The capirotada is a favorite am dessert but only made seasonally! The shrimp quesa tacos are the most amazing and a family favorite of ours. Don't forget the sangria and / or margaritas!

1ufhrM8HQ9afhXy7bjb9YQ.text: Great selections for both lunch and dinner. Add the guacamole to go with the chips (which are also amazing)!   Gave 4 stars as it took quite a bit of time for a waitress to start serving us, given it was 4pm and pretty empty at the time. Once she did start waiting on our table though her service was great.

d-lM1yR1oLe04laTMRyj1A.text: Food was ok. Service was lacking. It seems like they are understaffed. Way too many mistakes with our order. Not sure if it was the kitchen or server but I wasn't impressed

Hf84dTYnsdnLhfJfhfnEiw.text: Love Leticia's a must stop when I am in Vegas.  Little ways away from the strip but well with seeking it out. Music and atmosphere are great.

zaYtBVptVqfmdXgBUS6jCw.text: Can't beat the selections of delectable Mexican dishes! Everything I've had is tastee!!

9PRMBImsU9LvZ6Vhr9SZyw.text: Very nice customer service ! Very good good but they really messed up my take out order pretty bad forgot a lot of the things I asked for in my order

OseA_jlBFmuZDgLoPQU1Cw.text: Food is great!  Decor is eclectic and a little more upscale.  The salad has mixed greens rather than iceberg lettuce.  Portion sizes are good.  The chips and salsa taste fresh and the bean dip they serve with it is so yummy!  If I go by myself, the service can be spotty.  I like to eat out alone and I feel like I'm sort of a last priority at times, especially when it's busy.  When I'm with other people, the service seems much better.  They offer military discounts, which is a nice bonus!  :-)

RRMhhEXqxpRgiPBqfHUSoQ.text: Our favorite local place in NW, a tad on the pricey side for what it is but the lunch specials are a good value.

kjUT5MVYEyxkXhznUlhI2Q.text: It was all just... Okay. The chips were so thick that my jaw almost got tired chewing on them which is crazy. We had the nachos so we had the same issues with the chips. The quesadilla which was just meh basic. Taco bell status basic. The taquitos, meh basic. The margaritas were meh okay. The Carne Asada quesa-taco was OUT OF THIS WORLD. That is what gets the three stars. Sooo delicious. I would go back just for that. The service was good. The busser was super sweet and attentive. The waitress was very busy but did the best she could. I expected more but I mean... it was okay.

YdFIojwqOlBgnvrnDCWc7g.text: We met friends for dinner. Perfect for three kiddos to "do their thing" while we adults got a chance to talk and catch up. Service is always fantastic. Food....? It is of course the top reason we go! Chicken tortilla soup is exactly how we like it and Street tacos are delicious! Can't go wrong going to Leticia's Cocina. My only suggestion - make a reservation - because everyone knows about this greatness!!

DA7EevsYxuO21-tRi8xMsg.text: It was my first visit here. OMG what a beautiful atmosphere and the staff was great. The food was AWESOME!  Keep up the great work and continue to please the public with your goodness. Hope to see you again the next time I come to Las Vegas. Gracias!!!

Q8y9UG4p9WJjPlLjcIvRoA.text: Margaritas were bomb and their Molcajete is to die for! Strongly recommended I'm going back for seconds today

RM4_2HH7Qg2Q44Pbjw3OKw.text: This restaurant is mediocre at best. We came in at 5:30pm on a Friday and were told it was a 30 minute wait. So we waited the 30 minutes, got the text to return, and were seated. The restaurant was pretty packed, which I thought was a good sign, but booyy was I wrong. I'll get right into it..  The waitress brought out drinks fairly quickly and there was already a basket of chips with salsa waiting on the table when we were seated. The salsa was good, but the chips were terrible. They were super thick and tasted stale. We ordered the chicken tamales and carne asada burrito. The order took quite some time to come out. I don't know exactly how long, but two tables that were seated well after us, both received their orders before us. Anyways, the tamales were dry. That's the best way to put it. They were dry, crumbly, and tasteless. The rice that came on the side was laughable, looking AND tasting like it came out of a dang rice a roni box. Next up..We had asked for grilled vegetables in the burrito, but instead we got raw zucchini. We were also up-charged for the guacamole we asked for but never got on the burrito. We didn't make a fuss about it, because at that point we were desperate to get out of the restaurant. Needless to say, we won't be returning.

BCeaIKDYhCq0s8AbOuJNhA.text: How to make Mother's Day and my birthday  less enjoyable?  Go eat at Leticia's Mexican Cocina....wait, we didn't even get to eat.....we walked out.   The restaurant opens at 10am, our reservation was at 10:30 for the reason that we were a group of 14. I made it a week in advance . We arrived on time to our reservation and were seated promptly. But that's the only good thing they did. After being seated and getting our beverages. It took 30 mins  for the waitress to comeback to take our order.   We waited, and waited and waited. In the mean time other customers were being seated and eventually served, a few even finished eating. By this time the whole restaurant was full. We kindly asked the bus person, and the waitress about our food. Finally the manager came to our table and told us he was going to check on our food.   By this time it had been ONE hour and THIRTY mins since our order was taken. The manager came back and kindly said that our food was still not ready.   He did offer to comp our bill. But that didn't resolve our food not being ready after almost two hours. This is the first time I've walked out of a restaurant. To think that I've praised Leticia's for years makes me even angrier.   Thank you Leticia's Mexican Cocina.

e08AVuF3alVTStKOZaVTrQ.text: Oh, where do I start...To begin, it took 10 minutes to get drinks and chips. The waitress came to take our order, and was difficult to understand. When we tried to order a dozen tamales, the waitress told us they only had 2 kinds, even though the menu lists 5 varieties. When our order came out all plates were hot, but the food was cold. We sent food back twice and it still came out cold. It took a while to get refills on drinks. The bottom line, not worth the price, terrible service, cold food, and  ignorant employees.

nQupbJfCX-sWIwJ0b9emMQ.text: We had large party of 25. Erica the manager handled everything and for a reasonable budget.  Great food great service. Thank you to all at Leticias  for making this evening just what we wanted it to be,  a gathering of close friends/family after our wedding.

SsNjHC9lQhlm4_zjH9R4ZQ.text: The food is delicious, the atmosphere is welcoming and warm, and the staff is amazing. Lucian was our waiter, and I honestly have never experienced such an amazing service from any individual in my life. I highly suggest the elote and the horchata! The chicken tacos were heavenly as well.  Warning: the pozole is huge and you probably can't finish it.

DKXQa0iY8_DJE_9JlzJGcg.text: I frequent this place about once a month. Wait staff is both kind and attentive; food is excellent. Prices are fair. I love their spinach and mushroom enchiladas with white sauce.

C2pj5i2DE18sMcpXUGk5PA.text: We come here for the food, but we stay for the exceptional service from Rogelio! He always makes us feel welcome! Ask for him when you arrive!

JuUwM4qhbZMjX2EsulpPew.text: Been here about 5 times and I have never been disappointed.  My wife was once but ever since that time she is always happy.  Their salsas are excellent and every dish I have received is excellent.  Would highly recommend this establishment.  Not sure if they take reservations but I would look into it as they get busy.

xOWeuL7-IAAkr3JdHMH6uw.text: Their Empanadas are not made with pastry dough, but a fried taco shell.  Very cheaply made not authentic empanadas. Don't bother.

Kyh_jsTe7AvTCiyq0XqZ8g.text: I go out all the time to eat and this is the first time I got the service I deserve not only was her service attententive but it was also caring and nobody actually cares about serving,but she made me feel like I was at home, the food was great much appreciated due to her service I will be back again!

0jBnatIpkg5rhgeRyqM9eA.text: Great food, horrible service.    I've been to Leticia's 3 times and each time was impressed with the food and totally disappointed by the substandard service.  The food comes out slow, the servers are arrogant and inattentive, it is difficult to get even a drink refill, and all three times we were treated as if they were doing us a favor by serving us.    We won't be going back, which is a shame because the food is excellent.

--vhjejGhCa8eSw5eAYv7Q.text: Went for our monthly lunch adventures with the ladies. The food was great, no complaints. I would've given a higher rating but the service was slow. He was great and had our orders done correctly but during the hour and a half only two of seven got our drinks refilled. By the time he came back around to our table we were ready for the check. Maybe they need more servers if he was the only one servicing both sides and outside of the restaurant?

G1KLbyS_ZRL53xvlP3bPGA.text: I had lunch here with my wife and two year old twins. We arrived at 11:00am on Saturday right after the restaurant opened. The food was excellent. I had a breakfast burrito and my wife had chicken tamales. The chips were great and came with three different salsas.   The service was also excellent, however there were only about five other customers since we were there so early.   If this was located closer to my house I would be here all the time. I will have to settle for stopping by whenever I am lured to the northwest part of town

jf__GQQAZPOmG6QRiGPFuA.text: Lively atmosphere & killer pozole & it's available all the time...... Score. Love the devote & very friendly staff. The margaritas looked really good but I had a michelada & it was delish!

iMH16P9lPjDen7b4IksTQA.text: Always worth the wait! So happy we stumbled upon this place after a late night trip to Lowe's!

wrmmDNUnudwl-ltBNZ5HMA.text: First time we went was excellent with great food and service. Not tonite....we had the worst service food was ice cold  except one meal which was still bubbling hot kids meal s came out 20 minutes before ours they were finished before we started..lots of empty tables but some of the worst service I've ever had.

U7YEMGPa71hlIVwKC_dt4Q.text: Good neighborhood Mexican food, great margaritas, and mostly very good service. Always busy so we try and hit it around 5 pm. I've tasted their tacos, enchiladas, chicken mole, and various other things which were all great. It's weird, but their hamburger is among the best I've ever had.

apY8E7lUzLWdqKodhheXcw.text: Leticia's is pretty good. A very diverse menu of Mexican cuisine. The atmosphere is ok, a little too dark. Menudo is on point as well as the pasole, fajitas and choke rellenos. Things that need improving would be room in the restaurant and waiting area, more lights, enchiladas and drink specials. Other than that not a bad place for lunch , gets busy for dinner. Lunch is much cheaper than dinner if anyone is looking for the best deals.

voxfBrj5lE6z-HO_VGSpPw.text: The food here is consistently excellent!  I've tried something different each time and have been impressed across the board.  The Carne asada is life!  The service is awesome too.  They always anticipate our needs.   Definitely recommend checking this spot out.

8ddWIG17vCO-YtGekJhxxA.text: Came in here for the first time today, and the food was great! I really enjoyed the bean dip it had cheese, & chorizo! The service was good too! Ill be back

0Cd30FXfnQ848yf57Y4Zcw.text: Best Mexican food in town!! It's my go to spot whenever I eat out. The service is always awesome and they are very sweet :)

eWmPdfgmdTvrZrN6N4nnJg.text: Worst service ever!!! Not just us, 2 tables around us as well....20 minutes after being sat, still nothing. Then came guacamole;  no chips no drinks. 5 minutes later we had chips;  no drinks. Went and asked for manager and got our drinks. 20 minutes later, 2 of 6 meals came out. More waiting. Asked for manager again. Finally the rest came out. Food was ok. The kids meal came with dessert: churros. Hard as rocks.  Manager never came out to check on us. Had to ask for bill; then find someone to run the card. The table next to us NEVER  received their bar drinks. They asked 2 different servers and the manager...they never came.  I've heard the lunch is great; I'll never know because I will never eat here again!

Xz6vFgQ9tl1K-DLkf7wjNg.text: NOT impressed!  Big pieces of fat in my pork burrito, wife's "puffy" tacos were anything but puffy taco shells (seemed more like pita bread).  Beans and salsa weren't flavorful and they simply cost too much for the tasteless food that they serve.  Won't be going back!

Vbz_MFhogHb5ebKzFhAuXA.text: We had Laticias cater a company party for our Christmas party. Their Tamales and Shrimp we to die for!! The staff was very friendly and punctual and their prices were very reasonable for the quality. We love the restaurant and wanted to bring the great food we have enjoyed in the restaurant and share it with all of our co-workers. Amongst some tough critics in our party, everyone had nothing but great things to say about the food and service provided from Laticias. We will definitely go back to enjoy their food and atmosphere and plan to use them to cater our next event.

IQ6rYLoykKXkBjQ-lkyumA.text: Service was a little slow, but the food made up for it! Food was definitely 5 star, and the house margaritas were great too.

ZZxyj29ZwbG1ZZ0kgxaSGg.text: Very good home made tasting mexican food.  Here is the deal I have been here three times, 2 times it was great and once it was lousy.  The sauces they make for enchiladas and such are incredible, I had the chicken mole enchiladas and they were amazing.  I have also tried all kinds of dishes of others and they were all good.  The bad experience I had was the time I went with some real picky eaters, we had all kinds of special requests and the waiter was rude and basically said that they couldn't figure it out.  Then the meal came completely wrong (surprise).  Also on another occasion a guest got carnitas and it was just big chunks of fat (and I eat carnitas all the time).    They do have a deal on fridays I think when you can get 1.50 street style tacos and they are awesome.  If looking for mexican in vegas try this spot and also Via Mercados, both are worth trying.

uSYyWCM4UykNlw6S_eZn2g.text: Great food and great service. The only reason I did not give five stars is because the environment is a little cramped. They definitely need more space.

3auYGq65Kb3DgaXsbsi5cg.text: Food is delicious. However, the owner can invest some quality time in teaching her employees some good restaurant etiquette. Hostess skips waiting customers on the list to give first available tables to the neighborhood favs!

fnn9dTF0TQcOkzeiBiJL-w.text: good: food, service  bad: so dang far from meee  try the fish tacos!

gecZmiSqUL4T9bUKsqfBOA.text: Great Mexican place. Good food.. Good pricing.. Big menu. Easy parking. Nice location. Full house on a Wed night is always a good sign.

VxYdHvgIqh_zPmQvcQRzFg.text: If you are looking for decently priced Mexican restaurant try Leticia's. I've eaten lunch and dinner here and I'm never disappointed. They have a good red beer!

r3fatidq3nci3z0QV5odBQ.text: In my experience with Mexican restaurants, you can never find that perfect place.  One place might have the best chips & salsa, as other places have better margaritas, while another place might have the best fish tacos.    With that being said, Leticia's definitely has the best Carnitas in Vegas.  Overall, I think their food is excellent.  They have some of the most tender, flavorful Carnitas I have ever eaten.  I've also had their Carne Asada burrito and the Milanesa; both where the steak was also tender and flavorful, and not tough and chewy.  I've had better chips & salsa at other places, but I can't complain when it's free (part of the meal).  Of the numerous visits, I've only had one visit with slow service, and our food took 30 minutes to come out from the time we ordered.  All other visits, the service was great and the food came out fast.  Prices are decent for lunch specials, but I haven't eaten dinner there yet. I haven't been disappointed with the food there yet, and I would recommend this place to anyone.  It is located way up in the Northern part of Vegas, so it's not conveniently located (unless you live up there).  But if you love Carnitas, then you have to check out Leticia's.

9qIp99vwLj5L4l2QbKXt9w.text: Tried this place after the owners came to the YMCA community fair with free watermelon drink and chips and salsa samples. I will give any business who takes the time to support our community a spin.   We went as a family and found the food of average quality for the price. The wait staff was attentive but the kitchen was slow. Then the karaoke started up and we just wanted to eat as quick as possible and leave. On a summer night starting the amateur songbirds at 8 sharp when families are still dining together felt chaotic.   This place is close to our house so we will give it another spin when it is not karaoke night. Perhaps on a a Tuesday when I can't help but smell the fajitas they make on the patio when I drive by.

mjfO1r04dIuElNwj-eZShA.text: Not sure whose idea it was to serve mole poblano in a full cup of stale oil, but I haven't had food this disgusting in years.  Corn tortillas were fine.  Chips were good enough.  Rice and beans weren't bad.  But holy smokes, the pork in the mole poblano was drowning in oil.  It's like they bought one of those cheap bottles of mole mix from Wal-mart, then dumped the top half of the bottle in without mixing the oil and mole back together.    My wife said the shrimp taquesos were good, so I might go back and order those.  But yuck, yuck, yuck!  Don't get the mole.

MZZf0zHOIMIxi4QVk2B1oA.text: We came because of the great reviews.  Our server got almost every order wrong.  I give the one star for the chips and salsa.  I love good Mexican food.  This was not good at all.  I could not eat mine.  I will not try again.  The atmosphere was nice though!

dAoDikP5Cpkuq7GSj5CjVw.text: I hate Mexican food.  The best places I have had before are just barely edible for me.  Surprisingly I absolutely love this place.  Their carne asada burrito with the white sauce rocks!  A little pricey but their food is absolutely worth it.

_OBvDRV4wdUJHp8emN977w.text: I like this place. Specially when the weather is nice and you get to seat outside. The service is a hit or miss, but for the most part they are very nice.

ZLopSgc5M1kj97V5zuBjRQ.text: If you haven't tried it, try it. Happy hour in the bar or a nice relaxing dinner I love this place every time I go. The owner manages the place and keeps it in line. Service is great and quick. The food is a True masterpiece of Mexican.

LBCUWdE2cbn3oU94OUqBSA.text: Excellent service!!! They were on top of our needs... Beautiful interior of restaurant..  Chips and the 3 salsas are great ...  Will come back

_Bs5yzrrrttkXf0vcp_rHQ.text: Food is above average, environment is awesome and margaritas are freakin great...creative, original, huge selection.

CFa1NrbXjT6rsKnV3V_g1Q.text: We have been going to Leticias for almost 4 years!  It is Las Vegas' best secret!  I have nothing but fabulous things to say about this place!

9VzW-QK_iNphoiQDll7HTQ.text: Went here for the first time last week.  We only had drinks at the bar but had a great experience.  They brought us what tasted like homemade tortilla chips and bean dip with red and green salsa.  Really good.  I had a yummy gin and tonic.  My guy had a few really cold beers.  The best part was the service.  Had a great time with the male and female bartenders.  Didn't get the guy's name but Wendy was a delight.  Think we'll go back again this week for our 'date night'.  I'm in danger of becoming a regular if the food turns out to be as good as the chips and dips, decor and friendly service.  Will keep you posted.

twDIo50oil6XTJhTwX_slw.text: The level of service from this restaurant is excellent. Each time my husband and I dine here we are never let down. The staff, food, and environment is awesome. I highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys Mexican food. You are seated right away even on busy nights. I am not certain how they do it. I love the location. The Centennial Hills area is very beautiful.

nKUw4mN-wYGIYunltxTEog.text: Leticia's USE to be a great place for Mexican food, unfortunately no longer. The service is very slow and sporadic at best. The food lately has been just ok, and the quality has definitely gone down hill. We enjoy eating at local places, non chains and are very disappointed in the direction this restaurant is going.

XCslpDAq-Gbf7UnU4o6nBw.text: Awesome service and food. I got the mole, and would probably pass on it next time. It was a little too chocolatey and sweet. Mole aside, I can't wait to go back!

9rkWO5Em14tnIDib6vK97w.text: We came at the busier lunch time I've seen and the staff still had everything well running! We were seen right away and seated. Our drink orders arrived promptly. This is the best Mexican food I've found out here... Which is rare for me to say since I'm from Texas. The guacamole was sooooo fresh. And the Mexican corn on the cob was fantastic, they will even cut it off the cob if you ask. And don't even get me started on the yummy chips and dips! He and I didn't have enough room left for desert but I know they smelled amazing.

zZbn5vfoyG-RSmkrKYoPAA.text: I absolutely love coming to this restaurant. They treat you like they would if you were visiting there home. The food is so delicious and super authentic. They don't win the best taco award for no reason!!! Everything on the menu is super great. Usually I order the smothered taquitos or some enchiladas! If not then a huge bowl of child verde with pork and flour tortillas!!!! I do suggest to make reservations because this place is always packed!

xYT8AJqvJjdQAI2kZV1rTg.text: Food was really good. I ordered the puffy tacos. I ordered a margarita and i swear, it was the strongest Margarita ever! It took awhile to get our food but the server was great. He made sure our drinks stayed full. I'd definitely go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My view from the table
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My drink after A horrible day at work.

-V47elX674EFgrf_LaiZlQ.text: Ate there today and he menudo is the best in the city. Split the menudo with the Wife and had Pastor and Asada Volcanes off of the appetizer menu. After the menudo and chips, salsa, and bean dip I was already full so I only ate one and brought the rest home for later. Food is always on point and the service is pretty good. Leticias....one of my must hit monthly Mexican Cocinas!! You won't be disappointed!!

1shquElZA3-x2l4Sj5pPAw.text: Wife and I LOVE the place! We just had another great meal and we will keep coming back. Everything is fresh and not from a can. What a novel idea! You owe it to yourself to go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this place! Staff and food are great!

IW-ssi8-QmeRwq479NikNQ.text: Best frozen margaritas I've ever had. If you're in North Vegas and want good Mexican food come here. Great atmosphere, great staff.  EDIT: Removed a star because subsequent visits have been progressively worse in regard to customer service and the frozen margaritas are consistently way too sweet/liquidy/syrupy.  Also the cheesy rice is very bland nowadays.

LDyrXcF1HgfSQuijzLVe1w.text: So I will start a review with 4 stars. This place gets -1 for not great service. But could I add 1 back for the food? NO, fajitas were terrible & bland. We ordered fajitas for 2, but there was barely 4 ounces of meat, mostly onions. I easily cook better than the food here. Oh so of course you can add 1 back because of the cost. NO, it was $18, that's right $18 per person; a total of $36. There are many other places where you can get much better, for less.

ej-fEr5-DVxIzbU5R0NXbQ.text: This is one of my favorite places, but after this visit, I've decided I just don't like their food. I keep ordering things and they keep bringing out weird dishes. Last night my husband ordered a small cauldron of bubbling goo. This was supposed to be fajitas. Melted cheese was on the bottom but there was no way to extract the cheese through all the liquid goo. A huge slab of flank steak was balanced over the side of the bowl. There were supposed to be shrimps wrapped in bacon. The waiter said they were in the bowl. They were not. Long story short, I'm not going to Leticia's anymore. It's taken me years to realize that I'm a On The Border Tex-Mex girl!  I simply don't like this real Mexican food!

Lk0u7ga2r35Oh_uxu8N_FA.text: Delicious food in a nice, traditional Mexican setting. Service was a bit slow, however, it was also very friend sky and cooperative.

7AOAQsmWXOSzvvclcjUd8Q.text: This place is ok, def not worth the price though. I got a carne asada burrito and it had more rice than it did me in which I understand that a lot of places do fillers and their burritos but this is ridiculous. If they lower their prices I might consider coming back to this place but it's mediocre with a Champagne price tag.

Ym53lTIfNOKAthdQlz7iqg.text: The chips are fresh, so is the salsa, the food was just okay,  nothing that I would run back to! But the shrimp ceviche and the margaritas definitely would have me running back only during happy hour! The service was A1, everyone was very nice and friendly, especially my waiter Claudio!

nuUBip9VELd6skEe1Lxcbw.text: Absolutely fabulous! Can't say enough about our server Esther! We asked her for help with the menu and her suggestions were spot on!  Very generous portions. Will visit again and again. Excellent!!

TYolRj24yZHi07EkRecT9g.text: Great food!  Went on a Thursday night and had a pretty long wait but we later found out it was due to a huge party.  Our waiter, Luciano was incredible!!  Ordered the enchilada dinner for two and had so much food we took some home for lunch the next day!  Kids also eat free on Thursday's!

nFI8Yl7AWQfTxqHlTg-fZA.text: Man what a great place for Mexican food I had the empanadas and they were absolutely delicious and my wife enjoyed the chicken rolled tacos.  One of the highlights were the refried beans they were light and fluffy and creamy absolutely delicious this is definitely a new spot for us when it comes to Mexican food.

zVQUYpEaVh7y4HJhEijoTA.text: This was my 2nd experience at Leticias and I was impressed by the food, not so much the service. Took awhile just to bring our drinks. Had to also hunt my server down and let him know we were celebrating our anniversary, was told our desert would be free and it wasn't. Don't know if ill come back again.

ARQ9ZPb6fC2VGxkobybDLQ.text: I don't understand why this place has such good reviews. My wife and I have been here and the food is not very good. Very bland and high prices for the quality of food. None of my friends like it either and have been multiple times.

sDs6ouRpYMBX4kwaA7G_1g.text: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Vegas. The chips and salsa was really good, and in really enjoyed the atmosphere.  My only complaint is the service is really slow.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PmW8d8VOgV3bLjB3YU0U5A.text: Service is always friendly here. Have been 3 times now and have had to wait 10-15 min each time for a table. They are always busy which I guess means it's good!  I have had the street tacos which are great but get a few because they are small. The best is the shrimp guacamole. Holy schmoly rolly Polly does this appetizer rock. It's so big it became our meal! Drinks are good as well and they have happy hours. Free chips, salsa, and beans!
