Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres leches

oRTxXYysO73TyZv279zxTA.text: This place is fantastic! The chips and salsa are fabulous. For dinner I ordered a cheese and carnitas enchilada in verde sauce. It was on point! The verde sauce is to die for. My husband ordered the Chile Rellenos. Rarely do you find them with anything other than cheese filling. He said they were delicious. This place is super cute as well. Definitely worth a visit while in Vegas.

nXaj_eF9NoHFYuza1ml3gQ.text: I knew Leticia's Mexicana Cocina made my top (702) Happy Hour locations, but I learned something new today. The restaurant meets my standards for being a kid-friendly dining spot. 1) Friendly, attentive staff. 2) Homemade chocolate milk. Horchata is on the menu too. 3) Kid's menu and crayons. 4) Children like to watch the food set up on the kitchen line. 5) Booth seating.  Great Blanco Pozole today!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kid-friendly environment, service and cuisine at Leticia&#39;s Mexicana Cocina.
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Leticia&#39;s Mexicana Cocina (Farm Rd. at Durango, northwest Las Vegas, NV) entertaining kitchen line.

jvykgQSjrviQAg8eDg4hgA.text: My husband and ate there today for lunch and the food was awful. We can so tell that this was all microwaved.  The meat was dry the rice was hard the beans tasteless.  What a waste of taste. There is no way this place get great reviews honestly. Definitely won't return.

tKxmxuw4x85ZshAxUqWz_w.text: Excellent meal. My husband enjoyed the tostadas and I had a cheese enchilada and a chicken enchilada. We will return.

1CmL7FqXg2WtMyJOZnIZBg.text: Just found this place a couple months ago and it is becoming a regular for us.  Great food, area of town and service.  I can only say that the taco salad is delicious because that's all I get.  The food my family orders looks as good as mine.  Sometimes there is a little bit of a wait which only testifies to the great meal they serve.  Tonight though, no wait at all.  Just an all around nice restaurant with great food at a reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the taco salad!

Lzttiqa3q9xTnAuTvoAAVA.text: So freaking delicious. Chips and salsas are to die for. Fried ice cream nom nom nom wish I lived in Vegas so I could come here more often. Homemade Mexican food. Had the carne asada and chili releno with beef. Chili releno was good probably get cheese next time and the carne was spicy and soo flavorful! Can't wait to come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili releno with beef
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada. Homemade chips, salsa and bean dip!!!

uIlyFiMULafsVZAEFoTdDg.text: Really enjoy this place. The place is cozy and inviting. The food is yummy and the prices are decent.

nErH5_CvToGNiDaRPpGiFw.text: So good. Came here a year ago and forgot about it. Wanting real authentic Mexican food I remembered. Staff amazing, food amazing, happy hour amazing, cozy and comfy. Come try.

V19QILBbHEHVi9TGdh2S7Q.text: The good here is great! Very authentic and fresh. Their lunch specials are great and you can't beat the price either. This last time I had the carnitas and tortilla soup and both were AMAZING! This if definitely one of my favorite places. Only con is the server was pretty slow and it took forever to get a refill on our drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tortilla soup is probably the most delicious soup I&#39;ve tried and is a great price.
Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The carnitas are AMAZING!

xZ7vmGPX75tYN2UwahUstg.text: Very good food! I had the shrimp fajitas and the guacamole with crap as an appetizer, definitely recommend both! Our drinks and appetizer was brought out fast but the food took a little longer to come out but was worth the wait. The atmosphere was good and the place is well decorated with a choice to sit in or outside. Our waitress was very nice and the prices were very affordable. The best Mexican food we've had here in Vegas yet!

fhCETLs4GCF2exr5BYtgIA.text: Came here for happy hour with a friend. We had a good experience! I would come back again.  Pros: -happy hour prices are very reasonable! -house margaritas are good (not super boozy, but also not too sweet) -complimentary chips/salsa are yum -lots of vegetarian options -$2.50 happy hour options (party of 2 and we ordered 4 and were full!)  Cons: -service was a little bit too slow (we were left alone for long periods of time and we ran out of water multiple times) -limited parking close to the entrance (but not terrible)

LUXE12gcOPNvqhUNt-Hqfw.text: The service sometimes is rocky because they are usually extremely busy but they always get the food out in a timely matter and it tastes great everytime!

ADL3Sx98YS7Zqs-uZuamlg.text: I love the el pastor burrito they make its awesome. the  pitcher margaritas are not fresh made meaning its a margarita mix. the bar is quiet and the bartenders are pretty cool. i come here often i like the happy hour options AS WELL. they keep the place clean and the bathrooms are kept up as well

qKnWJDBtmjw0QvQIu-um3A.text: My husband & I have been here twice. Good atmosphere- but the food needed more seasoning & wasn't what we consider "authentic". Originally being from Central California, we're spoiled when it comes to really good Mexican food. Second visit wasn't as positive as the first. The food wasn't seasoned well, the ceviche was unlike any I've ever had & we weren't fans. My husband & I each had a Bloody Mary & they were not good - way too spicy & zero garnish. Not sure if we'll be back for a third try.

10oru7Sjcjb_urvWJ8ThEQ.text: All I can say is fuck Justin. Worst service ever. The food was cold and bland. Homeboy decided to drop my to-go box on the floor, throw out one piece of food that fell, put the rest back in and informed me that the "other part is fine", after I watched it hit the floor...  He was abrasive and sketchy, and the whole experience was incredibly disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GMkYbqFpGvF1-qYRlUbzTw.text: I was excited to try this restaurant as I heard good things. The chips and salsa were okay. The margarita was delicious! The only problem we had was my husband and I were brought the wrong food. His dish was completely wrong and I got plain shrimp tacos when they should have been their "speciality". The waitress was ho hum and just wanted to know if I liked the tacos so she didn't have to get me the actual ones. I'll return and hope that we get the right food next time!

EhdI-HGA1NpVATOlbPbLGg.text: As always great food and service! Chef Andy is the best: I am always eating up the chips and dips they start you off with! My favorites are the fresh soups ! But everything on the menu rocks!

J6iP3_x_M0AGesrqrmbQRg.text: The food is awesome. Chili verde is delicious with lots of meat. The atmosphere is nice with the Latin music in the background and our server Tammy was super sweet!

qbleH1Q11EAGiTOhtWqYsg.text: Just happen to be on this side of town and decided to try it. Great atmosphere!  We had the carne asada for one and the fish tacos!  Good size portions and food came out quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Leticia's Mexican Cocina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada

8XOWN7oyW5Qn-Q1RciddSg.text: I don't have enough positive words to say about Leticia's!  Simply the BEST Mexican food in Las Vegas and beyond.  We like to call it "Mexican gourmet," but there's a comfort level that goes beyond gourmet.  From the time you walk in, until the time you leave, you're treated like family.  You'll see regulars, tourists, and celebrities (Carlos Santana eats here!!!!), all treated the same by the lovely Leticia.    Fair warning, the free salsa/beans and chips are HIGHLY addictive!  I can't even count the number of times that we've had to take home the majority of our entree because we filled up on the margaritas and chips & salsa.  I would seriously hurt someone to get her tomatillo salsa recipe.  Seriously.  You can have my firstborn.    Don't be afraid to ask your server for recommendations.  Or the person at the next table, if their food looks interesting.

gkLoanRSlHy0GajY22-iIA.text: Truly the most delicious food, drinks, and incredible service, I bring anyone that comes into town here for dinner at least once because it is so good. They serve you two salsa chips and a special bean dip as soon as you sit down. They're happy hour is very good especially for the beers! I think they are 1.50 but I cannot be positive! Still, you have to try it once and you will never regret it. I promise

PannaOCSk_x2YHtgsRouDQ.text: Awesome service and great food! Just not quite a five star.

DQ1Dt4O4_3Tk5a3wsfJDEw.text: This place is as authentic as it can get. The food is delicious and tastes like my mom made it...(shes a great cook). Their Jamaica (hibiscus) margarita is to die for. Love this place!!! We live in California and when were in Vegas which is more often that we like to be, we come here for dinner. Its a drive from the strip, but its so well worth it.

E7Bxh7zwMGSlbtKJkVbaaw.text: The only Mexican restaurant where I can order and be certain that I don't get sick....90% of their menu is gluten-free. The wait staff is knowledgeable about the effects of gluten for those who must avoid it. In addition to being gluten-free, the food was scrumptious. The only other place that I can be certain of the ingredients is my own home. Easy to get to, a few blocks off 95 north. Celiacs- Enjoy!

rM6l0psODPAnrY8n3s2OWg.text: I eat at Leticia's frequently.  I have tried many different dishes (all fantastic!) and have had many margaritas (delicious).  Great staff!  They have fun street festivals during special occasions.  So happy that it's close by!

u-WlLPVD_UZOShObkEnAvA.text: AMAZING food. Best Mexican we have had so far in Vegas. In fact we went two days in a row. I judge Mexican food by three things - Margaritas, Sopa De Tortilla and Guacamole. All three were beyond my expectations here. So so good. We were also there for my daughters birthday the other day and she was treated really well and loved the ice cream treat and that everyone sang to her. We will be back lots!!

IwDkpXEiZbTwyeoLB30hHg.text: It would be hard to distinguish the pedestrian, south of the boarder offerings at Leticia's from those at Chevy's or On the Boarder.  I like the bean dip they served with the chips, but other than that, my two trips have resulted in frustrating, slow service and mediocre Mexican food.   I miss Vega's Cafe!

dqyASRLT09hKdFGXeV3Wlw.text: I'm not a huge fan of Mexican food, but this place is pretty delicious! I'd recommend this place to anyone!! LOVE IT!

LAICibKDae7rqCdD8W5Hgw.text: Great service and good food. Drinks are made strong, worth the money. Fluffy cheesecake is the best!!!

UV_2D_XDceQCm-nv9bQeEQ.text: Food was amazing. Justin at the bar, was incredible!  Great suggestions for entrees and drinks!

Ra4srCGnn1vvG6fq-tkj8w.text: Good little place to grab a bite. Too bad the 'town square' it's located in is just one street. The rest is empty lots and dirt. Economy of course...what can you do. Service was good, staff friendly. Chips, salsa and bean dip, gratis of course. Had one good salsa, decent flavor. Me and my girlfriend shared the carnitas for 2 and let me say this, you could probably feed 4 people with this bad boy. Huge! Meat was good, not greasy like the carnitas at another local place ~cough~ macayos ~cough~ Rice was typical, nothing really too special, beans were good. Overall good, nothing to crazy spectacular.

5yuqpRTBXGURnrd34V3nLA.text: Everything was quite good and some of the best guac I've had in a long time. A tad pricy for Mexican, but yelp is there with an awesome discount to help.  I need to try the margaritas next time.

UTHjIgp4mfsmkC7E898_LA.text: Awesome Mexican food. Mole way better than any other place in the valley. Chile rejeno was superb.

nwMPHpDnGWQFDDqUJ9Oi8A.text: I was really excited to live so close to a Mexican restaurant when we moved to the area, and our first dinner here was great; service and food. However every time since has been disappointing. I have tried a variety of menu items hoping to find something worth coming back to but its just "okay". The staff is all over the place running around, one night a waiter ran around the corner booth and kicked an empty chair in his rush and it flew right into my fathers leg, it was hard enough that my father said "ouch". He made eye contact with our table grabbed the chair from the floor and walked away without even acknowledging the fact he hit a customer. I know he was aware of it because he went and told the manager about the incident right in front of the kitchen window, we were seated two booths over so we were able to see & hear the conversation happen. Not the waiter or manager came over to make sure he was okay or apologize for the incident. We let the incident go and even returned tonight giving it a last chance. My husbands dinner was not as he ordered it and his said his margarita was terrible, unfortunately we will not be returning.

Ls-A6_RsEvJVRLcIAjqR6Q.text: We will never go back.  Everything we ordered was either overly spicy, grainy, or bland.  The chili rellenos were soggy.  The onions were burnt.  We were so disappointed because it is so close to home!  YUCK!

N4ObzjtWde6LjJe5XmuRSA.text: Me and my boyfriend waited to be seated, for 15 minutes which wasn't a big deal. But it wasn't busy, so I was a little confused there. We sat down, and started with the salsa, beans, and chips which I am in love with! I proceeded to eat some of the chipotle salsa and there was a hair about 10 inches long, that I had to pull out of my mouth. I asked my server whose name was Duke, about it, and he told me it was a chile strand and it happens all the time. he refused to to acknowledge what had happened, and did not apologize. We then tried to order off of the happy hour menu, and he told me because it was New Years Eve they were not honoring the happy hour menu, when we called two hours earlier and the hostess and told us they were having it. So we proceeded to leave, it was the worst customer service I have ever received. I did have a couple other experiences at Leticia's, that were quite enjoyable. Although, I will not eat here again, the hair experience was a total turn off.

oCRR28MzQFRsyQj_2r-ZAg.text: Very disappointing. No flavor. Terrible service. The waiter practically threw the chips at us on his way by. Had shrimp tacos but there were MAYBE 1 little shrimp in each. Had to dig to find and even then when I say little I mean... these were THE SMALLEST shrimps on the planet. My husband had the carne asada burrito. Blah! Zero flavor. Had to add the habenero salsa or it would have tasted like nothing. WAY over priced for the low quality and very low service. Great building, street shopping theme, but terrible parking. Will not return.

pJemEx6FI2LowIEciREXeg.text: I think my father summed it up well, he's never before left a Mexican joint not full of beans and rice. It was weird how there was so little of each and the rice had cold clumps. I got the impression we got leftover rice reheated. I'm not a temperature freak either, but sorry, it was cold.  I find it bizarre that this place has so many peachy reviews on other sites. Taco Bell definitely has nothing to worry about.

Ov4LK61B2lyCUprIuKlMTA.text: I feel very lucky they opened this place near me. Not only is it cozy, but the food is very good. Love the taquiza cart they have out on Monday nites during the the summer. I hear they will be offer the taquiza cart for the "Movie In The Park" events this summer. They have good Sunday brunch deals and happy hour.  I believe they also have karaoke on Saturday nites.

r7mMT9j38mmJtBFuQgv-WA.text: The very best, authentic, home-style Mexican food you can buy , and that is only because grandma doesn't charge. Excellent service, great easy atmosphere, and very interactive, on site owners. Well worth a drive. Be hungry when you go. You will leave satisfied.

CChWZdMRpp40Ve1kwVwbJA.text: I really liked the chips! They are made out of flour tortillas and were very crispy. I was really impressed with the menu and all the options. They have deserts which I have not seen offered at other Mexican restaurants, such as Capirotada (Mexican bread pudding). The server was happy to make recommendations and frequently checked in to ask of the meal was and if I needed anything else. I ordered an horchata and loved it. It was served in a huge glass (no refill needed) and so authentic, like the kind made at our family functions. It tried the Taquiza (Mexican Street Tacos) in chicken, carne asada and al pastor. They were all really great and will be back again to have them. I also had two tamales, Green Sauce Chicken and Rajas Con Queso. Unfortunately, I did not like the tamales, kinda of dry even though I got them "Enchilada" style. My server had mentioned that she did not care from them and that they were dry, prior to me placing the order. I appreciate her honesty and she was right. I will come back to sample more items and for the Taquiza.

feoUYwC5J_rVNiCJjYK1QA.text: Terrible food and distracted service-we ordered 3 different things and none of us liked any of the food-everything was very poor quality-even the taco shells were stale tasting and to top it off when I checked my bank statement the next day I was charged $140 dollars more than the correct amount!
